column6: No comment

Popped in to the new no 7 on a weeknight this week and overall had a good meal, though I now know exactly what I'd do if I came back. While the cocktail list and cocktails themselves were fine, I'd grab your beer of choice or a classic cocktail and snag a seat at the bar. From there, I'd order the broccoli tacos (they pack a ton of flavor on their own but the add a few dashes of the sauce they'll bring out and it's a flavor explosion) and also a side of fries (as long as you like em McDonalds style). That's it - that's the order. If you absolutely must have a larger meal, I think the fried chicken sandwich was quite tasty. Tried the cheeseburger too but it was very minimalistic and frankly, very rare - didn't taste like much else than... meat. *shrugs*

I've been waiting for this to open for months.  So cute inside and has a real neighborhood feel.   Really good drinks, wine and beer selection. I did t eat but the menu seems limited which I think is smart since they just opened.   Looking forward to being a regular
The burger is the only thing that's good here. Very limited menu. Drinks are mediocre. The chicken sandwich was meh. And french fries just ok.
Still as good, if not better than ever. Great wine by the glass list, refreshed menu items (bologna was uniquely delicious), and killer, juicy fried chicken sandwich. Fries still in point!!

Welcome back, no. 7! This new/old spot is such a great addition to the neighborhood. We have so many good restaurants on Vanderbilt but have been sorely lacking an unfussy but elevated new American neighborhood spot. This checks all the boxes: food is great but not too pretentious or too expensive, and the cocktails are perfectly mixed. (I almost wept with joy when my watermelon mezcal drink wasn't sweet--why does everyone need to pour a pound of sugar into a watermelon cocktail?! no. 7 gets it.) We had no trouble walking in on a Saturday night but the place was doing brisk business. Super pleased to have them here and hope they're around for another 13+ years.
No comment
This is my favorite restaurant! The food and drinks are always fantastic, and the vibe is a perfect mix of relaxed and elegant. Plus, the staff is amazing!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Get counter (instead of gallery) so you can interact with the executive chef Toshio Matsuoka and get to watch him make the sushi with fresh fish flown in from Japan. The space was super intimate (6 at counter + 8 in gallery) and 2 people were celebrating their birthdays and everyone sang along which was sweet. Choose the 8:30 slot so you can enjoy the cool speakeasy wine / sake room downstairs after your omakase! At the very end, they hand you a summary of your courses (21-23 depending on where you sit) but wish they had provided this earlier so you could follow along better! There were many mackerel nigiri on tonight's menu and no salmon or anything exciting surprisingly, so taking 1 star off for lack of variety (and did have a hair in my appetizer in the beginning). However, servers were very nice and Chef Matsuoka is beyond sweet and polite. I felt that people sitting in the gallery (behind the counter) were missing out on the experience.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

column3: Upper West Side, New York, NY
column6: No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Such a fresh and unique take on an omakase experience - fantastic from start to finish! Every detail is so delicately curated and you're instantly transported into the immersive world of Mr. Moto. The menu was absolutely delightful, full of variety and had things I don't typically see in other omakase tastings - and SO MUCH FOOD. Chefs and staff were also wonderful, and even though there was another seating after us, we were able to linger a little longer after our meal at the moody downstairs lounge. A must try!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Came here after seeing on social media how you get a secret passcode to enter. Made reservations a few weeks back, so my fiancé and I, and our friend came for the 21 course tasting. Loved everything about this place! From the decor, the little story behind it, the servers were absolutely great (knowledgeable, friendly and funny!), and of course the food! All of the fish we had was super fresh, with some even being flown in that morning and prepared for the evening we were there. What I loved compared to other Omakase we've been to, is they use very little rice with the fish. They really highlight the taste of the fish as well as how they prepare it. Instead of feeling bloated and super full halfway through the tasting, by the end of the 21 courses, we felt very satisfied without feeling super full. Again, this was easily the freshest fish I've ever had at an Omakase or sushi in general. Don't want to give too much away, since the story behind Mr. Moto and the way this restaurant does everything, is a very cool experience. But I do want to commend the servers, they were very knowledgeable about all the fish we were served, and were very personable and funny. Would definitely come here again!

There are some meals that stick out in your memory throughout your life. I know the omakase experience at The Office of Mr. Moto will be one of those meals for me. You could taste the passion in every bite of fish and in every sip of sake. I teared up at one point when biting into a piece of sushi, and the chef was so happy he celebrated by pumping his fists in the air. The whole meal felt like an ode to the gifts of the sea. If you are looking for a truly special meal, you've found the right place!

Where do I even begin? It was a very interesting experience. First, they give you a secret code and you need it in order to enter the restaurant. I have been to some restaurants in Japan and it is like that. I like how they are bringing this idea to New York. It kinda remind me of speak easy bars. The food was delicious and we enjoyed all the pieces. The waiters were very attentive. My drinks was always full. My favorite was the ikura uni cluster egg! Will come back again!

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: No comment
This is an outstanding sushi restaurant in New York City. Not only the taste, but the concept of the restaurant and the staff are wonderful.
Everything was excellent. The fish was super fresh, rice warm and sweet, and service was unbelievable.

The most worth it experience ever. Mr Moto's omakase menu was immaculate and creatively put together, and I was insanely full by the end. No fish or flavor was exactly the same and all the courses were incredibly fresh and well-balanced. Sitting at the counter was also an amazing experience while watching the chefs perfectly prepare each fish. Loved the decor and the aesthetic of the place as well (def insta worthy!!).
No comment

A delight with the sweetest, most attentive staff, and hilarious sushi chef who brought the most elegant nigiri. We loved that there wasn't too much rice on the nigiri so the fish could really shine through! Sardine was easily my favorite and the Hokkaido uni was such a treat! Great sake list also!

We had the best time! Of all the omakase spots, this had just enough to differentiate itself without losing the centrality of just really good food. The space is small and cozy, but laid out so no one feels cramped and with comfortable seating. Interesting details are all over, providing fun stories and information and all looking beautiful. The service was impeccable and everyone was so kind, we loved getting details about what each course was and they were attentive to every need/want. The pace of the night was lovely, we never felt rushed and we were still sad when it was over. Best of all was the food, every course was delicious, very fresh and seasonal and expertly seasoned. There were many things I hadn't had before, and it was all really great. I liked that sitting at the tables permits you an extra course- really makes it so there is no wrong answer between table and bar. Truly a 10/10 experience, great for a fun date or night out with friends.
We had a last minute galentines-- the food was so delicious, the decor so cute, the staff was incredible -- they made our afternoon very special, great experience

Immaculate vibes, service, and sushi at this spot. Honestly one of the best and most unique omakase experiences I've ever been to in a city full of great sushi. Great in particular for true sushi buffs as this experience takes you through historical tradition. Also love the speakeasy feel and secret downstairs lounge!! Highly recommend for a special date or just because.

The whole experience was excellent - one of the best omakases i've done. Ambience was super classy - everything from the secret entrance, the lighting, decor on the walls, and the waiting room downstairs. The chef was really nice and friendly, and the food was exceptional. Very good value too for the price pt - number of courses was extensive, and the fatty tuna and uni are a must try
The best omakase in nyc hands down. Speakeasy vibe is on point and the value for 185 per person is insane!! 18 pieces had me stuffed!

Refreshing omakase concept with an intriguing theme that makes you want to research a transformative period of Japanese history leading up to the Meiji Restoration. The menu is a great blend of new and well-executed classics. Has the best scallops I've found in NY so far memorably fresh uni. Food portions were satisfying too - it's not just a tasting session, but a real meal as well. Will be back to check out the cozy lounge next time!

column3: D Street / West Broadway, Boston, MA
column6: Fantastic experience. The food is excellent. 21 course omakase for a great price. Comparable to the best in the city. The space itself is also unique and beautiful. The restaurant is warm and you immediately feel welcome by everyone. As a plus - check out the really cool speakeasy in the basement!

From the moment we arrived at the incognito entrance, it was an intimate and curated experience. Every detail is thoughtful, from the history and art on the walls to the presentation of each course. The staff were friendly and knowledgeable, and the sushi was exceptional. Each course was delicate and presented as a work of art. We enjoyed the variety of fish and presentations, including traditional preparations from before freezers were invented. A unique NYC dining experience not to be missed!
unique omakase sushi experience. we enjoyed every pieces. great sake selection as well.

EVERYTHING was next level. So well done and beautiful presentation.  The staff was beyond friendly and accommodating. New favorite place!  Brunch on Sunday was so fabulous that we had to return later in the week for dinner. It will NOT disappoint!
No comment
No comment
No comment

For a place to grab a drink and some snacks, I would definitely recommend Cool world. The oysters were top notch: good mignonette sauce and tomatillo hot sauce served with them. The fries, which I was wary of given they were pretty thick, were actually delicious. Super hot and crisp on the outside but somehow still tender potato goodness inside. Seemed a bit chaotic service-wise but they were very apologetic and ultimately it didn't impact us much.
Good ambiance. The wedge salad was SOOO good. I was pretty full by the time the French onion soup came so I can't fully judge it
No comment

Been here a few times, last 2 times were not great. First bad experience alerted management and they did acknowledge the mistake. Had dinner here last night. Ordered main course, side of fries, then oysters. Fries came first. Then main course, then oysters while I was working on the rest of the meal. No one helped clear the table or make room. Only when I got the bill did they take the oyster shells away. 3 bad oysters (were they preopened)?
Cocktails were delicious and so were the fried duck balls. Everything else is alright - not bad but not exceptional. Kind of pricy for what it is.

Came here during the NY marathon today and was such a let down. Ordered the soft eggs thing and it was terrible like soggy eggs even when I specified I wanted well done , it was not , also had no chicken when they said it did. Food took forever . My friend didn't order a sauce and they charged us for it. The waitress was very confused when we had a bill with two different charges which was very odd. Bad experience, would come back but only for drinks.
No comment
No comment

This is such a cool space and a great location, but there's so much turnover for some reason. Had high hopes that this chef would stick, but unfortunately, it just wasn't great. Awesome service but we had the potato app with cabbage on top which was okay but sort of strange--heavy on the acid and sort of like sauerkraut. Then the halibut was good, but about three bites. The portion was comically small. The waiter agreed and brought us shrimp cocktail and Brussels which was so nice, but they were so overpowered with spice that we were coughing and just couldn't eat them. Such a bummer bc it's lovely for so many reasons, but the food was just a miss.
Incredible. The dishes are decadent but light!  Flavorful without being overwhelming/distracting. Great service, vibrant crowd. Incredible chef.

Excellent fresh spot with a simple, yet unique menu that does not disappoint! The chicken and waffles were on point and all the sides were fantastic. Great cocktails too! The chef clearly ads his own flare to familiar flavors, and the care shines through. Definitely recommend!

Had a birthday dinner here last night. Food was great. It is very loud but I am also very loud so it worked out. But the STAFF- incredible. Truly charming and lovely in a neighborhood that doesn't always give the most welcoming of vibes. Brooks the bartender and Ben our server- truly lovely. Will be back asap. Get the rolls and steak frites!
Stylish and cool, great food and stellar drinks situation. Great addition to the 'hood
Scallops were awesome, as well ass the wedge salad and the mussels! Our cocktails were great and the wine program is nice - had a delicious sparkling pet nat. Great staff too!

Came here for my birthday a couple weeks ago. I love the ambience and location is great, however I don't think I've ever waited so long for a meal in my lifeIt's a new restaurant so I am sure they're working out some kinks but the service was wildly slow. There was about 3,000 servers working but no one was really working? We were in no rush and I'm not an impatient person but after waiting an hour for our first appetizer I was a little bit like y'all good back there? Food was okay. I ordered the fish which had a nice flavor but it was just a quarter sized slab of fish swimming in broth. I asked for some rice on the side to eat with it bc ur girl needs substance, but after 40 minutes of waiting I canceled it and ate my lil fish in ab three bites. Is this how the Williamsburg girls stay so fit? I also got the salad that had savory granola on top which was v weird and soggy. Anyway! I have no idea what I'm talking ab and I never write reviews but thought I'd share. I would come again bc I love the interior designers & drinks are good but I wouldn't come hungry lol‍
it was the best dinner i had in nyc. highly recommend. michelin quality at a low price
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I've been to Yara twice now and have enjoyed it thoroughly both times. Flavors are bold and authentic. Quality of ingredients and execution of cooking are very good. I am looking forward to going back.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
This is the real deal! It's not just hummus and Kebobs. They serve food that my grandmother cooks. And they do it almost as good. The ambiance is elevated and the service is super friendly.
No comment
No comment

I came here with my friends for a birthday dinner. The food and service was amazing! The restaurant is very nice inside as well. Everything tasted so fresh and the cocktails were made perfectly. I definitely would recommend this restaurant!
No comment

Seriously great food.  From the basic hummus to the more elaborate mixed grill, shawarma, salmon, and chicken livers!  Just excellent and unique in their preparation and quality.  Was at a business gathering, and we were in their downstairs section: Nicley appointed bar area, and very comfy seating where we could talk and enjoy these superior presentations of traditional Mediterranean dishes.

We went for lunch on a weekday and it was completely empty. Sometimes that's nice but I think it resulted in us getting a bit too much attention from the waiter (who may have been the owner?) and it became a bit uncomfortable. So kind and I'd recommend this place to everyone, but I think the restaurant's vibe is actually better for dinner when it's more filled up. They have great cocktails, great mezze, and great mains. I'd recommend the hummus for sure and the salmon.
Food and ambience were great.  Waiters could have come by more often, but all in all, we had a great dinner and a nice evening.  Really liked this place.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Excellent food and service! They also had live music which really added to the ambiance.

Really enjoyed the food and vibe here. Felt like someone's home, there were live guitarists and the whole crowd was very diverse/cultured/vibrant. The service was slow hence the 4 stars but I'd recommend this place!
No comment
No comment
Best ever! Fresh everything. Great service and ambiance. The Okra was to doe for! Deserts were a dream.
No comment
No comment

Lovely mediterranean restaurant with ample seating, great service and extensive menu including vegan options. Enjoyed the mezze that comes with generous serving of pitta, and enjoyed the taste of warak enab. Vegan Okra tasted more stew-like than expected and not as flavourful as hoped. Otherwise brilliant place to dine and would visit again.

Beautiful venue, has a nice, sophisticatedly elegant atmosphere. Staff are kind, like hospitality is perfect but their service is slow, and the food is okay at best. When we entered and requested a table for six, we were told we couldn't stay longer than 2 hours bc they had a full house of reservations later in the evening. This was fine with us, except servers didn't check in with us promptly enough for us to order our meals at appropriate times. (Everyone was sweet though). Food also came out late and at different times.
No comment
No comment

Not what we expected or wanted. I understand that waitstaff do not need to be friendly in NYC. But it helps. The food was okay. Nothing special. The place is loud. Brightly lit restaurant made you feel like you were in cafeteria. Food was poorly paced to the table. Would not return. Not because it was bad but because NYC has so many other choices.

Food is ok . No really a good flavor more on the plain side . The waitress no very gracious. She was not impolite but was in a hurry and we didn't feel welcome. The ambiance is nice, clean and modern . Love the Lebanese music .
No comment
No comment

Loved the food. The flavors were delectable. I ordered a fattoush salad with lentils and rice. It was truly wonderful. We also had the chicken kabob platter. Also delish. The chicken was not dried out and it was not overdone. The service was second to none and with a smile.  I recommend this highly.
No comment
No comment
Very rude staff, owners yell at the employees in front of the customers. Very nasty and overpriced. Don't go there!!!
Food was amazing! The downstairs bar is very chill and beautiful. The beet falafels are a must!

Have been here a few times and the food, service & ambiance are all top notch.  The staff really knows their food, how it's prepared and sourced.  Great time with some friends and though the place is lively we could all talk and be heard.  I cannot say enough about the wonderfully fresh food and variety of dishes. In a time when fine dining is so competitive and staff is so difficult to hire and keep Yara is killing it.  Cannot wait to go back!!

One of the few places in NYC that offers kibbeh nayeh from the menus I've looked at! I first had this dish at Sunnin in west LA and found it appealing. Yara has one with cracked wheat which adds an interesting texture and with more fresh garnishes. It didn't have as much flavor as I remember but that's ok. Their babaganoush is a little more  sour than I'm used to also. We also tried a chicken and vegetable stew that i can't recall the name of. It's a little upscale restaurant but everything was well plated and fresh. Other aspects of the menu didn't stick out to me as much. Overall a good experience and would come back!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Do yourself a favor and go and eat here. The food is so good !!! I loved the lamb and okra curry. The vibe of the place is also so warm and friendly and the hostess , Linda is absolutely the best!

Service, food, and prices were great. A group of us ordered a few appetizers and a couple entrees yo share. We were all happy with the food, portions, and the bill. The waiter knew we were celebrating something so he brought out a dessert without even asking (he figured it out bc we had 5 in our group and only 4 credit cards were used).
Fresh. Delicious. Authentic Labanese. Yummm!!!  Weeknight dinner with friends. Our first time at restaurant and our restaurant of choice did not disappoint.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Food was mediocre and the service was not well organized.  Drinks took forever to order and we had to call the waiter to come so we could order food. It was just spotty and erratic.  Decor is ok but they add tip for a party of five so you know what's up there.  Won't be back.

We were visiting Manhattan for our anniversary, and picked Yara based on the reviews. When we arrived, we did not have a reservation, but the waitress directed us downstairs to their bar where there was full service. The downstairs bar was great, nicely appointed, and was like a little oasis in the city. Furthermore, we had one on one service with the downstairs barman Mauricio was exceptional, and really enhanced our experience. Mauricio had an excellent touch of being attentive without being crowding, and was more than happy to give us recommendations on the most popular dishes (which were fantastic) , as well as socialize. Linda the owner stopped by and was very welcoming and passionate about her staff. Lots of space, nice decor, and great food! Definitely stop by if you are in the neighborhood
No comment
No comment
No comment
Amazing food! The fattoush salad, grilled meat, hummus, and kunafe were all so good. Yes, it's definitely pricey but totally worth it for the quality of the dishes. Highly recommend this place!!

Ordered delivery and were extremely disappointed. We live a block away so I'm not sure how the food would be cold by the time it arrived but it was.  We ordered red pepper hummus and received plain. Fries were cold and soggy. Chicken shawarma couldn't be appreciated due to the overpowering garlic sauce on the sandwich. Falafel sandwich was decent though. Overall very disappointing experience and we will not be ordering from here again.

The food was incredibly well presented, deliciously and unique. I wanted to order something unique and could not be found somewhere else. The owner recommended us chicken liver, Lebanese sausage, and a feta dish, and they turned out surprisingly tasty. Their Lebanese ice cream has three different flavors, all unique and refreshing, you can even taste the strawberry seeds in the strawberry ice cream. The Lebanese milk pudding was fluffy, light, and aromatic. We had pleasant conversations with the owner. He was very hospitable and interesting, sharing with us his stories traveling around the world. Will definitely come back and try other dishes. Highly recommended for the unique food and authentic cultural experiences! --Jingwen & Matthew
No comment

Beautiful setting and uncrowded eating arrangement. Food was excellent and specialty drinks outstanding.  Chairs were found to be uncomfortable by my guest and myself. Waiters sharp and trending impatient while the restaurant was not overly crowded.  Strange unisex bathroom found myself in there with my client.  Not the most comfortable experience!
No comment

Definitely one of the best Lebanese spots in Manhattan. We got the Yara fries, hummus, babaghanoush, tabouleh, falafels, cheese sambosik and kibbe- my favourites were the sambosik and tabouleh, but everything was great (the yara fries were amazing but could use more zatar). We had the lebanese strawberry ice cream for dessert and it was delicious. Definitely would recommend.
A very beautiful restaurant, open modern interior,  staff very friendly , food are very fresh and tasty.

Terrible. worst take out we've ordered and not cheap either. missing half of the ingredients listed. will not be ordering from here again. most street meet vendors in the city out these guys to shame.
Very nice setting and space. I also loved the food. It's a four star because it took them too long to bring the food out, and to get the cheque.
Great food and nice service. Lovely decor and good lunch specials too. Maybe a little pricier than some other Mediterranean places but food was quality.
Good food, good vibes! I would definitely come back. I ordered a few smaller plates and it was great!

Came here for NYE dinner. Food was delicious (especially the fried cauliflower and the grape leaves). Such good Malbec. Staff was amazing and so friendly! Perfect intimate ambience- great for a date. Will definitely come back!
Amazing!!! Great service, love the ambience, AMAZING hummus, and just great experience overall. Highly recommend.
No comment

I have never had a worst dining experience. We came here for a birthday dinner and everything was wrong from service to food. Our order was incorrect multiple times. The filet mignon came out over cooked. The lentil soup tasted almost like a cleaning solution. The server and bartender we're getting our drinks wrong all night or forgetting to ring them in or bring them out. They gave us a complementary dessert for the birthday girl and I take a bite and there is a literally a piece of a wire brush. The owner Linda was so sweet about the situation but it's still unresolved. We waited almost 30 minutes to get our check. Our table consisted of over 30 years of being in the restaurant industry collectively and none of us had ever been so angry with a dinner. This was our first and last time ever coming here. Ambiance was pretty but experience and service was not.

Yara could have been good but the flatbread served with our mezze and sandwiches was definitely not fresh. It was like eating thick brown paper - tasteless and tough. It's so easy and fast to throw flatbread dough on the grill, not sure why day old, dried out food was served to us. I was surprised by the good ratings other reviewers gave Yara. The cart outside my building does much better falafels for 1/3 the price.  The pickled turnips were good, though.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Good food, fast service. They served us the brunch sandwiches even during dinner which was nice. Chicken shawarma was 10/10

The ambiance was nice but the food was overpriced and you can certainly get better quality and price elsewhere. Our chicken shawarmas were so salty and came with a garlic sauce that tasted like straight up garlic paste. And their dessert was far too sweet. We got the kunafe.

Staff at this 5-month old restaurant was very welcoming, hospitable and professional. Setting is spacious and decor is modern. Main dining room is street level; downstairs is the bar where you can also order from the main dining room menu. Menu is simple and diverse for vegetarians and non-vegetarians and dishes are reasonably priced. Tried a couple of mezze dishes (falafel and babaganoush) and an entree (vegan okra) for dinner. Great flavors at a great value in a beautiful room!
No comment
No comment

Restaurant was empty on a Saturday night. The waitress clearly looked like she didn't want to be there - she had airpods on the entire time and disappeared for 20-30 minute periods. Didn't check on our table a single time after taking our orders (which wasn't done for 20 minutes after sitting down, despite the restaurant being empty). The service doesn't justify the expensive food, which wasn't very good at all. Stay away.

Great food we only had trouble receiving our food as showed in the menu the main course was with rice and  vegetables, they never mention to us that they ran out of rice. They need to work on their costumer service. Lamb chops were great got five them that!
Most amazing Lebanese food and desserts! Wine was really good too. Spicy potatoes are everything, the milk pudding is heavenly.

Food was amazing. Had the yara salad, falafel and hummus to start. For entres my and my friend both had the mixed grill which was great. Service was awesome. I sat outside (cuz covid) but inside looks like it would be very nice

We tried yara for the first time today! Loved the space and the food was amazing! Whatever we ordered was so good we didn't even have a chance to take a picture of it! Will definitely come back again! Happy for this new discovery! Cauliflower, and mixed grill were soooo good.

Overall experience was okay. Food quality was good and meat was cooked as asked for, however I was expecting real filet mignon rather than strips of meat. Rice portion was small which came with the platter but they did bring additional rice. Ambience was okay, was quite loud as it was busy on a Friday night.

BRAVO. We don't get to new restaurants often enough and as our granddaughter and fiance recently moved to 52nd Street and First Avenue and found Yara we went last night. There were five of us and we each ordered a couple of small plates which we shared as appetizers and entrees. Everything was terrific. Our plan is to return and eat through the menu then pick the 5 or 6 things we like best and focus on them going forward. I particularly liked the fallafel and the bread pudding squares that came with the ice cream. As the restaurant is popular, our granddaughter reserved a table for 6:30pm so we beat the crowd. We normally eat later than that but it turns out that this was a good strategy. The design of Yara is upscale and staff quite pleasant. Obviously, we'll be back.
No comment
See Tolba.  Wonderful service and exceptional food.  So enjoyable and fresh.  The okra was out of this world!!!!
No comment
No comment

Enjoyed it very much! From appatizer to desert, my wife and promised each other just a couple mezz plates, however, we ordered 2 mezzas and one  platter with the help of our server so we did not have overlapping food! And then a desert ! Rose water soaked pistachio something and Arabic tea! More then we planned on ordering but  Sooooooo good! Come on an empty stomach and just enjoy!
Beautiful restaurant but mediocre food. I got the beef shawarma platter and it was ok...not worth the price. The hummus appetizer was good but barely came with pita.
One of our favorite dining experiences in NYC. The owner Norman was great as well as our server. Excellent food and great ambiance. We look forward to becoming regulars.

Yara is certainly rather terrific. This is a great place and location with the nicest staff and over the top for value for the money. Such an outstanding menu, it was simply hard to choose, but I am really happy that I had Labneh. Crew is extremely helpful and will help you with anything. Definitely stop by if you can!

Yara is by far one of the best Lebanese restaurants around.  Service to ambiance to food quality,  all 5 stars worthy.  Came for Christmas dinner, and in no way did the skimp on service or food!  Falafel are a must, babaganoush is a must, hummus is a must, chicken shawarma is a must, their fresh hot sauce is amazing!  The hit though were the spicy potatoes!  Cannot wait to go back, all the flavors were unique yet complimentary of one another.

Very good good and surprisingly very affordable. I went with a group of 10 and they sat us in the side/ back room which was really nice. It kind of felt like we had our own special area. The atmosphere was fun and every time it's someone's birthday they blast the music very loud. Definitely a fun place to go for someone's birthday or just a night out. The night I went the bar was pretty slow but otherwise I would recommend.

Wow. Walked into the door with my boyfriend during lunch hour and the waiter at the reception desk upon seeing us immediately turned away and promptly left us and walked downstairs despite me calling out hello several times. Total, utter, absolute ignorance of the presence of two customers. It is ridiculous beyond description and the rudest I've ever experienced at a restaurant. No wonder it is all empty during prime lunch hour.

Very nice middle eastern restaurant . We were doing vegetarian dishes only tonight. Excellent mussaka, hummus , Flafel & salads. I wish they had something better than generic pita bread to go along with foods definitely going back to try out lamb chops and shawarma.
No comment
No comment
The food here was amaazing. Great service and a very comfortable atmosphere. Highly recommend trying it out.

When the waiter told me the best thing on the menu was everything, I didn't think it was possible. We ordered mezzes for the table, the falafel (which we ordered more of it was so good), babaganoush, hummus, yara fries, cauliflower with tahini, and sambosik cheese. Everything tasted so fresh and was so delicious I didn't want to stop! The staff was so friendly, accommodating, and made our experience so worthwhile. Would recommend to anyone visiting or locals wanting to try a new place!

My boss took me here for lunch and the place wasn't too busy, decor was nice but service was BAD! They have a prifixe lunch menu but it felt like 20 minutes before the waiter took our order, the chicken shawarma which came with babaganoush was however pretty good!

It might be nice for dining at the restaurant judging on other reviews but dreadful for delivery. An impressive list of things that can come with your falafel (add up to ten). Upon receiving the food, none of them were included except for pita bread and sauce. Won't be ordering here again.
No comment
No comment
No comment

The decor is nice with a really great Arabic styled wall. We had the best waiter Jonathan. The food is made to order so don't come here if you're in a rush. The food was good and special note to the best chicken liver I ever had. The pomegranate sauce made this so flavorful and juicy. The Arab coffee also was delicious.  We went on a Friday and they had an awesome dj playing mixes that were unique and diverse.

The food here is constantly stellar. I've dined in and also gotten takeout, can't really go wrong with any of the apps or entrees though the chicken and lamb is amazing. The interior is gorgeous and huge, I wish they had more of the neighborhood coming here to eat! Never have an issue walking in without a reservation. Good cocktails and wine list as well. Definitely my go to Mediterranean spot

Delicious food, beautiful interiors and service is great!!!  The only reason I don't give it a 5 star is because the vegan kibbe was welll...interesting ... not something I'll order again as it was served raw and the only way I was able to eat it was supper dipped on the hummus, but Everything else was top notch. The Babaganoush was my favorite! Their regular lamb kibbeh was delicious too. Will come again for sure!!
No comment

I've lived in the neighborhood for years and somehow always missed this place; mistake! Visited this evening, the restaurant is stunningly decorated; elegant and cool but not stuffy. Food was remarkably tasty, brilliantly curated and well priced wine list. The lamb chops we superb. Highly recommend.

Excellent food and warm, personal service. Everything was super fresh from the salads to the various mezze. We shared a few dishes that we really enjoyed. I have had a lot of middle eastern food over the years and this tops the list. Can't wait to come back.

Amazing.  The food is delicious.  They offer a number of Vegan options which are clearly marked.  The service is great.  Most Manhattan restaurants are  nightmares.  My wife and I are so happy that we went here last night, I could not wait to give it a great review. We live and work close to the restaurant, we will be regulars.

Great Lebanese food in midtown! Perfect place to bring your parents or a dressy-ish first date. The falafel was crispy on the outside, cooked to perfection on the inside. I really enjoyed the okra (kinda like a stew, comes with white rice), tender lamb chops and fresh fattoush. The owners were really kind and milling about the restaurant making sure the customers were enjoying their meals.

Went here for our first indoor dining experience in a while. Felt super comfortable and safe. The food was excellent, the server was attentive but never made us feel rushed or like we were being sold. As vegetarians, we loved having a large selection of small plates to choose from that were all delicious and unique. Overall, the restaurant was perfect for a romantic, COVID friendly date night! We will definitely be coming back!
If you want authentic exquisite Lebanese food this is the place to go! Everything was delicious! Great service, beautiful restaurant can wait to be back!
Food was good, but the portion size is laughable. $26 beef shawarma platter provided one small pita sandwich and no sides.
No comment
No comment

I had a sampling of a lot of different dishes here and they were all great. Try the hummus or baba ganoush (spelling?), but the lamb is also very tasty. I came here for a party so I can't comment on the quality of the service (everyone with whom I interacted was very nice), but it's a great space with a bar downstairs serving tasty drinks.
The food excellent. Drinks great. Service decent. Overall I'll come back & the staff were friendly and welcoming. Especially if I have a date lol

Gorgeous atmosphere. Love the warmth that you feel when coming in. Beautiful designs. Sleek. Very sexy place. All the folks working there have a welcoming smile. What to get: the Yara salad, halumi, and the classic grilled meats selection. They have a nice downstairs section where you can have a private chat at the bar..nice for a date or business meeting. A nice additional to the neighborhood.

This Lebanese restaurant just opened and while there are some negatives, I think this has huge potential! The food came out quickly and was cooked to perfection! They did forget an order but quickly recouped. The interior is modern and open floor plan but very welcoming. The cocktail menu is superb! The wine list is a little pricey but there are a couple under $70 which are worth trying. The one oddity is the exterior. The red awning with white font does not reflect the ambiance at all. I'll definitely be back!

I've only been here once so far but this is a really great location with excellent cocktails. I loved the ambience and it's nice to have somewhere trendy and upscale in an area that's mostly more casual. It's beautiful inside and I could definitely see this being great for a birthday party. They have great beef kibbeh and hummus. Their old fashioneds are on point. It's on a quiet side street in an area that's usually pretty loud so gives you a nice contrast.

Wonderful menu with lots of options for vegan/vegetarians. They have indoor and outdoor seating and I felt comfortable with the space between tables. Wonderful food and experience. Will definitely return
No comment
Very good cocktails and authentic Lebanese food. The downstairs is fantastic for groups and the decor is really incredible upstairs.
No comment
LOVE IT! Best Lebanese food in the city. The hostess, Linda, is so great! I will definitely be coming back.

The spot is such a little gem in Midtown. The Mediterranean food is so fresh and very yummy. There are plenty of vegetarian options and the service was very nice. I enjoyed the live music as well - great addition in Midtown
Absolutely pleased with attentive service and amazing food! Everything is fresh and delicious, definitely will be back for lamb tartare
No comment

Went here because of the great Yelp reviews and was very disappointed. While some of the food was good, the service was appalling. We were there for 95 minutes only got a water refill after they brought the check which took 4 requests and 35 minutes. It was 20 minutes before someone came to take our order and food took another 30 and came out wrong. Don't waste your time, there are far better restaurants who want your business.
Best Lebanese food I have had in New York. I've been there several times and every time have been pleasantly surprised by how good the food is! Excellent service. Highly recommend!
No comment

Came here for lunch on a Sunday. The decor was very beautiful, but things went downhill from here. Waiter was very confused and forgot our order. We had the lamb chops, cooked medium rare, the result ranged from rare to well done. General quality of the food was bad and not very tasty.

I held a dinner here for around 30 students on Monday and it couldn't have gone any better! The staff and management were superb and everything was set up perfectly. Round tables made for easy conversation and I got to see so many student to get to know one another because of the thoughtful set up. The food was delicious and the hummus to die for! The decor is also stylish, beautiful, and warm. Mo and staff made everything easy and took care of my student's needs especially those with dietary restrictions. Couldn't recommend enough for a date night, family event, corporate lunch!
No comment
No comment

What a great dining experience. The staff, the ambiance and the food were all exceptional. I feel like I've found a gem that I will keep returning to. We got a bunch of apps and all were good (hummus w/meat, kibeh, spicy potatoes, grilled halloumi) The Yara mixed grill was amazing! Can't wait to come back!
Great outdoor dining experience - temperature scanner and hand sanitizer were available; tables were spaced apart; and wait staff wore masks. Quick turnaround on order, and the food was delicious.

Beautiful atmosphere and service from hostess and manager was welcoming and friendly. Wait staff was slow and awkward and didn't seem confident in the menu as it related to a nut allergy. Food was luke warm but pretty good. Overall expected a wow experience but left a little disappointed.

Absolutely amazing dinner experience. Came for my birthday dinner and the entire restaurant has an intimate family dinner feel with brick and Mediterranean inspired walls and decor. Each area in the back looks like having dinner in a well displayed dining room. We tried a bunch of appetizers and entrees which were outstanding in flavor and presentation. The whole staff was accommodating and sweet to our guests.

Service they say is everything and the people here from owner,  manager to staff are exceptional.  We were treated like kings.   The ambiance is chic,  the food is great,  please try their kibbe neye.   Going back to try their mlokhiyeh
No comment

Lovely decor. The place is named after the owner's daughter, which I thought was so cute. The hummus, falafel, and babaganoush were delicious. My friend ordered the shakshouka and the portion size was way bigger than expected. At a typical brunch place they probably give you 2 eggs but she got 5! The pita bread was nice and warm. Overall pretty good Lebanese food. The only thing I didn't like was that the zaatar spread they gave us had olives in it which made it a little tangy.
No comment

The food is phenomenal. I bring my vegetarians friends and family here, but there are good meat dishes as well. I do wish the pita bread was fresh-baked like at so many other places, but that is my only gripe.
Amazing food.  Great service. Beautiful restaurant.  We enjoyed every minute!
Beautiful restaurant. The owner and wait staff were super attentive and everything we ordered was phenomenal. Best kibbeh in the city.

This definitely has earned a spot on my nyc restaurant favorites. I love a mediterranean, especially Lebanese, menu because of the healthy and tasty options available. The hummus is absolutely delicious, along with the mixed grill! Both the owner and the chef did a great job to cohesively create the perfect food and drink menus. Not only is the dining area comfortable and inviting, but I love sitting in the bar/lounge area downstairs pre or post dinner for a more intimate vibe! Can't wait to go back!

We had a great dinner at this place.  The inside of the restaurant is nicely decorated.  We split the plate of meat, chicken and shrimp.  It was a good decision because it was too much food for one person.  The wine was excellent and our server was fantastic.  He made some great recommendations.
Excellent food and service. Great wine list.
Authentic food, beautiful atmosphere. Great for a date night or group. Highly recommend if you enjoy middle eastern food or looking to try some!!

Food wasn't the best Lebanese food I 've had in NY.   It was fair. Restaurant's design was beautiful.. service was good! They cleaned the table with alcohol wipes after each dish. Overall was a ok to good experience.
The food was good, but I felt like they were rushing me out. I barely finished my meal before the hostess was taking my dishes.

Saw this place from the 212 steak house across the street and have to admit this is a way better and more convenient place for a romantic cute date, they have comedy shows that are actually funny with a full service bar down stairs with a cozy environment, couldn't recommend this place enough.
The food is really good, the service tremendous as well as the portions and the best part is that I can go to the gym and not feel guilty for eating

Excellent! One of my new favorites in nyc! Perfect Lebanese food, so fresh and tasty! We basically ordered the whole menu and it was legit. Hummus tabouli all the dishes are fantastic. Beautiful ambiance and great wine selection. A must try!

I was very happy to have found a taste of home in the city :-). I discovered this Lebanese gem last Spring and have been coming here almost every week (more like multiple times a week) ever since. My favorite thing about the menu is the variety, from the more famous dishes like mezze, shawarma, and kababs to the more traditional Lebanese dishes like Kibbe b Laban, Kibbe b Sayniyeh, and Vegan Okra. The Shawarma sandwich is by far my favorite in the city. However, what attracted me the most to the restaurant and kept me coming is the bubbly and energetic manager. His positive and welcoming attitude are what make this place what it is. The staff is nice and fun as well.

Beautiful spot but sub par food. The chicken kebab and lamb kebab weren't spiced properly and we needed lots of hot sauce to get any flavor. Zaatar fries are lightly sprinkled and taste like regular fries, for dessert the baklava looked like it came from a box and the crepes seemed like they were premade and just rolled and given to us. Unfortunately we didn't enjoy the food at all, such a beautiful location, such a shame.

Food is quite yummy. Best hummus and pita bread I've had so far in NYC - the pita is made from scratch and takes 3 days to make. The hummus is very finely ground, super creamy and has almost a chewy texture. Cocktails are very good as well, tried the bourbon based ones which were all very good. Wine is overpriced here, expect to pay $18 for a glass of Cabernet which was just okay.

Chic and trendy ambiance but aside from that, nothing to rave about. Came here with a group of 7 and pretty much ordered everything off the mezza section for sharing. Food was okay and some items were quite hard to share. What threw me off was the cocktails "glasses" were plastic. How odd! That didn't particularly go well with the trendy vibe. What was nice was that they brought out free baklava for a friend's birthday.
We ordered from caviar, the grape leaves are excellent, the lamb ocra is excellent, the rice is really good too. Highly recommend
Best Lebanese food in the city. Food is spot on and reminds me of home. Amazing staff and beautiful atmosphere.
Delicious food and amazing service.  Owners are passionate about the food and want to make every dining experience special for guests. Authentic Lebanese cuisine. Can't wait to dine in again!
No comment
Went here after trip to zoo, what a great choice, falafel and Holumi was to die for. Followed by a mixed grill I would punch a nun for. Outstanding service and value.

Holy eff. Some of the best Med food I've EVER had!!!!! Fresh, clean and perfect! Everything was clearly made in house and with care, the service was good, decor on point.....just a great newer spot in the city that should be around for a LONG time.
No comment
Great authentic lebanese cousine, great service! Beautiful decor and cozy restaurant...

We had a light, late dinner here and really enjoyed it.  The decor is wonderful, contemporary and stylish.  Service was excellent.  We only ordered mezze with drinks -- everything was delicious.  We'll certainly be back for a full dinner.
Love this place, the decor has meat packing vibes, the service is great and the food is lovely. I highly recommend it.
No comment
Great ambiance. My girlfriend and I enjoyed the restaurant and hostess immediately upon walking in. The food was decent especially the labaneh.
No comment
No comment
No comment
I've been to Yara on different occasions and every time I come, I have a great experience! Excellent food, authentic Lebanese dishes and amazing staff. Mohamad makes sure every customer leaves happy.

This place was incredible. My friends picked it for my birthday dinner. The staff was incredible, very pleasant and professional. We met the owner-such a lovely woman (treated us like family!!). We were in a private dining area which felt just like being in someone's home. The atmosphere was great, food fantastic and lovely people and service. Thank you for making my birthday dinner so pleasant. Will definitely tell everyone about this place and hopefully be back many times. I highly recommend. Thank you, thank you!! 5 stars all the way.
If I could give this place a 20 I definitely would! Amazing interior, amazing food, and amazing waitresses! All food was cooked amazingly and the kabob was juicy but still well cooked!!

So much fine  trying different restaurants. This place was fun, lively and the food was great. The service  was awesome as folks were extremely attentive. I had a lamb dish that was so good. For starters the hummus was tremendous. The staff helped us choose meals and all of us left raving.

Went there with my coworkers and had a pleasant experience trying out Lebanese food for the first time. Lamb tartare was surprisingly not gamey and the taste was very smooth. Lamb pie was good too. I felt like some dishes were expensive for the portion but there were definitely dishes you wouldn't find anywhere else. We also got complementary chips and some purple vinegar veggie (name not sure).

The service was amazing. Alex and Oren took care of us and went above and beyond. The food was so delicious and the cocktails slapped. If you ever need a good date spot this is it. The ambiance is relaxed and refined yet modern. Skrrt skrrt
Wow wow wow! This was arguably the best meal I've ever had ! Amazing options for vegan food, Absolutely delicious! Wow wow wow!

My friends and I tried Yara and it was wonderful! Great service, tasty drinks and the food, amazing!! I have had Lebanese food before and have been in the middle east, Yara is authentic! Absolutely delicious! We tried several of the mezze and desserts and cafe turki with cardemom. So good! Visit soon, this is a warm, beautiful place!

Two stars for the amazing decor, and good service. The food was quite disappointing. I was extremely surprised, given the stellar reviews. The underwhelming hummus was accompanied by packaged/cold pita.  The second serving of pita was a bit warm. The chicken shawarma was surprisingly bad quality.  But if you are seeking ambiance, and are blessed with a limited palate this place is quite exceptional. There's a lot of potential here, the cuisine just needs to be revamped.
No comment
Food was excellent. Highly recommend fattoush, moussaka, and the salmon. The chocolate vegan ice cream was surprisingly good. Ambience/decor is modern and welcoming. Highly recommend!

Really enjoyed this place, which just happens to be on the way home from my workplace! Some well-crafted cocktails and delicious food along with ambiance and welcoming service (Jacob the owner and Oren the bartender, respectively, made my friends and I feel welcome like we'd been long-time patrons when in fact it was our first time there.) We will be back soon. Waiting for the booza (Lebanese ice cream) to arrive sometime soon and then we have a total win here!

Service was amazing however the food was super cold, I told them I wanted a new one but they literally bought out the same exact food not warmed up or anything. The shawarma is absolutely disgusting, super dry and has no taste I Promise. I'm never going back. This was the worst place I've ever went to.
Food is great we had to come back more than once! Highly recommend best lebanese food in New York

The restaurant design is beautiful. I tried the Taouk lunch special. Had some amazing appetizers. Atmosphere is relaxing and service is great. I would return to try other dishes. I highly recommend this place.
Excellent experience . Food was very delicious. Ambiance is so cute and amazing service . Definitely coming back again .

Yara is a VERY, VERY lovely looking fairly large restaurant. and it is not noisy!  There is a downstairs lounge area with a bar that is a great space. All of the staff are friendly and very attentive. The food is well prepared and very good. If you are looking to celebrate a special occasion or just go out for a nice lunch or dinner, I recommend this restaurant.
This is the best Lebanese cuisine in the metropolitan area. Nice atmosphere and the food quality is always good and consistent. I strongly recommend it.

We loved our dinner here. The staff was pleasant and attentive but not overbearing. When something was wrong they quickly fixed it and brought us free drinks. The food was delicious - we shared lots of dishes and all were good. The owner is warm and friendly. Highly recommend.

The service was decent and the ambience was nice...however, the food is completely inauthentic and overpriced. If you're looking for Lebanese food, don't come here.  It seemed like "Lebanese food" you would find at a shopping mall.  Even the pita was stale.  I am very surprised by all of these positive reviews.

I been to a few places in the city where they serve Hala food and they are really few of them but hands down Yara is one of my favorite  very Elegant setting but what really made me fall in love is the food I can sincerely say is as good as the authentic home made Lebanese food that you get from your mother hands .. I was really hungry and didn't have nothing but breakfast so we went all in me and my brother we order basically the whole menu the hummus with the meat and the pine nuts was amazing as well the fattoush salad we also got the falafel they where crispy and delicious so was the sambosek but when I got the vegan Kibbe I thought is going to be some okay experiment on an traditional Lebanese food but I was surprised it was so good with a lot of flavor I was really impressed. it was the last  thing after that we start with the main dishes my brother had the kibbe labneh and I got the mixed grill I can say the kibbe labneh was very good since we shared everything but the mixed grill was full of flavor and the chicken was juicy not dry at all and the kafta was awesome at this point we can barley breath but we couldn't skip on the desert and as well we want to have the full experience of Yara so we jump in the desert menu we had the Boza which is the ice cream   for me the pistachio and kashta flavor I can't say any more than that highly recommend if u in the mood for an excellent experience and great taste and flavor enjoy ....
New neighborhood gem, so beautiful!!  The service is exceptional and is so fresh and terrific please don't go away!!

Yara is amazing. The staff is very attentive and friendly and continued to fill our drinks before we even finished the first one. The food is amazing and fresh and inventive. I would recommend this place to anyone. Definitely come eat here.

I heard about this new Lebanese restaurant and definitely wanted to give it a try, however I wasn't pleased with my overall experience. Servers were friendly but that's about it. Generally an establishment would bring you bread and butter before the appetizers -- not in this case. Cocktails and appetizers took too long to arrive. After the cocktails and appetizers were dropped to the table, the main dish took forever to arrive. They also sent our second appetizer after we were half way thru our main dish. Appetizers weren't tasteful but it was edible. The main dishes were nothing new except fancy names. I was expecting a BANG for my buck and the portions were not shareable. Decent prices (which was good because it didn't kill my bank). Overall a bad experience. The only thing that I've probably enjoyed more than the food was the cocktails. I will definitely not be going back to Yara.
Hip new spot on the East side. Delicious and fresh. Chic interior. I liked the kibbe.

This restaurant hits all the marks of what a restaurant should be! The decor is beautiful. Sophisticated and warm and inviting at the same time. Beginning in the downstairs lounge. It's a soothing yet modern space where you'll want to sit on the couches with friends and enjoy a cocktail before dinner. Once you head upstairs for dinner you will find yourself in a beautiful well appointed dining room. Every dish served was made with the freshest ingredients. A good chef shines in the simplest dishes. All were prepared and seasoned beautifully. Warm fluffy pita was put on the table first with an olive oil dip containing zahtar and black olives which was served with pickled turnips on the side. Delish. The hummus, falafel made with beets, babaganoush, cauliflower, moussaka and exceptional grape leaves were all winners. They compromised a meal in itself. We had an entree of grilled lamb chops, cooked to perfection and a traditional okra dish that was fabulous. A standout dessert was milk pudding!

Amazing place. And staff super friendly. Justice took care of us and was amazing. Manager Eduardo was also great.  Would recommend it to anyone to have a amazing great time with friends. Great view and amazing maracuya margaritas.
No comment

Absolute rip off going to be 100% honest. While eating on a boat is fun, especially on a summer night. The price was not worth the quality. Get some Mexican food to go and sit in a bench by the water, you'll lower the risk if getting seasick exponentially. Servers were fine, definitely not in them, but they can't save a bad meal ya know? It was actually pitiful how small the guac appetizer was (see picture) literally you get more on your burrito at Chipotle, not exaggerating.
No comment
No comment
I really enjoyed my experience. The food was good... They were well organized and clean. The boat was on time both sailing and docking. It was a good time.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Small meals for pricey menu, just get the nachos--it's a lot and might be worth that price. Drinks are strong. Ride is one hour in the water but you can stay on the boat roaming around or what not for 2 more hours.

This restaurant is located at Pier 81 in NYC. You pay about $10 to board each. You need your license and COVID vaccination card to get on. They sell Mexican food primarily tacos. The tacos average to about $17 for a meal. It was 4 people in my party. The bill was about $220 with appetizers, drinks and tacos. I am giving it a 3 because I was not that fond of the food. The steak taco was ok the shrimp taco did not tickle my fancy. The guacamole and chips was blah. I could of made it at home. The churro dessert was good with the caramel sauce and the drinks were good and strong. The best part of the trip are the views while your eating and to take pictures of you are into that.

Granted I will start we had a group of 12 with us. BUT for the amount the waiter came back to confirm things we ordered we didn't get half of our drinks and food and we're still charged for it. We had to go down to the bar and remind them after 40 min... and it's only a 2 hour boat ride. The boat itself was beautiful and the views were great! The shrimp were gross.. guac not the best. The waiter yelled at me when I reminded him my tacos didn't come and told me I never ordered them.. I wrote it down I did order them. Service really was terrible and the tacos could have been better. The waiter argued with us saying we got free food (when we didn't) so we shouldn't be complaining. Asked to speak to a manager and he never came. Only come on here for the views. Don't waste your money otherwise.

I love the energy! Alex the manager is on top on things, he greets you sits you and chats to make sure everyone is having a good time, Christian and Adrianna was our waiter, he brought our drinks and was helpful with any questions. I bought season pass because I love the boat that much. They have Sunday brunch all you can drink and all you can eat from 12-2pm and the boat goes towards the Statue of Liberty from Thursday Friday and Saturday boat goes to east side from 8pm -10pm. This Is the ideal first date for someone who loves sunset by the river, I recommend the nachos and the drink called dessert  moon, the drink has agrave and pear, it has a unique taste and I definitely recommend it if you want to feel like you're away from this wild city for a bit. this boat is ideal

The lobster tacos were delicious, wish I ordered 3 instead of 2. The drinks I wasn't to fond of, taste mostly like juice and wasn't strong enough. After two drink tries, I ended up just ordering a beer. The whole experience is dope though, def going again before the summer ends.
No comment

We had a blast! The crew was incredibly hospitable, the food was delicious, the drinks were great, and the atmosphere was so much fun. Beautiful views of the city from the Hudson. The only thing I'll say was the food was a bit scarce and took a while to get through the line - get in line for food early if you go. But other than that, no complaints - our group had a wonderful time!
No comment

I came here for my friend's bday during the day. It was cute. I would visit again because it has a lot of potential. Only downside is the music was giving me hotel music. I want to go to it during the night because that looks like a vibe.
For my birthday in September 2021 we took the ride around NYC. It was a great experience! Empandas were delicious but not for $$$! The dj played good music! I'll go back this summer during the day!

I was a bit nervous after reading some of the reviews - but we really liked it.  The food was very good, the staff was friendly and the views were great.  My only complaints, which were minor, are that the waiter took his time coming to take our order (and only came back once), and my tequilla sunrise was  ALL tequilla - way too strong.  We only did the one hour cruise, but we plan to go back and do the two hour cruise.
No comment

Slow service, took 25 minutes to get our order taken. During the last 30 minutes of the entire experience, our food came in all at once even though we ordered an appetizer + drinks. Plus my fried cod fish tacos were cold.. and bland, didn't even come with lime. The frozen sangria/margarita drinks had 0 alcohol in them but were $16. The food in general was just average at best, NOT generous on portion size, no spiciness and light on salt. It was impossible to flag down a waiter also. We didn't get our check in time and had to wait on the boat while people were leaving in order to pay. Would skip eating here next time but the boat ride was nice.
No comment
Drinks were so good. Ridiculous that it cost $8 to add salsa to our chips. Vibe was fun. Cruise was shorter than planned.
Cute boat, good food (pricey though I would eat before as well), drinks are ok but I'm not much of a tequila person so I'm biased. Would come back for the brunch party or night party.
Spontaneous trip and a beautiful dining experience. Food was good and drinks too. The pay experience went smooth, scan bar code of the bill before we docked again. Very easy. Will return

The best thing about this restaurant on the water is the fact that you cruise for an hour and Can see the skyline and it's so peaceful.     However, the food is mediocre.   Not terrible but nothing to brag about.   The frozen Sangria was sweet and delicious.    We were on the 6pm cruise Im thinking the 8pm would be a lot better because of the sunset.

We came on the boat tour for a university event. It was a nice trip. We spent about an hour riding north on the Hudson and then back to the pier. We bought tickets for a package which included beers, chips & guacamole, and tacos. We were pretty happy with the tacos. They were very juicy.
No comment
The cruise was such a great time! Not too short and the food came out so quickly and all of the staff was friendly and accommodating! Will definitely be back this summer!

Experience was really fun and you get some beautiful views of the city. My el remolino was such a good drink! However, Food is a bit pricey for what seemed to be good tacos. Tacos that you can get anywhere in the city for about $10 cheaper especially just for 2. Service is alright given there's about 100 people on this boat who are constantly away from their table because of the want to take pictures with the amazing views. So they, what seems , wait until you get back to your seat to bring out your food fresh. So that's a huge plus. Overall, fun experience. Looking forward to doing it again with a bigger group of people and family that live outside of the city. I wish I would've taken pictures of the food but we were starving.
The food was very bland, drinks were not as strong as you would think it should be, and one of our servers seemed very inexperienced. The pros are good music and the views.
a slightly above average restaurant on a boat with above average views, experiences and memories. also dranks.

When you hear the name "La Barca Cantina" and see Mexican flags hung up, you automatically think about dancing to Mexican or Latin music. Sorry not the case! Don't get me wrong the staff were all very nice and respectful. The food and drinks were okay. Unfortunately, the DJ was rude. I politely asked if we could request a song and her response was "you can but I may not play it". She still had two more hours to play and she put 3 Spanish songs and the rest of the night she played rap music. Don't get me wrong I have nothing against rap music but cmon mix it up and if that's the case the boat needs to change its name.

The mezcal selection here is absolutely top notch and quite affordable considering you're on a boat cruising around on the Hudson! You can tell the owner put a lot of thought into it, and I loved the tasting notes as well. Definitely a one-of-a-kind experience, and can't wait to go back to try more. Also enjoyed the shrimp taco, ceviche, tres leches, and La NewYorkina paletas (Mexican chocolate mmmm). That one star below seems harsh - most places have some kinks to work out right when they open. Still a great addition to the scene after a long pandemic year and luckily just in time for summer!

My husband & I had the pleasure of experiencing this floating restaurant.  I cannot say enough great things about it! The staff was pleasant & professional, the atmosphere was very relaxing. We stayed & enjoyed a second round on the boat & had some wonderful dessert. Eduardo, the manager, was absolutely fantastic. I will be definitely be back for a girls trip!

So we order the guacamole, it was basically just smashed avocado with tomato and nothing else. No taste. The truffle esquite was good they served it with nachos, but the pitcher was definitely not it. It was an overpriced juice pitcher.. it didn't taste nothing like passion fruit more like coconut and definitely not what we were expecting. My friends ordered 3 different types of tacos, steak (decent), Tony's campechano (for specific tastes) I think it had bay leaf and it overpowered the meat. Al pastor tacos (no complaints from my friend). And the cheese quesadilla which was the highlight of the night. Lastly the churros, the caramel sauce was good but they were not freshly made .... Don't make the mistake of ordering the lobster tacos though. The experience was cute though, but have a lot to work on.

What a great day drinking activity! This boat takes off and you get beautiful views of the city skyline. Staff was friendly and invested in guests having a good time. We did a bottomless brunch for 2 hours then spent the rest of the day enjoying the boat ride and bar! Will definitely be coming back and recommending to friends.

It's great for a summer boat ride but they really have to improve the music!! That's my only complaint. We want to here live modern mix of music. Not boring music that makes you feel like your at grandmas or church!!

column3: Upper West Side, New York, NY
column6: Good food and vies but it is overpriced for the area, which the boat would make up for if you didnt already have to pay $25 for a ticket on the boat. Service was great though and the food and drinks came out quickly. Would go back for a birthday/celebration or when friends are in town but not just for dinner.

Best experience ever! I found out about this on NYBucketList. Once you enter the boat, everything is a fiesta! The staff welcomes you and guides you on what the options are. The boat is nice and clean (restrooms too). The one hour ride through the Hudson is nice, but it feels like a short time because you're having such a nice time there. Kudos to Wesley, Oscar and Dave! Best bartenders ever! And thank you Eduardo for such a lovely experience. Greetings from Costa Rica!

Amazing experience - despite the drizzle - the service and atmosphere was great. The food was flavorful, well presented and overall well. Drinks strong and delicious, Aztec Goddess was my favorite of the night.

Went there for Sunday lunch with my husband. Loved it! Lovely music, can't beat the views. Friendly service, great tacos and they have lots options plus a full bar. I m a New Yorker, but do enjoy this "touristy" stuff sometimes. So, they have 2 levels and the top deck. I believe you can probably book an event and have a whole deck to yourself, for that I would pick a lower deck. Still, great for a date or just hanging out. Definitely recommend them, hope they stay though the winter months, could be fun. Good luck!!!!

My boyfriend and I came here for the first time yesterday. We ordered chicken and champechano tacos. The food was amazing and the frozen margarita/sangria drinks were so good!! We ordered an appetizer but it never came, maybe they forgot, regardless we didn't complain because everything else was excellent and it wasn't on our bill anyway. We will be back!

So much fun! The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful. The food was very tasty and paired well with their strong drinks. I would highly recommend the steak tacos and the churros. Overall a great experience and the best vibes!

Nyc best kept secret!!!!! It's a floating Mexico restaurant!!!! So u go on to the site and pay $10.00 for your admission fee which is so worth it because u can stay on for the next hour go around,your just ask to go downstairs so other guest boarding can enjoy the the top view also.What an amazing experience,meeting new people,drinks where on point!!! Tacos were ok but staff was so polite and helpful especially David and our host Craig.Did mention that they really need to change the music up a little but overall this was a real fun experience and recommend this floating restaurant to everyone u can even have a birthday or any special event here .Will definitely be back

Don't waste your time or money. First of all, the boat literally goes back and forth in circles in about a 20 block radius. You're going to get a lot of views of the UPS building on the west side highway. The service was terrible. The staff who let you on the boat were so unfriendly. I don't know if it's cause they're all so young but yeah no thanks. My friends and I ordered shots to start and literally they don't even give you full ones. When you tell them that this isn't a full shot they're like do you want a 2 oz shot? No. I want my full 1oz shot that I'm paying for. Terrible service. Staff seemed really inexperienced. Extremely overpriced. Everything on their menu was very expensive. You're charging me for my drink so give me what I'm actually paying for. Literally will never recommend or go on this boat again.

The experience was wonderful staff is amazing drinks are amazing the only thing that wasnt great was the food so you really pay for the experience. Ive heard the brunch is way better then the hour cruise so i will definitely be back! Overall great time!
expensive but good experience. It is a 1 hour tour. Good music. The food is good!!!!!
Great place to enjoy the view of nyc while having a delicious Mexican food with friends- family. And while you wait for the sunset, have a few cocktails.

Fun experience but the ride is too short. It's only an hour and we were still enjoying our drinks abs felt rushed to finish them so we can depart and the next group can board.  The food was ok. The drink were ok. The service was ok.  It can be a vibe if it lasted longer.
Such a fun night!! The boat ride is beautiful, the food & drinks were great, and the staff was fantastic. Highly recommend!!

I had the most amazing time! The service was absolutely amazing. I really appreciated that our waiter gave candid feedback and gave us the best experience. Marcus was the best I would come back to request him. Eduardo also set us up really amazing! They take care of their customers here and the food is delicious.
They're aren't enough words to say how amazing this experience was! Amazing food, drinks, and staff such a perfect moment for friends 11/10:)

Aside from the amazing skyline and sunset views + never ending tequila/mezcal options, the best thing about La Barca Cantina is the service. I was SO glad to see Alex again this season, he makes the entire experience better and more enjoyable. Also definitely try the beyond nachos! they were my favorite dish

I wanted to love this place, I truly did - due to the location, the experience, price I wanted it to be something that I would want to do often but unfortunately I was left disappointed. You can make a reservation for sailing times which is great since this is on the pier and without reservations who knows if you would be able to get on. The recommendation is that you arrive 15-30 minutes before your sailing time so that you can wait to board and obtain a seat. There are 3 levels with the top level being the most desirable since it is outside. They do have it so that you are able to switch to other levels to continue drinking without having to get off if you're not ready to and to also allow everyone the experience to be on the top of the ship which I think is nice. The food and drinks left a lot to be desired - the tacos were all covered in like a bbq sauce which is just weird. If the meat was seasoned correctly, I don't think that sauce would be necessary. The drinks were watered down for sure, I didn't taste any alcohol. It was nice to be able to say that we did it but I doubt that we return.

TRASH. The food was trash. My steak was raw. The food was bland. They missed order notes. The food and drinks on the boat is very expensive. They are all appetizers. There's not really much to choice from on the menu. The drinks are watered down. I had so much hope for this experience and it was honestly not worth it. I don't recommend anyone purchasing a ticket. The views at night ate the only thing worth the $10 tickets. They don't even have flavored drinks such as strawberry margaritas etc. They also didn't give us no utensils. It was not what I imagined it would be.

They overbooked and just left us on the dock. Saying the only option is take the next boat at 8pm or reschedule . What they didn't tell us is that if you kept ordering drinks on the boat . You don't have to get off, this no new people can get on. A real shit show. Completely mismanaged

La Barca Cantina is considered a Mexican food restaurant Yea right! "Tell me what Mexican restaurant sells ceviche with no tostadas or some crackers at least" well guess what welcome to the first restaurant that doesn't have any! Not only that the portions of the food are less than a hand full and over priced. By the time they give you your food as well you better run out the dinning because you might only have 10 minutes to enjoy the view outside. Really bad experience and if they had negative stars rating I would have used them all.......

Was there on 6/18/21 and the food was not good at all... the food is overpriced and the portions are very small. The ceviche and shrimp cocktail are about 10 oz in size. Ceviche does not come with tostadas and they don't even sell tostadas there. You can go for the views but its just 1 hour so you can't even enjoy the ride.
No comment

On August 13 2021, my daughter took me here. We had a blast...My daughter and I had tacos.  She had the fish tacos with a bowl of yellow rice.  I had pork tacos. Delicious. The staff are helpful and friendly. Alex, Michael and Edward and Francis are the waiters. We were on the water for an hour. I was a bit worried that I would be sea sick, but not at all.  This is a great place to go beat the heat.  I really enjoyed it. And would love to return again.  Make sure you check their website. And check for yourself.
Had an amazing time. Food an drinks wer awesome. Stayed for the next boat ride an got a whole mezcal lesson from the owner. I will definitely come back again before the summer is over.
No comment

You have to buy tickets in advance, however it's not time slotted. When we arrived, 30 minutes prior to sailing, they told us we had to wait 2 hours until the next sail time because they were full. The food was OK and expensive. I prefer the North River Lobster boat in comparison.

Fantastic views, the crowd was pretty manageable so not a long wait, you're able to stay on board for a while so great place to chill for a bit. Unfortunately, the food except for the corn off the cob and the steak tacos are bland (or oddly chunky a la the al pastor tacos) and the cocktails are weak. Our server forgot abt us on the 2nd deck and on the upper deck the server gave our shots (which we ordered after spending $100 on weak cocktails) to another table. The downstairs server also double charged the wrong card. Great spot for views, a great boat ride and alcohol on the rocks, nada mas.
