Food is definitely not great. It's the experience that we went for. We went for the sunset cruise which was great since we saw all the lights go up. Very picturesque.

I've visited La Barca Cantina a couple of times and it never disappoints! The food is delicious and authentic, the drinks are tasty and the staff is truly the cherry on top. They make you feel like you are part of a family that you didn't know you had. The manager, Eduardo, is very amiable and knowledgeable.  I went for a drink at the bar on the bottom level and had the best time talking to the staff there. The concept of being on a boat surrounded by great people and amazing food is truly therapeutic. I highly recommend!

We planned a party on La Barca. Great time! Delicious food and staff is fantastic! Special mention about Eduardo   the manager - he is a pleasure to work with  - very professional and a wonderful host who puts the customer first! Thank you Eduardo! We will be back!

Worst service and worst place to go spend your money, I prepaid for a ticket to get on board, was a few minutes late and waiting for my friends who were looking for parking, the boat was also late, I had to beg to get on and for the boat not to leave us.... All the while my friends were running from where they were to the boat...... smh, and bathrooms were very dirty so was the table,  overpriced tacos and drinks, beware. I will never come here again
10/10 experience from start to finish. Amazing views, drinks, staff, and food. Staff and management went above and beyond to make the night incredible. Highly recommend!
They close the last trip at 8pm. I had a bad experience. The lady sold us the tickets after eight. She could've warned us. They only accept cards at the booth.
Great staff with great service and even better food. The drinks were good and food came out super quick. A nice hour long ride within the Hudson. Will definitely be going back.

Went with a group of friends I hadn't seen in forever and  it was the perfect place to "re-emerge" after so much staying in. Tacos are terrific, the mezcal list is AMAZING but the best part is just being on the water. Put this high on your post-pandemic to-do list!
No comment

The staff was so friendly, very welcoming, and attentive- not to mention knowledgeable. The food was amazing with vegetarian options! After our sail we headed inside to the lounge area and got a mezcal tasting at the bar- it's a must try! I can't wait to sail again. It's a great date spot or even a casual hang out with friends.

We had first visited the night they opened, and the service is markedly improved in the month since. Understandable, with such an intricate operation, but they pull it off smoothly and with warm courtesy. The food is quite good, and the list of tequilas and mezcals would not be out of place in a high-end restaurant. Eduardo, one of the managers, is an excellent addition, and the entire staff is attentive and prompt. Plus, the sunset, the skyline, the waterfront, from out on the river! An usual and delightful way to spend an evening. We have our season passes and will be back often.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Everything here was excellent. Found myself seated during happy hour and had oysters. Was a little put off that the server didn't have any clue where they were from. I would have expected a seafood market to make a point to teach the staff that kinda stuff.
No comment

The FRESHEST fish you can find in Greenpoint!!! This restaurant/fish market has it all. Incredible seafood selection that also sells great complements to a meal (citrus, for one.) I haven't eaten in the restaurant itself, but will need to change that soon.

The food was good. We had 6 people for a Sunday late lunch. Happy hour oysters and some had some interesting beers. Lots of outside seating. Inside seat is a bit cramped. Really enjoyed my fish cakes. But it just two fish cakes, next time I will order a side of fries to for with them. The fish sandwich and fish tacos looked really good. Oysters were fresh.
No comment
No comment

Electrifying Seafood spot with definitively the best lobster rolls in the city. Don't sleep on oysters either, and make sure to get a reservation cause seating can get tight.  $30 a lobster roll; $1.25 an oyster. 5/5 stars as a lunch spot.
No comment
No comment

I'm from The New Bedford MA area, home of the nation's highest grossing seafood port in the US, so we take for granted that we have access to the freshest fish and shellfish. Greenpoint Fish and Lobster may as well be on the New Bedford waterfront. The Scallop Crudo was outstanding and my wife's fish and chips were right there with the top local spots that we frequent on Cape Cod. Loved the outdoor dining and the service!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Super fresh seafood! We helped our cousin move in Brooklyn and stopped by here for lunch. It was delicious! Hubby said the oysters were good and fresh. Fish tacos were small but the fried fish sandwich was a great size. Seafood soup was creamy too. Love all the restaurants around greenpoint. This place has a super cute outdoor seating area and I would love to come back if I'm in the area
No comment
No comment
A heartfelt thanks to Peter (Midtown location)  - for being such good company. amazing oysters and gulf shrimp. Me and my gal pals will be back

I was super excited to try this place. The staff is nice but I'm sorry our food just wasn't that great.  We got the fish over rice, the lobster roll, and brussel sprouts. The fish had no flavor, the lobster roll was delicious and had a lot of lobster meat in it, the brussel sprouts were underwhelming. Both my husband ate the same thing and we both got sick after eating there.

Food is good but I came to eat for lunch with my family on a Monday afternoon. They were closed for seating and only offered a lobster roll and chowder to go. Very disappointing that we paid for a full price lobster roll and have to leave and eat it somewhere else.

For $40 you can have a "lobster roll" on a not even toasted roll full of almost exclusively claw meat. Rubbery claw meat I might add. Don't know if this is a one off thing but it's definitely not what I, or anybody for that matter... signs up for. Ed's lobster bar will show you how it's done if anyone wants a better recommendation.
The food was absolutely amazing. Went to lunch with my wife and ordered the oysters, lobster roll, and the fish and chips. Oysters taste very fresh. Highly recommend the food here!
No comment
The food is amazing. Wonderful staff. We love it. I highly recommend this place. Don't miss out.::))
Amazing grilled fish and service !! Also, their special Key lime pie is so delicious!
No comment

Decent raw Eastern oysters and highly spiced Chilean sea bass. They were supposed to have a "local filet" on offer but it wasn't in evidence. The fish n chips was made with pollock. This is a typical fish store with diner attached. The prices are sky high, especially for wine, and the selection was poor. They were having painfully obvious problems with servers, which is unfortunate.
No comment

Happy to see that their inside is open again! Great food and the best darn seafood in the area! There is also a market where you can order fish by the pound as well as oysters. Nice folks in there. Their michelada is awesome, btw! great mix. I like to have the fish over rice, clam chowder, and oysters!

This place looks very inviting from the outside as you notice workers in the window cutting and preparing the seafood.  I was excited and debated between their special (half shell crab sandwich) and a lobster roll. I had to pick the lobster roll because the place does have lobster in the name.  I should have went with the special.  The lobster roll was WAY OVERPRICED!  Almost $36 for a normal sized portion that was very chewy and came with a paltry sized chopped lettuce as a side. My daughter got an octopus salad  that was $21 and was fairly small in size itself - but she definitely had the better deal. It seems every place these days is shrinking their portion sizes and increasing the costs for them. The one plus was the service - the serving waitress and another waitress were attentive and friendly but I cannot justify the cost for what I received in quality and quantity.
No comment
No comment
Fresh, excellent chowder and lobster roll, and oysters too! The service was great, nice outdoor seating and good cold beer on tap
No comment
No comment
Food is well prepared and I would recommend but don't come to this restaurant if you have a heart condition... Excessive salt
Excellent oysters, west coast and east coast, very reasonably priced. Friendly and fast service.

It pains me to have to write this. Got shrimp, clams and mussels from here the other day. The clams and mussels were good but the shrimp was off. I let my bf (who has a not-very-good sense of smell) prep them so I didn't catch it til they had already been added to the seafood boil. I didn't eat them, but my bf did (against my advice!) and got sick. Moral of the story: ask to smell the shrimp before they close up the bag and don't delegate important tasks to heavy smokers.

I think it was one of the better lobster rolls I've had in a long time. They have a great outdoor set-up (they used to only have like six tables inside) and a very attentive staff. Bluefish pâté and the fish & chips were also top notch. The seafood is just so fresh and prepared so well. It's just absolutely delicious, I totally get the crowds. Making a reservation is not difficult, and I wouldn't sleep on this place, especially while it's still warm.
Best fish market around!! Their scallops are the best I have ever had. We always get our fish here to cook with because it's so fresh and flavorful. Worth every penny!

Quite possibly the best meal I've had in 2021. We started off with salmon tartare, oysters, and grilled octopus--followed by delicious shrimp razor clams, tuna burger, fish and chips. I was floored. These people are talented. I wish they served chilled sake, just because it's my favorite.
No comment
No comment
so delicious. lobster roll is perfect, west coast oysters were perfect. 100% recommend!!!
No comment

What a remarkable restaurant. When's the last time you visited a seafood restaurant that could tell you the name of the boat the damn fish was caught on? These guys are absolute heroes and deserve all the positive recognition in the world for the thought and care they put in to preparing food and delivering an impeccable dining experience. Don't miss out. They do take-away orders and have the freshest seafood from markets you just won't be able to reach anywhere else. Not to mention the amazing personalities working and operating within this corner gem. If you want one of the best seafood experiences you can find, and the attentiveness and personality everyone desires in a 5 star dining experience, this is where you go, people. A+
No comment
No comment
Greenpoint Fish & Lobster has an amazing seafood market and restaurant. All their seafood is super fresh and tasty. It is also a very welcoming place! I recommend you trying this place.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
This place is great. They source amazing seafood and cook it deliciously. Nice vibes too.
Incredible fish and lobster!  Great staff!  My neighborhood favorite! The threes collab is so clutch!  Great beer and food!

I have been here a few times and it was amazing! A lady cooked our food and she was fantastic. This last time was horrendous and changed our mind for good! We waited 45 mins. A bunch of tables and bar area opened up and instead of placing us at the table he placed us right in front of the hottest area in the place the cook top!  As soon as we sat the music went up to the most annoying  decimal of loud I couldn't hear, and it was so hot..  We ordered fried fish tacos, and a fish bowl.  The tacos were over cooked and burnt. The fish bowl was short of a salt lick. Super disappointing..  I'm not sure where the lady chef went but it is short of disappointing she wasn't there the night we were.  Dinner was inedible
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Excellent fresh fish and seafood. Love the menu. My recommendations are Jasmine rice bowl, Raw Bar!

I wish I was a food critic with a massive following. My family was heading to New York City and wanted to have lunch in Brooklyn. I found your restaurant, checked out the menu and my family was so excited to have an amazing lunch. We arrived at 1:00pm and found out they were only open for dinner due to Covid. I told the staff we drove from Philadelphia and the next thing we knew, the staff was taking care of us for the most amazing take out meal ever. I've eaten seafood all over the east coast, but have never had a lobster roll as amazing as your restaurant. The roll was beautifully toasted and buttered. The amount of lobster, taste of the lobster and consistency of the lobster was pure perfection. I want to thank the staff for being so service oriented and truly generous to take such good care of us. Thank you, thank you, thank you! You truly went above and beyond. Other restaurants should strive for your level of food and service. We'll done!
No comment

Went for happy hour on a tuesday night. We absolutely loved everything. Our waiter was so nice and the oysters were amazing. Most of all, the LIVE SCALLOP was the BEST. We literally had 5 of those between the two of us. We had all of the happy hour oysters and clams AND we had 6 of the recommended oysters from our waiter. We also had shrimp cocktail and pate and the scallop soup. We enjoyed the shrimp and pate but the scallop soup was OK. But overall our experience was incredible and we will be going back.
No comment
No comment
This is a wonderful delicious surprise inside what looks like a fish market. Feels like a celebration of fresh seafood on the East Coast. Could easily be in New England. Friendly staff, good beer!
No comment
This was my favorite restaurant in the neighborhood. Maybe a change in management? Arrogant and abusive behavior. I won't be coming back.

Sooooo yummy their fried fish tacos are amazing. The fish sandwich is sooo good but honestly the crab sandwich didn't taste any different than the reg fish sandwich and I wouldn't recommend paying $6 extra for it. Also the fries were mediocre and not really worth $6. Wish it had some flavor on it. The tartar sauce was good
No comment
We've been buying our fish and mussels here, but their summer outdoor restaurant.. OMG, the curry mussels are so good! And the fried fish is amazing.
No comment

This place was a good find. Their fish is as fresh as it gets. I love that they have happy hour all throughout the week which is not typical of most places. Oysters we ordered were from the west coast. Oh man, they resembled the favor of urchin to me which was right up my alley. We went through like three rounds in addition to some clams and other oysters that didn't dazzle as much. I love that they had a Chablis on their menu by the glass. I was just at a wine tasting the previous night where the Sommelier introduced us to a beautiful Chablis and of course we found ourselves laughing to each other when we saw it on the menu and ordered it. Service was on point! Overall solid!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Wow what an amazing experience! Seafood was fresh! Service was fast, they delivered to the other side of town. I normally only review when the experience is bad. But, I had to give these guys props on their establishment! Order from here, you won't even sorry
Always a pleasure to buy free seafood from here. Dining in is always a treat too. If you're looking for the fresh seafood this is the place. They're friendly too and the service is top notch. Enjoy!
No comment
No comment

Went here for the oyster HH, had a great New England feel. Oysters were on point and there were allot more to choose from at regular price. Moules fries on HH also did not disappoint (who doesn't love fresh steamed mussels) but warning fries come underneath the mussels (in case you've never had them this way). Intrigued by food options but will definitely come back at least for oyster HH and the MUSIC... pushed this review into 5 stars.

Great spot to sit at the counter, slurp down oysters and admire the cooks preparing food on the flattop grill.  While we're generally bigger fans of the smaller, briney west coast oysters their selection from Maine, Mass and NB were tastier than their sole west coast selection (WA).  Places like this are few and far between.  Especially in north BK.  They have happy hour deals even on Saturdays.  Worth popping in for a drink and oysters to start the evening.

Came here for brunch and went all out. Had the man-mosa which is Narragansett beer with orange juice. Surprisingly good. Pairs well with all the food I ordered. Started with breakfast tacos which had fried oysters, eggs and other things. Was delicious. Also had fish tacos and the daily fish sandwich. All tasted fresh and I will definitely be back for more. Place is small with limited seating. I recommend coming here with a small group.

one of my favorite if not best place in the neighborhood for fresh fish! They are known for their high quality + sustainably sourced products and they even have a small market counter up in the front if you'd like to grab something fresh to go! Try the daily crudo's + smoked fish plate!
No comment
No comment

We were looking for some amazing seafood to cook for our stay-at-home Thanksgiving this year. We found this place recommended in a magazine article and decided to give it a try. We got jumbo lump crab and sea scallops and they were so good! Will definitely be back for fresh seafood!
No comment
No comment
No comment

The fish selections change daily based on availability, so freshness is assured.  If you want to try a new type of fish this is a great spot. I didn't know the neck of the fish is a special cut called the collar.
No comment
No comment

This was hands down one of the best meals I've ever had  in NYC! the salmon toast was killer   and the Brussel sprouts were to die for, we also enjoyed the Caesar salad with a dressing so good it had me licking the bowl. The staff was very knowledgeable and beyond friendly the whole experience felt like we were dining with long time friends. Can not wait to go back!
No comment
This fish market/restaurant is beautiful, clean, fresh and for the most part delicious. I wasn't a fan of their fish and chips but everything else has been Devine.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Amazing customer service and food. Everyone was very efficient and kind. I felt like I was being taken care of the entire time, without it being overbearing. Really nothing to complain about, which is rare for me in NYC; I'll gladly make the trip to come back.

This is one of my favorite restaurants in the neighborhood. When I can get away with it, I usually suggest this place to someone visiting the area for the first time. They have a fresh fish bar that functions as a market, seafood bar, and an extension of the restaurant kitchen, so you can check out the goods. Check out their website and also their very impressive Instagram account.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
YUM. this place is great for anyone who is a fish lover. Drink a beer and enjoy some oysters.
No comment

This is one of my absolute favorite restaurants in Williamsburg/Greenpoint and I can't wait until it reopens for restaurant service.  Great oysters, fish tacos and other seafood dishes, and a very friendly staff.  Highly recommended.
No comment
Cute little place!!! Loveeee the food! So fresh they cook in front of you. Waitress very nice! Will come back for sure!!

They cut 1/3 of the bun off their lobster roll (see posted pic) & have the gall to charge 27.00. If you want to pay a small fortune for a slider and a side of mediocre potato wedges in a trendy Brooklyn neighborhood this is your place.
No comment
No comment
Quality seafood at a great price. Very knowledgable staff and always fresh product. Worth the short commute from Manhattan to get product.

The lobster roll is priced at $27. It was incredibly stingy (small) and it came with 10 fries and a pickle. Appalling - you can buy a whole lobster for that price. Not good value - as someone has mentioned below.

Loved it!  I took myself out for dinner and just ran into this little restaurant. I live for seafood and this place looked legit. There is a long bar facing the kitchen and oyster shuckers and a couple of tables. Service was fantastic. Food was great. They were having happy hour so I had 1/2 dozen oysters each at 1.50$ and fish tacos. Delish. Will be returning for date night.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
I usually come here for the fresh fish. It is a bit delicious but the fish always tastes delicious when I cook it.  Myself not being an expert chef that says a lot.
The lobster rolls are really yummmmmmmmmmmy! Our lunch here really hit the spot. It doesn't smell fishy at all and everything we tried was delicious!

Place is definitely a gem.  Oysters were on point and their beer selection is decent.  Place is nice, clean and have a very chill vibe.  Seafood were fresh.  Only reason I didn't give it five stars is that I wish they had more selections for their entree menu.  Will go back for sure.  Happy hour daily from 4-6 pm!!!
Nice place for raw clams, oysters and crudo. Happy hour for oysters and clams. Cool vibe for appetizers prior to dinner.

Had a great meal here last night. If you love seafood, you'll definitely enjoy yourself. They have a great selection of fresh seafood and raw bar. We got the lobster rolls, classic Maine style with lots of meat and two full claws on top. We also had some Oysters, which were great, and the fried Brussels Sprouts. They're a must!  Service was good, prices were standard, and the restaurant itself is casual and cute. A couple other quick notes -- good music, and Shandies and Micheladas on the drink menu! Can't go wrong here.
Best seafood in The 5 Burroughs!  We buy all our fish at GPFL twice a week.  Can't wait till we can dine in again.  They make it better than I can at home! :)
No comment
No comment

This is a really decent happy hour spot, but it lacks seating space. It's a good place for a drink and oysters & clams with a friend or date. I did not try any of the other items that they offered just because it's not a place where you can hang for a long time (gets crowded quickly). Clams were really great and so where the oysters! Recommend for happy hour or a quick bite!
No comment

I came here for my fish friday during Lenten season. My friend got the fish & chips and I had the fish tacos (grilled, not fried) and fish chowder. The fish & chips were okay, a bit too much batter for my liking. There were 3 pieces of fish, but on the bright side, an abundance of fries that we couldn't finish. The chowder was too salty and not thick. I kinda wished they had new england clam chowder on the menu instead. The fish tacos were also disappointing since I've had some pretty amazing fish tacos in the past. Maybe it would've been better fried. Service was really good though. I just wish the food was better. Oh wells.
Wonderful service on a Sunday. Thanks Nick for the hospitality. Oysters are Priceless and Fish Tacos.

I looked this place up because my mom was visiting and loved seafood. We had the best experience here from beginning to end! The staff was so friendly and the customer service was great. We had a mix of the oysters, lobster rolls, and a steamed lobster - all AMAZING! The atmosphere was very cute and I've already rendered this place to several friends. Will definitely return soon!

I was craving a whole lobster so i decided to come here. Unfortunately by the time i had arrived a lot of the items on the menu were already 86'd. My boyfriend and i ordered the fish and chips, fish chowder, fish tacos, and the fish pate. didn't want all fish but had no choice at that point. The fish and chips were very crispy however it was under seasoned. The fish tasted like there was no salt at all. The fish pate I enjoyed very much. However i dont know if i would call it a pate because the texture was definitely a tuna salad texture. The corn chowder tasted great but was a little too thin for my taste. And the tacos were just okay. Overall i would go back to try other items.

Awesome lunch on Saturday, we ate shortly before but when I walked by the window and saw a golden tilefish on the display and a guy cutting a beautiful side of YFT. I told my gang we are going to eat lunch again!! The owner/fish buyer, Vinny, was on hand, friendly and making sure everything was perfect and it was! Oysters, lobster roll and soft shell crab PO boy was great, not some frozen Indonesian Hanby crab! This food was fresh and sustainable. I will struggle going back to Brooklyn and not making a stop here.

Best lobster roll I've ever had. The FREAKING TUNA BURGER is a true gem. Tastes like an actual burger. The daily specials are worth going on different days of the week just to try out different dishes. Forever a fan

Wonderful oysters. I'll be back if in the area again. Fish tacos on a spicy side but delicious.

The best spot in all of Greenpoint/Williamsburg if you are looking for fresh seafood for sure! It's a small restaurant with a fish counter in front and a long bar in the back, couple tables too but I would for sure come here with a group of 1-3 only. On a Sunday evening the place was packed, thankfully one table was available, although we did have to wait a ridiculously long amount of time for someone to clean it off before we could sit, hence four instead of five stars. Although they seem to have a large staff, they still seemed pretty occupied at full capacity. On to the food. Mussels, featuring a salty and delicious broth. Scallops, tender but unfortunately a little cold on the bottom due to only searing one side. Fries, crispy and totally what you want with seafood. Overall will come back to try other dishes as well as take advantage of their happy hour.

As much as I love their fish, I must say this was probably the most revolting tuna tartare I have had in my entire life. Brown MUSH, which looked like someone got sick after a night out, with so much mustard seeds that would probably feed half of population of NYC and entire EGG YOLK. Why, Greenpoint Fish???? Why??!!!!! To ruin such a beautiful fish takes a real incompetence. Bravo, you won the award for the most disgusting tartare in the entire world! I think 7/11 taquito is more appetizing than that. What a flop ((( To top this, artic char fish tacos were just as bad. Absolutely never coming back, and neither should you. What would Gordon Ramsey say??!! Yikes!!!! Get YOUR shit together!!!!!

Friendly staff, food was great, but the ouster was simply the best hands down the best. Having your chef cook you meal right in front of you was pretty neat, can you imagine that your is fish market and the fish is not smelly at all! Good job guys!!!!

I simply don't understand what's so great about this place. It seems to always be packed, which is great for them but perplexing to me. The food was not that good and totally not worth it. I understand that they use fresh ingredients and whatnot but after ordering probably like 5 different things already, they were all just meh. Did I just go on bad days all 5 times? Seems statistically unlikely, so I'm going to have to say that this place and I just don't click.

Wonderful and new for the Greenpoint neighborhood. So many choices of fresh seafood- tacos, ceviche, mussels, oysters, etc. They even have fresh fish cut right in front of you to take home. It's a quaint spot with about 6 seats around a bar and 4 high tables. The lobster roll was one of the best i have had and the cod tacos were tasty too. We started with the hake crudo appetizer, which was a lighter version of salmon. All dishes were simple but very pleasing to the taste buds. They post all the daily seafood options on a blackboard.

Went to restaurant, not the part where you can purchase fish retail to cook at home.  Food tasted pretty good, not amazing, not bad.  Prices were really high given portion size.  Nice atmosphere and good service though.  Can't see giving this place more than three stars.

Great vibe, reminds me of San Francisco meets New England in a Greenpoint kind of way. For the me music was awesome but varied enough for many different kinds of people just not bad. Yay. Seafood really as fresh as can be. Cooked and raw  prepared food, delicious and not over complicated. Seafood market top notch. Just go

I've been here before, and the food was always great. However, today things got really awkward when our sever sorta forgot about us (in a restaurant with more staff than customers). Our food never came after about an hour of waiting. He never checked up on us at any point and we had to finally approach him to ask for a check. He didn't realize that he forgot to put in the order. We were probably one other table of the two he was serving. The whole thing was a bummer.

No comment

Dinner at Greenpoint Fish & Lobster Co. An appetizer of Wild Gulf Shrimp Cocktail, poached & chilled jumbo shrimp from Dulac, Louisiana w/house cocktail sauce. An entree of Grilled Red Snapper over a mixed green salad w/peaches, walnuts & yogurt thyme dressing. Paired w/a glass of Bridge Lane Rosé. The shrimp & wine was good, but the red snapper was severely lacking of any seasoning. I had to add salt & a squeeze of lemon leftover from my shrimp cocktail app to give it some flavor. It was an ok meal, but not the best grilled fish I've had. This is a seafood market, raw bar & restaurant where the seafood is sourced from a close network of purveyors/fishermen. This is my 2nd time here but each time I've felt like something was lacking in my meal. Willing to give it another shot though...

consistently the best, freshest quality seafood. their menu thoughtfully represents a seasonal catch menu that upholds the fish in the best way possible. I never leave without feeling very satisfied and largely impressed.

I wish I could give 10 stars just for the fried brussel sprouts. They're a meal in themselves and so so delicious. We also got the daily crudo and fish&chips which were great as well. Lots of flavor for not a lot of money - this will definitely be a staple!

Hands down the best dish & chips, monk fish, fish tacos, and lobster roll in NYC. This place is worth the trip.
Would you like to pay $27 for a quarter of a pickle, fries and a few small cold pieces of lobster on a cheap bun?

The service was terrible. The chef behind the counter burned pancakes and the manager had to come out and remake them. There were 7 staff and no one in the restaurant. The manager then picked food off our plates and ate it before serving it to us. We sent it back and left. Then she tools the plates away to finish eating.

While in Greenpoint my sister and I  decided to eat at Greenpoint Fish & Lobster Co. for two reasons. The first reason is because her friend works there. The second reason was because one of the recent pictures geotagged at Greenpoint Fish & Lobster Co on Instagram looked delicious. The fish tacos were an amazing starter, but do not order this as your main course if you are very hungry, because the dish consisted of two small tacos. For my main course I had the best lobster roll I have ever had in my life. It outshines RedHook Lobster Pound, which now used to be my favorite and Greenpoint's Lobster Joint. I was ready to order another lobster roll to go, but was only reluctant to because of the price. It's a small, sleek location with marble surface and high top tables. When you're in the restaurant you feel like you're in a high end fish shop. The wait staff is super attentive, and the chefs at the lobster bar are friendly as well. They had a very interesting menu, not just your typical fish and lobster spot! The specials included dishes like bluefish pate.
No comment

As a lobster lover, I spend my days searching for the perfect lobster roll... and Greenpoint Fish and Lobster has my favorite in the city. The chowders are also really tasty, and there's a really good daily fish selection. The fish tacos are okay, but most everything else on the menu is incredible.  When craving seafood, it's a go to.
Shot in dark and decided to stop on our way home. Clean and fresh. Amazing food. Raw bar to die for. Friendly atmosphere and the staff is on point.

Had lunch here finally and I now dream about that rice bowl. It's the kind of meal that's pricey but not easily replicated at home so I can justify it. Not a regular affair but if u feel Iike treating yourself.. will return

I've had take out twice. The fish and chips were delicious. Large pieces of white fish with a crispy breading with real thick cut fries. The Thai mussels were not as good. There was some sand in them which ruined the dish for me. Still the sauce was very good.

Good service, great interior space and great selection of fresh seafood. I had the half sandwich and cup of soup special. The chowder of great but the sandwich was under seasoned. Kind of disappointing.
Everything is good here. The muscle.. Yum!! The oyster.. Hmm I just couldn't stop. Cute little place but the food I would definitely come back again.

The quality of the oyster is consistently high and super super fresh!!! I love this place. The waiters here are so friendly, we come here every weekend for the oyster happy hour, and one of the waiter remember our order! Highly recommended to come with friends, loved ones or even alone!

Tiny place but that's not unusual for Brooklyn. Lobster Roll is Maine style cold lobster and warm bun. The fries are made with real potato's not frozen. Excellent. Having that all with a small salad and watermelon iced tea, The music is excellent, neosoul Goapele, The Roots, Dwele! The watermelon iced tea at $5 is pricey.

I don't just throw 5 stars around, great fish, great people, great music. 3 words for you, happy hour oysters
No comment

Literally one of the worst customer service experiences I've had at any restaurant.  The staff is inattentive, unknowledgeable and dismissive.  The manager is curt and rude.  A shame as I used to love this restaurant solely for the fish sandwich which they removed from the brunch menu.

This place is really the best. The product is the freshest in town, and the staff are super helpful and educational without being pedantic. I'm a seasoned cook, but new to preparing fish, and between my general inexperience cooking it, and the ethical and environmental issues involved in sourcing it, I generally avoided it before Greenpoint Fish and Lobster opened. But the passionate and skilled folks behind the counter are always willing to talk through cooking methods for whatever I'm buying, and even have some recipes printed out, so everything I've bought there has turned out perfectly! I always learn something new and spend less than I expected. One of my favorite places in NYC.

Thank god you're here! I haven't dined in but holy crap it is not possible to find seafood to cool at home in this hood without you!

Each of my dining experiences at Greenpoint Fish & Lobster Co. have been amazing, which is why I am a repeat customer. You can dine in or buy the freshest seafood to cook at home. Chef Orion cooks up phenomenal dishes! This place serves insanely delicious food, beer and wine at affordable prices. If I could eat here every night I would. The owners and staff are friendly and knowledgable...they know their seafood. There are good vibes flowing in this restaurant. The ambiance and music are great, and it's super clean. It's situated in a nice neighborhood...an easy, short walk from the G train, close to Williamsburg and parking spots can be found. There's no reason not to try Greenpoint Fish & Lobster Co. I've eaten scallops, mussels, flounder, salmon collar, fish tacos, raw oysters, salmon crudo and more...ALL WONDERFUL!
I had higher expectations of the lobster roll, but it was just average and the food was on the more expensive side for not being as tasty as one would hope.
Overpriced lobster rolls. It was sad that a bite size of a lobster roll and a whopping 10 fries cost $27. This is a joke, right?
No comment

Took the ferry over from the city and had an amazing lunch here on Memorial Day. Service was great, seafood was extremely fresh and beer was ice cold - what more could you ask for?! Delicious selection of fresh oysters from both coasts as well. Was too stuffed for the key lime pie but will definitely be back to try it!

Don't believe the hype. Time Out magazine recently claimed this place has one of the best lobster rolls in the city, so I trekked out here from midtown after work to try it. It was below average. Small amount and didn't taste fresh. When I told waiter, he added insult to injury by showing me a live lobster rather than offer to replace. Maybe it was an off night. It was pricey too. My friend enjoyed his fish sandwich, and the atmosphere is pleasant. Avoid the lobster roll and you should be fine.

It was ok...the fish was not as fresh as I hoped...the fish in the tacos was a bit mushy...not the texture you want in fish. The crude toast was pretty good.
Mmmm!!  Cute atmosphere, good food, friendly ppl with chill vibes!  The fish tacos were the best I've had!  Little spicy with great lime flavor!  So yummy!  Must comeback to try the curry mussels!!

This place has the best seafood! The cook was awesome.  You can see the love he puts into perfecting your order.  The so called chef (pudgy Caucasian) made me not want to eat. He used his bare hands to touch all the food products and was hovering over the staff. Everyone else wore gloves. It was really disturbing for him to be so unprofessional. I would've given five stars had he worn gloves.

The atmosphere and service are nice and friendly but the food, raw or plated, is overpriced.  For instance, a $17 fish sandwich was delicious for the first bite until you realize that's about all the fish you'll get.  The rest is bread and sauce. Hopefully it was just a quality control issue and not their standard practice.
Really enjoyed the salmon crudo and fish n chips. The lobster roll wasn't worth $27, I would definitely not order that again. Overall, great fresh fish and service. Will return.

No comment

Love this place, we went after a recommendation from a local. Excellent seafood, lovely decor and friendly service. We had the lobster roll and the market fish plate plus oysters. The lobster roll was perhaps a little pricier than elsewhere, but it was exceptional quality so you get what you pay for! Really good wine too. You can tell the owners really care about the place and are passionate about the sustainability and quality of the fish. It's quite small so I imagine it gets busy at weekends.
No comment

In a neighborhood loaded with Polish Catholics who eat fish on Fridays and during Lent, it seems implausible that there was no fishmonger. Nor were there eateries featuring seafood. So Greenpoint Fish and Lobster set up shop and is killing it. We found it on Yelp and loved every minute. The menu is carefully curated throughout. Just three or four choices of microbrews on draft, or oysters on ice. But they are all good. We had littleneck clams, Maine oysters, Massachusetts wheat beer, perfectly seasoned fish tacos that rival those in San Diego, a bluefish plate loaded with artisanal grilled veggies like chard and carrots, and the highlight dish, mussels in a coconut curry. This place is a winner. Ingredients run out as the night wears on, so go early.
Delicious. Fresh. And not too pricey. The perfect date night spot!

This is my favorite place for super fresh fish to cook at home and to bring anyone who comes into town to visit. Everything I have tried on the menu has been amazing, and you won't find a better lobster roll. The staff is really fun, but it can get a little tough for them to get around when the place is packed. Oh, I don't want to leave out that there is rose on tap! I recommend stopping in with a friend and trying a little bit of everything.
delicious lobster roll, good, fresh oyster selection. friendly staff, nice environment.
Prob the worst fish and chips i have eaten. Fish was chewy, every bite was chewy. Horrible! Oysters where good and the beer also. Def wont go back even as a local!

A+. Friendly attentive staff and fantastic seafood. Definitely worth checking out. I had the founder plate which there was some confusion as to whether I'd  ordered fried  vs grilled. When it arrived grilled they fried  another piece for me anyway without asking! Love these guys! They went above and beyond!

So happy to have this addition to the neighborhood! Amazing Fresh Fish! Well stocked daily. I go in so many times to buy fish to cook at home from the fish monger. Beautiful quality, they pay special attention to detail for deboneing and quality. The service is EXCELLENT! I've had so many wonderful experiences eating at the counter enjoying Fresh as can be oysters and the fish tacos are a must. Love the idea they have of the Kelp Pad Thai, it's not the best in flavor but an innovative option. Can't say enough good things about this establishment. Their sidewalk seating just got approved as well! WooHOO!
No comment
Three stars because the food that they allowed us to receive was actually good. Service was awful. Don't sit at the patio at night. It's not a patio. It's just street seating with one tiny candle.

The most amazing shellfish to close out the summer. George who shucks the clams and oysters is amazing and pristine. Such delicate care. I am now a fan of the Noank CT oysters. The best I ever had. This place made my last day of the summer. 88 degrees in the Fall !!!!
No comment
No comment

This small, intimate restaurant in Greenpoint has THE BEST seafood in all of Brooklyn!  The tables are set up for couples, there is a fish market in the front, and a bar that runs down one side. The oysters, lobster, and fish and chips were fantastic. I can't wait to go back!
Fantastic fish and chips. Probably the best fish fry I've ever had.

We love this place. Fresh seafood, tasty hot plates. Even the veggies cooked perfectly. There are kid friendly, in my opinion. They work with the space they have and we were welcomed warmly with a 9 month old. The muscadet was reasonable and has a good level of acidity. Happy times. What else can i say??!!
No comment

Brought a family member here for dinner and I was kind of disappointed.  Small place-not the best to seat 4 people.  I think the fish was a bit over-priced and we left wishing we had gone somewhere else.

Food was still on point but maybe the owner changed? Lately on the weekends, their service was questionable. There were too many staff hanging out in the front kitchen so that was distracting. Then I had to ask to order, and follow up on dishes. I noticed one server and chef from before.. but overall management feels .. disoriented. Food was excellent but it's hard to relax and enjoy.... what happened?

Amazing place. Very fresh. It's so hard to find fresh fish sometimes, but this place is real. All the oysters are great. Please try the banana cake!
Happy hour prices are so good to be true!!!!! Love this place. I will def come back. Good space, good service, superb food.

The Lobster Roll didn't live up to my expectation. It wasn't bad but it didn't taste that fresh and I just don't like cold lobster rolls. The fries on the side were pretty good. I also ordered the bloody mary which was pretty good but was confused why they gave me a can of beer to keep pouring into it. The service was pretty good. Wouldn't be coming back though.

This is probably our favorite seafood place in New York. What I like about it is that it feels like eating in a fish market (which is basically what you are doing). The fish sandwich is based on whatever is fresh that day. And I love watching the food being prepared. It's obviously not a formal sit-down kind of place, but for seafood and fish that is fresh and well-prepared, you can't do much better.
Fresh oysters, good drinks, great steamed lobster, crisp fried fish, n good service. Don't need much more.
No comment

Fish tacos were good! We sat at the bar, where I was entertained watching the kitchen guys prying open dessert plate-sized bivalves and such. My boyfriend liked his fish sandwich a lot, which was served on perfectly griddled crusty bread. And not too expensive! We skipped the booze and it only came to $37. I'll be back.
No comment
Good beer and nice fresh oysters that's what attracts me to this place. Well staffed and they are helpful in case you get confused about their menu options. Good local spot with decent prices.
Food is absolutely fantastic... best lobster roll around! Pate is delicious and the tacos are tasty too. They've also got a great selection of wine (even on tap) and beers.
Seafood is fresh here, you can taste it on your tongue! Try the live scallop, you can share this between two people. If you sit at the bar, you can watch the chef put your meal together.

Everything about this dinner was AMAZING! Service was attentive and pleasant. Happy hour wine and oysters were on point! The Arctic char was delicious. The best fish and chips I've ever had. This is definitely a place to check out! Get there early to make sure you have a seat.
