No comment
Feels kinda upscale w/o the pretensions and stuffiness. Just exceptional food, great service and good music. We're already looking forward to returning!

An Amazing addition to the LONG ISLAND CITY neighborhood!  Has to be the freshest seafood in the area.  I stopped in on friday and met Adam and Will,very friendly and knowledgable. I bought Fluke and shrimp,which were both fresh and delicious. I have not had fluke this good since I caught fluke myself .  The shrimp were some of the greatest i have ever had. Fish this fresh is something that is very hard to find. Looking foward to all the things that they have in store.  Stop by and check it out yourself on 48th ave off Vernon Blvd.  Thanks for moving into the area.

We went there on Sunday after the lunch hour. A smallish restaurant/ fish market. A pleasant staff, cold beer, a great fish chowder, a tasty fish [grouper] on biscuit sandwich. What else could one want on a dreary Sunday afternoon?  We weren't in the mood for raw oysters but will go back to try  them, and have more chowder. In all regards a good deal.

Snuck out for a rare date night with my husband and we had no idea where to go. He only eats fish so we decided to check out Greenpoint Fish & Lobster Co. It is small but did not feel over packed. Everything was solid and good. Was it mind blowing? Not really. There was also nothing to complain about and the atmosphere was pleasant. We definitely will be going back. Just a pleasant local spot that could easily become a regular place to go.
This place reminds me of the tapas bars in Barcelona... both for the ambience and quality. The grilled collar bone was simply outstanding. The clam chowder is a must have..
No comment
Small fish and lobster gem in Greenpoint, my favorite unique part being the rosé on tap.
Super good food- calamari, fish tacos, lobster roll, key lime pie. Super friendly and attentive wait staff! Our server Nick was awesome!

Amazing food and service. Key lime pie, rice bowl, and oysters were phenomenal. We will definitely come back again to try out other items. The fish tacos were great but not as good as the other items that we tried. We also appreciated the extra wasabi sauce to spice up our foods.

I went to Greenpoint fish and lobster last night, and it was very mediocre. The fish did not taste fresh, and it was one of the hottest days of the summer- it was eighty degrees in the restaurant and the fish was sitting out in the heat!
There is a wait for dinner. Market seafood plate tends to run out. Food here is reasonable price and fresh quality. Amazing ambiance as well.

Red snapper crudo Black Sea bass  raw bar  my whole lobster  French fries Brussels sprouts yummy, my Gansett was COLD , lobster roll and clam tostada was good too. Great Saturday night option. Simple clean and delicious. Chef Francis  keep up the great work. Waiter - Ben excellent service!!!!

I just had the loveliest evening with my husband at Greenpoint Fish and Lobster over oysters, wine and a gorgeous crudo.  We live around the corner and buy our fish from here often but rarely stay longer.  Our server was sweet and attentive.  I'm leaving this review now and only giving three stars, because on the way out we had a zero star experience buying some fish. After enjoying raw bar and drinks, I scooped up some fish at the counter and received some serious hostility from the fella working.  It left an incredibly bad taste in my mouth and put a negative punctuation mark on an otherwise perfect little experience.  It just sucked.
No comment

Outstanding seafood, reasonably priced and great menu! Friendly wait staff. Small place but very cozy. The menu changes frequently. The mussels were plentiful and flavorful, fish is fresh (you can see the fish on ice as you walk in). Very creative menu. From tacos to pad tai to lobster of course. This is a winner.
No comment

No need to MULLET over, this place has COD it all.  A+ selections, knowledgeable staff, excellent social media-to coax you with the daily selections, and to top it off the widowy corner location is like being inside a fish tank-that's ambiance! There's even the occasional large polish man that taps on the glass.
Place is super clean but small. The fish is fresh all the time. The service alliteration slow and prices a little on high side
No comment

As I was around the area for work, decided to search yelp for some fish. Well, Greenpoint Fish & Lobster popped up with very good reviews. So, I decided to try it out, and thank god I did. Although a little pricey, I tried the lobster roll and it was out of this world. Will definitely be coming back, and trying out the other items on the menu.

Tried to come here twice but the wait was about 30min each time so didn't wait, finally decided to wait the third time and it was TOTALLY worth it. SO so delicious, you can taste the freshness. The lobster was incredible and the mussels were really good too. Can't wait to go back. Ps they have rosé on tap which makes the wait chill..

Fantastic job all around. I originally came to this place for the market, which has exceeded my expectations every time. They do run out of stuff later in the day, so come before the after-work rush. They have a great selection of fish and shellfish, and everything we've bought has been extremely fresh. The friendly staff is very helpful. The gf and I just sat down and ate here for the first time last night, which spawned me writing this. We had the buffalo fried oysters (super good and not overly buffalo sauced), bluefish pate (still talking about it today), lobster roll (tasty and lots of lobster), and the rice bowl (a well thought out dish). We managed to get out of there for $120 including 4 glasses of on-tap rose. It's a raw bar in NYC - you're not going there for a bargain. You're going there for awesome seafood, which they deliver.

Best fish restaurant in the city. Period. We just moved to the neighborhood and when we don't eat here we buy the fish - always super fresh- and cook it ourselves, although not quite as well. Great beer and wine selection too. Love the vibe. Love the staff. You will not be disappointed.
Impeccable, thoughtful food. Great service albeit there on a slow rainy day. Dis chowder was superb, fish tacos were as fresh as it gets.

Incredibly fresh, straightforward, quality seafood that is a delight to share with a few friends. Recently went with a group of 6 and felt pretty squeezed but the wait staff were incredibly accommodating and even relocated us when the party grew unexpectedly. Love the simplicity of the environment and menu and would add on one star if liquor were served!

The single best fish and chips I've ever had. The chips were unusual, not in a bad way, just not what you'd expect. Instead of shoestring or waffle, they laid a bed of simple yet delicious fingerling fries. The main act was the fried fish; so delicate was its texture that I wondered how they could cook the breading perfectly and still pull off rare to medium rare fish. The oysters were also knock out, but I don't think I can get past that fish!!

Went to Greenpoint F&L Co this morning for brunch with a few friends. Love the clean, relaxed environment. The food quality was fantastic and innovative - had a custom beverage, oysters, breakfast taco (fried oysters and scrambled eggs), and a regular fish taco. All tasted very fresh. Also, for those who like perfectly cooked sunny-side up eggs, my two friends ordered the hash. Those yolks were barely holding together without popping - perfect. The service was fast and friendly, food was served quickly. Would strongly recommend this to anyone who likes seafood - they keep the menu moving and don't just serve the same old tuna or salmon you'd find most places. Mix up that palette! Stop by GP Fish & Lobster, they'll probably have something you haven't tasted before.

One of the best places to eat in green point! We always have the best fish here. The chefs know exactly how to cook every plate on the menu. I highly recommend this restaurant. Just by the display in the window you know you have come to the right place. Always fresh always great!!!
Amazing, fresh seafood.  Highlights were oysters, crudo, and the scallops with fried mashed potatoes.  Great service.  Worth the hype.

Ahh-ma- zing !!! The food, the service, the atmosphere - delicious, quick and relaxed respectively. The raw bar - two for Tuesday was a steal at $20 for a dozen oysters. The porgy sandwich was both soft and tender while being just the right amount of spicy. My husband had the whole orata, while I can't speak to the taste of the dish personally based on the pile of bones left it had to be delicious. The house rose was the only thing that didn't impress me but that's not really here or there as they do have other options for alcoholic beverages.

The food is good - have been there before - but service counts too: I came alone this time and was told that I could only sit at the bar (crammed between two large guys) because the tables had to be saved for 2 people....except that it was already 2pm and there were MULTIPLE empty 2-person tables. Did they expect a mid-afternoon rush?

I felt like I was in the West Village - delicious food, great decor, and a great looking crowd.  Top to bottom the food was delicious, especially the lobster roll. Rice bowl was legit, and the skewers cooked to perfection. Everything was fresh, priced fairly and just basically super legit.

This place was absolutely nothing special. The Polish bakery that preceded it was infinitely better. The fish tacos were small and tasteless and the lobster roll had way too much sauce on it and it was super tiny. Perhaps the only thing they have going for them is the fresh fish which we don't have in this neighborhood but I wouldn't go back again.  They also made me pack my own doggie bag which was not cool. I promptly gave away the leftovers to a homeless person.

This place was interesting, but not sure it deserves a near five star rating. Their prices are sky high and portions small. I was disappointed in the lobster roll which was too citrusy as I was hoping for a more authentic "Maine" style roll which is sweeter typically. The roll only came with a pickle, not even chips. I get lobster is pricey, but chips aren't. Adding that would've made it seem more like a worthwhile meal. Service was totally fine and it was definitely cool that they sell fish in house too.

For $18.50 the fish and chips were terrible. They used cat fish...cheap and low quality.. And the fish batter and fries  were on the brown side of golden... over fried and too salty. The tartar sauce was nice though.

This place is amazing. It has fresh fish and oysters and more. The oysters are amazing and they have beer on tap as well to help you wash it down. Heard they get all the stuff fresh each morning, tastes very fresh. The staff is great too. No wonder I have been at the place like 10 times already. A++

Such a wonderful place to go the fish was fresh and beautiful they sell fish they make the fish they have a great menu check it out online I had the shrimp and grits it was outstanding such flavor my husband had the  fish tacos so good.
Super super fresh sea food. One of the best restaurants in Greenpoint, Brooklyn! Would go again for sure.
Oysters are fresh and always changing. Lobster roll was also delish. But oysters were the superstars of the night.
No comment
Very nice new restaurant. Good food and great prices. Service was a bit slow, even with very few people there, but overall experience was great. Will be back.

Great lunch.  We had fish tacos (mahi grilled), lobster roll and fish chowder. I'm gluten free so a gluten free chowder was a welcome surprise.  Quantities are good and food quality excellent.  The local Smash beer was perfect.

The food is pretty good...not mind-blowing.  The place is very over-priced for what it is.  It's almost as high as Manhattan price...which is puzzling.  I live down the street and walk by the place often but haven't brought myself back to the establishment because the food is slightly better in Manhattan and the price is the same.  Also, they need more appetizers and small dishes to accompany main entrees.
No comment

The store & selection is small, but the quality seems to be superior. I started off with the crudo, the chef's choice was king salmon, and I will say it is some of the leanest and cleanest (as in finish) king salmon I've had in awhile. Very sublime. It was drizzled in a mellow EVOO and some salt. A squeeze of lemon, by yours truly and we're good to go. I suggest to Greenpoint that they go with a grassier tasting EVOO; because the salmon has such a mellow taste, you kind of want a contrast, which the lemon and salt really don't provide, but are good compliments, nontheless. Next up were the oysters; all tasted as advertised. All cold, briny and fresh. Condiments are not needed; you can go bare-valve on these. My two faves being the "creamy ones" from the east coast, and the only west coast from Washington State. I forgot to take down the names. However, when a west coast oyster, eaten in the east coast, has such a clean, sharp grassy front, that it tastes like a well fed lawn just cut smells - as in nose bleed, you know the guy who purchases the oysters knows his $|-|it. If you get the house Clamato, ask them to hold the hot sauce & spice; it covers the taste of the raw bar. In fact, just go with their iced coffee, if you need something to wash down the bivalves. The service is examplary.
The food here is delicious. I came with my partner and in-laws and the seating really isn't great for groups. We all enjoyed our dinner though and I would come back.

Never reviewed before. But had to today. Lobster roll was ok, really tiny and bland. Razor clams, bland. Mussels a little over cooked and bread was stale. Sashimi, thick cut and no flavor. Best thing was probably the fish chowder. Ask me if I'd come back? Maybe for the soup... I could've caught them on an off day.. Who knows?!

Ordered a whole fried croaker, fish tacos, and a few oysters and each was incredible. There is a fresh fish market in front and narrow restaurant in the back. The smell of the day's catch hits you before the aromas of the cooking oils. The staff are friendly, attentive, and as you eat you glance over at the market customers and smile at the quality of the seafood you know you're both getting.
No comment
Brilliant. Food was phenomenal - best lobster roll ever! Nice decor, good vibe (even for non-hipsters), great neighbourhood. Win!

Freshest seafood around NY. Best Baja style fish tacos on the east coast (and this is coming from a SoCal kid) and Rosé on tap. Ask about the daily specials, they're constantly changing and all delicious.

Went there on a random night. The food is good but not worth the price. Ordered the fish and chips and it really is no better than you would get at a bar/pub. The oysters are not that fresh. The only saving grace was the lobster roll.
Amazing food, great environment and the staff is extremely nice. If you sit at the bar you get to see the "kitchen" and watch all the fish being made. Loved it definitely coming back!

Greenpoint Fish and Lobster is on of the best fish markets in the city hands down.  The sourcing of their seafood is from sustainable fisheries and the quality is impeccable.  From oysters to monkfish to Alaskan salmon, these guys know good shellfish/fish.  As far as their restaurant side goes: the fish tacos are easily the best I've had in the city.  The monkfish satay and kelp noodle pad thai are both delicious and they have a great selection of oysters.  In fact, I wasn't even a west coast oyster lover until these guys changed my mind with wild Alaskan oyster and a super interesting "Shigoku" from Washington state.  The difference from other west coasts I've had: quality & freshness.  Go here, buy fresh fish, order oysters, order fish tacos and other fish dishes and you will be in seafood heaven.

Just made one of their tuna burgers and 45 min passed and I started feeling warm then my face became as red as a tomato and my heart started racing. 2 hours later vomiting and diarrhea, I have been food poisoned and there is no doubt this tuna was the cause.
No comment

Great spot. Crudo Char is excellent. For oysters Glacier Point and St. Simon's were great! Staff is friendly and cool. Music is spot on. Felt like you were eating on a 1950's naval ship in a Wes Anderson Movie.
Came here for dinner at 7pm. The air conditioning wasn't working well and we were sweating...! So HOT. Very friendly staff and good service but food was just ok.

Completely fabulous spot in Greenpoint - can't comment on the food as I don't eat fish but my 10 year old son rates this place highly - "fantastic oysters and clams, beautifully presented!". The staff are A1+++, attentive, friendly and super-nice. Go and eat here......
Unbelievable. Came highly recommended by a friend and it didn't disappoint one bit. The scallop at $13 seems expensive, but it's honestly not. It's a huge revelation.

This is an interesting fishmonger cum bar set up with lovely food cooked right in front of you! The chef went the extra step to make my wife something special as she is allergic to herbs, onions, and garlic. We had the fish plate of the day with seasonal veg - it was a blue fish that I hadn't eaten before but beautifully fresh. They also do a tasty IPA and the chefs are easy going and friendly
Lovely little place to enjoy super fresh seafood. Like the bar seats where you watch your food being prepared.

Greenpoint Fish & Lobster is a great neighborhood gem. There dedication to sustainable seafood is admirable and their food is delicious! Since finally getting here it has become a staple for my wife and I. The atmosphere is very welcoming and casual and it's a place we always leave looking forward to returning to soon.

Wasn't expecting much for a Greenpoint fish place by boy was I wrong! Everything from Salmon, Artic Char to Sea Bass! Haven't eaten here yet but planning on doing so VERY soon (as early as tomorrow)! They got everything on the menu from fish tacos to fish rice bowls. Fishes are very fresh! And they sell all these awesome sauces, marinades, etc. It's a one stop shop for those who need ingredients for their fish. Plus the store is SUUUPER cute :)

Best lobster roll I've had in Greenpoint. I've converted...no more Lobster Joint for sure.  You can tell the difference between fresh meat vs the packaged frozen stuff.  The extra dollars are worth it, my new go to when I want to treat myself.  Staff is really awesome as well...went with my boyfriend and loved the fact that they're serving quality product, with awesome educated friendly staff, yet still has the laid back vibe I gravitate to.  Happy I live walking distance!

29 dollars for a lobster roll! When this place opened, a regular roll was 18 and a jumbo was 22. It was very delicious. The market price of lobster today was 12.99 which is normal. So, when I was told that the 29 dollar price tag reflects the rising market price of lobster, I just had to walk out. Luke's makes a wayyyyy better roll and their pricing has been the same for years! Very disappointed with my experience today. Never seen a 29 dollar lobster roll in my life, and I grew up in The Hamptons!
Great spot for seafood. Good menu and fresh seafood. Not great for groups because it's a small joint.

It's not cheap, and seating is tight at prime times, but I've never had bad food here. Also, you won't find friendlier, more attentive service in Brooklyn. The last time I went (tonight), several servers--and even one of the cooks--checked up on me regularly. The menu has some impressive variety for a relatively small place. The chowder and (fried) fish tacos are really nice. I tried their key lime pie, which I liked a lot. Plenty of wine and beer to choose from (and some cocktails, too, which I hadn't noticed before). The raw bar might not be offered if you're visiting near the end of the night (so no oysters, etc.). In summary, the food is consistently solid and you can count on cheerful, efficient service. The place doubles as a walk-in fish counter, too--a plus for Greenpoint. Definitely earning its keep as a neighborhood staple.
GPF&L is amazing at what it does: down to earth, fresh, clean seafood. One of the best places in the city to eat seafood and enjoy a drink. The market, too, is top notch.

This place is great as a fresh fish market and restaurant.  Sitting at the kitchen bar is a great way to see how they prepare their dishes.  Don't miss the fish collar which is rich and delicious.  We love the green thai curry mussels and the fish and chips too.

Very disappointed. My party of 3 arrived and was told the kitchen had just closed. We said ok were about to walk out and then the waitress said if we waited a few minutes she would check and see if they could serve us. We got drinks while we waited and were seated with 10 min. We sat at the counter and then were ignored for a good 10-15 minutes. It was becoming clear that the waitstaff was totally overwhelmed (the place was busy) and the chefs behind the counter we're visibly tired and pissed off. We were begrudgingly handed a menu and we tried to order ASAP. We ordered 3 lobster rolls and the chef said bitchily "we are out, I mean u sat down after the kitchen closed." I had enough of the attitude, paid for our drinks and left. I have no problem being told that a place is closed. There are many other fantastic, well run restaurants in greenpoint. It was insulting to be seated and treated so poorly.

It's great the place serves the catch of the day.  Love its philosophy.  However, the food just isn't great.  Came here six months ago, and to date, no dish has stuck in my head, except the raw oysters which required no cooking.  My partner, who had wanted to try this place for awhile, didn't care for the food either.

Granted the lobster roll is very good, albeit small (considering the outrageous price) and a tad salty. I do like that the dressing is not overwhelming. But the price coming in at about $28 is an effing joke

Silly expensive. Food was fine. Small portions, pretty simple which is typical for good seafood, but $6 to add three shrimp to the $15 Pad Thai? $6 for 3 shrimp?!?! Plus, server was not too friendly. If I'm paying over $100 pre-tip for two drinks, six oysters, and two mains then a smile would have been nice, at least.

One of the best mussel dishes I've had ever! You just can't beat the freshness of the seafood! For heavens sake it's a fish market! But don't let that think you will be stepping onto wet squishy rubber mats as you walk in accompanied by the wafting odor of raw fish in the air.  Although there may be a little authentic stank, the place is impeccably decorated and not to mention spotless!  I had the side salad which was a five star side indeed.  What a great find in Greenpoint!

I moved from Florida to Greenpoint about a year ago. In Florida, pretty much every grocery store has big, beautiful displays of fresh and reasonably-priced seafood. And apparently I took that for granted. Because after my move, I definitely realized that I wasn't in "Kansas" anymore. I kind of cried a little bit when I realized that the three closest grocery stores to me, C-Town, Key Foods, and Associated Foods, all had "seafood" sections that were 2' x 4' worth of refrigerated shelf space with pre-packaged, previously-frozen, scary-looking seafood. C-Town, where I shop the most, frequently seems to run out of salmon. How do you run out of salmon? Anyway... I am so very happy that Greenpoint Fish and Lobster has opened! It fills a much needed void in the neighborhood. No longer do I need to walk a mile plus to Harvest Market in Williamsburg or The Food Cellar in Long Island City, or a mile and a half to Metropolitan Fish in Williamsburg for fish, because I now have my own fabulous fish market right in my own neighborhood! The staff couldn't be any nicer or more knowledgeable about fish, the seafood couldn't be any fresher, and the prices seem fair. I highly recommend this place.

Small space, big flavor! Would have preferred not to have to sink down in my stool directly under staircase, but it was a busy night and the food was delicious. We've gone back to buy fish- super helpful staff too.
Underestimated our wait time severely. More of a hipster vibe than a true seafood shack experience.

Yep, It's great. The fish sandwich is very good. The place looks great, the staff is awesome. Destroys Lobster Joint, however it ain't cheap. I've only been for lunchtime (it doesn't really feel like a dinner spot) and can't get out of there for under $25

So, I read through the NEGATIVE reviews before writing this review.  I wanted to give a 5-star review, however after reading through some negative reviews I suppose some decent points were made that must be considered.  First off, most of the negative reviews point to poor service, overpricing, not enough seating, or small portions.  NONE of these should be heavy-weight factors.  First off, this restaurant is MEANT to double as a fish market/store.  Therefore a customer would be a fool to expect the best service and big tables to host large groups.  It's simply not that kind of place.  Secondly, if you want cheap eats move out of NYC, one of the most expensive cities in the world, and enough complaining about portion sizes.  Most Americans eat wayyyy too much, and the smaller sizes are better for your health.  On to the review;  the decor is attractive clean & bright.  The layout and seating, while not great for late dining with parties larger then 4, is fine.  The food, in my opinion, is spot on.  Sure they could dress up their dishes a bit more to make the prettier, but all in all the food displayed the chef's knowledge of each ingredient' so presence in each dish, and balanced texture with flavor perfectly, making sure that each element is noticed.  Great spot.  Will certainly go again a few times this year.
Lovely space and everything we tried was delicious. Super fresh fish. Loved the skewers, crudo and fish tacos but need to come back for the lobster roll and fish and chips.

The food here is sublimely fresh and cooked to order while you watch (though I have to say they exaggerate their portion size a bit).  However, the two girls working service that night were really inattentive and somewhat bitchy, and failed to seat several people who'd actually arrived before us.  When they called our names, there were about 3 couples who, it turned out, had been waiting for more than an hour and were pretty pissed.  Then while we ate, my friend asked for some of the condiments on another table and the waitress sighed and gave it to us, then rolled her eyes at the other server.  I'm hoping this is something they'll sort out over time, as I'd like to return someday and purely enjoy the truly delicious dishes, instead of feeling like I'm hassling the waitstaff merely by sitting there.
Amazingly delicious dishes, friendly attentive staff, clean and light atmosphere, what's not to like? If you are a seafood lover and haven't been here, you are missing out!

I stopped by this place yesterday and it was very tight seating area inside and also very crowded. So I decided to order to go. My order was two portions of Fish and Chips and one soup. Total (close to 50 bucks) has surprised me. This place is really overpriced! But I am thinking, this is a highly rated place that serves very fresh seafood. The food in reality was pretty bad. Soup was OK but fish and chips... Ridiculous! This expensive dish includes just small amount of french fries and only two pieces of fish. When you start consuming the "chips", you realize that fish is only one third of it, the rest is a nasty oily over-fried breading! So I ended up eating only half of the plate. I must tell you this was a terrible experience for $50! I would be more satisfied by much cheaper fish fillet from nearby McDonalds (not that I consider it to be a decent healthy food). I was planning to try their Lobster roll next time but now I don't think so. Make your own choice but think twice before you go there.

This place is just the best.  The seafood is unbelievably fresh, the vibe is fabulous, the staff is so passionate and attentive, and the food is fantastic. The oyster selection is out of control. Can't say enough good things.

I got the lobster roll.  Yep it's expensive but it is good.  That will be a once in a blue moon treat.  I want to try the rest of the stuff on the menu.  I will not buy fish here to make at home as I cannot afford it.  But to have them cook me a little something every once in a little while I am okay with that.  The people that work there are great, the place is clean.  Here is my two cents, you better have fries or slaw at home, or you are going to be hungry after your lobster roll.  But the lobster and roll is fresh and good.

food is ok, ordered the fish and "chip"... staff doesn't really seam to care, most expensive lobster roll in NYC. beer selection is trash. but the white dipping sause is killer.... Did enjoy the outdoor tent.
No comment

I think this place is amazing. I know it attracts a lot of bitter hipsters, and a lot of reviews here are by people that will never be happy and look to the internet for justice rather than have a real life confrontation, but I've been here 3 times and my food was always pretty spot on. I agree that some of the prices don't make much sense though. I think a 14 dollar lobster bisque is an avoidable item, but tell me where you can get fresher seafood in the neighborhood. It's sad to me how entitled, bitter and deluded some of these reviews are about a place that is doing a real service to the community where no one else has shown much interest. Unfortunately, its become that kind of neighborhood lately, where people would rather complain about any less than perfect experience than appreciate the effort. If someone doesn't acknowledge you at the counter while they're cooking, its because you're supposed to write your order down on the piece of paper. The one in front of your face. Play by the rules of the establishment you have entered, and you will be treated properly, pretty simple.
No comment
No comment
No comment

This place has some of the best octopus and best drinks I've ever had. This was my first time coming to this spot and I'm so glad I finally stopped by. The waiter was very helpful in explaining the menu and making sure that my peanut allergy was known to the kitchen staff. We had the guac, charred octopus, Taco De tromps, and the Pork Tacos. Just know that everything comes pretty small so you've got to get a few different items to get full. The only reason why I can't give this place five stars is because I absolutely hated the dessert option. It was basically a fried churro type thing with cream but I felt the cream didn't have enough taste and that the fried crispy bits had no substance but that's just me! I'd love to see a few more dessert options for the dairy sensitive people. Other than that amazing, amazing restaurant with great ambience, really dim lighting, and wonderful food.
No comment
No comment
No comment

The thing I love most about living in Williamsburg is that when I think I've been to any restaurant worth visiting, I'm proven wrong on every occasion. My friend recommended Aldama when for lunch after we had spent the morning at Domino Park. I hadn't heard of the restaurant but my friend only had glowing things to say about it. We walked about 10 minutes from the park to the restaurant which is located in south Williamsburg. Aldama is a modern Mexican restaurant that's ideal for a special night out. The spot is on the smaller side with a large bar and table seating around that. When it came time to order we decided to get the guacamole as well as an assortment of canasta and trompo tacos which were amazing. We also had the house margarita which was equally exceptional. Come here if you find yourself in the area with a craving for quality Mexican dishes!
No comment

unexpected, excellent intimate atmosphere with large outdoor area. great cocktails and food, especially loved the yellowtail ceviche and the poached lobster. the duck breast was fantastic, particularly the stuffed heirloom corn dough. best tortillas i've had.

This place is pretty unassuming when you first enter, you'd think this place was just a small bar with a few seats but when you get taken through to the seating area you'll see there is more indoor and outdoor seating. My friend made a reservation for Saturday at 5:30 and we were able to be seated right away. All the staff was very nice, we really liked the ambiance and the decor, one thing that was funny was the little water cup, now they did keep our cups filled but it was just enough to take a swallow of water before someone had to come back around and fill it up again. Now this menu is very unique and besides some things like guacamole this menu looked nothing like I'd ever seen in a Mexican restaurant, now that's not really a bad thing because the food was really good and of great quality, we got the guacamole which instead of being served with tortilla chips was served with 3 tortillas that were of the same consistency of a chip, no complaints it was great and had a little spice to it, you can tell they didn't over do it with salt and instead used herbs and spices, that's important to me. We got the duck appetizer which was unique and good, we also got the Taco De Trompo which also was good but really $9 for a taco? Now it was unique I have to give them that but really overpriced in my opinion, we shared the Asado which is a 26 oz steak, it's served with some cheese with fig we think and tortillas also with a green sauce, now the quality of this steak is great, well flavored but not overly seasoned and can easily be shared by 3-4 people, you definitely pay a lot for it but it's good, what I didn't like is when we finished the tortillas and were offered more we expected that it would be complimentary considering the amount we paid for it but I was disappointed later to see that we were charged for it, now in comparison to the price of the total bill it was small change but it's the principle in my mind, this is a unique place that is very pricey but it's also unlike any Mexican place I've been to before, the drinks are pricey as well, it's a good place to check out but for my budget I couldn't come here too often.
No comment

column3: Long Island City, New York, NY
column6: No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Come for happy hour!! Drinks are around 10$ and there are food specials as well! Otherwise wasn't too pleased with my actual meal. We ordered gauc and chips- the avocado was not ripe so there were big hard pieces in my gauc. Then for a party of 5 they gave us 4 chips. I also don't like these new "chips" which were small whole corn tortillas (so then you just break it up yourself). Didn't make sense for a big bowl of gauc. The mezcal based frozen drink was delicious but it went from 10$ to 14/15$? Same size, that's ridiculous. Come for happy hour otherwise not sure if it's worth your time. Nothing else we ate was really worth mentioning.

Great new addition in the Williamsburg area. Stopped by here with a friend to check it out and had a great time! The guacamole was outstanding and the cocktails were fantastic and worth trying. The happy hour was worth checking out, the server Vivian was very hospitable!
No comment
Excellent food! Amazing drinks , don't miss happy hours  high recommend, nice music good vibes
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Best tacos de trompo in nyc. Everything is super fresh and delicious. Definitely recommend
No comment

I came here yesterday for my friends birthday. I told the waiter that I had a peanut allergy, and he told me the only item we ordered that had peanuts was the guacamole. We ordered a variety of shared plates, including the cornish hen. I ended up having a horrible allergic reaction and had to go to the emergency room. We were supposed to go to a concert that evening that I spent 120 dollars on, but I instead could not go and spent 300 dollars on an emergency room visit. I am very disappointed in this service.
No comment
No comment

The food here is pretty good we had the lobster and chicken.  They drinks were good as well I had a Mt. Fuji similar to a Margarita.  Seating outdoor is nice however flies and mosquitos are a bit of a nuisance hence the reason for 4 stars.  Overall great vibe and ambience check it out!
No comment

This incredible meal is definitely one of the top restaurants in Williamsburg. Food highlights: Taco de Trompo, Hamachi and Tacos de canasta.  The setting and music were perfect and the staff was helpful and informative.

Aldama was truly an experience. The staff was more than generous and the food was delicious. They have devine vegan options and not to mention the guacamole and cocktails are to die for. Cannot wait to return again!
No comment

Let me start with the Daykon tostadas they were amazing and the service is tje best !   From beginning to end. Drinks are strong and delicious ! Great selection of mezcal, I love the decorations!  Special thanks to William for your hospitality. We did not have a reservation but he went out of his way to accommodate us!
Cozy place, great vibes, awesome staff, gourmet food. Willie was very accommodating to our needs and an excellent host.
What an INCREDIBLE meal! Wonderful cocktails, amazing food, excellent service. Prices are comparable to any nice New York/BK meal. Ambiance is great. Highly recommend!
No comment

This was probably the best Mexican food I have had outside of CDMX. We started with the tacos de canasta, yellowfin ceviche, and taco de trompo. All were phenomenal in their own ways, but the taco de trompo was probably the best taco I have had -- and this is from someone who adores tacos de trompo and al pastor tacos like no one I've ever met. Completely worth the price, was an experience that left me only wanting more, which in this case is a good thing. At the end I had to shake the chefs hands, because as many know, their creativity often goes unappreciated.
Sind at night was so welcoming!  Food and drinks is amazing bud service is wonderful. This is my favorite restaurant in Brooklyn. What a great experience. Thank you for a amazing dinner experience!
No comment

Top notch. I don't usually write reviews, but I can't begin to emphasize how good this meal was start to finish. Everyone who works here-A++++, the food-not just delicious, but filled with integrity, authenticity...the commitment to story.
No comment
No comment
No comment

thursday night with not reservation .. But they were very excited to have us. Mg and host were very welcoming!! food is amazing. octopus is a not missing plate. thanks for a great dining experience!!!
My new favorite gem !!!  Excellent service !!  Best chicken I'd ever had!!   Great selection of mezcal and the Asian hostess was nice and friendly. !!  I can't wait to come back for brunch

I absolutely love this place . I was there on Thursday with my boyfriend and we had a great time .  The food was awesome ,tasty  drinks and amazing service. I will be back to try their brunch . I definitely recommend this place . 5 stars from me and my bf. Keep it up the great work, Aldama

This place has a lot to be said in its favor: great staff, drinks, ambiance. However. Many vegans and vegetarians will come here for the vegan mole - which is a dish one basically never comes across, it's practically an oxymoron. This restaurant makes a big deal about this dish. It's the most expensive on the menu. And it is awful. Besides being almost nothing other than mole - a few tiny  mushrooms, that's it - the mole tastes burnt with a charcoal aftertaste. No one at my table found anything positive to say about it. And two of us found it repugnant enough to stop eating entirely. So disappointing!
Great ambience!!   Food is amazing!! Service is friendly and professional. Drinks :  try the sangre de mezcal !! Lo love the music !!

Underwhelming... Maybe since it was a soft opening ( I hope), I'll give them another shot in a couple of months.  I got duped by the nyeater article prior to visiting. "Despite his history serving drinks at top-tier restaurants, Reyes wants Aldama to be an approachable, everyday hangout. "I don't want to have a hundred different tequilas and mezcals on our wall," he says. Instead, the bar is focusing on 10 bottles of each, available for sipping from copitas with slices of oranges. A happy hour -- 5 to 7 p.m. daily -- advertises frozen margaritas and beer and mezcal shot combos for $10 or less.".....  There was no mezcal selection, only one cocktail list with 6 drinks ($14 each), one with mezcal....and it was frozen...I'd assume since the founder of the establishment is a bartender, the drinks would be more impressive...to each their own. Food menu was short as well and did not wow me either (and we ordered everything with the exception of the guacamole) There are only 2 meat options on the menu, both are small plates.  One is the cecina; thinly sliced, dried, crispy filet( think beef jerky meets chicharron) and the tacos- very good!  As explained by our server, the corn is imported de Mexico and milled in house! Growing pains... I'm sure they'll right the ship... Go here and you'll see what I'm talking about.
No comment

No comment

This is the only Jack's Wife Freda location that I've gone to that wasn't absolute chaos on the weekend! We came at prime brunch time on a Saturday and had no problem getting a table. The bloody Mary ($14) is always a great choice here and it has a good amount of kick. The Bianca ($15) was a little too sweet for my taste. The salt & pepper eggplant ($14) was a great appetizer, super crispy! Maya's Breakfast Bowl ($23) was absolutely delicious; loved the green sauce. The poached eggs with tomato and haloumi   ($18) was okay, but super small. I was unfortunately still hungry afterwards, although everything tasted great. Service was attentive as well.
Was excited to take my wife to this restaurant, but turns out it was nothing special. Eggs were sub par, same with the coffee. Meh.
No comment
No comment

Absolutely delicious. We ordered the chicken wings, halloumi, salt and pepper eggplant and butter lettuce salad (house salad?) watermelon spritzer (forget the true name) and a rose. Unique pairings that make the dishes sing - halloumi had cut grapes , for example - superb. Very high quality olive oil in the dressing and on the dishes. Vibe was airy and fun since it's summer. Not packed on a Friday night late which was ideal. Super worth checking it out! Thanks chef!

This place has to be infamous by now. However, I enjoyed my meal here.  I had the madame Freda and halloumi. They were both gorgeous , but you can't really go wrong. This place has beautiful food and ambiance. The service was great and is in a great area. The restroom was nice.
No comment

Cannot recommend this place and our server VIN highly enough. He was witty and fun, keeping a running joke going all though our meal. Love it. On to the food... every dish was A+. Grilled halloumi, roasted cauliflower, kafta, and zucchini chips were the standouts, particularly the cauliflower with creamy garlic sauce and capers. We couldn't get enough and Vin was kind enough to bring us extra of that garlic sauce to dip with our pita. Flourless chocolate cake rounded out the meal, unnecessary after all that food but immensely satisfying. They also still have the pink guzzler cocktail on deck (made with watermelon juice) if you need one last taste of summer.
No comment

Nice food and ambience. We've been here for brunch a few times through the years. Service was fine before and stood out recently with our server Olivia - shout out to Olivia at the Williamsburg location for her genuine hospitality. The extra juice for our birthday breakfast was very thoughtful too.
YUM!! i had heard great things prior to coming here.. but service was so good & food was amazing. Would recommend :)
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Came recently with some friends for a night-before-thanksgiving-friendsgiving and it was super chill for all 8 of us. The food was great and the staff were super attentive. The one thing I didn't like was the pushy waitress who kept upselling "her favorite", the grilled halloumi (3 pieces of rubbery cheese for $16) that we ended up ordering, but for the most part the food was good. I had the steak and it was a reasonable size but my friend had the fish ala plancha (salmon) and the portion was pretty small. The waitress was also a bit sassy when we were forced to ask three times what the whole fish  (branzino) was because she got it confused with the fish a la plancha (salmon). She kept repeating salmon until we pointed out there were two fish options on the dinner entree menu...

Pretty good food. I had the grilled chicken sandwich which was good but very dry & very little aioli. The bread was good though. The highlight was the super friendly dark haired waitress who made our time here special regardless.

We sat outside with the fans keeping us cool which felt great. Lots of seating options. Food came out hot, quick and tasted spectacular. Could not have been more satisfied with our meal. Our server Lizzy was the big highlight. She was super sweet, helpful and completely took care of us from the moment we got there to the moment we left. She also recommended we try the duck bacon which we did not regret. Cannot wait to go back

This place has solid food. Chicken is one of those menu items you order when there's nothing else to order, but here, it's one of the best dishes- Peri Peri chicken! The green sauce is amazing. We also get the Fried Zucchini app, and they also have a children's menu. The Steak and the sandwiches are okay, and but I honestly think the portions are on the smaller side in general. Good atmosphere, and friendly servers!
No comment

Went to the one in Williamsburg and I loved everything about it. The ambience to the food and our friendly server who has a unique name I can't remember. Over all can't wait to come back and/or check out the other locations. I am a Resturant Manager in Florida and was thoroughly impressed and will recommend to anyone visiting the New York area.
No comment

I loved my meal and the melon mimosa was something special. We walked in at 10 on a Sunday and we're sat right away. Our waiter was very chill and got us in and out quick to enjoy our day in the city. Definitely going to come back here if I have the chance.
I got the chicken prego sandwich delivered, it was $20 before tax + tap and was about the size of a McDonald's chicken nugget. Will never get food from here again.

Go somewhere else for brunch, this place is a waste of money. With friends visiting from overseas it seemed like a great place to go. Sadly, it was one of the worst meals I've had in NYC. I'd made a reservation well in advance, and upon arrival, they had to squeeze us in when they were ready, not for the time I'd made the reservation for. The cocktails we ordered took a lifetime to arrive, were small, and the beer was flat. The food was the jewel in the awful crown; the burger was a cheap processed burger, in an even cheaper bun, rendering it completely tasteless. Fries were awful. The chicken sandwich echoed this, and the waffle was - according to my friend - inedible. The highlight, sadly, were three postage stamp-sized pieces of Halloumi for $16. Would advise anyone to choose somewhere else, so many better options nearby.

Very overpriced mediocre food. The burger was boring. The chicken wings came out cold! Good luck breaking up the waitstaff huddle for some attentive service. Maybe their other location is better but this one is a hard miss.
Tasty, welcoming, open and inviting. Definitely made our first day in NYC / USA, worth visiting for the brunch

As is true of other locations, this is definitely a cute and popular spot for lunch. This is mostly a review of my specific dish: I ordered the sirloin steak entree and it arrived very well done. I asked my waiter if I could get a new steak medium rare - he was very kind and immediately made the change. Unfortunately, the new steak was still overcooked with not much flavor. I appreciate the kind and quick service, but I would not recommend this dish.
Convenient, and comforting. Great staff, good food, and great value. Glad they're in the neighborhood.
No comment
Looked pretty nice and always crowded so I decided to try. Ordered peri peri chicken, it was a bit burned, not much flavor, overpriced for what you get.

I was so excited to have this restaurant open in my neighborhood, but was very disappointed by my first experience. The Prego Steak Sandwich, recommended by our server, was basically a slider. Small bun, very little meat, totally not worth the price. My wife's meal was so blah I can't even remember what she had - the breakfast bowl? The wine is served in Dixie cups. Just not at all what I was expecting from what I've seen and heard. I live across the street and I will not be back.
Great addition to the are, love their breakfast. The breakfast bowl is awesome and make sure you ask for the green sauce.
Great addition to the neighborhood! Food was delicious as expected and the owners were so kind and welcoming. Will be back again and again.
Service was some of the best I've ever had. Atmosphere was awesome and loved the vibe. Really felt like they were happy to have us there. Will be coming back, thanks for a such a great time!

Been coming here since they opened, have never had any issues. Always have loved the food and the atmosphere. But today- went and ordered a salad and there was a RUBBER BAND in my salad! I was blown away seeing that especially being an ex-line cook myself. They were really sweet about it and I appreciate that but it will be a while till I go back there again.

I never leave yelp reviews really but I have to say I have had an exceptional experience here! I got to restaurants everyday and the staff here was some of the most genuine. Our waiter with the long hair and bangs made us laugh multiple times, had the best recommendations, and was really kind about me spilling my water on the way  out. The blonde host was extremely kind and every other busser and server met us with a smile including the manager. The chocolate cake was unbelievable and the steak was perfectly cooked. Drinks were great and I had a great time. Wasn't much of a wait at dinner either. I'm glad it's now open down the block from me and I will definitely be going back. Finally-- they serve breakfast all day. What could be better?

This place is incredible. First - I had just finished a run when I came here, and was obviously in dire need of water. Every few minutes they came around bringing us water. All of the waitresses were SO fun and friendly and brought out water bowls to the patrons with dogs. Super aesthetic and great outdoor seating. Service was super fast. 10/10 lattes. My boyfriend and I got the grapefruit yogurt parfaits and the granola was super good, grapefruit was really fresh. It's a little pricey, but you're paying for the incredible service and quality food. Would come back here in a heartbeat, next time for dinner!

We stopped here for brunch today and everything was delicious. Started with the zucchini chips which were beyond delicious. Then I had the poached eggs and my husband had the madame Freda. Unbelievable. The Bloody Mary was also delicious - perfectly spicy. Would go again any day of the week.

This place is charming and thoughtfully designed. I loved the comfortable booths and the art on the wall. The staff also were very accommodating, and the service was perfect. The food was also excellent. I will be going back. The only issue I had was that they served wine in a rocks glass rather than a wine glass. It takes away the experience of eating out and enjoying a glass of wine. Something that simple as a wine glass makes all the difference. I wonder if they do that at all their locations?
No comment

This is probably the best burger I've ever had. I understand the price of the place is about the ambiance, service, and quality, and it definitely held up. The burger was cooked a perfect medium rare / medium and was so juicy. My friend ordered the red sauce paste and the pasta was cooked absolutely perfectly and was so delicious. She ordered the half order of the pasta and the chef gave us the other half on the house! Worth the experience and the everything we got was delicious.
No comment

We ended our Friday night here and to be honest, I adored this place. We got the shrimp and burger and wow, the burger was delicious! I am not sure if it was because I was drunk, but the ambiance and the vibe here is so my sh**. I will have to try their cocktails some other time because I was trying to be good and not drink too much liquor. I had a two glasses of sauv and it was fine, but I am just a huge cocktail junkie and I feel like this place would deliver.
No comment

The ambience here was great, came here for a team lunch and we ordered the wedge salad chopped and the truffle burger. Honestly such a good burger and perfect amount of truffle. It was super quality and meat was cooked to perfection. The wedge salad was also super fresh and such a huge portion! Would definitely come back and I enjoyed how it wasn't hard to get a reservation for lunch! We also ordered the carrot cake and it was HUGE, but I didn't like how creamy and raisiny it was.

No comment

We went on a Saturday night. We enjoyed the crab rangoon. The artichoke dip was good but not super flavorful. I was very excited for the burger but when it came out it was a little cold and dry as if it had been sitting out for a while.

It's really cute, good vibes, and good service BUT overall the food was good, not great and not anywhere worth the price. I got the espresso martini as my drink, it was $25 (lol) and not very good. We got the king crab Rangoon ($30) to start. They were good but at this price point it's kind of laughable. For entrees we got the spicy shrimp pasta ($32) and steak frites ($56). The pasta was good, worth it, the steak was not. The steak itself was over cooked and the fries were under seasoned. We also got the truffle Mac and cheese ($20) and it was good. This place was nothing special and the prices made it an even worse experience. Not for me, won't be coming back, and don't recommend.

What a lovely place! We enjoyed delicious cocktails and appetizers pre-theater. The decor is unique and feels like Casablanca! The service was top notch and very friendly. Look forward to my next visit.

Monkey Bar has gone through a number of ownership and chef transitions since opening in the 1930s. Its latest iteration is now run by Au Chevalier from Chicago and the people behind 4 Charles Prime Rib. They are packed every night with an upscale crowd. It looks like you are walking off the set of Mad Men. It is good food and an interesting evening.
No comment

I had the most amazing dining experience at Monkey Bar and cannot recommend it enough! The ambiance of the restaurant is cozy and romantic. The burger and vodka rigatoni were out of this world! Save room for dessert! I highly recommend this restaurant for anyone looking for an unforgettable date spot that serves up delectable dishes.

A NYC classic with old school steakhouse style menu. I've been going to Monkey Bar for years and it never disappoints. Right now it's run by the same people behind 4 Charles and seems to have had a bit of an interior update but it's still the Monkey Bar we've always loved: beautiful, low lighting, impeccable service, great martinis and just a tasteful, classic experience all around. What can I say the zebra wallpaper makes me half. I highly recommend the French Dip, the crab Rangoon, the pasta and the Caesar. We were on a double date and ordered tons of dishes to split and the waitstaff was happy to arrange for our party of four.

A friend of mine invited me last minute because a table opened up on Resy on a Monday night at 8. The restaurant didn't disappoint. The ambience was a vibe. Our server displayed fantastic customer service and offered a lot of recommendations. The food was tasty with great portion size and the drinks were divine.

This was excellent. My wife didn't think it was quite the same quality as 4 Charles Prime Rib, but I thought it was pretty similar. We came with a group of four and got the wedge salad, the crab rangoon, two burgers, two French dips, bacon, fries, and then finished with the lemon meringue and chocolate pie. Everything was great, and I thought the burger was pretty perfect, although my wife preferred the French dip (which I also really liked). The desserts were both amazing. I will say, everything is very expensive, but the portions are pretty sizable, which helped soften that blow.
No comment

Very classy bar located inside the Hotel Elysee. It was packed on a Thursday night. The food and drinks are great - albeit you are paying a lot for them. The ambiance is social and fancy. Despite how packed the small bar gets, the bartenders are helpful, friendly and top-notch. Always a great time!
No comment
Cool atmosphere! 1930's vibe. Great food but long waits and very pricy. We put our names down but ended up getting seats at the bar. The salmon was incredible!

Went twice since it reopened last month. When you enter there is a casual front end that is dimly lit with a bar, a couple of tables and booths. I'm not sure if that is for walk ins but seems more casual than the back of the restaurant.  The room is dimly lit creating serious date night vibes. There are comfortable half circle red leather booths surrounding the walls and more tables in the middle. Lots of delicious things on the menu. For starters the salads can feed 2-3 people - enjoyed the whitefish Cesar salad. The steak tartare is absolutely divine along with the crab Rangoon puffs. For mains we really enjoyed the shrimp scampi and burger were hits. The chicken parm was good too thin cutlets with flavorful sauce. The sides including mushrooms and creamed spinach were also perfect add ons to the meal. Everyone will leave happy!
No comment
Great service, friendly staff and delicious food. If you're looking for a romantic dinner or a catch up with friends it's an awesome spot with beautiful ambience.
The food was AMAZING. Tartare, burger, and steak - I almost had to roll out of there. The wait for a table was a bit long, but we just sat at the bar while we waited.

Chic ambience and great food and drinks! Get ready to drop a dime though, but worth it for the service and vibe. We arrived right at 5 pm and were able to walk in and be seated. However, within 10 minutes it was packed. We got the burger, truffle Mac n cheese, white fish Caesar salad, and espresso martinis. The burger was solid and was similar to Au Cheval's. The mac n cheese was delicious, but unfortunately cold so that was my only complaint. The salad was really good, but it was hard to finish between 2 people. I definitely think we ordered the right amount of food though. The espresso martini was one of my favorites I've had, but my sister thought it was too sweet (but she also likes black coffee).
Stumbled upon this gem, old fashioned bar with great food and awesome service. Great atmosphere!

Now that I have visited this establishment multiple times, I can finally leave a proper review and stop comparing it to 4 Charles Prime! Monkey Bar makes you feel like NYC is back again. From the low lit but jovial ambience of the front bar area to the old starlet glam of the dining room, you can definitely feel an upscale yet comfortable vibe as you enjoy your meal. As for the food, they've still been making little tweaks here and there but I love the variety that their selection provides. If you're a steak lover and want a piece of 4 Charles Prime, the steaks that they have on the menu here are from the same purveyor and will definitely satisfy you. If you're seeking something different, their seafood options are amazing! I highly recommend the prawns. Their cocktail list is extensive, their desserts are rich and the service has been attentive. While difficult to get a reservation as well, this is your true Polo Bar equivalent. Treat yourself to the old feeling of New York soon...
No comment

First thing - exceptional service! The waiter was so knowledgeable, thoughtful about the dining experience and even sent us champagne for our anniversary! He gave great suggestions and timed/paired the dishes according to experience. I never in a million years would order crab Rangoon but these were life changing! The rigatoni vodka was spectacular. The burger is delish and it was even better dipped in the truffle pasta sauce. I could have lived without the fries. Dessert we had the spectacular banana split! The vibe and music are 10/10. Happy to make this restaurant a regular in my book!

I walked in for a seat without a reservation at 530. Hostess said It may be 30 mins. I got A drink while I waited for people to clear the bar.  2 hours later I finally got a seat in the corner where it was so cold I could not take off my jacket. The food was fine and the manager offered to get us drinks because I complained. Seated in the corner, feeling the pressure to eat fast, as to give up our table. It was dark and cold. Not worth it at all. Wasted a Saturday night
Great selection of beer and comfort food. Staff is very friendly and service was on point and this was with 200 plus people we had there. Great for casual events for business or friends.

The steak tartare was phenomenon but the bread was over cooked and sharp. The crab rangoon was good but you could get something just as good at your local delivery spot. The French dip was great (don't skip it) but it is definitely better at 4 Charles and on par to their one at Au Cheval. The pastas we're just okay but I wouldn't get them again. We had the spicy shrimp and the truffle tagliatelle (VERY salty). The spicy fried chicken was good but over shined by the wagyu steak which was delicious, especially accompanied by the mashed potatoes(so good). Don't skip the chocolate cream pie it was excellent as were all the cocktails (classic and bourbon old fashion, cucumber martini, and espresso martini). All that said, most items were over priced for the quality in my opinion.

Food was amazing. We got the fried chicken, roasted chicken, and the vodka pasta! Delicious, great job & respect to the chefs/cooks. (Compliments to the chef) I wish our service was better, our server was very pushy and short, borderline rude. All in all would be back, with a different server and better service. Food was great to be clear!!!
Great service and food was delicious and high quality. The dip was a fantastic starter. Not pictured are the side of mushrooms which were also an amazing side, would go back!
Absolutely fantastic restaurant. Make sure you see Kevin worlds greatest restaurant great weather in New York. Talk to
One of the coolest, interesting places!  Love it!  Very unique. Very retro ; makes you feel like you're in the 40's on some great movie set. Love it for cocktails.
No comment
No comment

So honestly a little disappointed. Service was excellent. Fastest order to table served I've ever experienced. The Vesper was perfect as was the red wine my date ordered. Taking a pass on the $450 / 32 oz prime rib (?), my date ordered the chicken Parm which she said was very good. My skirt steak was cooked to order, but too salty. The creamed spinach was good but too salty and the creamy corn side dish too sweet. My conclusion was that this place is serving up food (savory & sweet) to sell alcohol. C+
No comment
Fun atmosphere and great burgers. Good value for the pricey location. Nice servers and overall feels like a hidden gem in a touristy part of town.

Classy spot with chill vibe. The food was definitely good but I think it tasted better at 4 Charles Prime Rib than here.  Spotty service. We never saw our waiter again after ordering, had to flag people down passing by. Recommend if looking for a nice spot for dinner in midtown.
Fun place, classic 1958 monkey jungle theme on the walls, great burger, sides, overall a fun night out. Great wait staff, good music in the bar!

Great atmosphere... the food was ok... portions are good size and can be shared. The restaurant looks like a throwback from the 1920s and is a fun experience while in New York. Look for it to be pricey!

My friend took me here for lunch on a weekend. We actually got there within minutes of opening time so the place was not yet filled. Customer service is A+. And the food? A+! I was so blown away by the dumplings and the ramen (i ordered tonkatsu). Not only were they flavorful, the texture was perfect as well! I also ordered a thai iced tea was very good also. I was so happy with the food I really can't wait to come back here!
No comment

No comment

My friend and I came on a weeknight for takeout. Service was friendly and fast. I got the spare rib udon, my friend got the seafood spicy noodles, and we shared the chicken gyoza. Everything was great!
No comment
No comment

Solid offering. I had to ask for instructions on how to eat my Baa Mee just to make sure I was doing it right and i appreciated the wait staff guiding me with a smile. We sat in the 10 or so seat outdoor space which felt like a nice hidden gem of a space. The lychee (iced tea i think) drank a little sweet for us, but we diluted it and it was fine. 2nd time here and not the last.
No comment

One of the best places I've ever ordered off of Grubhub. Absolutely wonderful value for money and amazing selection! Delicious, high-quality food through and through. Everything from the gyoza to the noodles to the broccoli to the pina colada beverage was perfection. 10/10!

Excellent southeast Asian style noodle bar. Their grilled chicken with dry wonton egg noodle was fantastic as was their Tom yum noodle soup. The broth is balanced and well seasoned varying the flavor based on the dish. The fried chicken appetizer was crispy and moist.
No comment

Great spot for noods! Came here on a Wednesday evening with a friend for dinner and was seated right away. I ordered the Proong Tom Yum Noodle, which was great. I think this might have been my first time having tom yum actually and I thought it was pretty good. The taste of the warm broth was just what I needed on a chilly fall evening. Would definitely have it again, especially during the cooler months!
No comment

Second visit here, both times for lunch special! Quick tasty shoyu ramen broth that hit the spot on this grey nyc day, great noodles, okay chashu, nice lil kale salad to start all at a somewhat reasonable price for the area. Super friendly staff and nice interior (with a garden that I didn't see).

As always love the food at Proong. Whenever I'm in the area. Definitely order my favorites: Spicy Tonkatsu Ramen and fried chicken bao. The service is great and food has always been consistently delish.

Very delicious food at a great price! I love their crispy chicken rice bowl and their crispy tofu rice bowl!! It has become a new craving of mine. My brother got the seafood spicy noodle soup; and said it was amazing!! Overall very, very delicious food at a reasonable price. Honestly one of my favorite restaurants in the Gramercy/Flatiron area. The service is great and the staff are nice and welcoming. I am so lucky to live only a 7 minute walk away!
No comment
No comment
No comment

The place looks small from the outside but they actually have another sitting area past the corridor. Ordered the tom yum noodles - the broth is lighter than I expected but this actually made it a more comfortable noodle to eat (you will be disappointed though if you are expecting all the exciting spicy flavours). I like their choice of thin rice noodles in this one. The chicken and egg are normal. Also got the thai iced tea which is quite normal too - a bit weak in the tea intensity.

I've eaten here plenty of times since the fall, mostly take out. The staff is friendly and accommodating. The menu has slightly changed recently. I used to get the Hot Seoul Bowl now its called Kimchee Ramen and doesn't have the different mushrooms the Seoul Bowl has. I always sub the tofu for more veggies so it is very hearty and filling but not heavy. I love this entree so I haven't tried anything else. My coworkers love this place and frequent it whenever we are working in the area also.
No comment
Amazing food. I do some items are kinda pricey, but overall their main dinner items are worth the money and are delicious everytime. The place is very small as well.
Great food and service. Miso ramen and the duck sandwiches are delicious. Delivery is also lightning fast.
No comment
No comment

I really tried to like this place because they have lots of vegetarian options and a good lunch special, but the food is just really lackluster. The crispy tofu rice bowl and the vegetarian ramen were both tasteless and forgettable.
Great food and great service. The place is small so may not be good for groups, but their Proong noodle special was tasty and their steam vegetable dumplings went very fast.
The ramen is very large and the appetizers are really tasty. I liked the cheese gyoza a lot 10/10 and the tofu bun was great. I had the miso ramen and it was really filling and delicious.

This place rocks!! I'm actually shocked at how good this place is. As a self proclaimed ramen connoisseur, this is one of the best soups you'll have anywhere. Phenomenal mixture of flavors, never crazy crowded (yet), and a great menu. One of the best places I've been to in a while.

Delicious noodles lover spot. My friend and I were so surprised there is a Thai restaurant in the area that is not only cook regular also have an authentic Thai dishes such as spicy chicken claws soup, Kao soy etc. Service is very good and friendly, food is  fast and delicious.

I got this tonight on a whim as I've walked past 100 times but didn't think anything of it. I finally gave it a try and WOW. This Unassuming spot killing the ramen game. I'll definitely be back.
Love this spot! Delicious food and great service. Small indoor area but definitely worth going to.

Great environment and good food! I ordered the chicken noodle and bun and kale salad.

This was my first time back in the city for work since covid and we took some customers out for lunch. This place was perfect! They had a little patio where we were the only ones, they took our temperature upon arrival and followed covid protocol perfectly. Not to mention the seafood ramen was the best ramen I ever had. I can't wait to go back!
