Best ramen. Great flavor, GOOD THICK PORK BELLY SLICES, good price. They don't skimp on the protein like other "well rated" ramen imposters in the city. I like the spicy ramen best. Really can't recommend this place enough.
No comment
No comment

We were in the neighborhood and stopped by Proong Noodle Bar and had a terrific lunch. We had the Bang-Rak Baa Mee and the Crispy Chicken Rice Bowl and both were excellent. The prices were also very reasonable and the service was friendly and efficient.  The seating area is relatively small but was fine during weekday lunch.  Will definitely return the next time we are in this area.
Awesome noodles, nice and flavorful broth. Love it every time  always fresh food, which is a big deal for a New York restaurant.

The lunch menu was a great find. Before I was even done with my small plate of edamame the pork soup I ordered was already in front of me. The price was very reasonable, especially considering the quality. The Thai iced tea is another thing I will vouch for.
No comment
Surprisingly good noodles. Rich broth. Delish katsu. Noddles al dente. Nice people too. Def recommend it.
No comment

Absolutely GENEROUS amounts of meat and noodles in your bowl. The appetizers are fantastic as well, loved the corn fritters. Definitely try a combination of their noodle soups and newer ramen options.
No comment

Honestly I couldn't eat any of the chicken from my Crispy Chicken Rice Bowl order today. I attached a picture of one piece but the rest of it was also gross. The 'meat' was deep fried gristle,, fat, and skin. I'd had it before and liked it but this was a total write-off. If staff read this I would be happy with smaller portions of better quality.

I ordered delivery from here so the soup came on the side and which I appreciated so the noodles didn't get soggy during transport. My only reason for a deduction in a star was that I wished they were a little more generous w the contents - the photos seems like the dishes would be loaded with goodies not sure if it was because it was takeout that they limited the content or if a dine-in experience would've been more 'plentiful'... but nonetheless I was content with the flavors and selection and would try it again except as a dine-in instead of a take-out option.

Came here for lunch last week with high hopes and I was not disappointed. There's more seating in the back and great lunch specials.  Initially I thought the portion looked small, but it was actually the perfect amount.  Service was a little slow, especially since it was not crowded, but I'm excusing it because I thought the food was that good!  I look forward to trying other menu items soon.

i've gotten the khao soi ramen, shoyu ramen, and thai iced tea, and everything has been really delicious! also, i really appreciate that they separate the noodles and toppings and the broth -- nobody likes soggy noodles :0 definitely one of my favorite noodle spots and local eats! :-)
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

This little restaurant was the perfect spot to have a meal.  The service was excellent and the food delicious.  The front of the restaurant has 4 seats at a small bar at the window and another 4 seats at a bar facing into the kitchen.  Two tables seating 4 each share the small space.  I can only imagine how intimate it must be if all seats are filled.  I was there on a weeknight with my hubby and had the place mostly to ourselves. Lots of deliveries left the kitchen so clearly it's a popular take out place.  There is seating in a small room in the back and a tiny patio for outdoor seating when the weather permits.  I always appreciate a clean decent sized bathroom with a place to hang my coat and handbag.  We ordered the pork belly bun and crispy chicken bun and the pork cutlet noodle special which came with the clear broth on the side.  I like this as I like dry noodles and sipping the broth is refreshing.   Yelp check in treat was a large serving of edamame.

Every few years, I try going around the neighborhood near the hospital where I work.  So today I tried the Vegan Tonkotsu here, $15+ tax.  What I received was a container of very greasy miso soup and a container of 3 slices of plain tofu, 1/2 egg, some noodles, and a few pieces of cabbage.  Not worth it.  I don't like greasy food, I don't like salty food (miso soup), and I don't like being hungry as soon as I finish eating.  On the plus side, the establishment appeared clean and the server was friendly.
No comment
No comment

Delicious food! Great service. Everybody is friendly and makes good recommendations. The strawberry lemonade is so good I want to bathe in it. I ordered the bang-rak baa Mee. It was full of flavor. This place is definitely worth a try.
No comment
No comment

This is a small, but cute store. I ordered the spicy seafood noodles and a thai iced tea. It was a different experience to what you usually order at a thai restaurant. The prices are decent for being in the city. They offer happy hour from 3-7 pm everyday. I heard to pork buns were really good. The place is clean and has a good vibe. I loved the food and it's definitely something new you must try! Plus, the serving sizes are decent and would most likely fill you up!

I really really love their coconut mojito! i can drink it all day! Their plating are instagrammable esp their foods! And it does not only look good but it taste really AMAZING!! i am hapoy to have found this place! Will surely comeback every week!
Very delicious. I love their pickles in bun. Soooo good!! And must taste kale salads. So good.

Been waiting on this place to open for awhile as it's in a bit of food desert. I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the Pork Belly Bun. Great portion size (for $4), with lots of texture from the think pork belly, radish, cucumber, steam bun and mix of sauces. The spicy chicken foot soup was also great and tangy, if you're into that sort of thing. Server was seriously attentive and very nice. This was a soft opening so first impressions are valuable. Looking forward to going back soon, and hoping it keeps getting better.

I usually get either the Crispy Chicken Rice Bowl or Pork Belly Rice Bowl which are both great. The portions are generous and the food is delicious. This place has been a life saver during the work from home period.
No comment

I was feeling under the weather today and wanted something warm and to help my cold, found this Cute Noodle bar! If you are looking for something quick but yummy, great noodles and great service! The portions are a decent size for the pricing And this spot is spacious enough for big groups!

Delightful addition to the neighborhood!   We went for lunch and tried a variety of dishes.  The chicken and pork buns really stood out.  The beef stew noodle soup was delicious and hit the spot just right.  My favorite was the Kale Salad which was a great blend of tangy flavors, nuts, and edamame.  Definitely check this place out.
delicious salad and noodle ！ The Thai flavor seafood noodle is spicy and tasty. And the kale salad is just very on point. It's a bit sour and sweet. Very tasty.

Great new addition to the neighborhood in Stuy Town. Came on a chilly, cloudy Sunday perfect for a bowl of tangy, spicy pork rice noodles. Throw on some buns for an extra 3 dollars and a small Thai-iced tea for the ideal lunch meal.
No comment
No comment
This place is such a hidden gem!!!! The spicy pork belly ramen is the best ramen I've ever had in my life.... 11/10
Incredibly tasty and authentic thai noodles place in the neighborhood! I'm From Thailand and everything here it tastes like home!

This place is such a small little gem. The food is absolutely delicious, the staff is incredibly friendly and the ambience is on point. I ordered the spicy pork belly ramen and it was delicious. Not quiet as hot as I prefer but there were spices available to kick up the heat. The pork belly was huge and sooo good. Definitely will be back here.

What a pleasant surprise to find in this of all neighborhoods. It is so different and fresh. The decor is modern and the service was extremely friendly and attentive. Let's get to the food. It was undeniably flavorful and unique. I was caught off guard by sour bite when all I expected was a spicy bite. My fault since I should have known better from a Thai establishment. I will definitely go back to try the other dishes. I hope this place sticks around as the neighborhood deserves it.
Jasmine tea, Thai coffee, Gyoza, Edamame,  Thong-lor (shoyu) & Spare Rib Udon. The Best. Thank you.

Great spot for authentic noodles.  Both appetizers and noodles were tasty.  And when they say large for the drinks they mean it.  Had great larger than large Thai tea. Atmosphere was nice and the staff was pleasant and attentive.  Recommend for both locals and out of towers.
Had the Vit- Spicy Pork noodle. It was hearty and delicious. The broth had the sour, spicy, salty, and a touch of sweetness to it, perfect for a cold day.
They have a lot of tasty things on menu.  I like the shumai, the kale salad (best I've had), and their ramen.
This place is very cosy and have good vegetarian options as well! The veggie ramen is my favourite ..

Me and my friends had a great time here~ their seafood noodle soup is a must!!! I recommend it highly!!! Also their fried ice cream is so special~~if u have never tried it, go for it! The staffs here are so nice, they will treat u as a friend or family.. I will come back definitely!!

A quaint place that serves authentic Southeast Asian flavor. The beef noodle is particularly delicious. Tasty mocktails too. Noodle portion could be bigger given the price they charge, but overall a good dining experience.

Guys! This place is the best for your brunch or dinner or whatever! I mean their food and drinks are great! We had Su-khum-vit spicy pork noodle (this is da bomb) and Pork belly rice bowls (their pork belly will melt in your mouth). Also the place is super lovely with great services. Definitely will go back again!
Amazing tasty food! Awesome servers & service! Nice atmosphere. Big portion with reasonable price. I will be back again & again
No comment

Good thai joint in this area with inexpensive, generous portions of flavorful food. Tried the curry and the pad see ew and both were good and comforting. The noodles had a nice chewyness and the curry a nice kick. The restaurant is pretty small, the staff is attentive and efficient. Good stop for a casual meal.

Upon picking up my dinner ordered this evening I was upset to see that both people cooking the food were wearing masks with their noses sticking out. Since breathing is done both via the nose and the mouth, it is as if not wearing a mask at all. I nuked my food in the microwave, but will not be ordering from here again during the pandemic until they can guarantee stricter safety measures. It's unfortunate since the food is good.

The lychee sangria is very good! And the large is huge definitely enough for 2 people and only $15. I got the vegetarian ramen which was good but a bit bland. The service was fast and servers were very nice.

First time here and I was very pleased by their spicy pork ramen! The chashu was delicious and very generous, probably the most I've ever had in a ramen bowl. The broth is filling with an interesting sweet tinge to it--maybe from the corn? Looking forward to coming by again!
I found a special new Thai restaurant at 1st. Ave. I'm so really like Sukumvit noodle (Tomyum noodle). That one have a test little bit spicy and sour. The Proong salad, bun, cocktail also good.

My husband and I stopped in on a whim and it turned out to be soooo good. The Tongstu Ramen had a wonderful umami flavor and the pork belly was so good. We've been back countless times now and I can safely say that everything on the menu is amazing.  This place looks small from the outside but there's more seating in the back and a little back yard too. I can't recommend it enough. It's one of our favorite places.
No comment
This was my 1st Thai restaurant ever. I got the Sukhumvit Soup which was Tom Yum soup with pork. It was delicious & the Lychee Sweet tea was amazing. The staff is very nice.

I've only ordered to go here but the food is comforting and healthful. We don't have many high quality restaurants in Stuytown area so this place is a blessing. I especially like the homey Pork Belly Rice Bowl and the crunchy sweet salty tangy Kale Salad.

I've ordered several times, and gone in person once. The lunch special is a fantastic deal, and you can add things for very small upcharges that honestly make it feel like a steal. We've had several of the rice bowls and several orders of noodles, and they were all delicious. There are definitely options that are superior in terms of food, but I haven't been disappointed by anything and for the price have been surprised by how good. The fried chicken appetizer and free gyoza that comes with many specials are both very very good. All the rice bowls are served with a broth on the side that is delicious. All of their meats are always very tender. Nothing is overly salty like at some places, so you always get the actual flavor of the dish. Also when I went in with my baby the staff was all so sweet and accommodating. It's cozy (read: small but cute) inside and very comfortable. Will continue to be a go-to for me, and should be for you.

This restaurant has caught my attention by its name and after eating there, I give it 5 star; (1) great appetizers (2) love the soup flavors in the noodles (3) drinks and cocktails. My first time trying lychee sangria. (4) warm and friendly service (5) dessert...Green tea fried ice cream! I went with a group of 8 ppl, we were able to share and order different things. Definitely will be back.

Food tasted really good and flavorful. I wish they would have followed directions and provided chili sauce. The pork ramen was amazingly delicious! The shy mai was delicious and delicate, the gyoza was crazy good. I just wish I had my chili sauce to make it perfect.

4 stars because the menu is a bit small and doesn't have pad thai ‍ but the food is actually very good even though it seems slightly pricey. This evening I had the beef stew rice bowl. The meat was very tender, it also came with bok choy, and a soft boiled egg. The proportion is a bit off because there's so much rice compared to the other items but overall very good. I'll definitely be ordering from them again soon.

New Thai noodle shop opened on 1st Ave. same owners as Bangkok 2 Thai. A nice new addition to the places around. I would say the noodles are pretty close to what you'd get in Thailand. Considering they offered so many different types and most shops in Thailand specialize on one type of noodle. Cute concept of how the noodle dishes are named after different neighborhoods and areas.  Happy to see more Thai noodle shops.Will come back again.

Really great. Took a friend who has lived in the neighborhood for a long time and never went. Everyone was happy with their dish. I had the Spicy Ramen after seeing it praised on yelp. It was delicious, the cuts of chashu was the largest I've ever had from a single order of ramen. Not overly spicy, just the right amount to leave you wanting more. The sake presentation is quite pleasing.
Really good, authentic Thai food :) I tried the Thai noodle soup, scrumptious. Very good flavors of sweet and sour without being overpowering.

Wow this place is fantastic. I had a lychee mojito, pork bun, and seafood noodle soup. The presentations were clean and colorful. Each item was delicious! The noodle soup in particular was pungent and rich in the best ways. I asked for medium spicy and it was just right--strong but not overpowering. Five stars. Friendly service too.
Ate here for lunch with a co-worker. Great lunch menu! My soup was tasty. I'm glad there is more variety in what is very much a food desert around here.

This is a great new addition to the neighborhood. I've lived in the area long enough to remember when this location was a newspaper stand, multiple pizza places (RIP Tony's House of Pizza), a scone place (yes scones) and later a wing place... well here's hoping Proong is here long term. My mom and I shared the roast pork buns, fried chicken and quail egg wontons as appetizers and we both got pork belly bowls as our main dish (we also got a side of spicy cucumber salad) and they included a free "proong salad". If that sounds like too much food you would be right but I have to say for a neighborhood often overlooked for food options suddenly there are some really great options. I guess if I had one critique I think the bowl might go well with some sort of spicy condiment on the side but that is nitpicking. Proong has more than earned that second O!!
No comment
Super huge authentic thai iced tea! Staff is super friendly & helpful. Excited to try the noodles!
Great service! Yummy food! Def recommend. Fritters are great and great beer selection. New yummy spot
love the authentic flavors and causal setting.

I ordered the spicy pork ramen via delivery. Delivery was fast and prompt and the broth came lukewarm which was fine.(it's cold outside) . There was a generous portion of pork belly in the ramen and it was cooked perfectly and seasoned well. The only complaint I have is I was expecting a rich and creamy pork broth and instead I got a semi sweet coconutty broth. It tasted similar to a Tom Kha soup and although the broth was delicious I was just expecting a more traditional pork ramen broth.

Had the fried chicken and pork belly buns. The fried chicken was like a tiny nugget in a giant bun, so can't even give you a good review because there wasn't enough of it to give you a good taste. Total waste of a bun. The pork belly, on the other hand, was delicious. Great size, good sauce. Melts in your mouth.

Delicious!   I took my family there yesterday.  I love the service. Always did from Bangkok Two.   Everything is fresh and such wonderful fusion flavors.  I recommend it highly.  This neighborhood has very little. Finally, quality, great service and yummy cuisine!

Awesome!!! The food is delicious and the service is fast. They have an amazing tofu veggie bowl, and my family reports that the crispy chicken bowl and tom yum bowl are also spectacular. This place is very clean with a nice vibe. I would 100% recommend.

Wonderful atmosphere! It felt like a family invited me into the back of their small diner to serve me, a hungry student, a homey meal. The Pork Buns were probably the tastiest $3 I've ever eaten. And the ramen was so good I wanted to get up and hug the waitresses. There's a cozy little outside seating place in the back that looks just like a garden. And the playlist playing in the restaurant is calming melancholy music that makes me want to curl up on the bench and take a nap. A perfect place to eat by yourself or with a friend. Probably shouldn't bring more than 4 people though.
No comment
Good stuff! Delicious crispy chicken bun. Tasty flavorful noodles, too. The spice is excellent. #ProongNoodleBar
No comment
We got the Tom Yum Noodle, Stewed Chicken Noodle, and Spicy Pork Noodle. They were all very tasty! The stewed chicken was particularly flavorful and my favorite.

My first impression was how deeply brown and fragrant the beef rice bowl looked when it arrived and in taste, it didn't disappoint. It was delicious, authentically flavored and fresh, just what I wanted on a cold winter day!

I havent written a review in years but this is my neighborhood spot and I want to make sure this place doesnt go anywhere!  They have quality food that is always fresh!  It has a home cooked meal feel to it if your mom was an expert chef lol. This place is on my consistent seamless go-to. They deliver quickly, the food doesnt taste like fast food and the ingredients they use are fresh. Love literally everything Ive tried on their menu :)

Really good lunch spot in the neighborhood! We ordered ton yum noodle and the noodle with a chicken leg and they are both quite tasty, definitely a good fit for the finally warm spring weather. We also had the signature mock tail which helped to make the lunch even better. We also had some edamame and it was good too.
Delicious and good service! Like it! also recommend noodle with Pork And all appetizers！

Ordered the spicy pork ramen. The broth was nothing like a typical "creamy" ramen broth that usually get's creaminess from chicken or pork fat. Instead it was super sweet and tasted like it was made with coconut milk. Not horrible, but not what I was looking for at all. It was more like a Thai Tom kha kai soup with noodles and pork belly in it. Ingredients seemed fresh and delivery was fast so maybe I'll try something else on the menu one day but not in any rush to do so.

What a cute little restaurant!! So excited it opened right next to my school. The place is so cute and the noodles are delicious. Very unique flavor. I also got a kale salad from the restaurant, and it's really good !!! I will definitely come back
Cute little place. The food is really good both dine in and delivery. I've had the pork belly rice bowl and their noodles soups and both are delicious. Highly recommend!
Wanted to like this since I'm a fan of Thai noodle soup and it is close to home, but unfortunately the su khum vit spicy pork noodle soup was too sour.

Highly recommend Proong noodle Bar for the fantastic staff and the superb food. Decided to try this restaurant after reading review on Yelp. My faverite dish is the Siam square Beef stewed Noodle. Wonderfully fragrant and deliciously , this  Noodle Soup makes the perfect ... I love braised & stewed beef and I adore Thai style noodle.
No comment
My wife is Thai and she loves the noodle soups here. Great broth and fresh ingredients. Si-Lom Chicken Stew Noodles Stew highly recommended.

Don't let the small dining room fool you. If you walk to the back of restaurant they also have small backyard space which is very cute.  This place is definitely worth giving a try. The quality and taste was on point.  I would recommend their "Stewed Beef noodle soup" and "Super Chicken feet" Definitely worth trying.
Hair in my ramen. Idk about you but when your ramen noodles are tangled up with hairs... you never come back... disgusting. Never coming back.

The noodle soups aren't bad, but they also aren't anything to write home about. What bothered me, though, was that the shredded "chicken" in one of the soups is actually turkey. Sometimes restaurants substitute turkey for chicken because it's cheaper and looks kind of similar, but the meats have very different flavors and it's quite obvious.
Charming little place really cool Decour simple and delightful great service adorable garden delicious food

First time here and we'll definitely be back, especially when the weather warms up and we can sit in its cozy garden. Food was absolutely terrific, especially the kale salad and the Tonkatsu Ramen. Very reasonably priced wine.
Cute little place that opened up near my neighborhood. It's cozy and the appetizers were great. We had the Quail egg cheese wontons, E-corn fritters, Proong Kale Salad and the buns.

My coworkers and I love this new place. The Tom yum noodle is great but the beef one is even better!! And the fried chicken is awesome with some bold chipotle mayo. Best lunch spot around since this area doesn't have much to offer. Love this new place.
No comment
This one of my favorite Thai restaurants in NYC. It's close to my apartment. I ordered rice noodle with pork which was authentic and tasty. I will definitely come back again.
Really delicious pork bun and crispy chicken bun!  Flavors and textures were all there!! Tom yum oodles are delicious. Service is great!
We came here on a Sunday afternoon for lunch. We got the Tom Yum Noodle Soup and the Vegetarian Tofu Soup - both were delicious! The service was great, cute decor, good prices. We will be returning!
Very cute setting! Service is fast and efficient! The food came quickly, was warm and comforting and very reasonably priced.

This review is for takeout. Stopped by tonight and ordered food to take home. It was our first time trying Proong and we'll definitely be back. The food was really unique and flavorful. We enjoyed each dish. We tried the Proong Fried Chicken appetizer, which came with tasty sriracha mayo dipping sauce, the quail egg cheese wonton, crispy chicken rice bowl and the spicy pork noodle soup. All were really delicious. And the Thai Iced Tea was great too - not too sweet like many other places. Service was friendly and quick. We look forward to trying some of the other dishes in the future.

I was expecting decent noodles- but WOW- what flavor! The noodles were perfectly cooked- something you don't often find.  We had two noodle dishes spicy seafood (total winner) and pork. Both great. The ladies there were very sweet as well. Can't wait to go back.

This place just opened in my neighborhood, and I'm so happy! They have excellent noodles and rice bowls. My favorite is the Tom Yum noodle soup. They let you choose which type of noodles you prefer, so I chose the ramen noodles. They are fresh noodles (not freeze dried), and the soup has amazing flavor. The lunch special offers an appetizer/main course combo, and I chose the spicy edamame. Also delicious!

Recently moved nearby and came in for lunch on a Saturday. The Thai iced tea (L) was HUGE but the flavor was addicting enough for my friend and I to finish it along with the fried chicken buns and our entrees. Everything was delicious, and the staff was attentive. I see myself back here in the near future - I can't wait to try the whole menu!

The food and service were great! The gave us a free Kale salad and tossed in free pork dumplings b/c the waitress said our daughter was cute. We came in for the lunch special and were not disappointed. Since it was Easter today, the waitress also gave our daughter 2 chocolate Easter eggs. The restaurant was clean and family friendly.

I decided to try this place because it's close by. I ordered the Su Khum Vit Spicy Pork Noodle. I must say I've never been so disgusted in my life by the smell of the broth. It looked and smelled like throw up chunks and could not eat it! I have tried many broths and never have I smelled something so repulsive. The pork belly buns weren't up to par. It was mainly fat. Don't waste your money here. There are better noodle places around the city.

I've tried 2 of the lunch specials (Proong Tom Yum Noodle - very good, and Rib lunch - ok in a comfort food, not spicy way). It's a few bucks more expensive than some other neighborhood places. I want to try the beef stew noodle and will then decide if this makes it into my regular rotation. Delivery was on time and accurate.

I was looking forward to this place opening up, so I was disappointed to find that the quality of the food was not good.  The noodles were gummy and the chicken was very fatty.  The prices were on the high side for this kind of restaurant.  I won't be going back there again and wouldn't recommend it to others.
Pork bun was very good, looking forward to trying the rest of the menu

This place is so very very nice.  The BEST noodle place in the whole world so far. I was here on Saturday, the server was very(cute) nice and friendly to me. The salad was so nice. The noodle was very tasteful... I really like it so much, I like the egg, I like the soup , I like the noodle, I like the server, I like the atmosphere. I pretty much like everything... I would give this around 30-40 stars (if there is a button )... I will definitely recommend this place to all of my friends. I will come back here again for sure...Thx u so very much for the wonderful noodle taste
No comment
No comment
No comment

This is a local favorite in our neighborhood. My hubs has been coming here since he was a kid (former location), and introduced it to me in 2015 when we moved to Fort Greene (he grew up in Bed Stuy). The new location is great, it feels a little more off the path and has tons of seating indoor and out. What I love about Black Iris is you can rely on great Mediterranean food - always. The service isn't pretentious, it's neighborly, and it's usually quick. Baby friendly! Dog friendly! If you want to get in and out for some good food, without frills, and enjoy your meal, or even just a drink, this is your spot.

I work in Real Estate & so I'm always in the area & in between jobs I like to check out places in the area. This happens to be right by a job. I came in and I grabbed a lamb dish and a glass of wine. It was very yummy & delicious! Also, the ambiance is very cute. I love the decor & the style of the place. The music was also good! The service made my experience that much better. Everyone was very on top of everything!
No comment
No comment

Great layout The food was good I've had their food before I believe it was better tasting The Chicken and pizza was a little dry. The service was excellent I love dogs and totally respect disabled individuals  But not a dog eating in the same area in a crowed restaurant while Im eating. It was not a seeing dog neither. I could have gone to another place but I had already ordered. Besides that over all just lovely.
No comment
No comment

It's a neighborhood restaurant offering Mediterranean cuisine. The star & must have is the pita bread because it comes in round, fluffy, warm and yummy. The hummus is elevated because the pita is so delicious. I ordered the Merguez, a spicy lamb sausage with rice and a side salad. The lamb was ok, nothing spectacular and the rice was so so. My dining partner ordered the shrimp pizza, which was really good. In looking at the menu, I should have ordered the lambajin pitzaa because they seem to do pizza right. I would give this restaurant a second go when I'm in the area and order the lambajin pizza. The service was attentive on a Halloween night, which made the dining experience pleasurable.
No comment
My brother likes this place a lot and so does my cousin... I thought it was just OK but I'll definitely have to visit again to try something different.

We patronized this restaurant when it was on DeKalb and eagerly awaited its move to Lafayette Avenue. The quality of the food stayed the same though they've expanded the space, ambience, as well as the waitstaff. Very friendly, give it a whirl when you're in the neighborhood!
No comment
Cute inside, but not worth it. Expensive food for the amount you get, and pretty tasteless
No comment

Wonderful experience with the girlies! Me and my 3 girlfriends came here for dinner after a long day waiting for a 3 hour haircut and it made the day worthwhile. The owner, Adam gave us free cheese rolls and honeycake and made us feel so welcome. The black iris pizza was absolutely delectable and the atmosphere was calming yet lively.

Ordered delivery from here on a Monday night. The portions are fairly large for the price and the chicken kebab and gyro meat was decent but the salad and hummus had very little flavor at all and the dipping sauces were pretty bland as well. There are a ton of other Mediterranean places nearby so I can't see myself trying this place again.

I've gotten take out here a number of times and I think it's pretty decent. The hummus lacks flavor in a good way and the pita is excellent. The falafel is just average, nothing special. It's one of the better middle eastern take out places though.
No comment
No comment
Excellent food and selection. Freshly made and friendly service. Prices are also reasonable and the portions are generous!

Two stars because eating there was alright, but delivery...don't ever get anything lamb there. It was so nasty, foul smelling, I almost barfed and just threw away the whole thing after a bite. Think of the most sinewy, wormy piece of flesh you're trying to chew. Nasty af. And their veggies were soapy.

Love this place but the service since they moved needs work. There are a lot of servers and they can't seem to keep the details together. You sit on your own, and they don't take away the other place setting, they never ask you if the food is okay, I had a friend with me and they didn't bring her silverware, the servers were just gathered in the bar.. it's never full so there's no reason one can't get too service. Servers are completely distracted and sloppy service. I support my local restaurants but they need to step it up big time especially since the restaurant is not even close to being full.
No comment

I had a very unprofessional experience with this business. I ordered on seamless this evening around 7 PM. It was getting to be about 9 PM and the food still wasn't there yet. I called the restaurant and they said that it was too far to deliver, even though it's only 2.7 miles away. They forgot to cancel the order apparently so I have been waiting for the food for hours for nothing. Even after I got off the phone with them they then marked the order delivered, even though it wasn't. Now it's almost 915 pm and I have to reorder from somewhere else. So much for eating dinner at a normal hour. I was truly looking forward to trying out this food. On a sidenote I did ask if there was a manager or the owner was there, but the employee told me that they were not. Unacceptable all of this business. Get organized and change your delivery radius if you don't want to deliver to people. Ridiculous.

Came in on Father's Day evening with a large group after not being able to find a last minute restaurant anywhere. We were pleasantly surprised to find that not only were they open but they would be able to accommodate the group. Let's start off with the beauty of this place. Bright walls, airy atmosphere and just a tranquil, classy vibe. Our servers were amazing, very attentive and timely with our requests. The food was just amazing. Unfortunately,  we didn't get to take pictures because we were too hungry. My husband had the spicy sausage wrap which he loved. I had the grilled lamb with rice which was truly delish. Everyone else enjoyed their food and great atmosphere. I would definitely recommend this business and will be coming back.

I have been to both their old DeKalb location and their new Lafayette location. I always order their cold mezze plate with pita, and it's delicious every time. I think this is a great place to come with friends for a drink and some apps. The service leaves something to be desired though, I've had issues at both of their location with forgetting items, wait time, etc. but nothing bad enough to keep me from coming back. Also, I just had a seamless order that arrived without notification and in pretty poor shape - they completely refunded me, which was very appreciated.
No comment
Came across black iris when searching for a falafel in the area. They definitely met my craving the vegetables were fresh falafel was delicious. Portion was so big I could only eat half at a time.

I ordered from this place via DoorDash around 7 pm on a Saturday. I knew it would take awhile and the estimated delivery was around 830. I called at 840 when my food hadn't arrived and was told by the guy they were busy and it would be there in 30 minutes. I called back again at 920 and after waiting 5 minutes on hold, they told me my order had been canceled then told me he said that when I called at 840 and that I misunderstood him. I contacted DoorDash and they had no record of the order being canceled. Needless to say, I will not be ordering from this place again.

Staff is so nice it's a shame they serve such low quality wine. The food is a solid 4 star. Outdoor dine is a cute little set up. Restaurant is easily accessible from public transportation but I highly recommend driving or taxi and Covid 19 is still a serious threat. It would be nice if they took temperatures at the door so people could feel more comfortable knowing the stranger next to them is unlikely to have it.

I love Lebanese, Egyptian and Turkish food and reviews for this locale seemed positive. We went inside to escape the heat. Waiter was very nice but it was the dirtiest restaurant I ever ate in. It was unsanitary. Fan was filthy. The bathroom light switch had grime; floor, walls and table top were dirty. We ordered various appetizers and beverages for lunch. The foul and and spinach/chickpeas were not fresh not tasty; baba ganoush and hummus were good and flat bread was good. Falafel was ok. I also tried hot mint tea and I tasted chemicals not mint.

I have been coming here for years and also enjoyed their previous spot Olive Vine.  But yesterday may have been my last visit.  Starting with the service (and I understand this has nothing to do with food), I asked for table in the corner of the outdoor dining. It was set for 4, but we were 2, so we were not seated there.  Two minutes later, 2 people were seated at the same table.  A long while later, our order was take and after it was delivered we never saw a server again.  Now for the food...my ouzi was ice cold inside and had to be reheated.  The lamb in my friend's dish was tender, but flavorless.  He had to ask for salt.   Anytime I needed service, I had to get up and find someone.  Lastly, we charged our meal only to find a 'tech fee' of $1.50.  I was told that this was because we used a charge. When I said I should have been informed of this, the server said "We usually have a sign, but it's not there now."  Sorry, Black Iris...never again.  (BTW...menu was very different.  Maybe new owners?)

$11 for a lamb gyro... barely any sauce, dry as hell!  Horrible!  The sauce is the best part of the gyro and they cant even be generous with that?  Not asking for more lamb, which is more expensive, but you can't sell a dry sandwich!  Now I have to remind them every time for extra sauce!  Stop being cheap!

We picked this spot for a late lunch. Maybe they were understaffed, but the service was not stellar. Our servers were nice, but we had to flag them down to even take our orders. The pita bread was old and hard by the time we got it. The food was good, but we were unhappy with how long it took us to get it.

Nice staff. Good food. Could use better lighting. Couldn't really see much of what was on my plate.

The best Lambajin I've had in my life! Not stingy with the toppings at all. My friend had the chicken kebab platter and it was delicious, it came with baba ganoush, salad and huge homemade pita bread. This place is very affordable and our server Eta was a sweetheart. Will definitely go back!
No comment
No comment

On this beautiful sunny day my friend wanted to sit outside for dindin, so a quick Yelp search lead me to Black Iris. The seating was spacious and I was quickly seated. We got the salad platter and chicken kebab entree and an extra pita which we ended up not finishing because there was so much food (When does that ever happen??)! When the weather took a turn we asked to be seated inside and the waitress happily changed our seats. The pita and salads were super tasty, but the chicken was a bit dry. Will definitely come back for more bites.

We had our dog with us and were looking for a restaurant with outdoor seating. This one had space and a well priced menu. The food was really good! We got the combo apps with various dips and salads, lentil soup, chicken kabob and lamb pitza (like pizza). It was great and very cheap. The waitresses were beyond friendly and were very kind to our dog. They stopped by often to check on us and gave us free dessert. A gem in the neighborhood! It's cash only and byob.

Great food and a great place to eat dinner when its sunny out. The only complain was that it was long to get our waiter attention. Other than that the food was really good and I highly recommend this place to anyone who wants to try middle eastern food!
No comment
Ugh cheap food, very bland and overpriced. No beer or wine selection to speak of. Disappointing
No comment
This place is nice and simple . You can bring your on vine , and they don't charge for it. Very friendly staff.

I adore this place. I always order the labana, baba ganoush, spinach pie, zatar bread and hummus. Literally 40 bucks with tip for a huge amount of food for two people. Also, the baba ganoush is smoky and delicious. BYOB!
Nice place. Good portions and the food was good. I had the chicken with rice and it was delicious and the babaghanouj is something you should definetly try as an appetiser.
No comment
No comment
Chicken Ouzi was amazing. Hot and crusty and perfectly cooked. My loomi spilled in the bag but I'm not mad. This was well worth the wait. Ordered on grub hub.
No comment
No comment

This is one of my favorite restaurants on DeKalb that I've been going to for...at least a decade?!  The food is delicious and feels fresh and healthy. I'm a meat eater, so I love the lamb shish kebab, but my vegetarian friend is also aways thrilled to go there because she has lots of options on the menu too. She always gets the Assorted Plate which is tasty huge!  The inside is spacious with beautiful middle Eastern decor and ample seating. In the summer there is street seating and outdoor service.  Wait staff is very friendly and they bring you glasses for your BYOB. Wine shop is right across the street. This place truly is a gem in a sea of overly trendy overpriced "hot spots." Don't ever change and don't ever leave us!
Simple and straight forward middle eastern in a corner restaurant. Outside seating makes for good people watching in Brooklyn. Wine store across the street has a terrific selection for BYOB!
Got delivery through Uber Eats. Flavorless hummus. Chicken was the consistency of rubber.

Been ordering delicious food from Black Iris for years. Excellent pitza, zaater, and hummus! Interesting selection of Middle Eastern beverages as well. This place is basically my go-to comfort food now.

They have the best Middle Eastern food ever. One of the day we placed seamless order, but the place unfortunately closed down early and the order was cancelled. Surprisingly next day Manager Adam sends a text apologizing for the inconvenience and offered us the same seamless order for free. I generally love the food from here but now they have a special place in my heart for being kind.
No comment
This place is great for a bang for your buck. Everyone across dietary restrictitions was able to fine something they were satisfied with. The service was attentive and the food very filling.

Tired spot. Falling apart. Service is at borderline of takeout - ie you would better off ordering at the counter and getting your own water. But at least it is empty and there is no wait. Falafels and such are AOK.
No comment

Came here for lunch and seeing it said byob, I gave it a try. I ordered the lamb pizza and it was soggy and sour. Let's just say I had better. Also tried their lemon pita which also sucked.  I got the check and the waiter failed to tell me there was a $5 corking fee and it was on the menu but I never saw it. Whatever menu he gave me certainly wasn't on there. So I stopped arguing with him and let it go and I paid the bill, and will definitely never come here again.

Decent basic Turkish / Mediterranean food. You know what you're getting - warm crispy pita, hummus, a generous portion of green salad and a chunk of meat, in my case merguez (lamb sausage) for about $15.

Black Iris is basic Mediterranean. Nothing will knock your socks off there, but it is ok, if you're just looking for 'ok.' I've had a few very disappointing deliveries of their pitzas, maybe they just don't deliver well.

literally no idea how this place has such great reviews. ordered everything -- falafel, the cigar, the spanikopita/spinach pie, the schwarma. ALL TERRIBLE. the rice wasn't even good.
Excellent lamb..not the shish kabob but their whole cooked lamb these people know how to.please the palette. Quaint little corner spot. Fair prices and decent service. Oh my gawd just try the lamb.

The worst service I've ever had. We waited over an hour for our food. Had to remind our waitress for everything we ordered more than once. Had to ask for silverware. Had to ask for napkins. Food was mediocre - not worth the wait.
Cheap and easy neighborhood joint, not particularly great but gets the job done. Actively bad falafel in my opinion - too fried and dry, with virtually no seasoning.
No comment
The leg of lamb shawarma is amazing. Please get it with hot sauce. The service was pretty quick and the staff is very helpful. Try the lamb pitza as well, dont forget to put cheese on it.

You have to try the chicken pizza it's out of this world walk in just before closing and I was treated very well by the nice staff I was very pleased by the service and staff definitely will be returning

My fav Egyptian spot in NY. Their plates are great, and the signature Egyptian pizza Black Iris is off the wall. I'd usually bring drinks from nearby delis since they don't serve alcohols.
Really great spot. The food was delicious and the drinks were too. Casual yet comfortable. Good prices. Recommended!
No comment

Very good food, very affordable, and always has spots available out front on the patio. I come here all the time when I don't feel like cooking, or to eat and drink a few bottles of byob wine before going out.

This is a delightful little place for eat-in or take out. The food is freshly made to order and authentic. It is a terrific place for a casual meal. We had chicken kabobs which were tasty but a bit dry and a merguez plate that was delicious.

I've liked almost everything, but pretty expensive! The chicken is amazing and the white sauce that comes with it is deeeelish. Falafels are pretty good, but some of the salads from the five-salad platter were weird. The best one was definitely the hummus. Black iris salad is tasty too. The guy on the phone recommended the chickpea and spinach salad with tomato sauce and I thought it was bland and gross. Rice could use more flavor. Delivery guy was pretty fast though and overall like the food.
The most amazing pita bread I have ever had! The ingredients are fresh and delicious! This is a standout in the neighborhood

I don't like BYOB and I don't like cash only, now that I got that out of my system lets talk about the food. The peta is good, eat lots of it. The soup tasted like any run of the mill lentil soup. The pizza is a pitta turned pizza, not bad. They skimped out big time on the hummus. I saw a very active microwave in the kitchen, I hope that was just the chef warming up his own food.
It was very difficult to find delicious and cheap Mediterranean style food in Bed-Stuy until Black Iris came about. The babganoush is stellar.

Great neighborhood staple.  Food is fresh, perfectly seasoned, and expertly prepared.  I eat or order in from this place weekly- happy every time.  Also it's a great deal for the quality of the food. The only thing I would change would be crispier falafel. One of the only affordable BYOB places around with truly high quality eats. Love this place.
Love black iris, order from them a lot. Their hummus is awesome, some of the best I've ever had. The food is always prepared quickly and ready when I go to pick it up. It's cash only so you know.

Called Seamless who got in touch with the restaurant and they told Seamless that I was outside their delivery area. The nerve - they *accepted my order and took my money* and had me waiting for food that would never arrive all because they claim I was outside the window, but of course I wasn't because they show up for me on Seamless. Great value, BYOB, and you gotta try the spinach and cheese pie. Big fan of this place.

One of my favorite Mediterranean spots in Brooklyn. The service is amazing, food is delicious and most of all price is fair. It's a small place and on the corner so you can't miss it. Only complaint is that most places don't charge for pita bread but this place does not that it matters. Order the assorted salad plate which is totally worth it and the shish kabob is absolutely amazing.

I think the food here is good We had the garlic bread lentil soup chicken gyro and lambajin pitzaa all are good.   BYOB on beer and wine which rocks only thing is that the decor is dated and drab.  I would come for take out or if I wanted a quick place to down a beer with some tasty middle eastern food.

Great food and service! I've ordered from them on Seamless before but never eaten at their restaurant. They have a good outdoor space and are BYOB!

Delicious falafel platter with babaganouj, grape leaves and lentil soup! I'm  Lebanese and grew up with these foods and Black Iris really accomplished an authentic, appealing and filling meal, loved it!

Delicious! Got the lamb sausage, beet salad and thyme pita to share. They have big portions. I really like the food and the service is great on a weekday! One of the few restaurants open in a Monday night.

Love this place. I always get their combo of 5 side dishes and an entree to split with whoever I'm there with. Good portions, good food, good price.

Sub-mediocre food, though the service was pleasant enough. I had the stuffed grape leaves with yogurt sauce and falafel platter with hummus and a salad. The only half way enjoyable thing was the falafel, which wasn't all that good.

The lamb pizza (lambajin) can be salty but it's what keeps me coming back.  I personally like the chicken and scallion pizza (no cheese on it) b/c it's so fresh and clean tasting. the shrimp pizza is a little too garlicky for me. The olive (black iris) pizza can be really really salty (stopped getting that). the loomi (tea) is really good. and the service has usually been top-notch. the 1st time i went the guy let me have a free loomi just to try it. FYI it's cash only.

I ordered the chicken kabob platter w hummus for delivery. The packing and service (person who took my order & delivery man) was good but the food was very bland and did not taste good at all. The texture of the chicken was rubbery which made it very unappetizing and the hummus had no flavor.

I'm starting to wonder if they just had an off night because there are so many people on here that are saying how great this place was. I would say it was mediocre at best. The food really was not that good. Service was ok. Prices and portions were good for area, but it is cash only. There are so many better middle eastern places in Brooklyn... I would just say skip this place.

I really like their food especially the Lambajin! Soooo gooddddd. The hummus could use a bit more flavor but it's decent. It's very clean and the waiter was sooo nice and friendly. I would most definitely recommend this place to someone, also the chicken gyro was really good.

Not sure why this place gets such good reviews. Got take out from here, lamb kabobs were way chewy and too salty, chicken kabobs were rubbery and bland and the hummus was bland as well. The salad was decent, but that's kinda hard to screw up. Good flatbread, I will give them that. For the price we paid, should have been much better though. Get the same type of food but better for the same prices at nearby zaytoons.

The food was delicious and we got excellent service. My date was having tea so the server brought me one too! I had those ground lamb kebabs with double salad. the meat was moist, delicious and perfectly seasoned. They must have had some extra baked goods in the back because our server brought us complimentary dessert.

I'm not familiar with Middle Eastern food, but I like an adventure. Black Iris is a treat. I ordered falafel with rice and a salad. The food is seasoned nicely and delicious. My waitress was pleasant and attentive. The only complaint is there wasn't any heat in the restaurant. I sat with my coat on. Would I visit again for another dish? Absolutely!

Things are hit or miss at this place. I recently ordered a falafel platter with tabouli on the side. The falafel was super dry and not like any falafel I've ever had. The tabouli wasn't really tabouli just chunks of tomato on top of dry parsley, bulgur and scallion.
