Ordered the shish kebab with babaganouj and salad and pita. Everything was fantastic. The shish kebab tasted smoked perfectly, and the babaganouj was creamy.
No comment

My dumb friend and dumb self stopped in here for dinner on our way to a show last night. It was pouring rain outside. We parked a mile away and forgot essentials like jackets and umbrellas (see why we're dumb?) On a mission for falafel, we walked in soaked. We were greeted quickly with a "poor idiots" look, and sat down. With our menus came a stack of napkins and some hot tea to help bring us back to normal operating temperature. Super nice gesture by the staff, who really were very kind and attentive. We started with hummus (great) and pita (fresh-baked!!). My falafel was excellent, and dummy friend said the same of his chicken gyro. I would absolutely go back if I'm in the neighborhood.

I get takeout falafel from here at least once a week and it's absolutely delicious.  I must agree with another poster that the falafel is also easy to eat because of the way it's wrapped.  And did I mention that it's delicious?  Well, it is.  Delicious.

5stars for an amazing restaurant.  My high school alma mater is around there and for years I've always seen this place, but never went in.  Man, I had no idea what I was missing.  Bring your own wine is pretty cool.  But the food....absolutely delicious. The chicken, lamb and sausage are all perfectly cooked and juicy.  Go and try for yourself

Maybe it's just me... I used to work at a lebanese restaurant that was transcendent...but I've tried this place twice several months apart and have been really disappointed by their food. The hummus is creamy and smooth but it lacks something...oh right, taste. The tabouli was equally zingless. The spinach pie had mozzarella??!! in it. I don't get why this place gets so many stars. The food is bland and completely unauthentic. keep walking.

It actually blows my mind that anyone thinks the food here is good. I ordered the falafel and hummus. The hummus had NO taste. I mean it didn't even taste like chickpeas. And the falafel also had NO taste. I'm actually so blown because this is literally the blandest food I have ever had.
The best! I go to sleep every night dreaming of their mezze platter. the labaneh, the tabouleh, the hummus. . . zzzzzzzz
No comment

I can't believe I haven't reviewed this place yet, I've eaten their food so many times. To me, this is some of the best Middle Eastern I've had in New York, DEFINITELY one of the best bargains. The falafel sandwich is amazing, and it's gigantic. It's also $5. The platters are fantastic, especially the veggie and chicken kebabs, and the hummus, ohhhh the hummus, and the babaghanouj, both amazing. I have yet to try the pitzas, that's next on my list, if I can manage to tear myself away from the falafel that is...If your choice is between Black Iris and Zaytoons around the corner, well I think you know where I stand. Grab a bottle of wine from the shop down the street, and dig in.

This place is awesome! The atmosphere is very mellow and the food is phenomenal. This is a great place to go to BYO drinks and order tons of apps and just eat with people you like. They also have great falafels!  The babaganoush is to die for.  They make their pitas fresh to order and they usually come out to you as a huge heat pocket!  This is hands down my favorite Mediterranean place!

Great place for take out/delivery. Or as I am sure people have written already it's BYOB which is a bonus for eating there. The house-made flat bread and hummus are quite good. Also there is this crazy pizza-like appetizer called Zatter Bread (pita topped with olive oil sesame seeds and thyme) which is worth checking out. The falafel leaves a little bit to be desired, otherwise it's pretty solid place oh and cheap!

This place is good. The service is excellent the food is ok, not the best Mediterranean food I've had but gets the job done. It is also BYOB which is a plus if you want to have an affordable evening out.

The Black Iris pitza is amazingly wonderful!  I became addicted to it while living in Ft. Greene, but now that I live in Greenpoint I often find myself riding the G train to satisfy my Black Iris cravings.  The dolmas are delicious as well ... even the small order is ridiculously large.  Also, since Black Iris is BYOB, it's wonderful to be able to pick up a bottle of wine at nearby shops like the Greene Grape or Thirst.  The service is incredibly friendly and the prices are reasonable ... I love this spot :)
My favorite place with toddler, we often order black iris to fort greene park for an easy picnic. Healthful and well priced and fresh. I love this place.
Amazing lunch. Pita and dips were to die for. I crave it now, will be making this an often go-to spot!
Absolute best restaurant ever. BYOB, great food, and fantastic/friendly service. The pita bread is BEYOND. Will come back many times.

This is one of those restaurants that is always suspiciously empty.  Sunday through Saturday any table in the house is yours.  When I first moved to Fort Greene, I could not figure out how a place with such good, solid falafel, hummus, babaganough and lentil soup wasn't more popular.    (Especially since it's located on what has quickly become a strip of expensive restaurants on Dekalb Avenue.) Then I found out that everyone orders take out! If you're on Dekalb and just want a relaxed, inexpensive, tasty meal, stop by and actually use their tables.

I've gotten takeout and eaten in there a few times now. While the waitstaff is friendly and it is BYOB, I've never been really turned on by the food. Also, the takeout tends to be not great. I wasn't going to mention Zaytoons, but I have to disagree and say that they are waaaayyyy better, except in the falafel area, I concede that the sandwich is pretty kick-ass. I go here for middle eastern only when I can't get people over to my side of the neighborhood for Zaytoons.
Black Iris eats Zaytoon's for breakfast.  Sorry to say it, but that's just the way it is.

Black Iris is a great place for a simple meal that isn't greasy diner food, pizza, or take out Chinese. The menu features middle eastern items such as hummus, falafel, chicken gyros, lamb kebabs, etc. They have these really awesome pitzas which are pizza but on a pita. The regular pitas come out all puffed and I actually almost burned myself from the steam that was inside. I said the place felt like you were in a family pizza joint, and my roommate said, no its a cross between a family pizza joint and an actual restaurant. con would be... hummus is not the best I have ever had, but not bad.
No comment

The waitstaff here is so friendly, nice and pleasant.  It makes every visit so special.  The food is good and big portions as well.  I really enjoy their pita bread.  It is warm and fresh and oh so good.

Went for takeaway, and as I waited for my lentil and bulgur and chicken kebab sandwich, I was brought a deliciously warm cup of mint tea. This was a complete surprise and has made me a loyal customer. Such a simple gesture on a frigid winter night was very much appreciated.

We've been here a number of times, this is our neighborhood go to spot for delicious, reliable food at great prices (for Brooklyn), quick service, plus it's BYOB. Love their meat platter! Chicken kebob is always super moist and juicy, and merguez is delicious and just the right amount of spice. They always have fast, friendly service. Definitely recommend for a casual, low-key, affordable dinner in Fort Greene.
Unremarkable. A second star for being Mediterranean, but it's really rather subpar.

Black Iris is an understated little gem - it is delightfully casual (I prefer the back tables for two--  the dining room is dimly let and you can sit adjacent to each other on comfortable cushions), amazingly cheap, and very tasty. What Black Iris lacks in ambiance, it makes up for with dim lights, a few colorful cushions, and excellent food.  Start with the beet salad -- true, it's just a plate of amazingly flavorful marinated beets, but I guarantee even if you already love beets, you'll fall in love with them again after a plate of this salad.  And if you're anti-beets, this might just change your mind.  And then have a pitzaa - I prefer the "green" pitza (scallions, leeks, fenugreek, mozzarella), but I can also recommend the amazing dairy free chicken, peppers, parsley, garlic.  Dinner for two (with half a pitzaa worth of leftovers) came to $27.

I really love this place (the food is tasty and byob is awesome), but I had a super disappointing experience tonight. My boyfriend and I were out for a date, and the appetizer was great as per usual. However, we noticed the couple behind us receive plates that looked suspiciously like our entree. The gentleman started cutting into a piece of chicken when the waitress rushed over with another plate. She told him that she had brought the wrong order and took away the initial plate. Not two minutes later, she brings out our food, with the chicken on a different plate. We asked her if the chicken was the dish that had just been left with the other table and that the other table had touched. She said "no, that chicken was on a square plate, this one is on a circular plate."  My boyfriend decided to try a piece, and it was cold. It was obviously the same food on a new plate. We asked to speak to a manager, and he said it was a different plate, then said that the waitress had told him that it hadn't been touched. They were obviously lying and gave us a bit of a hard time about the situation. Eventually they did remake his order (or maybe just reheated even?), and it was good. However they didn't even discount the check after all of the nonsense. It was incredibly gross and inappropriate. Unfortunately we won't be back.
No comment
Huge plate of healthy and delicious salads for $9. With byob wine, $15 out the door. Plus leftovers. Mmmm.
This rating is based solely on their lambajin pitza, which I've had delivered to work.  It's freaking delicious.
Delivery and Eat-in - Both great! The food is good and fresh, cheap and the service is outstanding!!! The falafel is lacking a bit but all-in-all I am a very pleased customer!
Great delivery option in the area. Absolutely addictive chicken gyro pizzas and platters, at low, low prices.

By far the best midddle eastern food in BK, plus it's byob, and cheap! The guy who runs the joint is insanely friendly and after your dined in once, he'll wave at you if he sees you walk by on the sidewalk. In the warmer months you can grab a table outside and enjoy the passers by in Ft. Greene. Black iris pizza is the best thing on the menu which says a lot because the shiskabab is supper yummy too. Yumtown for sure.
No comment

Had a great meal with my family here last weekend. I have a two year old and both the food and the atmosphere was kid friendly. I was a little skeptical at first b/c the restaurant had a B rating, but we were hungry and everything in the neighborhood was packed. I've hard better hummus but there pita and garlic pita was yummy in its own. My husband got the lamb and I got the chicken pita. Both were delicious. The service was friendly and efficient. I would definitely come back.

Earned every one of these stars...I used to be a super Zaytoon's head but now Black Iris has won my heart. The food is always bangin. My only complaint is that they don't deliver to Bed Stuy, boo hoo.

Great spot that I frequent maybe too frequently. Everything is fresh and perfectly prepared. Service and staff is always super friendly. BYOB, just makes it that much better. Make sure you have cash as they do not accept credit card.

In a neiborhood with mostly mediocre food, this place is reliable..it wont' blow your mind but it's fresh, conistent, and the food is made with care. I usually get the veggie pizza and mixed appitizer salad...and they make their own hot sauce. solid place.

Lebanese restaurant with great vegetarian and carnivore options. Their salad platter is amazing!!! You get to choose 6 salads and it comes with fresh baked hot pita. I always pick the baba ganoush tabbouleh, fava beans, spinach and chick peas and potato salad but I've had every option and they're all very flavorful and very good. I'm not a big meat eater but I've tried their lamb sandwich and it's really tasty. The mint yogurt sauce puts it over the top. My boyfriend is a big meat eater and that's one of his favorite things to get in this neighborhood. Their Mediterranean style pizzas are good too. The fennel/fenugreek is my fave. I had the chicken wrap here once and I didn't like it but they were happy to exchange it for something else on the menu. I got the falafel instead and it was amazing!!! Must've just been a bad one off meal because I've had their chicken and almond dish before and I enjoyed it. The staff is always friendly and accommodating. And they make great Turkish coffee too!!!
No comment

This place was great- had food opps for all. It was BYOB (in the city?!) which was great as well. We got the Pita pizza with veggies, no cheese- so freakin good! Also tried the veggie kebab? OMGOSH it was so good- never have I had such good grilled onions... they were amazing. I could have eaten a whole plate of onions only and been satisfied- sounds silly, but they were THAT good. Cute little dark divey place. Great hummus, yummy HUGE house salads. Everyone was pleased. Food great, Bill was amazing (thought it was wrong because so cheap!) and service was GREAT. Definitely come back here.

I finally decided to try their food yesterday and I'm glad I did. Their serving portions are big. I ordered the chicken kebob and loved the char the chicken had.  Only downfall was their baklava. I've had better, it was drizzled with enough honey.
Gotta love the BYOB aspect, the food is very tasty and they give you a ton! Price is definitely reasonable as well. It's super casual inside, don't expect any fancy decor.
Nothing was bad, but have had much better Labneh and Hummus. Service was really friendly. May go back, but wouldn't go out of my way.
No comment
The decor is homey and authentic. The food is good. The couscous is a must try. The service is slow though.

The entrees are large and filling, making it a great value for the neighborhood.  The staff is friendly and especially warm to regulars.  The babaganoush is creamy and not heavy in tahini, a common flavor misstep.  And the hummus is smooth and delicious.  Try the lamb or chicken dishes, which come with freshly puffed pita, perfect for dipping.  The side of rice looks deceptively plain but is wonderfully flavorful.  Desserts are the usual sticky honey nutty confections, but can be cut with a piping hot glass of mint tea.

Black Iris has become our go-to spot for quick, tasty, and reasonably healthy dinner.  I always get the chicken kebab and baba ghanouj, and it comes with fresh pita and a tasty salad with pickles & olives.  There is always way more than I can eat, and the place is BYO.  It's a great deal.

Labne is AMAZING, served with thin delicious pita.  Thick, creamy, tangy, served with an olive in the middle and a slice of lime. I was so full from the rest of the delectable yet affordable meal that I took most of the labne for lunch the next day. For the main course I had delicious vegetarian lentil soup. It's BYOB and on a Sunday night there were some couples, some small groups of friends.. definitely a place to go with just one or two other people. Nice dark Middle Eastern décor, a very jolly and attentive waiter. The menu reprints reviews that claims it's the best in Fort Greene - or Brooklyn?-- and it may be.

Assorted plate! Five choices! Get the most bang for your buck! The potatoes, grape leaves, and lentil and bulgur are amazing and delicious. The baba ghanouj is some of the most flavorful I've had anywhere. The only disappointment is the hummus. Really bland. The pita is amazingly fluffy and large. Overall, it's really good stuff. They would give my favorite place (Fatoosh over in Brooklyn Heights) a run for their money if they simply had better hummus! Delivery is lightening fast as well. Prices are amazing. Really, go there now.
Delicious. A little pricier than other places with the same quality of food but I'm guessing the little extra you pay is for the vibe...
No comment

It's my favorite take-out falafel place. I'm particularly addicted to the falafel sandwich and the lentil soup, and they are super gracious about not using plastic bags and reducing take-out waste. Prices are very very good.

I've been coming here for years.  The servers are always very sweet, very attentive, and really helpful.  Homemade pita, delicious stuffed grape leaves, ginormous spinach and cheese pies, excellent hummus, lamb pizza...can't really go wrong.  It's cheap, big portions, and BYOB.  Great for an easy weekday night meal.

Very inexpensive and everything I tried was excellent. Has a relaxed vibe to it. Fresh baked pitas, metz, merguez, kebabs, everything was great. Muy favourite though was the lamb pizza was divine!  I will visit that place just to get the pizza!! Loved heaing Arabic music playing in the background!

GREAT lamp chops, the meat and fat were practically melting off the bone in the most amazing way. Staff was friendly and gave us cold tea on the house. Very chill place, definitely the perfect food to try on a hot summer day in Brooklyn. Stuffed grape leaf appetizer is a sure thing!
Great restaurant, and wonderful service. I was there recently and the waiter gave my friend and I complimentary dessert! Fast delivery, too.

I get the falafel sandwich all the time. It's filling and tasty and at $4.75 it's tough to beat as a lunch option on those day when you really need something substantial. The guys in the kitchen who work the take out are super nice. They are always pleasant and appreciative. The hot sauce is the bomb.
No comment
This food is amazing. It is some of the best Middle Eastern food in NY, and I have been to a few places in Manhattan and Brooklyn, and this is by far the best.  And the prices are reasonable.

Came here with a group of co-workers and friends for a nice Friday night dinner. There isn't a whole lot of seating, but the five of us got seated right away. Also, good to know that they're cash only right away, and have an ATM right by the front door -- very convenient! We came on a  night where they were particularly slammed, and the very kind waiter informed us of this fact right away. As a result, our food came in strange spurts, but always with a smile and an apology. We brought our own wine, which tided us over in the meantime. We got the zataar bread (to DIE for!), and the five-dip sampler (hummus, tabouleh, beet salad, baba ganoush and pinto beans). Absolutely incredible, and more than enough for the five of us to share. Sadly, they couldn't coordinate our pita bread to come out at the same time, so we used the crusts of our pitzas (also incredibly delicious, especially the Green pitza). However, our waiter kindly comped us an extra plate of baba and hummus when our pita bread did come. We also got kebabs and gyros, which were delicious and very easy to split. After all that, it only came out to 18 bucks a person. We were all completely satisfied, to the point of bursting! It's been a long time since I've been to a restaurant where every single item was so delicious. Can't wait to come back and try even more.
No comment
No comment

So we drove in from Long Island to the Brooklyn Flea (market), which, by the way was very interesting and fun.  After two hours, we were hungry and we decided to try the Black Iris for a little lunch.  Nice atmosphere, good view of the streets of Fort Greene.  The bathroom was fairly clean (Dr. Oz says to always look at that).  The food was massive and fresh. Big portions and the green tea was unsweetened and minty.  The server couldn't have been nicer or more helpful and the owner was friendly and appeared concerned about our well being.  The semolina cake sample was good, although a tad stale in my opinion.  Prices: quite reasonable. Will definitely include this on the list of "go there again and bring some friends or family" places.
No comment
Great place. The food is excellent, the service is always delightful and the atmosphere is relaxing (nice street view/low lighting). The only complaint I have is that they don't take credit cards.
No comment

AMAZING. I was born and raised in the Middle East and this food is authentic! The lamb gyro/sandwich is delicious, flavorful and huge. The zatar and labnah were perfect, just like home. The meat platter dish was well cooked and properly seasoned. Loved the grape leaves. The mint tea was on point. Service is quick, staff pleasant, and decor cute. Love the atmosphere, middle eastern music at the right volume for conversation and lighting perfect for a date. I have gone here multiple times and plan to return. It is the best middle eastern food I've had in the whole city!

Came here on Halloween and they were slammed.  People were waiting over an hour for tables and the take-out was quoting 25-30 mins for orders to be ready.  We put in our togo order at the window and walked around the neighborhood enjoying the crazy shenanigans going on up and down the street.  Costumes everywhere, people celebrating their first day out of the house post Hurricane Sandy.  It was really nice to see the little ones out trick or treating despite all of the halloween parade cancellations.    We gave the restaurant our cell number so they could call us when we should circle back to pick up our order.  They never called but we went back in right on time and it was ready.  When we got home our food was subpar.  We got the chicken kabob platter and the lamb platter which each came with some lettuce tomato and tzatki and one choice of side.  Both of the meats were overly dry and flavorless.  I just felt like for over $30 for take out I could have actually enjoyed my meal.  Ended up throwing half out since it was so inedible, I never ever do this, and was looking forward to taking the leftover in for lunch.  I can only imaging how tough it would have been on a reheat!!!  I hope this place is much better when its not so slammed or when you dine in.  (Perhaps a little byob action could have helped me wash down the bland platter with more of a happy face on....hope so!)

Black Iris has excellent Middle Eastern food and a menu that includes some unusual options. I usually end up getting the five salads platter when I go. The chick peas with spinach is delicious and their baba is great. The pita is made to order and is amazing. I have also tried some other dishes here - the spinach pie is good and HUGE (it's like a full meal by itself and is only $4). When I have gotten entrees, the portions have always been more than I can finish. The first time I went and on one subsequent visit, I got the Pastilla (I don't think this is how it's spelled on the menu - it's a Moroccan dish that is chicken (or pigeon) with almonds in puff pastry topped with cinnamon and powdered sugar). I had only ever had this dish in Morocco. The one at Black Iris was good, though a little too sweet and much more than I could eat. To get the most out of your visit, I recommend going with a group and sharing a bunch of things. One other nice thing about Black Iris - it's BYOB, so you can bring a nice bottle of wine to enjoy with your meal and not spend a lot. Sadly, there are no wine stores in the immediate neighborhood, so you have to plan ahead. Or bring beer!
If you want an amazing meal and want to save money with byob Black Iris is the place. Service is awesome, and delivery is stupendously fast...make sure if you bring liquor to tip well!

I struggled with the star rating that I gave...after reading reviews I just knew that this was gonna be a 4/5 star review..but they came up short...now maybe i feel this way becuase i am sold out to addicted to the point where i am taking apps for a sponsor..hooked on maoz! First off the plus' the pita was great warm and chewy, T&L was fresh, my problem was with the tahini and the fafael itself....the tahini was horrible...no flavor, watery, wrong color, it was just a mess! the falafel balls were soggy..not crisp and very bland in taste. I also ordered the blakava...eh...it was just okay..nothing to write home about! I must say my waiter was very friendly and gave me a comp. cup of hot tea..which hit the spot cause it was COLD outside. Being that is in my neighborhood I will mos def go back so that i can sample the pizza and dinner entrees. all in all..as of now i give the place a 2.5..i mean the tahini and falafel are the most important components to the wrap.

This place has become my standard of excellence for Middle Eastern/ Mediterranean food. Huge portions and it's all delicious. After going there two or three times I already felt like family-- the entire staff is very warm and friendly. And they don't have drinks here, but they are all about BYOB. One summer day when my boyfriend and I were eating outside, we ended up finishing our beers for about an hour after we finished our meal and the waiter was totally awesome about it.

I came here for a friend's birthday a while ago, and was a bit disappointed. The food was great, and definitely worth the prices--but the server didn't pay much attention to us, brought us the wrong drinks, and when I asked to have the rest of my food wrapped up it never returned to the table.
No comment

For lunch I ordered the chicken kebaob and my dad ordered the leg of lamb.  The chicken was okay, but the lamb was very dry, under seasoned, and the portion was meager (two or three anemic slices).  The salad that accompanied both entrees was good, but this was a very disappointing meal.

This is our go-to place. We order from them about once a week, and they have never disappointed. Not once. Shish kebab, felafel, grape leaves, chicken orzo, merguez, pitzas: All excellent. Plus the guys who run the joint are great. We even had our wedding rehearsal dinner here, our guests loved it. Can't say enough nice things about Black Iris.
solid food. my  go to middle eastern. fresh. delicious. has never let me down.

I had the best time here last weekend. The staff was so friendly and really attentive. The food was delicious. I highly recommend the lentil soup and the garlic pita bread. The best part it's BYOB. It's great for dinner with friends, or for date night. Can't wait to go back!
Tasty food, big portion, and cheap. Plus BYOB! Good deal.

Read some reviews and in my mind was rolling the dice. I definitely did not win. My buddy and I ordered the shish kabob platter with baba and a falafel sandwich. The delivery arrived promptly (about 30 mins) and we paid up. I noticed they charged me $2 for delivery, where it clearly states free delivery on the supplied take out menu.....insulting much? To their gracious credit they provided us with a free falafel platter and soda, in addition to our order. Wow thats a pleasent surprise! The falafel sandiwch and platter were good, not great or anywhere close to the best ive had. The falafels were still quite crisp and had pretty good flavor. The salad was ok, but the olives were tiny. The baba that came with the shish kabob platter was horrible. Literally if you think this even resembles real baba ghanouj, i feel sorry for your taste buds. The hummos was marginally better, edible at least. The shish kabob was decent, edible, but I wouldnt order it again. The pita was warm and chewy, and had crispy parts in the center from the baking....quite delicious, especially when its wrapped around a falafel sandwich. All in all pretty dissapointing, but the falafel sandwich around their homeade pita, could make me order it
Delicious food and extremely friendly staff. Their fresh pita is amazing and so is their hummus. Everything I've ordered here was delicious!
Fresh and tasty.  The lentil and bulgar salad is great with some olive oil and pita fresh out of the oven.   Lentil soup is awesome... One of my favorite places.  Wish they served brunch.

Black Iris is the best MIddle Eastern food in Ft. Greene.  I usually eat vegetarian here so that is what I am commenting on.  The assorted salads and the garden salad are always fresh and tasty.  The pita is home made which is a must since I despise store-bought pitas.  The hummus is very good and I always get the spinach-cheese pie.  The atmosphere is quite casual, but the staff is friendly, especially Medhet the waiter.  The staff is very welcoming and I have stayed here for hours talking without any prerssure to leave.  You can't beat the prices here and it's BYOB.  Eat-in is quite an improvement over the take-out, but it's doable.

Cheap, fresh food with a BYOB policy and friendly service. We really enjoyed our time in the restaurant, but a few dishes were disappointing, namely the lamb sausage (my date said it was too dry) and the hummus and babaghanouj which tasted strange and unappetizing. The 10" veggie pizza was enough for 2 people and very flavorful, though overly cheesy. The grape leaves and philo roll appetizers were the best part of the meal - both were delicious and came in surprisingly large portions. If I lived in the neighborhood, I would definitely come here often w/ a bottle of wine.

Yes, food is great plus BYOB- I'm just echoing others' comments.  Let's talk intangibles.  My wife and I have been going to Black Iris since '04.  Two kids later and it's still our go to place- either with or w/out the boys.

Terrific Middle Eastern cuisine in the Neighborhood. I can't recall the name of the Manager there but he is very generous and super friendly. The pita is soft, the hummus is tasty and the Kebab meats are juicy. I love this place!
Best mediterranean food in the upper Brooklyn neighborhoods that I've tried. Very reasonably priced, and super friendly staff.

Wish this restaurant was in my neighborhood in Manhattan, I'd stop in weekly.  Kid friendly.  Shared apps with my friend, very fresh tasting, and I had the Merguez spicy lamb sausage, with onion, garlic and special seasoning with rice and salad.  Didn't have big expectations, but I am still thinking about how tender and delicious that sausage was.

I was there a couple weeks ago and the food is delicious. I accidentally ate the chicken, assuming it was halal. I found it later on that it wasn't. The lamb is halal, only. Anyway, the food is great. The service is great. I totally recommend it.

Their lamb pizza is so so delicious, as well as their hummus, which is served with their homemade pita. I also love their chicken gyro platter, and the vegetable pizza. Overall, I appreciate the consistency in their food quality, the affordability, and the always friendly smiles I get when I walk in. One last big plus: it's BYOB!
I used to like this place.  Too bad I found hundreds of tiny  roaches crawling all over the table!  But, what did I expect anyway.....it always looks filthy.

Delicious food, very reasonable prices and really nice atmosphere. Our waiter was very nice too. We had lambajin (sp?) as an appetizer to share, chicken kabob and shish kabob. This was more than enough food. I think we would have been ok with just one entree.
this is one of my favorite restaurants and a place i've been going for years - the food is great, the atmosphere is warm, and the staff is awesome. dine-in and delivery are both super reliable.

excellent food, excellent service. byob always nice. cozy atmosphere.  chicken and lamb melts in your mouth.  try their pitzzas.  will definitely be back.   check it out.  i know what i'm talking about
nom nom nom! affordable and solidly delicious middle eastern food that comes in big portions. excellent for the neighborhood.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Went here last night and were sadly disappointed, because the restaurant had so many good reviews. I'll start with the positives: the restaurant is thoughtfully decorated and the staff was wonderful. The negatives: unfortunately the food was not good. I don't like to write a bad review, but the food had little flavor and I'm not sure what it was trying to be. I thought I had had Moroccan food before, but "Chinese" frozen vegetables, on top of super soft couscous and over cooked dry chicken was just odd. The lamb shank was on top of mashed potatoes? It's possible I am clueless about Moroccan food or my expectations were too high.

Yep, 5 stars. Wow - first, the restaurant smelled a-maz-ing! Secondly, the were busy but our server rocked: taking the time to answer our questions and was on top of keeping our liquids flowing during our entire time there. Finally, highly recommend any of tangines, although they're not served with that cute little dome!

Delicious Moroccan fare, so happy Tara Kitchen opened in the neighborhood.  The lamb tangine with honey, prunes, apricots and toasted almonds was the perfect mix of savory and slightly sweet.  I generally do not eat prunes, but I love them in a lamb tangine.  My husband had the lamb tangine with chickpeas, parsley chermoula and tomato jam.  Also delicious but with a bit more heat due to the spices.  As a starter we split the cigars (ground lamb in crispy phyllo dough).  The tagines are accompanied by rice and pita.
No comment

Stopped for lunch a few weeks ago. Food was very good and ambiance was nice and cozy. Prices very reasonable too. Staff were friendly and waiter helpful with dish recommendations. Service was a tad slow but perhaps due to being fairly new. Would recommend and try again.

The best moroccan in NYC! This was an amazing experience -- the flavors were rich, nuanced, unique, the decor and plating just reminded you that you were in store for something special.  We ordered the tagines, which may seem slightly expensive, but are well worth it.  The lamb tagine was especially good!
No comment
No comment

I am always looking for new spots to try and came across Tara Kitchen, which is very close to my office. I went with coworkers for lunch today, and we really enjoyed our time there! Not only is the restaurant beautifully decorated, the food is delicious! I had the ground lamb kebab which came with rice and veggies. I can't wait to come back and try more of the menu! I would highly recommend Tara Kitchen!

It has been ages since I dined in  Moroccan restaurant.  Delighted that Tara Kitchen opened within a 5-minutes walk from my home.  Friendly, lovely service.  Meat and vegetarian, even vegan options. My favorite was an orange salad -- perfect orange slices and tastiest black olives ever.  A feast for the eye as well s the mouth.  Can't wait to return.

The food here is excellent. If you come for lunch I highly recommend the lamb cabbage rolls. The tea was also excellent. Looking forward to going back at night and trying the tagines. The restaurant is well-designed and the staff were all great.
Ate dinner on Saturday night.  The food is very tasty and staff friendly.  A great addition to neighborhood.  Meatballs, tagine and couscous were standouts.  Tea and cookies great too.

After a decade of success with several locations in Upstate and one NJ, this modern Moroccan restaurant is ready to bring vibrant flavors and unique spices to NYC.  Tribeca is lucky to be introduced to this cuisine as it's not as common as it should be.  The female chef has been featured on TV as well in many publications and she knows how to bring her A game to this competitive market.  The signature tagines (aka stews) are featured with chicken, lamb, or seafood, and a variety of veggies, accented with earthy cumin, coriander, turmeric, and paprika. You can also create your own, a la Chipotle style. Then you get a sweet contrast with fruits like dried figs, prunes, apricots, or olives for a salty surprise. Can't forget the cabbage rolls, like babies all tucked away with savory ground lamb.  Sadly, desserts are limited to two options, so hopefully they could offer a plate of Moroccan cookies to go along with a cup of coffee/tea. Such a welcoming spot and hope it will become a stable if not in NYC, at least in Tribeca.

This place just opened a week ago and it's really great! I had a lunch special and it was moderately priced and absolutely delicious. The menu is quite balanced - you can find something regardless of whether you eat meat and whether you can tolerate spices. The service was excellent and everyone was very friendly.

I was immediately enticed when I saw the menu of this place but unfortunately, we stopped by the weekend before Lunar New Year so they were focused on those orders and did not have their regular menu. We ended up trying their butter coconut mochi cupcakes ($10/3 pieces) and the mini burnt cheesecake (pineapple, milo, and ube: $3.50/each). Everything was delicious and was the perfect sweetness (perhaps some might find it too light but we thought it was so good!). I can't wait to return and try their regular menu, though it seems they are closed through the end of March :(

We walked in around 1:30 pm today and a lot of things had already sold out. They have a special menu that they're focusing on for lunar new year so a lot of their normal menu items are not available until after LNY. We got a few cheesecakes (pineapple, Ube, and milo flavor) as well as some butter mochi. They were all delicious! I really loved the texture of the cheesecake - light and perfectly sweet (aka not too sweet). Will definitely be coming back to try their regular items as well!
No comment

I love desserts that are "not too sweet" and Kuih Cafe serves excellent treats that taste delicious and isn't too sweet. They have a really small storefront in Chinatown so there's always a small line outside the door but it moves relatively quickly. I went this past weekend and ordered some Halloween / pumpkin treats from them!
No comment
No comment
This place definitely made it to my list for good Malaysian Desserts!! Finally got to try the burnt durian cheesecake and it is absolutely delicious! Totally recommend it !!
No comment

My favorite spot for Malaysian food. Small cafe opened Fri-Sun only offering kuih, basque burnt cheesecake, various sweets and usually one great savory dish.

No comment

Probably the most authentic Malaysian food you can probably get in NYC. The fried chicken coconut rice and the Kuih dessert are simply beyond appetizing. I also suggest other Malaysian delights offered by this adorable café that are delicately made by the owner of the restaurant, exquisite and palatable - Yum!
Delicious kuih. I got the kuih set and the pandan slice.  Subtly sweet and fresh tasting. Too bad they ran out of the durian special today. I will definitely go back and try other food and dessert

Outstanding Malaysian food, extremely authentic and wonderful flavors. Tried the entire menu and each one was a winner. I tried every Malaysian restaurant in NYC and this is my favorite by far  Definitely best Kuih and Nasi Lemak I ever had and gets a thumbs up from my Malay relatives.
Delicious, home made kuih - so good fresh out of the steamer! Coffee right next door too
No comment

We ordered the 8" black sesame cheesecake for my mil's 70th birthday. The entire center was runny and raw. We were only able to "try" the outer edge that was cooked; roughly an inch all around the outside. Astronomical price for probably the most poorly constructed cake I've ever tried.
No comment
adorable little place that has a delicious, rotating weekly menu! super sweet owner and the desserts are yummy, unique, & well priced
No comment
Fabulous Malaysian snacks on Eldridge Street. I recently tried their Kuih Set of four sweet bites -- all wonderful. Lovely service as well. Highly recommended.

Came in as a complete novice, had never had pandan-flavored anything, but love trying new-to-me flavors especially sweets. While I don't have anything compare it to, I can say, their pandan layer cake was one of the most delicious things I've ever eaten. The cake was like a cloud, and the layers in between were unlike anything I have ever tasted- sweet, a little salty, subtle, creamy, just incredible. We had a mixed set of kuih flavored with red bean/coconut and pandan, as well. The texture was amazing! The ladies at the counter were so helpful and friendly, and very accommodating as we asked for recommendations. I can't wait to go back and try more of the rotating menu!
No comment

Came here late in the afternoon so wasn't much left. I had the pandan chiffon cake which wasn't very sweet which I liked and had a light sugary layer on the edges with subtle pandan flavor. The owner was very nice and talkative. She curates and changes the menu weekly and you can follow the weekly menu posted every Tuesday on Instagram. Will definitely be back to try some of the gelatin desserts and rice dishes.
Came here two weekends in a row just for their amazing desserts - fresh, great texture and perfect sweetness (on less sweet side)!

My Malaysian friend and I stopped by here quickly to try some Malaysian sweets. It was pretty good. I can't remember the names of the dishes (maybe I never knew) but my friend said it was authentic and that's good enough for me.
A small, low-key spot in Chinatown serving rotating Malaysian items. Got the weekly package with sticky rice goodies that reminded me of SEA. Pretty neat, go support small businesses!
No comment
No comment
No comment
Super small and cute shop where the owners are so nice and helpful. Each dessert is made with so much love and care. Went with Malaysian friend who highly recommended the place.

Malaysian sweets made fresh. I hope this local shop receives a lot love and support, there aren't many malay sweet shops in nyc. They rotate their menu every Tuesday. Expect to take out and eat at home. To note, these sweets are very very sweet (honestly probably by nature), so if that's not your thing then keep that in mind. I would still get their sampler of the week to try it,  malay sweets are so unique so it's very worth it to try out at least once.
No comment
Absolute gem, hole-in-the-wall. Please get whatever layer cake they have. It was the lightest yet richest flavor of pandan cake ever. The coconut rice meal was also incredible as well.
No comment
I don't know what I had but dessert sets were sooo good, kind was expecting it to be overly sweet, not the case! Just the right amount of chewy goodness
No comment

This place is *so* good, and I'll definitely be coming back often.  Can't speak for the savory food (yet), but we tried several desserts--coconut sundae, the pandan layer cake, and the kuih set--and they were fantastic.  I'm sad (but also a little relieved) they don't deliver, because I'd order from here all the time (and blast through my daily calorie limit).  This is exactly the kind of excellent small business that we all need to support so that they can keep growing and providing delicious treats you really can't get elsewhere in the city.
No comment

My family's from Penang so I'm usually pretty picky with Malay places I find in the US and the pandan kiuh is as close to the og stuff I'd get in Malaysia!! The lemon poppy chiffon cake, though not a traditional treat was surprisingly refreshing and has extremely strong lemon flavor while not being overly sweet, love it! I also can't stress enough that the fact you get an entire nasi lemak order that more than fills you up and is only $7? what!?

A new small business focusing on authentic Malay sweets, snacks and their national rice dish. The proprietor is still testing out the market and figuring out permanent items to stay on menu. For now, finger friendly sweets and slice cakes are available as well as beverages and bubur Cha Cha, a popular south eastern sweet soup made with yam, pigeon peas, tapioca petals all cooked in coconut milk. Best to visit during the weekends as more savory offerings are available. Staff is friendly and readily answer any questions. More detailed menu is in the work to improve understanding and ordering process.
Great food and desserts! I love pandan and ube. Thank you for the pride cookies and kuih!

I had the Talam Ube, Pulut Tai Tai, Kuih Dadar, and Pandan Chiffon cake. All four were great- just the right amount of sweetness and the I LOVE coconut!! I'm excited to come back and try their other desserts and food (their menu rotates weekly, I check on their IG @kuihcafe). I highly recommend this spot if you're looking for something different from the Chinese desserts you can find all around Chinatown. The owner works so hard on all of her items and makes everything from scratch! You won't be disappointed!

It is a small eatery with a very cozy feel. I think they are only doing take out now. Only one person is allow in at a time but you can preorder and they are quick to have everything packed up nicely. Clean and everything is packaged ready to go. The nasi lemak has a nice kick to it, and flavorful. Liked their fresh homemade kuih and pineapple cookies... I stocked up a little bit because it has been a while since I went to CT. So, glad this is one of the places I finally got to try. They post their week's offering on Instagram as well as their opening hours. The owner(s)/staff are really friendly, which isn't easy during time like now.

Back again with another 5 star review for the gem of Chinatown. Had the turmeric chicken (sorry no pictures because in my belly) and the pandan fresh cream cake with coconut shavings (finally remembered to take a pic before I ate). Absolutely delicious. The flavor of all the meals are so good, but the cakes are always always always perfect. Never too sweet. Always stalk their Instagram for the week's menu so I can secure a slice of my favorite before it sells out for the day.
Super friendly service, delicious desserts! A taste of KL in NYC! Only drawback: they serve instant coffee. If you're kind of a coffee snob, get your coffee elsewhere.

Pretty much have tried everything since I found out this little gem in Chinatown. And almost go there every weekend because they change their menu weekly. Their durian burnt cheesecake is a must try you love durian!! I also love their savory cookies so get them if you're not a big fan of sweet cookies!

Soooo happy I found this place!! My mom grew up in Malaysia and introduced me to Kuih Lapis (a coconut milk based dessert) when visiting and I fell in love. They are almost impossible to find in the states but this cafe has a rotating selection of some of the most delicious and beautiful Kuih. They also have other staple Malaysian dishes like Nasi Lemak which I can't wait to back and try.

I have first stumble upon this gem two weeks ago thanks for SendChinatownLove Foodcrawl. As a fellow Malaysian, I always have low expectation of Malaysian places since they never really hit that spot and make my tummy satisfy with the taste. However, this place really changed my mind. I first got a set B which includes Nasi Lemak with 2 random Malaysian Kuih (Kuih is basically Malaysian cake/dessert, usually bite size). The Nasi Lemak was average, very similar to all other Malaysian places, but once I took a bite of the Kuih, yoooooooo, it blew my mind. I never expect to taste something so authentic in NYC. I've been going back whenever I'm in the area to try out the different kuih, not one have disappointed me yet. I would totally recommend this place if you wanna try some authentic kuih that taste 99% like how it is in Malaysia. Btw, the place is small so you will need to get it to go.

Such a cute cafe. I've been looking for a kuih place for the longest time. They just opened a week ago and i love it already. They change their menu everyday so it's always new whenever you go. The people there are SO nice too! Got some to go to share with the fam

I visited because I saw such pretty pictures of the cakes online!  My daughters and I shared a durian cheesecake and also the Kuih Set, which had 3 different desserts. All were little beautiful gems. It's a very small shop but the owner was very friendly and explained the different cakes to us. I highly recommend this spot for a not-your-usual dessert!

Waited 2.5h in line to find out they ran out of pretty much everything on the menu when it was my turn. Not sure what the challenge of giving folks in the line a heads up is. They make them wait for nothing. I'm sure food is great, but they have no idea how to run a business.

Great lil shop for aunthentic Malaysian treats. Check out their IG for their weekly menu!! The kuih and the cookies are my favorite to get every week! Still obsessing over the package of salted egg cookies
This place is absolute amazing, we went 2 days in a row. The desserts were the best tasting desserts I have had in awhile -- the Cassava and the Panda cubes
The Durian cheesecake is a must-have, it's the perfect combination. I've also tried the pandan ondeh-ondeh cake, the nasi lemak, curry cheong fan and assortment of kuihs. All delicious and cheap!

Newish cafe on Eldridge Street in Chinatown. One of the nicest shop owners ever, always willing to explain the menu items and talk for a bit. I'm always excited to try the kuih, as it changes every week, and it's a type of dessert that really hasn't gotten as popular in the US as you'd think (despite being colorful and photogenic). There's limited seating but that doesn't really matter in a pandemic. Prices are very reasonable as well, and I recommend just trying stuff out!

Note: this place is closed on Mondays even though it says it's open on Yelp hours for the store. This place has great street style Malaysian items. The sambal for the nasi lemak is very good. The dish could use bit more of the ingredients to balance the rice to fixings ratio.

My boyfriend took me here in a search for pineapple tarts back in February, and I'm so glad he did. This place is amazing. The tarts are buttery, sweet, flaky, and an explosion of pineapple flavor. It's not like the sad pineapple tarts you buy in grocery stores. These are a must try for anyone visiting china town.

EUREKA to finally discover foodie that is so close to the heart & of course my appetite for Malaysian Delights. The Nasi Lemak is really to die for. Super humbling owner/chef as she demands for freshness & her creativity amazes the craving for authenticity. Give it a try & you will be wanting for more!
Delicious Malaysian desserts! If you are craving for kuih kuih make a stop at Kuih Cafe. Place is tiny so if you have a big group, it's advisable that you order a take out.
Amazing pineapple cakes and coconut ice cream with pandas and taro. They need more business!
Very very good nasi lemak and pineapple tarts! Love it. One of the best nasi lemak in NYC. ( I am from Malaysia)

I'm Singaporean and I have been looking for kueh and nasi lemak for the longest time! This little cafe is a small taste of home and because it's home made it taste extra good! I love this little place very much

This place is such a gem. As someone who is Malaysian born, I have very high standards. The food at this place reminded me of home and my mom's Malaysian cooking/treats. The owner and lady at the front were so friendly, sweet, and took the time to explain everything they offered. The owner wakes up very early every morning so she can make everything fresh and from scratch....and I can tell how much love and effort she put into her nasi lemak and her kuihs. Specials change everyday which keeps things exciting. Can't wait to go back!
Delicious mini pastries and cakes.  Owner is so kind to let me sample her items in the store.  Would definitely come back for more.
No comment
No comment
No comment

The food here was pretty authentic and decently priced, but nothing too special. I wish the beef noodle soup had more flavor, and that the fried rice wasn't just salty. The waiter was also a bit rushed and impolite. I probably wouldn't come here again but I'm glad that there was no wait before being seated here.

Very fast service and high quality food with a nice dining area thats cozy and clean! Highly recommend coming early because this place fills up very quickly! All the servings are super generous and meant to be consumed family style so plan on sharing when hon come with a group of a couple of friends. Every bite was delicious and I can't wait to come back and try more! 10/10 recommend the rice noodles as an appetizer--some of the best I have had with an amazing sauce!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Came here today (Saturday) for a late lunch and Uncle Lou was packed! The wait wasn't too bad and we were seated in about 10-15 mins for a party of 4. The place cleared out around 4p or so towards the end of our lunch. Food was delicious! I wish we had a bigger stomach to try more of their dishes. I didn't get a chance to take pics of the other dishes but took pics of the Peking duck and salt pepper shrimp, scallop and squid dish. The HIGHLIGHT of the meal was the dessert - it made my day to see sai mai lo being brought to our table (it's a coconut dessert with taro and sago, yummy goodness). Shout out to our servers who provided great service and care!

No comment

4 stars for a nicer atmosphere than your typical Chinatown restaurant and interesting selection of dim sum and Cantonese style dishes.  Really dug the combo dish of stuffed eggplant, long green peppers and tofu in a black bean sauce!
No comment
No comment
No comment

This location used to be a vietnamese restaurant and i used to go there a lot back in the days. Now it's a Cantonese restaurant. I like the over design of the restaurant . It's wide and airy with brick walls. The price in my opinion is on the pricy side as most of the items are 25+. A chicken broccoli will run you 20 dollars here but maybe it's a bigger portion . A small bowl of century egg congee is 7 dollars. You can get that half the price elsewhere but then again due to inflation and everything else , prices on everything went up . The wonton noodle soup I got was 8 dollars which is fair as you could probably get that for 5-6 else where but definitely not at a good restaurant like this and location like this . Also tried the Peking pork chop. My wife said it was alright.  I think it was pretty good . It's not too sweet and just right in my opinion .

Will always remember as the first china town food I ate at in New York.  Most of the food was delicious and I'm only dinging a star due to honey walnut shrimp being low quantity for what we paid.  Overall, enjoyed my time and the staff was very accommodating.  Had leftovers that were able to be eaten the following day and that's always a win.

Food--great top notch Cantonese style cuisine.  Great service nice people.  Top recommendation!

Awesome place with great food! Came with a big group and they brought all of the food out quickly and provided amazing recommendations. It's BYOB beer and wine only with a corking fee, but they have some options to purchase there as well if you want to go that route! Highly recommend for birthdays, or any group celebrations! Was not able to get pics of all dishes but we tried around 10 dishes and every single one was great!
No comment

Uncle Lou is a relatively new Cantonese restaurant with a modern interior. The staff was not very attentive to new customers coming in even though the restaurant wasn't very busy. I ordered take out on a Sunday afternoon at 3pm and the estimated pick up time was 45 minutes. I assuming the guy who took my order was uncle Lou. He's wasn't very friendly. The food was average and slightly on the salty side. I had the fried garlic chicken, salt and pepper fish, walnut shrimp, and vegetable mushroom yi mein. The garlic chicken was good but I had much better. There was a lot of garlic but the flavor was lacking in the meat. The salt and pepper fish was on the hard side and a tad too salty. The walnut shrimp was good but I would have preferred the sauce to be less sweet. The yi mein was the best out of the dishes that I ordered. Very flavorful.
No comment
No comment

Uncle Lou's is a great spot in Chinatown with attentive staff and excellent food. We sat at the bar to eat but the whole restaurant is well done. The soup dumplings and pork buns are fantastic. We had their famous garlic crispy chicken dish which I thought was salty, but overall really delicious. Would highly recommend!

Don't be deceived by the modern signage or name of this place for it doesn't look like it belongs in the middle of NY Chinatown. The food is totally legit. We just wanted to take a break from the cold NYC winter so we wanted something hot. The congee with century egg was the comfort food we needed. Couple it with shrimp siomay and I was ready for another round out in the town. The price was very affordable compared to other restaurants in the area. Worth the stop.
No comment

The shrimp dumps were some of the best I've had. My partner really liked the crispy chicken. This place also has a really cool atmosphere and a line out the door the day we came. Would for sure come back

Visited NYC for the weekend and tried Uncle Lou.  We ordered a variety of dim sum dishes and a braised duck dish.  We were took busy catching up so I forgot to take the photos of all the food.  Food was okay but I feel like we didn't order their best dishes.  The decor was cute and the place looked cleaned.  It started to get busy when lunch time arrived.
No comment
Couldn't have asked for a better workday lunch. I got a generous portion of tasty sweet & sour chicken and a pork bun at a really good price. Clean, fast, and friendly too!

This is a wonderful restaurant.  Large menu and quick service.   Very clean and everyone left feeling very full and satisfied.
No comment

Been here a handful of times, the decor and ambiance is inviting and comfortable. The food is uncompromisingly Cantonese (traditional). On one hand, you get the Chinatown tourists - and on another (based on how tables spill into each other) you can tell that this is a real neighborhood restaurant that is reflective of the Chinatown community. I would bring my friends for a night out - yet this is a place I'd bring my parents & grandparents who crave some old school Cantonese. The staff was also friendly and they had an English menu which is a plus. Would definitely come back to try out their seasonal menu.
Home cooking good!  Great service - busy but worth the wait Crispy Garlic Chicken and Steamed Buffalo Fish was so

came on a friday night at 7 with no reservation, waited maybe 20 minutes for a table for 2. service was super quick and food was so so yummy!! we split the eggplant in garlic sauce (鱼香茄子) and crispy garlic chicken which were honestly both equally delicious - so much so that the people sitting next to us asked us what we ordered after they had already gotten their food and everything :0 cannot wait to come back and explore their menu more!

Man I so love this place food was amazing, this place was definitely a hit for my trip to NYC. Ambiance was great and the service was phenomenal!

I was craving for a decent Cantonese meal last week so was looking thru yelp for a list of cantonese grub in Chinatown. Originally me, my brother and mom had decided to dine in on Thanksgiving day, however big mistake follow suit as we didn't prepare at all and we should've reserve a table if anything for any holiday dates. So here is my pleasant experience ordering take out from Uncle Lou. The following day, I stopped by again during their lunch hours and they are again almost having the entire restaurant fully occupied by customers. I was greeted by one of the waitress as I continue to look down at their recent updated menu, I noticed prices were up by roughly 25%, I understand it was the high inflation thus they adjust their prices. I ordered R35 which is the Garlic Crispy Fried Chicken w soy sauce, bokchoy on a bed of rice, and I also ordered Fried Salt and Pepper Jumbo Shrimp over rice. Both were spectacular and delicious! Felt like this is a proper establishment, they take their time and knowledge of cooking and frying these type of dishes. The chicken is crispy, lightly battered, tender and juicy. The shrimp is also lightly battered, fried to light brown colour and crispy. Overall I'm fully satisfied and would like to explore more of their main dishes given the fact that my brother' s birthday is coming up next week, we would definitely reserve a spot so we won't miss out again!

Great service and uncle Lou was awesome. It was his birthday week so he was pouring Japanese whiskey for all the tables. Food was on point. Only the lobster noodle dish was a little bit disappointing . The only reason I docked a star. The condensed milk taro dessert was like a hug on the inside

Everything was incredibly delicious, and I look forward to going back many more times.  The quality was incredibly fresh, and everything was cooked perfectly.

Good Service. Food was good. I especially loved the crispy garlic chicken dish. Will go back again to try some other items on the menu that looked really good.

Went a second time but tbh customer service needs work, called for a reservation. Name wasn't on the list when I got there, then they forgot 3 dishes my table ordered... the food was still solid but they are short staffed during peak hours....

Service is fast, food is fresh. Everything is so delicious and the staff works together for a smooth service.

The Egg drop soup, pork bun and pork fried rice were bland. Otherwise the food was very good. We had chicken w broccoli, general Tsos chicken, sweet and sour pork and vegetable lo mein. The apps were good too including shumai and vegetable dumplings.

It's a safe choice to go in a group. Everyone can find food of there liking. Wouldn't say it was amazing but it was good/ok. The decor is great definitely a nice pick to bring someone on a date.

Uncle Lou is the best! Since it has opened it has only got better! Great service, ambience, location, and most importantly the food! It's clean, well organized and once again the food is hard to beat especially because the prices are so reasonable. The signature chicken and duck, ginger friend rice, garlic pea shoots, stuffed eggplant and countless others are deliciously addictive. You really can't go wrong when ordering but I do suggest asking for recommendations. I highly recommend the restaurant to anyone looking for an authentic dining experience in Chinatown!

This is an amazing DELICIOUS restaurant with hard working kind employees. My husband and I were visiting NYC, looking for good Chinese food, we returned for a 2nd meal while we were there. Everything we ate was absolutely delicious. The restaurant is beautiful. Can't wait to go back

Was looking forward to coming here and it did not disappoint! Loved the lively atmosphere and family style format. Everybody looked like they were having a blast. Portions are perfect for sharing so be sure to mix it up and try something new. Loved their take ok the General Tso's. Everybody talks about the crispy garlic chicken; now I know why!

No comment
Solid place for Chinese food. Every dish was delicious Highly recommend stop if you are in Chinatown.

Went here for lunch and luckily got in before the rush. Split some dim sum and vegetables (garlicky eggplant) with my coworker. We both had our personal rice dishes and all was very good! Need to come back for a fish dish for a fuller assessment. Price point for value is great, service is average. They also didn't carry two dim sum dishes that we wanted to try.

The food was great! Very fresh and flavorful. The wait staff was prompt and courteous... even the restrooms were some of the best I've seen. We will definitely be back. I was even able to meet uncle Lou!
No comment

This place is next level Chinese. Every dish is so delicious and made with such love and care. My favorite dish was the lo mein and my significant other enjoyed the lobster lo mein. The noodles are spectacular and unique - not your average lo mein. The atmosphere is casual cool without trying too hard. The focal point is on the food and the people you are with. Definitely add this spot to your list as I know it will become one of your regular staples.
Best Chinese food I've had, had no idea what I was walking into and was pleasantly surprised
No comment
No comment
Incredible, delicious, well-packed, great servings, perfect for any occasion or ordering takeout.
Everything is good here. You cannot go wrong with any dish. The weekday lunch specials are my favorite and there is more variety. Go there early as there's a huge lunch crowd.
As awesome as reviewed.  Crispy chicken with garlic sauce and soft shell crab are delicious

Heard a lot about this place so we were able to give it a try.  8 of us ordered 1 dish each.   Every dish was delicious for the camera and our palates!   Classic Cantonese dishes and classic American Cantonese Chinese dishes were all impressive!  It is now one of or my favorite spot in NYC for Cantonese Chinese food!  Finally a place that gives Toronto Cantonese spots a run for their money here in NYC!  Thank you Uncle Lou for making this happen and hope you and your staff keep up the great work!

Very well cooked classic Cantonese. Reasonable priced, nice decor, even the bath room was nice and clean. Only drawback was the service. Waiter hardly pay attention to customers. Otherwise is not bad.
Everything was amazing! You leave having had a ton to eat but not feeling heavy. Service was very good and food came quickly despite the restaurant being full. Will definitely go again.
Special place. Legit Chinese food that you will actually see Chinese people eating there. Not traditional American version but very good and something for everyone.
No comment

I order it to go & by the time I got back to the office the salmon was a bit cold but it took awhile to walk there since they don't deliver not the fault of the restaurant just wish they had delivery.  The salmon tasted good, unfortunately I had asked for brown rice & they gave me white & the veggies which I feel like they threw in what was leftover was a few pieces of bok choy & a few bits of cucumber. I would have liked more vegetables since I've seen other pictures of the dish with a lot more vegetables. I'll try it 1 more time but if they skimp on the veggies or give me white rice again I'm sorry. I'm definitely not coming back & tell my friends & family not to too. Even though they don't state the give veggies with the salmon, other friends & family who has eaten and taken pictures stated there was suppose to be more veggies when they saw my lunch.

Uncle Lou's is the new go to spot in Chinatown. This place offers delicious old school style Chinese food at a great price. Awesome breakfast and lunch specials. I tried several dishes here, all were wonderful. A great place for holiday and family dinners.

We went on opening day and didn't disappoint. We ordered a wide variety of starters and meals and all 5 of us loved our plates. General Tso was crispy and sauce not to spicy. fried chicken with garlic the skin was perfectly crisp and broth tasted perfect. Sesame chicken was great traditional dish. And I got the Singapore chow mei fun noodles. Suttle kick from yellow curry. Several proteins mixed in. Very large portion. Two could easily share this. We also got fried pork dumplings, wontons in Chili sauce was amazing, and spring rolls perfectly crisp. Food served hot and fresh. Highly recommend

Great food and great service, and this menu offers authentic Cantonese dishes which is not so easy to find in NYC.   Ambience of the place is nicer than others in Chinatown.  Had lobster noodle and it was awesome... hit a spot after not having it for so many years.   Other dishes were great too.... Sweet and sour pork had a good crispy taste without too much batter, and the stuffed green chilies appetizer was great too.    Will definitely come back.   Many more dishes I want to try!

Nice, updated restaurant that still gives you the traditional Chinatown feel. Portions are a bit small but just a reason to try more dishes. Went with beef and broccoli with General Tso's and they were both fantastic.

My colleague and I ate a delicious meal here. We tried the sweet and sour pork,  the house duck and chicken with garlic sauce. Each dish was delicious and plentiful. We look forward to returning! We operate a local food tour business and hope to partner with this restaurant in the near future. Chinatown is very happy to welcome Uncle Lou's.

YUM!! This place is always hopping and for good reason. The food is fabulous and interesting Canto fare. I got the HK BBQ noodle soup with wide rice noodles. It was delicious and the noodles appeared to be knife cut - such a nice touch. The wontons in chili oil were delicious and beautifully presented in a savory dipping sauce under the chili oil with fresh herbs. They were very accommodating. Hot tip - if you want to be extra COVID safe, ask for the seat closest to the door. It gets good air circulation from the doors opening and closing.
No comment
Came with wifey, thought food was good nothing special and the duck special was honestly like rubber ... So sad

I was so excited to try Uncle Lou, after reading the Grub Street article. My family is from Hong Kong and I am always looking for good Cantonese food to satisfy cravings. The food here really hit the spot! The soup starter was already stellar, didn't taste very watered down or too strong of flavour enhancements. The honey walnut shrimp and sauteed pea shoots were our favorite dishes. We also had the sweet and sour whole flash fried fish, I loved that they used lychees in the sauce - super authentic. They had run out of the chengpi duck, which we really wanted to try, but we got the half peking duck instead. The baos were awesome and fluffy but the duck wasn't quite the peking duck style, more like Cantonese roast duck. Still yummy though! We also ordered the dried scallop egg white fried rice and that was amazing. Highly recommend!

We hosted a big family birthday here for 50 people.  The staff went above and beyond to help us make the night exactly what we wanted it to be.  We worked with Larry in advance and appreciated both his recommendations and flexibility.  The food was astoundingly good, and both our Chinese and American guests were impressed.  Would definitely recommend for either a regular meal or a special occasion!

SUPER CLEAN! Lots of choices, all well flavored and thoroughly cooked! The vegetable lo mein was delicious, as were the spring rolls! If you're looking for a nice atmosphere and classic Chinese dishes, come see Uncle Lou! You won't be disappointed.

Went to there tonight. The food is very bland. Ordered the half chicken with garlic. You can't even taste the garlic. Also ordered the sailfish fried rice with chicken and there was no salt fish in it. It's a pretty new restaurant they should focus on putting out good food. If it's good people will always come back. Don't think I'll go back again.
Food was delicious but confusion on my BBQ order. The ginger fried rice is addictive!!

We'll be back.  This is exactly what you think it is:  A Chinese restaurant that makes the kind of Chinese food you remember.  I ordered Shrimp in lobster sauce.  $23 .  Lots of shrimp.  Delicious.  Sweet and Sour Chicken? $17 really really good.  The message here is that if you want good food and generous portions, you have to pay for it.  After trying all the mediocre places in my neighborhood, this is a pleasure. The service is good.  It's clean, the furniture is shiny new, the bathroom is clean and everything works.  Take a bus, grab a cab, or hope on a subway.  It's Chinatown and it's the real deal.
Classic C'Town o'skool menu.... I'm sorry but this will be my new go to spot from now over the "Mott" street joints!!

Fantastic duck! Loved the surprise buns that came with the duck, instead of the typical wrappers you see at other Cantonese restaurants. We also got and recommend the pork with string beans and crispy chicken. And even though it was super packed during dinner service, we were seated pretty quickly for a group of 4. Very nice staff!
This is home-style cooking at its best. Enjoy great food with wonderful company. Our favorites are sweet and sour pork, garlic chicken and eggplants

Stopped in to pick up some takeout before the Harry Styles concert (it was on the way from my family's apartment). Service was quick, my food was ready in under 30 minutes. However, the food itself was terrible. Beef and string beans were missing the rice that I ordered alongside it, and was 90% green beans 10% beef. Lackluster flavor. Pea shoots with garlic were inedible, I don't even know how to describe the flavor except slightly resembling dirty dish water. Scallion pancakes were mediocre, kind of soggy but okay flavor with the sauce. Will never be returning and do NOT recommend, there are places in Chinatown that are 100x better and way more reasonably priced.
No comment

Uncle Lou is the place to go for traditional Cantonese cuisine. I was impressed with the quality and freshness of the food. Fried garlic chicken was cooked perfectly! So much flavor and the chicken breast was so juicy! All the dishes was just amazing as well! So much flavor and not greasy at all! I will definitely come back again with my family!

Excellent first visit to Uncle Lou's for Lunch. Rice platter lunch included tea, house soup ("lai tong") and sweet tapioca soup dessert all for under $10. Dining room was clean and so was the restroom which is a good sign! Only reason rating was not a 5 was due to wait staff taking a little longer to close the tab. They should improve over time with more experience. Also suggested posting menu on the website even without pricing due to future price changes, to show menu item selections . Keep up the good work Uncle Lou..... from a fellow "wah kew / jook sing" born and raised in Chinatown.
Real HK style Chinese-American food. You will enjoy these delicious food in clean and neat environment.

I have only had take out here and thought food was very good..especially their special ribs!! Glad to see lot of traditional Cantonese dishes in Chinatown again and the rice dishes are such great value!

Their lunch menu is amazing! $9 to $10 for most lunch menu and that's pretty much for everything. The portions are huge!!!! sweet and sour pork, and the orange duck was amazing ... the neighbor table told me she comes her every day because she works around there with the court. Weekend is a bit different because they are very busy....
No comment

We came across Uncle Lou's today looking for a new place to try in downtown China town. I can simply say that we were very pleased! The food was great and the atmosphere was really nice in this new restaurant. Though a bit on the pricier side for Chinese food, I think the quality made up for it. We also got lucky that Uncle Lou's nephew was working tonight and had him as our waiter. He was amazing and even had us try a momo chacha. Great job helping out your uncle and thanks for making our night. Have a happy New Years. We'll be back!

Walked by and saw a new place to try. So I'd stopped by and decide to give it a try. Had the Singapore noodles and egg drop soup. I have to say it was spicy like how Singapore noodles should be. Definitely come back again.

Classic Cantonese joint in a warm, modern (really - timeless) setting. I'm so happy that a place like this exists in Chinatown! I've been here 5x since discovering it - each time trying something new. Most recently tried their new special Salt x Pepper soft shell crab, and - oh boy - didn't realize how much I missed the last couple of months! Uncle Lou and the staff are always so helpful with recommendations. An instant NYC classic - Long live Uncle Lou forever and ever!

Latest visit decided to depart from my regular mandarin orange duck and tried the lamb casserole. A mild rich flavor which built with every bite, nice mushrooms and liked the texture of what I assume was the cartilage on the lamb knuckles. The meat itself was tough and stringy.

The food was excellent, the service was non-existing. We waited 50 minutes, and then finally one dish arrived: fried rice. We had to call the waiter again and ask where the rest was. Some of it just never arrived - but was on our bill, of course. They removed it when we pointed it out - but we never even got an apology. Such a shame. Great food deserves to be enjoyed.
No comment

Uncle Lou's is right down the street from where I work. My coworker suggested this place due to the high volume of people there all the time. We decided to give it a try and ordered three dishes: sweet and sour pork, sweet and sour fish and general Tao's chicken. We called ahead for pickup and they told us it would be a 40 min wait. Fine, we were waiting at the office anyways. Picked up the food and I had huge expectations for it but the food was mediocre. It's more like a bougie Chinese take out restaurant that you find around your neighborhood. Not going to try again.

Uncle Lou is special. From the food that takes me back to my youth in Chinatown to the stylish interior, this new restaurant is ambitious in all the right ways. I am proud to take my friends here to show them my culture.

Uncle Lou...just wow!!  My experience at Uncle Lou was pure delicious! First let's start with the restaurant, it's beautifully decorated, perfectly lighted with nice music vibe. Second, coordination of staff and management was perfectly displayed. Team work at work! Management and staff took a quick moment of their busy environment to chat with customers which gave special attention of being part of a beautiful community. Last, but not least, the food, oh wow, the food, presentation excellent and taste exquisite. We ordered a few dishes and each dish was absolutely delicious! One of my favorite, Chicken and salted fish fried rice!  I left wanting more! Definitely will visit again!  Love Rocky

Very nice atmosphere and the waiters while attentive were hard to communicate with. Didn't have ice which I thought was weird. Sweet and sour chicken was overly sweet with not much chicken and mostly fruit. Beef lomein was not bad, but the Starr of the meal for us was the crispy garlic chicken. Half a chicken with incredibly crispy skin and succulent chicken. It was amazing!

trust me there is nothing to rave about at this place!! We were so excited to try it cause of all the delicious pics and many choices. My husband got the chengpi duck over rice and i ordered pork belly mui choy over rice for take out. Both dishes LACKS FLAVOR OR SALT. The duck tasted really weird, it's like sweet and sour duck, the meat was bad and dry also, skin was soggy cause drenched in sauce. The pork belly mui choy had NO FLAVOR whatsoever, it's like it was blanched many times and all the flavor is gone. It was also really fatty, like so much fatty pork pieces that I couldn't finish my dish. The fat was getting to me halfway thru eating. It's sad cause mui choy is supposed to be really salty too but that wasn't the case here...maybe they preserved their own veggies? Lol. What a disappointment.

The only reason I'm giving one star is for the food. The service was horrible, we weren't greeted at the table and had to go up to the bar to get water. Then we waited 15 more minutes and had to ask someone if we could order. Then when it came time to pay, we asked for our check and had to wait another 20 more minutes. This was in the middle of the day and the place wasn't busy. If you're looking for good food and terrible service, this is your place
