Tasty, traditional Chinese food and reasonably priced. The wait can get pretty long so best to come before 630pm.

Came here based on high review on a Saturday around 4pm. I'm shocked by the unwelcoming attitude. Almost looked like they had too much businesses now and could care less of incoming customers. Left with disappointment.
No comment

Truly delicious food. A family place, a community space, and it was blown away by how yummy it was. I am going back today because I need to try more! I had the hot and sour soup. And then the crispy fried chicken with garlic and soy sauce.
The food was great, the place was so cute and certainly a place to go. It's certainly recommended.

I've been here twice in 2 weeks with my family. If you're craving really good food, you must come through. The prices are reasonable, and portions are good. We tried so many dishes...lo mein, peking duck, seafood platter, eggplant, scallion pancakes, dumplings, congee, rice dishes and more - and I can tell you that it's all tasty! Dessert is complimentary at the end of your meal also, and everyone is friendly! We'll def be back.
Decent food, solid service. It's not any better or any worse than the other Cantonese spots in the vicinity (more gringo-friendly and better PR, I suppose) but good graphic design tho!

We heard this was the best Cantonese restaurant in Chinatown so we walked in and the wait was around 20 minutes for 6 people on a Sunday afternoon, which wasn't bad at all. The hostess was really nice and clarifying. Once we sat down and ordered, we didn't have to wait long at all for the first dish to arrive! It was very appreciative from all 6 starving individuals. Memorable dishes were the HK style lo mein with duck, salt and pepper fillet and the scallop fried rice with Chinese broccoli.
Amazing awesome authentic food. Place run by good people and very friendly and comfortable environment.

The future of Chinatown. Gorgeous menu. The true taste of Hong Kong cuisine. Try the salt and pepper frog or crispy garlic chicken with house soy sauce. Mazel tov to the wonderful owner and her daughter, enjoyed chatting with you today, "I'll be bock".
This place is a gem. The food is amazing and the service top notch. You can't go wrong with anything on this menu.
Excellent food, old favorites well prepared.   We had L8. , salt and pepper seafood.  Service was attentive.
No comment

Good food, reasonable prices! Duck in orange peel sauce excellent but duck was made from frozen duck but excellent sauce. Ribs with winter melon very good, bland and not much meat. Fish bony but good. Very pleasant experience. Good service.
Fantastic food and service.  Personal touches by Uncle Lou himself.  What a great way to finish our trip to NYC on a cold night!   We've found our Chinatown spot.
I ordered rice with soy sauce chicken. The chicken had no flavor  and it came cold. My grandchildren food also came cold and we have to put a lot of soy sauce to add some flavor. Not good!!

We were looking for a restaurant to celebrate the New Year and stumbled upon Uncle Lou when another place we tried to go to couldn't get us in. There was about a 30 minute wait, however they were very understaffed and were not expecting such a high influx of guests. Once we were seated, the food came out promptly and it was SO GOOD. Definitely exceeded my expectations for authentic Chinese food. We ordered the garlic chicken, sautéed pea shoots, and beef chow fun. All were so delicious. Larry was a great, friendly waiter and made us grateful that we chose to eat here. They even served us a complimentary dessert for New Years!
We've lost a few old restaurants to the pandemic but it's great to see a new place true to Chinatown. Modern interior with classic dishes and good prices and the food is on par.
Best place to dine in China Town! All the food  is fresh and delicious. The atmosphere is fun and family oriented.
Amazing food and service. Dumplngs and duck were fuego!
Delicious food! Had a whole fish, pork belly on mustard greens, and wonton soup. Very authentic.
This place is truly special. Amazing food, staff, and space. This feels like Chinatown at its best. Will be back.
Rooting for this place that feels like what community is all about. The food is so good and they make everybody feel so welcomed. Jook sing approved. Local approved.
No comment
Great food and prices. My family wanted a great Chinese experience and we were not disappointed!
Very authentic Cantonese restaurant! I am very impressed by the Sweet and sour pork ribs. It's soooo crunchy! Staff are friendly and the restaurant is very clean. Highly recommend to all!

ALL HAIL UNCLE LOU (this review is equal parts of the owner and the food). Incredible Cantonese restaurant. The owner himself, Uncle Lou, even greeted us on an incredibly busy night to ensure all was well. Highly recommend everything we ordered, including the whole fish, house duck, beef with string beans, lo mein, fried rice and shu mai.

Unlike some of the older restaurants this place is upscale.  Food is authentic cantI would go again.  They have your popular dishes often seen in Chinatown but also dishes such as snow pea shoots,  ginger fried rice.  Chicken with pepper.  I'll be back
No comment
What an amazing restaurant! Great service and excellent food. I cannot recommend this place highly enough!! They've gotta bottle the chili sauce!
No comment

When you first arrive in the restaurant, you'll be instantly greeted by spices and aromas that make you want to sit down and order immediately. The decor is modern, fresh, and aesthetically pleasing. We ordered (to go) R1 (braised pork belly) and R45 (curry chicken) and it was delicious. Prices are extremely reasonable and the restaurant takes covid seriously (doors and windows open ajar for fresh air + an air purifier). Can't wait to come back again and take my time enjoying the food here!

What can I say, but incredible everything! Please do yourself a favor and head over. Service and food was top notch even for a very busy Sunday! I had the ginger fried rice was immaculate with the help of spare ribs was a combo of all combos! I had to stop eating and made sure I had enough for leftovers. The sweet and sour pork was out of this world the right amount of flavors! Guys go and support!
Food was fabulous. You must try the "Lo Wah Kiu's Favorites".  I am sure a lot have no idea what that means.  lol...

Came here for the first time today and the food totally made my day! It reminded me of the dishes I had growing up in China. So amazingly authentic! The ambience and service are fantastic too! Prices are super reasonable! Can't wait to come back!!

Went here with my friend who chose it based on reviews- it did not disappoint!  Yummy crispy chicken delicious green and garlicky shrimp made for a lovely lunch in China town.  The servers ere attentive and helpful and the restaurant is clean and well maintained. Great spot don't sleep on it!
I wouldn't recommend going to this place. They requested more tips than we already gave them. Plus took forever to give us water. The food portions are not good and the servers were rude.

Wow. Just tried this place. I've grown up with Cantonese food and Uncle Lou's is really impressive. We loved the garlic crispy chicken, the mussels with scallions and chinese celery (a special of the day), fried flounder, beef stew with radish, and stir fried pea shoots. It was all really flavorful and balanced. We gobbled it all up! Every detail was well thought out. The tea was perfectly steeped and didn't have the leaves sitting in the teapot so it wouldn't oversteep. The complimentary chicken soup at the beginning was really tasty and traditional. Even the rice was really tasty and fragrant. Uncle Lou's strikes a great balance of offering really traditional dishes with small unique twists. Go here!!

Out of the way place on Mulberry Street.  Doesn't look like much from the outside.  Inside was bright and modern.  Food was EXCELLENT.  Had seen a review of this place in the New York Times and wanted to try it on our trip to NYC.  We were not disappointed.

We ordered 3 dishes for take out and were told it would be a 30 minute wait, which we happily waited. It ended up taking them 90 minutes to get us our order. They also did not take into account our request to remove walnuts due to an allergy... we will not be coming back.

My family had dinner at Uncle Lou and they could not have been more accommodating. Service was impeccable and the food was delicious and a great value. Everyone loved the duck and my personal fave, the walnut shrimp dish! I always get the fried rice here and their hot chili oil is also insanely good. Uncle Lou is such a great addition to Chinatown and is definitely a new go to spot!

By sharing these reviews ..we give a try on Cantonese Dishes yet feel abit just little upset on sauces..only sweetness nothing else..also garlic fried chicken not enough spices taste too ..try adjusting skills of cooking would help..will try other specialty again...Thank you
No comment
Amazing place in China town! Everything we ordered was fantastic. Large plates, good for sharing.
It has quickly become my favorite place to go. The food is great, I can't get enough of it. It's a quiet a little place to have dinner with family and friends.
Great food!  Enjoyed every dish we had.  The braised pork belly was awesome, and normally don't like pork belly.
So scrumptious, familiar & cozy, like eating at your Chinese grandmother's house.

Pulling together another review after being here 5x in the last 3 weeks - always something new that surprises me. Every app - fantastic. Wait staff - fantastic. Ask for the chili oil! I really can't say enough good things abt this place and the people behind it

Would love to support my Chinatown businesses if we can actually get to eat there somehow. Called for 7:30pm reservations for 6 for a Wednesday at around 1:45pm. Lady on the phone said they were busy, call back at around 3:30-4pm. Called back at 4pm to ask for a table. Lady says no need for reservation, just come in. We roll up to the restaurant at 7:30pm just in time to see a guy pulling the gates down. Looked inside and the seats were stacked on tables, place was empty. I asked if they were closed, and the guy said "sorry, the workers are having "LNY dinner". (LNY was back in February.) I'm all for supporting businesses, especially a Cantonese owned spot, but am super disappointed at how we were treated. If I end up actually eating, I'll update this review. But for now the entire exchange left a sour taste in my mouth. The Chinese for the restaurant name translates to "Happy People," but our first time experience with the place left us less than content.

ugh. chose this place because the name of it is sentimental to my family. we had high hopes for this place. but tonight was just bad. we walked in around 7:30 & they said the wait was 45 mins. OK, we decided to wait because we saw people leaving. great, the wait wasn't 45 mins and we were sat within 20 mins or so. it was very crowded/busy. service was very mediocre and that's being nice. we ordered fish maw soup, honey jumbo shrimp, general tso chicken & sizzling steak. except the shrimp & steak took FOREVER to come out. everything did really. there were people who were sat after us that got their food first. we waited so long that we told them we didn't want the steak anymore. we were actually trying to leave after the soup & chicken but as soon as we mentioned it to the waitress, the shrimp was coming out. we ended up cutting our dinner short and not taking/eat the sizzling steak. overall, we're all super bummed.

This place is just awesome. Super friendly, great food, and a wonderful spot to visit when in Chinatown. The ingredients and textures of the food really stood out. I'm definitely coming back next time in the neighborhood!
No comment

My family and I dined here for mother's day. We ordered 10 dishes! EVERYTHING was delicious! My favorite was the Chenpi Duck, fried stuffed eggplant, and the fried red snapper in garlic sauce. The duck was so flavorful and tender! The crispy fried stuffed eggplant was so good! The fried red snapper was so crispy and meaty and the garlic sauce was super tasty! I will definitely come back soon! This place is officially one of my favorite restaurants in Chinatown!

Went on a Thursday for lunch . Lots of people, short wait..maybe 5 mins. Had to flag down for wait service because busy lunchtime other than that no other complaints.  Order the steam fish which was tasty and authentic Cantonese style and worth the extra wait while my friend almost finished her spare rib dish.  Prices and portion size are very reasonable. Definitely recommend this place!
The duck was mostly bones and there was a huge discussion because they did not want to split up the check.

Food is decent, service was okay, the lady loved to smile and the young boy is really energetic. But make sure you give a lot of tip when you go because otherwise, the guy at the counter is gonna call you on your way out and insult you for not giving enough tip that meets his standard. So for everyone who's planning to go there, make sure you empty your wallet for tips in order to protect that guy's self-esteem and his dignity.

I tried Uncle Lou and I love this place so much!  The place is spacious and tastefully decorated.  But what hooked me was their sweet and sour ribs.  It has the perfect balance of sweet and tart, crispy on the outside yet juicy and lean on the inside.  It was so incredibly crunchy even with all the sauce.  Without a doubt, its the best that I have tried from any place else and I always order this dish if it is available.  Their other items on the menu was just as delicious.  I can't wait to go back for more.  My gosh I can't stop thinking about those ribs LOL.

This place is amazing!  You walk in to a tasteful but stylized modern decor, full of plenty of instagram friendly backdrops, but the traditional lanterns and other classic touches let you know that Uncle Lou's is the real deal.  The menu reminded me of that classic Chinese food menu I learned to love as a kid and the food was some of the best I ever had!  Everything was delicious and my only regret was that I didn't have room to try more tasty dishes off the menu (something to look forward to for next time!).  This place is perfect for date night, a night out with friends, or an evening with family.  I will definitely be back and I highly recommend everyone checks it out.

The service here was awful.  A party that got seated almost ten minutes after us got all of their food when only two out of the four we ordered had come out.  I had to chase down the waitress to inquire about our missing dishes.  Then I gave a credit card for the bill, filled it out with no tip because I was going to leave the tip in cash.  Dashed for the restroom before doing so because it was crowded.  The waiter then proceeded to yell at my teenage daughter about the "missing tip".  My daughter was really upset when I came out of the bathroom.  So I had to set the waiter straight about his behavior.  He's lucky he got any tip out of me in the end.  NEVER coming back here EVER.  Oh, and the food was just okay.  I've had better in the vicinity.
10/10 recommend FOR SURE. So good!!!!!!! the orange beef was definitely my favorite !

Really excellent American Chinese food, the best I've had in a long while. It's a bit on the pricy side and the portions are small for the cost but the quality is excellent and the waitstaff efficient and well-trained. Definitely worth a visit. I'll certainly be back here.

Uncle Lou's is a most welcome addition to the rich Chinatown culinary world! A great mixture of delicious old school Cantonese/Toisan staples updated with some of the freshest and varied veggies I've ever seen on a Chinatown plate. The atmosphere and service couldn't have been better. My wife and I enjoyed a festive yet relaxing Lunar New Year Dinner here. We  will definitely be back. Thanks to Yu & Me Books for the recommendation!!!
Absolutely incredible. The food was delicious and the service was great. My favorite dishes were the eggplant with garlic sauce and the ginger fried rice. I'll definitely be coming back.

Came here for a family meal and I must say Uncle Lou is such a refreshing addition to New York City's dining scene. The space is welcoming, the staff is friendly, and food is perfection. The yuxiang eggplant, walnut shrimp, baby bok choy, and steamed fish were very well done and flavors were on point. The highlight for us was the crispy sweet and sour spare ribs. Will be back.

Food was absolutely fantastic. Had the egg drop soup, wonton soup, spring rolls, lo mein, fried rice and kung pao chicken. Service was inconsistent, but just have patience as it is their first week open. The staff was all extremely friendly and accommodating. Will be returning in the near future.

Tried it for the first time today. I will be a repeat customer. The crispy chicken was done just right, juicy with lovely crunchy skin and not too salty like other places. The steam carp was perfect. Also recommend the honey walnut shrimp. Service was professional. Nice decor and good spacing between tables.
You can order anything on the menu and you won't be disappointed. Highly recommend. Uncle Lou is very friendly and you can tell everything from the dishes was thought out with love to your plate

Best new restaurant in Chinatown! Classic Cantonese offerings in a setting that welcomes both old mainstays of the community, and young curious visitors looking for some reasonably priced comfort food
This place is great. Wonderful food, great prices, cool atmosphere, and great service! I recommend the roast pork buns :)

Highly recommend Uncle Lou-- great vibes, well-decorated (Vita Tea wall!), sweet staff, and amazing food! I loved the ginger fried rice and scallion rice noodle rolls (among many other yummy veg things) and my meat-eating friends were pleased with their choices, too. Portions are generous so I'm surprised I had room for the delicious tapioca dessert with taro and sweet potato, but so glad I did! Love this new addition to the neighborhood and will definitely be back for more soon.

We had a really unfortunate dining experience here. We waited for 20 minutes before even being acknowledged as several waiters walked by us to serve other tables. We stopped someone to ask if we could place an order. The appetizers came out in a reasonable time frame. Then we waited another thirty minutes, and finally decided to ask about the status of our order. The waiter said it was coming. By this point, all those who had sat down around the same time as us had already received their meals and finished eating. There was even a table that came in thirty minutes after us who had their entrees before we had our appetizers. They seemed to know the owner. After stopping the waiter again, he asked what we ordered.  He came out with one entree and then asked again what the other entree was, at which time we said just cancel the order and asked for the check. At the end they brought out the check immediately and said they did us a favor by not charging us for the second entree which we had cancelled anyway. We were disappointed as we looked forward to the food. Poor service outweighed the food. Such a bummer!

Uncle Lou's observes the Covid requirements faithfully and there are no surprises in the menu. You get what you pay for. There's a little bit of a surprise: for the price, the food is pretty dang good. To make you feel at ease, the decor, fixtures and spacing brighten the place, but is not imposing. The staff are friendly and also unimposing. The mini dim sum menu under Appetizers was good. I had the shumai, chicken feet and steamed ribs. The congee was good. While not exquisite, as total package, this place hits above the mark.
Great Food, alot of selections. Will come agian I recommend this place to all my friends and family when in Chinatown stop at Uncle Lou

We chanced this brand new restaurant while  walking around Christmas day. The food smelt so good and got demolished the second it was placed on the table. We loved the wonton soup, crispy orange beef, and Shanghai fun noodles. Glad we went here. Would go back in heart beat.
wonderful service, employees are very polite, and the food was amazing and comes with a lot

Such a pretty spot & perfect for brunch. This spot offers a strict pre-fixe menu that changes based on chef's choice & seasonality. Had the sweetest sweet peas as a starter & some duck breast with chili oil + ramp (instead of scallion) pancakes. For dessert we had cornmeal pudding with candied mangoes. Wondering if this is a BYOB spot, just missed some spirited drinks but not complaining. They also served up some very refreshing iced coffee perfect for 90 degree day.

Came here for a birthday party and absolutely LOVED it! I wouldn't be surprised if it's pretty hard to get a reservation in an average evening because it's so small but I love spots like this that have limited seating and limited space, everything's so well curated and the restaurant itself is absolutely adorable. The staff was all so lovely and made the evening that much better. It's definitely a spot that lot of locals love but even if you're not from the area it is a great experience that I would highly recommend!
No comment
No comment
What a lovely charming place. I love the atmosphere and I love the pre fix. Great concept! Highly recommended! And if you have the chance to have their sourdough bread, what a treat!

Such a lovely concept for a restaurant. Truly a hidden gem in the area. The chef himself came out to thank us for coming and they even adjusted the menu to make it vegan for me. Everything was delicious but I have to say the japanese sweet potato was to die for! Highly recommend.

We came here for brunch, we loved how the place was decorated, how kind the staff was and people being true to the "dinner party" concept which was talking to strangers! The food was incredible and quite a good portion for $22. I can't wait to come back to try their dinner! I highly recommend !!
No comment
Cute concept but the food was incredibly lackluster. It felt like something a not particularly talented at cooking friend would feed you
Fantastic! Homey, beautiful space, delightful staff, and the most delicious food. A great communal space and place to return to again & again as the menu shifts.

Food and service were amazing!! Vibe is so cozy. The only thing I'd mention is that the drinks were really expensive but the prices weren't listed in the menu. We ended up paying just as much for drinks as we did for the meal, which was a bit of sticker shock. But I will definitely come back and either BYO (which I saw others do) or just ask ahead of time :)
No comment
Couldn't ask for a more authentic home-cooked meal by the nicest people ever. Our 3rd visit. Love you guys. See you soon.

A New York gem. Really good food, adorable ambience, nice staff. A great neighborhood place. Their lunch picnic boxes are gourmet but for the same price as you can buy basically anything -- 16 or 18 bucks. Pretty sweet deal! This spot is new to the neighborhood, support them!
dinner party is an absolute delight. Every menu is thoughtful and scrumptious. Their sourdough goes OFF. Feels like home away from home. Also All the staff are really hot.
Impeccable service, food, and vibes. The owner and staff care so much about this place, and you can taste it in the food!!!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
The food is really good. The portion is on the smaller side. Excellent service! Cute ambiance,  good for brunch, lunch, or dinner.
No comment

Does not look (nor is it) fancy but the vibe was right, staff was cool (thank you Luis) and my nephew and I had a great time. Spicy feta app, grilled octopus, moussaka, and salmon platter just made for a delicious night. I've ordered from them on the past for take out, but being there was a great experience. Pictures are attached apologies but that spicy feta cane out first

This place was exactly what you need ! The service, the good and the ambiance was perfect. I sat at the bar while RUBEN was bartending and the drinks were perfect, strong but smooth. The music was good, and the food was good as well. Service is where it all starts and the whole team was smiles. If I lived in this neighborhood, this would be my neighborhood bar. I will definitely be returning ! Thanks for the hospitality Medusa, thanks to RICH as well.
Great food ! So delicious. Place and music wonderful. Thank you! I'm really recommending

We had put a reservation down for a party of 7, and they accommodated us accordingly even though it was last minute. A solid selection of appetizers. We ordered the Spanakopita and Zucchini Chips for appetizers. I went for the white fish which was phenomenal. Tad bit on the pricy side but the drinks are good, staff are nice, and the decor is modern and hip. Quiet Greek version of Miti Miti across the street (same owners). Will be back!
No comment
No comment

Last night we were celebrating a birthday of someone who needed to sit outside- they gave us a heated private patio! All of the food was outstanding! Almost everyone in our party had a food request/severe allergy , and our server handled it was care, precision, informed us of the ingredients and was able to give us veggies instead of bread- flying colors! Even my old-fashioned drink was divine!! We also had to split the check betwn 6 of us, and she cheerfully did so although it was quite complicated. We will all absolutely will be back here!
No comment

Decided to come back for more and brought the fiancé and he loved it as much as I did! We ordered the Greek Mac and Cheese which was wonderful! We also got the Loukomades (Donut dessert), which is a fried donut hole with honey and walnuts. They were both very good and so much fun! Definitely a place to go to if you want something different!
I have no complaints. I came hungry and left full. My food and drink was good. The aestheic and layout was nice too.

Really liked this place. Went for lunch and had the lunch special with a friend. We both had gyros (me, chicken hers, lamb) that came with pita chips or a salad if I remember correctly. Carb-lovers we chose the pita chips. We also had the icy Aphrodite (frose) for drinks which were quite good. Servers were kind and attentive. Their decor was cute. Would go back for dinner.
Very fun and laid-back spot! Looove the design and theme! The food was delicious and the service was great. Would definitely come back for more

We came here by chance looking at the high reviews and decided to give this place a shot. Came here on a Thursday evening and there were about 3 tables occupied. We sat outside in the patio section and the service was very good. We ordered the Branzino and the Greek plate with a lot of different veggies, my favorite being the okra with a tomato sauce. The food was just alright- nothing spectacular but the server who was the bartender as well was very attentive and kind.
Have always loved this little spot on 5th Ave. good good and delicious drinks - worth your time!
Great food and great serviceHad a great lunch with my brother.   I will definitely be coming back.
No comment
Best Greek food in park slope. Food is always fresh and fairly quick. I would say it's worth the money, even if it's a tad overpriced.
No comment

If you're in the area, you must stop by here for dinner. We came here in a Sunday night and they seated us right away. The ambiance is casual but very playful. We ordered the Greek fries pastitsio (Greek baked pasta) and the lamb platter. I felt like I was eating from a green grandmother with the pasta, it was soo good. I ordered the frose with ouma. My first time tasting it and I would compare it to licorice that's slightly fruity. Overall a good experience, I'll be back
No comment
No comment
No comment
Fantastic on site catering and service by the Medusa team and Sean, more food than we could handle, great diversity and friendly staff! Highly recommend

Saw all the good reviews so i decided to try this place out for lunch.  I am a huge fan of pastissio, this was just ok.  I am not used to it not being in lasagna shape, this was more like a loose ziti dish.  A bit on the bland side.  For a lunch portion at the price I paid, i was expecting a side salad or pita with it.
No comment
No comment
Food was to die for and the service was even better! Hugo was amazing. He anticipated my every need and was super sweet. Definitely try the cocktails too!
No comment

The staff at Medusa are a pleasure and go above and beyond to make sure every meal is above their standards of quality. Alvaro was our favorite. He was so lovely and helped us chose the best selections for my party. (I'm very picky with my food!) Happy Hour discounts. Everything is freakin' delicious! Check it out and see Rich.  The manager even made sure my party was happy, which is a rarity in Park Slope. Definitely check it out.

Medusa is a welcomed recent addition to the family! I already frequent Bogota and Miti Miti. In the height of the pandemic, I took my sister to Medusa to dine outdoors for her birthday which was amazing. On a whim, we decided to go back last night and it was perfect! Nini, our waitress, was amazing. She was SO sweet and gave the best recommendations. For food, we had the zucchini chips that came with an amazing tzatziki dip. In addition, my sister had the carne asada gyro ( Mini's recommendation) which was BOMB. I had the Hercules gyro, which contained American lamb, pork sausage, and chicken, and came with both marouli salad (so crisp, flavorful, and fresh) and fries. The meats were so well seasoned and balanced. For drinks, we got the mastiha mojito, Mr. Purple, blood orange margarita, lesvos + homos, and frosita. Ended the night with free shots as well!
Brandon our server was amazing. Brian the bartender makes great drinks. Highly recommend this place good ambiance and excellent service.
No comment
Kind staff, wonderful food! Whole table was very happy with their gyros. Cocktails also reliable.

Great food and lovely service. It's spacious so I felt like my friend and I could have privacy. My friend and I had the grilled octopus platter, and the massouka. Both very well seasoned and we didn't have to wait long for the food either. Coming back soon!
This is a great restaurant that is under appreciated.  Food is excellent, the restaurant is gorgeous and service I outstanding. We love it and come here often and are never disappointed.

Stopped by with some friends for an early bird dinner. The waiters and waitresses were very nice and attentive. And the waiting time was reasonable as there were not as many customers at that time. The amount of their fries and vegetable salad was big enough for 3-4 people to share. My dish was salmon with spinach. I cannot judge if it's authentic or not, cause I am not very familiar with Greek food. To me, it's just OK but not impressive at all. I have also noticed that their menu is not vegetarian-friendly, as there was only one veggie dish (eggplant) available in the entrees.
No comment

I was looking for a quick pre comedy show dinner and I'm very happy I found this place. The service was great and very quick when we mentioned we were in a rush. The food was delicious. I'm a vegetarian and loved the halloumi gyro (with fries). They have happy hour all day during the week and we were happy to take advantage of that fun perk. Definitely would recommend for a casual dinner and some great Greek food.

This place was a delight. I am suprised how empty it was! The food was ok but the staff made our dinner amazing. Nini and Brandon made sure oir drinks were exactly what we wanted and brought our food oit in a timely fashion. I would definately come her again

This place was so good! The food and service amazing. Will definitely be back! Came here with my father and sister and we were in love. We got the authentic greek salad to start and the dip sampler! We were full just off that!! If you like truffle, the truffle hummus will make make your taste buds dance. We also got the half roasted lemon chicken, pork platter and lamb platter. So so much food and flavor. We had left overs enough to feed us again the next day!!
Unbelievable time here tonight. Great local crowd, fresh and delicious food, refreshing well-poured drinks, and unbelievable service. I believe we had Brandon - what a guy!

Came here for brunch with the family and had an amazing time. From the start our hostess was very friendly and accommodating. Let's us move our table outside since it was so nice out and was easier to get a proper seat for the baby joining us. Drinks were solid for a brunch spot everything you'd ordinarily expect and done well. The dip sampler is great for a group good with sharing. A lot larger portion than I had expected so plenty for everyone. Fresh crudite and pita to dip with, we ordered extra cause it was so good. Personal favorites was the spicy feta and was pleasantly surprised by the black truffle Tamara. I normally don't like truffle but this was subtle enough to not overpower the tastebuds. My only complaint is I wish they had just a regular hummus as not everyone is a fan of beets and the flavor can be a bit much. For a main I went with the brunch gyro and loved it. So much flavor, and was able to use some of the remaining spreads to create some delicious unique bites along the way. Sooooo much food though. Will be back for sure.
No comment

Brandon was our sever and the food was absolutely amazing! Service was phenomenal and the vibes immaculate. We found this place a few months on Instagram and have been dying to go. Quick service, great portions and such friendly staff. Be sure to ask for Brandon! Well definitely be back as soon as we're in town again!

This place is fabulous and you'll love it's the fish is to die for and such good portions. Hugo the waiter and bartender is the sweetest. He knows the menu so well and always knows what to suggest. The rest of the staff is so nice too. Great meals here! I get the branzino. You'll love it.

Medusa was a choice made because my wife and I enjoy great GREEK CUISINE which I assure you this WAS NOT IT I ordered the branzino which btw is one my favorite fish and she ordered the baby lamb chops medium well. My branzino was tough the capers were old her lamb chops were served medium rare we had to send it back to be cooked more well to make a long story short I have been sick ever since I left the restaurant that was this past Wednesday evening it's now Saturday I'm starting to feel better. I definitely will not give these guys a second chance. I'm sorry.
Nene and Brandon were amazing! we are definitely coming back. Food here is amazing, great service, and overall great experiences! Checked in with us and was a friendly environment!
I went here for the first time with my family for my birthday and we all loved it! It is a really cool atmosphere with great Greek Food! I highly recommend it!

We loved this Park Slope find! It's got an eclectic, colorful decor, a delicious Medusa Brunch Burger filled with things I've never had on a burger before--including tomato jam made in-house--a killer spanakopita, and decadent, spongey Nutella loukoumades baby donuts. Not to mention, great service sitting at the bar with Brandon! Will definitely be back next time we're in the area.
No comment
The sampler of dips was delicious. The salmon was very flavor and perfectly cooked. The gyro platter was disappointing but the gyro wrap was good, although definitely need to order extra tzatziki.
No comment
No comment
No comment

We love Medusa!!! Not only is it a fun atmosphere, but the food & drinks are delicious and the staff is wonderful! When you go make sure to ask for Nini and go visit Brandon & Bryan at the bar. The gyros are delicious and although I always say I'll branch out and try something new, I can never stray from them. Looking forward to the warmer weather when they open the windows and bring tables out to the streets! It's the perfect spot for a night out or a fun brunch!!

Seconds after entering Medusa's doors after midnight on a random Thursday night, it was absolutely clear that we had made the right choice! The wonderful smells quickly transported us to another realm! Brian, our waiter and bartender greeted us with enthusiasm... and upon our request, he quickly and skillfully crafted signature cocktails using our spirits of choice. He was great with casual banter and helped us make our appetizer and entree selections which where all out of this world!!! The stuffed grape leaves are served warm, and although I didn't ask to confirm, their texture and flavor gave off homemade vibes; absolutely no words for the grilled octopus! Absolutely melt in your mouth tender and well-balanced flavors. On to my entree, a classic mousaka which was nothing short of mind-blowing, wonderful presentation, fresh ingredients, and layers of blissful complexity! Bravo to everyone at Medusa for creating such an aesthetically pleasing space to compliment our spectacular meal... thank you, Brian for attending to us so well! We look forward to returning soon!!! A+++
No comment
No comment
The food is amazing, and as a Greek person, that's saying a lot. Our server Marco made sure we had a great experience. It was such a blast!
No comment
No comment
No comment
Great spot for dinner, delicious food and drinks, not too busy. The server, Hugo was very accommodating! I'll be back for brunch.

My partner and I had dinner here on a few occasions. The food here is excellent, and Hugo ensured they accommodated our low carb diet. In an area with plenty of food options, this place really sticks out in a good way. We're looking forward to eating here again soon!
No comment

Friday evening we decided to head over to Park Slope Brooklyn , our "go-to" neighborhood for great eats! This night we actually let Yelp reviews determine were we would dine. We knew we wanted Greek food. Medusa Greek Taverna Turned out to be an excellent choice. Greeted with a warm friendly smile , seated right away our Server Mariah introduced herself . Such a lovely person. The atmosphere was Chic, Cozy, Comfortable , and Classy! Started off with a White Sangria for me, and my boyfriend had frozen Sangria, OMG both yummy! Not starving, but looking for a lighter choice on the menu. We ordered Grilled Octopus with a bean paste that was "OFF THE CHAIN" delicious, Fresh beet salad with goat cheese, Fried Calamari, Greek Olives . Everything was so delicious, definitely recommend this place. 5 stars ***** Cant wait to return. Thanks for a great meal. M & J

We came here on a Saturday night and it was not too crowded with outdoor seating available.  We ordered the pikilia (sampling of five dips- highly recommend!), spanakopita, grilled octopus (delicious but small portion), mac and cheese with orzo (flavorful but wasn't a huge fan) and the lobster gyro.  Service was attentive and food came promptly.  Most portions were big and we left the restaurant pretty satisfied.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Absolutely phenomenal Greek food. Everything was super fresh and the service was great as well. We  had octopus and rotators. The octopus s was chaired to perfections and the potatoes and a delicious dressing. The village salad was fresh and very well dressed. The short rib melted in our mouth and deserts we had the custard  pie made to order was everything. These are the same owners as Miti  Miti and Bogata. The next restaurant should be Italian bc they just do everything so good.

The hospitality from the staff here is so incredible. They are truly great people trying to offer you the best dining experience you can ask for. The food was incredible and even though I barely venture to Park Slope area this is such a cute spot in a prime area with extremely tasty dishes. My host George was such a gem as well. He was very attentive, not only to myself but everyone he came in contact with. They do have both an indoor and dining area but I preferred sitting inside because even the decor and vibe felt overall amazing. I would definitely be back for some gyros and a quick bite when I'm in the mood for great Greek cuisine!
Insanely good food, fair prices, large portions. This is the second time I've been here and I can't wait to go back. George, the incredible waiter who took care of my friend and I, is the bomb.
No comment
Amazing food. Amazing drinks. Fantastic service. The food is always fresh and Marco provided phenomenal and friendly service. Can't wait to come again. Thank you Marco
I was disappointed with the chicken platter.  I ordered Horta which I thought were the Lima beans bit ended up being the spinach. The platter for $23 was really sad.
Love the Greek frappe. So far we had small plates and it was all good. We also ate outside which made us fell safe.
was starving late night in the neighborhood and stumbled on Medusa, so good!! Brian was an amazing server. Definitely recommend!
No comment

My husband and I have been trying to get here since they opened but due to covid we were it's been hard. Finally made it out and Mark made our experience worth the trip out from queens. I highly recommend this restaurant. We started off with a few spreads and grilled octopus ( the grilled octopus is a must), we then couldn't decide what we wanted for our mains so we order 3 different ones, lemon chicken was so good and the with a strong but not overwhelmingly taste of lemon, I will be coming back for this dish. We also got the braised lamb platter as well as an order of baby lamb chops which were cooked to perfection. I highly recommend a meal here and hopefully you get to have Mark as your server, he was nice, friendly and very approachable.
Great, flavorful Greek food that is cooked perfectly! Couple this with an upbeat ambiance, and you e got a winning combination. All very authentic and delicious.

Came into Medusa, had a great time. Tapas were delicious. Bartender Brandon was super knowledgeable. Ended up sitting at the bar with Carolyn from  Miti their sister francise, shes amazing.  So much fun.  Come hang out with these guys at Miti and Medusa.
Had dinner with my girlfriend yesterday. Staffs were very friendly and food was delicious. We will definitely come back!
Great spot to eat! a highly recommend the zucchini chips (they were phenomenal). Brian was a fantastic server and was basically running the place. My fiancée thought he was easy on the eyes.

Nini was our server and she was amazing. The food was AMAZING and overall we were happy with our food. I got the octopus platter! I ate every bite. The brussel spouts were to die for. Also, the drinks? Please get ourself one. I had the cucumber jalapeño margarita and yeah...top tier. But back to Nini, she is the best!!!

I love authentic Greek food and decided to try Medusa when in Brooklyn for a few days. Our waitress Nini was also greeting customers at the door and her service was outstanding throughout the experience. She added her personal touch by taking time to converse with us and make menu recommendations when asked. The octopus appetizer was excellent, prepared well and served with gabs purée and capers. We did not have entrees but the brussel sprout salad was sufficient for a meal, and adding grilled shrimp made it over the top. Take a look at the description in the menu and you'll see what I mean. My son had the grilled chicken gyro with very good pita bread. It's a small place and I enthusiastically recommend it. The menu selections include a number of authentic Greek dishes. I will return to Medusa to try more.
The atmosphere is so much fun, and the food and drinks are amazing. Really enjoyed the vibe! I sat at the bar, and the service was great. Our server Brandon was extra attentive and hospitable!
Such a pleasant surprise. Amazing food and great service. Such a gem. Will definitely come back.

Could not recommend this place more. Food is delicious, service was quick. Hugo is awesome. I had the brunch burger. You must get the lemon potatoes. It was relaxed when we went on a Sunday afternoon, but they also have bottomless brunch if you're trying to party! Go now!

I was recommended Froze' by a local barkeep, i was weary. Meet a group of 4, sitting for brunch I had the lamb gyro and grilled octopus with my right hand. Outdoor service but we have to adjust. We enjoyed rounds of rainbows drinks and i forgot where I was. It was awesome and the bartender Wes was a solid. Would recommend to anyone visiting the slope. If you're up for a great afternoon, cheers, great ambiance and a break from the gentrification. Stay free my people.

Absolutely LOVED this neighborhood Greek place. The Happy Hour wine special is unreal ($8 a glass), the food is delicious, and the portions are big! The team is also so kind - Taylor and Lenie were awesome. Will definitely be back!!
Love the food! The wait time for the food definitely needs some work. But it's good solid food and the atmosphere is good, esp for brunch.
Absolutely delicious Greek restaurant in the neighborhood, with wonderful hospitality! My very Greek boyfriend approves.
The baklava was ridiculous.  Who knew sausages and yoghurt could be so good.  Very friendly staff.
Amazing food! They seem to prepare everything from scratch, and the output is beyond what I expect. I go for the spanakopita each time I visit. 5 stars for it!
No comment

Extremely disappointing meal.  Greek salad was tired, tasteless and small (and didn't even come with warm pita like most other places), fries were mushy and cold, and spanakopita was greasy and flavorless.   Absolutely terrible.
Came here to get some birthday drinks and Apps. Nini and Hugo took care of our group! Truly a great place! They'll take care of you! A++++++

The food was amazing, so great to find this restaurant in my neighborhood with authentic food. The service was top tier, we were served by Nini and she was so attentive and knowledgeable! She recommended our meals, and we all enjoyed them. Can't rave enough about the food AND service!!!
SO YUMMYYY and amazing service. Get the platter and thank me later :) BRUSSELS SPROUTS TOOO. So unbelievable and friendly staff

Amazing spot with great food and ambience. We ordered the zucchini chips, grilled octopus and the grilled shrimps as the appetizers. The seafood was fresh and well seasoned and the zucchini chips were fried light and crispy. It was not greasy at all! For entrees, we ordered lamb chops and the branzino. They were cooked perfectly and even the sides were delicious. Overall, I love the food but we also love the service. Everyone greeted us with a warm welcome and we were lucky to have Brandon as our waiter. Great service. Highly recommend.
No comment

Without a reservation, we waited about 30 minutes to be seated on a busy Saturday night. Well worth the  wait. We all (4) shared the Village Salad, so fresh with great dressing. I ordered the Spanikopita, great Phylo crust. My husband ordered 1/2 roasted chicken, great portion size  and tasty. My DIL ordered okra and sardines, she loved it   My son ordered short ribs with orzo. His was delicious but disappointed with the size of the meat, about 2" square, lots of orzo. We also shared the Greek fries,  really good. With Three alcoholic drinks, total was $175 with tip. Rather pricey but we would r
Such a great find! Good food and service! Pita chips with the eggplant dip were my fave and the waiter Hugo was so sweet! Definitely will be back.

Best gyro in the area. Meat is never dry. Not that cheap tasteless stuff you get at some Greek places. They care about their food. Fresh ingredients and a solid menu. Cool vibe at the storefront and also strong on delivery. If you want Greek this is a good bet. Also recommended the spanakopita, the dips(some are better than others I could do without the favs dip) moussaka, pastitsio. One note I love the fried zucchini chips but I have had some times where it is too salty and not as crisp. When they nail it it's amazing! They could work on consistency, that being said it's always still pretty tasty.

Loved this new gem in park slope! I am vegetarian and found so many veggie/vegan options that I was blown away. Definitely recommend the zucchini chips. Would so return to try the 5 spread sampler; looked very enticing. Our server Mark was very courteous in the recommendations and went above and beyond to make sure we were pleased and catered to. Since I made a reservation we were given a nice seating. I loved the geek vibe and touch all over from the medusa at the entrance to the Greek statue models on the ceilings and the blue clean crisp bar setting etc. entire staff was attentive. The vegan baklava in the end was so yummy, packed 1 to go as well. The mocktail list is very interesting. I enjoyed the Trojan horse which had a smoky taste to it. Can't wait to return!
The food smelt so deli from the street it drew me in. It truly lived up to my expectation. The food was delicious! Hugo was just fantastic offering wonder suggestion.
The waitstaff (Hugo) as well as the food was exemplary. Each and every plate was delicious and the waitstaff were friendly and knowledge about the menu. The prices were so reasonable too!!
No comment
No comment
Delicious and fun! Went there for a friend's birthday dinner- our server, Marco was super attentive and made the evening special, along with the whole staff! Thank you!!

Got delivery a couple of times from here and it hasn't been great. Today I ordered a couple of gyros - both were totally soggy / left the bread inedible. I think you guys should really pack the bread separately. Also the salad that came with the gyro was truly just a pile of shredded lettuce with a sprig of dill in it. Hardly a salad. The lamb was tender / tasty. This place might just be better if you go in person.

We were looking for some yummy Greek food at a place that was COVID-safe with good vibes and Medusa was perfect!!! The dining out front was very warm and ventilated. The food was fabulous, as were the all day happy hour deals. Our waiter had great energy that made us feel so welcomed. Wow- we will be back soon!!!

Enjoyed a delicious meal and appetizers. The drinks are really great! Our waiter George was very friendly and provided wonderful service. The restaurant interior was very inviting and they took every precaution in regards to spacing and cleanliness. Can't wait to go back!

Came here with my friend for lunch, very nice ambiance super clean.  George the waiter was super nice, attentive, it was my friend first time having Greek food,  George took his time and explained few nice options. The food was delicious, portions are filling, we ordered zucchini chips was so good, spinach spanakopita, we also had desert and Greek coffee. This is my 2nd time here and I had very good experience

This spot has a great service team, especially our server George! He recommended excellent wines and food. The octopus, shrimp and lamb is on point! When we had a small issue with the cook on the salmon George took care of it right away and everything else we had was perfect!
No comment
No comment
Ordered delivery of gyro and baklava - fast delivery and delicious wrap. The fries on the other hand were ... well not good. Definitely will order from them again.

Went here last night with my boyfriend for a Saturday date night. Was waited on by a wonderful, well informed, very attentive waiter named George. Excellent food, excellent service and fantastic Greek wine George was happy to tell me about. Going to make this my go to date night place!

Came here for a bday dinner, and had an amazing experience! Our server was dynamic! We requested they play Beyoncé's Coachella album, and they kept it on Beyoncé for the entire evening. When Spotify switched in an R Kelly song, they immediately changed the song, showing that not only was the food and service great, but that the staff is conscious. The food is GREAT! Definitely get the lamb platter if you come here.
No comment
No comment

I wish i could give it more stars! We had a great time there with friends. You can order just about anything on the menu and not be disappointed -- it's all very good. My waitress was super friendly, very fast and my food was pretty darn good. I am a fan!

Awesome place with great food.  Seems to be an addition to Bogota and Miti Miti which are so tasty. Staff is super responsible with COVID precautions, we had George whose food suggestions and drinks were spot on and he was very nice. Spanakopita was perfect and the icy Aphrodite goes down real nice!

Stopped in for an early dinner and was pleasantly surprised with a wonderful dinner consisting of the sampling of spreads with pita. The feta and pepper spread being at the top of the 5 served, but they were all delicious (eggplant, pea, fish, tzatziki were main ingredients in the other 4). Greek village salad, which we ate along with the apps: Nice dressing, well presented and tasty. Chocolate mousse for dessert to share (as it's big) and coffee. I also enjoyed a mocktail. Wait staff were very polite and considerate. New restaurant sparkle. Worth a visit.

I went here on 4-7-21 with my girlfriend and the brussels sprouts were the best brussels sprouts I have ever tasted. It had the perfect amount of crips and a tiny touch of sweet... so tasty. The beet hummus was also impeccable and the margarita was spot on. The best part of this spot was the service. A young man with long black hair served us and he was truly pleasant and helpful and kind.
No comment

Horrible service. I don't know how this place is operating. Not professional at all. I ordered food from them for two people and  for the price I paid for, the portions were tiny. I called them and they said they would take care of me. I went in today to meet with the "manager" and they didn't want to do anything about it and barely would match the amount I spend. The front cashier guy was rude and told me he can't help me because they are busy. After speaking with the manager arif , they finally gave me some food complimentary. They were very rude and they even left the food outside on the floor for me like I'm a piece of a dog and told me to pick it up. SMH.We all want to support small businesses but not these kind. Don't waste your time but head over to greek xpress near prospect park. Never going back here ever again. Good luck trying to fight with the management if you're not satisfied or have any problems with your orders.
No comment

I heard that a new Greek restaurant opened not far from Barclay's so I decided to give it a try. Medusa is small attractive restaurant that has a lot of potential. I did not have my gf with me so I opted to dine at the bar. First problem is that the bar stools do not have a back's and are very uncomfortable. The second problem is that they do not have a winter awning, and every time  that the door opened I got blast of cold air. The staff are very hip, but not very experienced. Now to the food. Tzatziki sauce is good, not great. Mussel's were very good, and the Octopus was tender, but not very fresh. Lastly, The bathroom's do not have hot water, and I washed my hand's with ice cold water. I will return once the weather get's warm, and post another review.

came to medusa for a second time and had an amazing time the food was on point and service was on point i sat at the bar where i met carolyn from miti miti the sister restaurant and she was amazing told me all about the boozy brunch she was very welcoming i will definitely make a stop in to visit her great businesses

Ordered in for delivery on a whim and was very pleasantly surprised. The chicken with potatoes was incredible. So were the Greek meatballs. I will definitely order again. I almost gave a 4 star review because we ordered through Caviar and they suck, super high fees and they actually delivered to the wrong address and didn't even attempt to get it to us. Since that's not the restaurants fault I don't feel it's fair to discredit them I will never use Caviar again however.

LOVE this place. We have eaten in and also ordered delivery and both experiences were great. The food is amazing and the service is thoughtful. When there was a mixup with our order, they called right away and got it sorted out. Thank you!!!!
B. E. S. T. authentic Greek food I've ever had!  The salads were so fresh and tasty!  The calamari was so fresh and crispy!  The lemon potatoes are the best ever!

Food is superb. I ordered a Greek omelette with Greek cheese fries, and wow!! Pretty much restaurant heaven for anyone who likes a good vibe, awesome people and delicious food. Will definitely be going back!
Best Greek in the area for sure! Delicious and strong frozes! Fresh salads and love the chicken gyro. Gotta also get the baklava mmm

This might have been the best octopus I've ever had. The waiter George was so sweet and as a Greek family my mother and I loved that he spoke Greek and lived there for a little as-well. He was so sweet and made great cocktails also. The food was amazing and they have outdoor seating all COVID friendly with heating and what not. The best Greek place in the neighborhood.

Hi! I am new to Yelp just created it a few days ago and have officially joined the help team. Not sure if any bios was owners will respond because I didn't see many responses on the page. You guys should be more active. I live in park slope and often find myself passing by places that seem so nice, but never have the time to sit and eat at them. I was passing by the other day and decided to come and eat some lamb chops. I was greeted by Juan and Lillian. (Both great people by the way.) Lillian was my waitress and was very attentive and nice. She was able to answer all my questions and trust me I had a lot. I ate the Lavraki which was so good. The one star was taken off for the wait time because I ended up waiting around 40 minutes for my food. When the waitress told me it would take longer for it to cook I didn't expect to be waiting there for 40 minutes. I then ate the chocolate mousse which was okay. I wish it was served colder and was a more lighter and creamy texture. As for the lavraki it was great. Definitely worth the wait. I really love the service here. I can't wait to come back. I' definitely will ask for Lillian or Juan again thank you guys!

My partner and I had a great experience with outdoor dining at Medusa tonight. The heat lamps are perfectly positioned for maximum warmth. I highly recommend the Figalicious cocktail, a fun twist on an old fashioned with fig jam, and the Medusa Burger, which had an insane tomato jam. What can I say, this place knows its jams! To top it off, our server George had such a joyful and positive energy. Loved it.

Honestly I go to a lot of Greek restaurants and this one was just great!! It doesn't look like anything much from the outside but inside it's super cute, has a very chic vibe and the food was excellent. Every dish we ordered was perfectly seasoned. The lamb chops very just excellent and a good large portion. The zucchini chips are a must. We were served by Mark and he was a phenomenal waiter and host. He was professional and attentive and always willing to go above and beyond. Thanks Medusa for a wonderful Greek surprise in park slope.
Good service. Unfortunately the food is subpar, the branzino we had was dry and moussaka was a strange sweet taste.
Good flavors love the Medusa sauce but $15/$16 for Gyro is a bit too pricy for me.  Would go back for a more fine and dine type meal however where such a price point would make sense.

Got the zucchini chips, lamb gyro with fries, and baklava. All delicious, the zucchini chips being my favorite (seriously could not stop eating them). Also, our waiter, Ari, was great and created an awesome vibe while we were there.
Fantastic restaurant the food was delicious and the staff was active I would recommend this restaurant to my friends,the food quality was superb I would look forward to come here again

BEST NEW RESTAURANT IN BROOKLYN. This place is absolutely divine. The chef came out and greeted every table and we couldn't help but talk his ear off about how incredible the food was. The short rib with orzo was out of this world!!
Food was delicious and platters were huge! Brandon was friendly and accommodating :) We opted for indoor dining and felt very safe!

Celebrating the New Year with another delicious take-out from Medusa Taverna. We ordered items we had not yet tasted, (octopus, spanakopita, moussaka, okra, zucchini chips, baklava) in addition to their wonderful spreads and salads. We have enough for 3 meals! The portions are substantial. The octopus was divine.  Spanakopita was so light and fluffy.  Marvelous. Loved the zucchini chips. Warmed them in the oven. The other food remained hot. The packaging is top-notch. Everything in its own little tight-fitting container. Nothing leaked. So fortunate to live within 15 minutes of this superb restaurant. Truly authentic Greek food!

This place is amazing. Good food. Great for sharing with a bunch of friends on a cold rainy evening. Our server George was quite nice as well and very knowledgeable in helping us plan our evening. Really recommend if your itching for Greek or even more so just some good pita spreads and meats!

Best restaurant I've been to in a long time. Went to Greece about two years ago and since COVID I thought I would never experience the food again...I was wrong. Medusa has the best AUTHENTIC Greek food you can find. Only thing that compares to the food is the service. Again, having been to Greece the people there were so welcoming of tourist. The staff and owners of were so kind and generous. You have to go to this restaurant. Order take out and make a night of it. Once restrictions are lifted we are bringing our parents here. Best food in BK!!
Fabulous Greek food (don't miss the stuffed grape leaves) and terrific service. Ask for George; he's the best!

I ordered my beloved pastichio and couldn't even finish it. I've never tasted a pastichio that doesn't even resemble at all in taste, what the actual dish tastes like. Everything was unseasoned making the meat taste very unappetizing and the dish bland. My stomach feels sick thinking about the taste of the food. There were NO spices used. I'm so disappointed. The leftovers went to my dog.
We had a really good experience here! The customer service is wonderful! Highly recommend the leg of lamb platter with the bird del sprouts!

Excellent spot with great service! Outdoor dining is nicely set up and servers are all observing safety procedures. Loved the zucchini chips, grape leaves, meatballs, and brussel sprouts. Our server George was fantastic!

I ate there yesterday for lunch for my cousins birthday and everything was absolutely delicious. We had the assorted dips, calamari, Greek salad and fried cheese to start and then the delicious octopus and chicken for entrees. Yummy cocktails as well and our server George was super attentive, knowledgeable and sweet. Overall we had a great afternoon with great food and service. Thanks!

I have always enjoyed my delivery food from Medusa Greek Taverna before, but last night my food was so nearly inedible that I'm still mad at myself for eating as much as I did.   I have never ordered the moussaka from them before but I was really looking forward to it. What arrived was a takeout dish of lots of lukewarm potatoes, a small amount of  ground lamb and a few oversized slices of eggplant topped with an entirely loose unset béchamel slopping over the sides.  No spice, sauce or even salt, .   It was easily the worst moussaka I've ever had.  It seemed like they didn't actually have any moussaka when I ordered it and they just threw some ingredients in a tub and hoped for the best.  The Horta tasted a bit rancid as if it had been cooked in oil that was not fresh. I couldn't eat more than a bite of it. The meals redeeming feature was the Greek yogurt topped with cherries which was delicious as always. I don't know what happened to this restaurant, but this was severely disappointing. Desperately need a good Greek restaurant around here.

This place is great.  Ordered delivery and everything was dynamite.  We got one of the family combination dinners with the chicken and pastichio and the lemon chicken.   It reads as pricey but this was a very good deal.  Will become our Greek go to in the area.
As frequent travelers to Greece and lovers of Greek food, this was not Greek food.... it was disgusting and inedible though. And directly went into the trash. Time to order pizza....

At the end of a day when the whole shelter at home thing was really getting me down, I really really really wanted to try a new restaurant. I found Medusa Greek Taverna on Caviar. And I'm so glad I did. The food was DELICIOUS! And delivered far faster than estimated. The halloumi gyro was exactly the comfort food I needed. And the sampler of dips was so flavorful. So happy I have leftovers of all of them to keep enjoying. The food reminded of food I ate at tavernas in Athens. I'll be ordering from Medusa again, and can't wait until I can visit in person.

Great 1st experience, from beginning to end.  Cool vibe, welcoming door staff, good cocktails, terrific server (Andrew), great food...we'll be back.  Only thing to keep an eye on is that there's some overlap in the dishes (ie zucchini chips contain tzatziki...so, don't also order tzatziki).  We'll be back
Great unhurried service, good food, nice vibe. A great option in the Slope. I will be back.

Had a DELICIOUS meal here, super creative menu building on all Greek classics I know and love.  Ambiance and staff are great.  Spread sampler was a great way to start off, the Zuchinni Chips were amazing, Cypriot Halloumi dish incredible, Fish Plaki, Tsipoura, and Steak entrees were all excellent.  Will definitely be back soon.
Really delicious food (best Greek salad I've ever had) and amazing service. Highly recommend!

Delicious, delicious, and this is from a Greek American...the food was totally authentic and the standouts were the avgolemono (egg lemon) soup, the pasticio, and truly everything we had was fantastic. This is going to be our regular go-to!

I have been a very satisfied follower of Le Botaniste for many years. My former colleague used to do marketing for them they so even catered to my office back in 2016. I did some silly pics for their IG once. I went to Belgium and saw their pre-opening back in 2018. I attended the opening party of this location and I am only my sharing all of this because their food has been so incredibly CONSISTENT & BEAUTIFUL the entire time. I remember they started Le Pain long ago and an old friend of mine ces worked their too. And while that chain is good, it does not have the small, artistic and sweet vibe of Le Bot. It's a good spot in soho, walkable to whatever else you could dream of. I want to steal their cute plates with their prescription vegetable art on it but I won't. Would love to have a location in Brooklyn!

This place is wonderful, love the ambiance and perfect vegan lunch spot. Love the chili and I had the coconut ceviche was amazing. Service was very friendly the nicest people. I can't wait to come back

Stopped in for a quick lunch and loved every part of this place. The food was fresh and delicious! It was very easy to find dietary friendly options. I ordered the Pasta Bolo (gf) topped with steamed greens and a Red Beet detox juice. They had indoor and outdoor seating if you want to stay and eat. I ordered my food to go but sat outside because it was too good to leave. A gem if you're in NYC!

No comment
Love Le Botaniste - their food tastes and feels clean. My friends and I often find ourselves coming here for the food and lemonade!

Came for an early dinner, and seating indoors and outdoors was plentiful. The food was prepared immediately and was relatively inexpensive. The wine by the glass option was small but straightforward. Taking off a star because of how much rice/quinoa there was, to the point where finishing the meal caused indigestion.
No comment

Simply amazing, health conscious vegan food. The entire place is gluten free, and they are local and organic whenever possible. I love supporting businesses that really have this in their ethos. Delicious. I ordered the coconut ceviche, gazpacho, a miso bowl and a curry bowl. The flavor is fantastic, portions just right, and overall vibe of the apothecary is delightful. Would come again!!!

No comment
Truly the best vegan organic food in NYC. I come back here often. My non vegan friends enjoy this place too. If you care about your body and your health, this is the restaurant for you.

I can't say anything but this place was amazing! Found it on a fluke and so happy about it. The food was tasty and of incredible quality. Plus, they offered beautiful wine to accompany your meal. Super excited to come back - this location had seating outside so people watching us just as great! Definitely recommend if you're in the area.

Always so so good! Great food..I've tried everything so far and not one thing disappointed. Of course chili sin carne is one of the faves along with Tibetan mama. New fave: beat balls! Soft juicy and flavorful. Lovely cafe  if I could eat here every day I would.

Food was delicious! The girls behind the counter were miserable though, not an ounce of welcoming energy or a friendly smile between them.
No comment

No comment

So it should be said I walked into this place one Saturday evening for the first time with the expectations of it being overrated. I actually held out on trying it for a while because of this thought. But let me just say I am still pleasantly surprised, and satisfyingly FULL, hours later-- and i am not a devout vegetarian by any means and still love my dead meat here and there. The food tasted fresh and flavorful with being try hard. They didn't even base everything around soy, which is great because my gluten/celiac intolerance is not fond of all these seitan/tofu meat substitutes. Adored the small, transparent setup with the pots of food right there-- similar to Hu and slightly less pricey. Tasteful. Casual chic ambiance, with a small bar area with some stools giving a cross between cafe/bar/diner. friendly, knowledgeable, helpful staff and overall creative vibe. Yes, everything is vegetarian and gluten free. Stuffed my face with the diy hot bowl and took the dessert (brownie) to go, with the cashew sauce on the side. It was a little dry by itself but the cashew sauce brought it from just alright to chefs kiss  I'd go back tmrw if I could

Impeccable design and amazing food. I felt satisfied and light as a feather eating their organic plant based food. Their tasty gluten free options are a win for even the most discerning taste. I'm a meat eater and I didn't feel like I was missing out. Nice to have options and switch it up..
The food and service were wonderful! We loved every single dish. I would go back in a minute!
No comment

Ugh, one of my favorite places and I'm not even a vegan or vegetarian! That shows you how amazing this food is! I usually get the Tibetan mama and it's just amazing! So much flavor in one bowl! If you haven't tried this place yet, you've got to try it. Hands down the best place
No comment
No comment

Great spot for lunch, dessert , or Coffee/Tea.  The staff was helpful to answer all my questions.  The key lime pie was tasty and Americano was nice and hot and kept my hands warm while sitting outside.  Can't wait to come back and try the entrees.
No comment
I love this place! The food feels really clean and I love knowing there is no cross contamination with gluten! Tasty to boot!

I've been on the search for vegan places to buy lunch from in the city. Soooo happy I came across this place! I absolutely love it! The food is delicious. They are available on food delivery apps but after seeing pics of the place I wanted to go and pick up my lunch in person. Be prepared to wait on a line if you go during lunch hours.  I arrived around 12:20 PM and was on line for approximately 15 minutes before I could order. I absolutely loved the spicy chili sin carne. The bowl includes: brown rice, tri-colored beans, quinoa, chili sin carne, ersatz sour cream, turmeric onion, and fresh herbs. It wasn't necessarily spicy but the flavor profiles were amazing! The ersatz sour cream caught me by surprise with how good it tastes. The turmeric onions had a beautiful bright color and tasted great. I am definitely going to be trying out different things off the menu. The food is on display behind glass panels while the staff prepares your meal. You're able to get a good view of the different options. If you are sitting inside, I did hear that they asked people for confirmation of vaccination status. When you pay at the register you can sign up for their loyalty rewards. Give this place a try for sure if you're looking for amazing vegan food!

My go to place in Soho for clean, gluten free and plant based food. The pasta bolo with gluten free pasta is my fave; I like how the bolonese & basil sauce mixes in. The beet & carrot juice is really good & well priced. My other faves are red beet caviar & green pea hummus. The coffee & wine is good here too. Love the spot; very hipster vibe. Ordering style is ready to serve bar style. (The UWS location is smaller but walking distance to Central Park & location in midtown East)
No comment
Stunning food.  Super tasty and flavorful - I had the bolognese.  Responsible packaging and fairly priced.  Best delivery meal in a long time.

Interesting menu and great food, plus on a delivery order we inadvertently threw the staff a curve ball (around an allergy-related special request) they couldn't easily handle. Huge praise for both adapting and communicating perfectly - big thank you!!

I really wanted to like this place, but it wasn't great. It's a healthy "fast food." I do love that they're plant based and they have a variety of choices. We got the summer roll, pasta bolo, miso noodles for dinner and the apple volcano for dessert. I liked the magic miso the best. All not fantastic, but not bad.

went here for a quick pick up in the middle of our shopping trip today and was pleasantly surprised by the sleek interior and apothecary vibe. It's like an update looking rice bowl place with interesting vegetarian options. Met a cute girl that recommended some of her favorites. Definitely will drop by again!

INCREDIBLE. I got the Tibetan mama and my friend got the botanical salad. We both loved our meals and would recommend. It was the perfect portion size to fill me up and did not leave me feeling heavy and gross. The decor was beautiful as well. Worth the price I would say.
To find this place made our trip so much better. Homely healthy hearty vegetarian food that you can count on while eating outside. I hope they also open a branch in Austin.

Possibly the best vegan restaurant I've been to! The employees were super helpful and sweet, the food was AMAZING, and the interior decor could not be more perfect. The aesthetic of this place is such a unique blend of London chic and Harry Potter plant classroom! It's an absolute must- visit, and has several locations here in NY. Please order the chili, as it comes poured over brown rice, topped with turmeric and loads of sour cream! And also don't miss out on the brownie with creme sauce! YUMMMMM!!
No comment

Great casual spot for lunch or dinner. Always feel good after eating the food here as it's wholesome and delicious. I'm a big fan of the make your own bowl so I tend to do my own thing instead of sticking with one of their classics but definitely can't go wrong with anything you get. Fresh/ amazing flavors and the ambiance is very cute!

For my first time being there, the service was terrible. Server was annoyed when we asked her questions about the food. She was also annoyed that we did not order fast enough. I was with 2 other people, both ordered and I was skipped as server helped next customer while I was still on line. When cashier asked server if she was prepping my food, server had the audacity to ask if I was still eating. She then tossed the other customers food back on the counter to "help" me. Disgusting. Very disappointing because food was good.

My best friend is vegan on the west coast so I always like to try vegan spots that are local to me. The decor and their style really caught me eye. Super cute, cozy and creative, so took a chance. The food is clean and tasty. My friend had the chili and I had the coconut curry and man we were so full! We wanted to have sweets after but just couldn't! Just another excuse to go back! Thanks to the friendly staff at this location
No comment

We stopped by for a quick brunch on a Sunday morning. The food was delicious (see photo), and they are well set up for covid safety measures. The people behind the counter were courteous and helpful in terms of suggesting what to get. Try their "Tibetan Mama," it's out of this world. Not to mention the "Superseed Avocado." Accompany with one of their organic wines. Overall a definitely pleasant experience.
I like the turmeric onions, though didn't expect it to be sour. The Morocco broth is a bit salty

I came here because I was looking for a healthy food restaurant. So glad I came here, the food is absolutely delicious!! Honestly, one of the best meals I've ever had. For someone whose a meat-eater, I didn't think a restaurant that is meat-less and dairy-less (100% plant-based) would be good...but I was pleasantly surprised, the food is both filling and tasty! I got the DIY hot bowl w/the "spicy chili sin carne" sauce--10/10!! The bowls are a generous portion. The prices are reasonable (2 DIY bowls + coffee + tea came to $42 or so). The place itself is very clean, nice and casual (they have indoor and outdoor seating). You buy the food at the counter and sit where you like. Love it! I definitely will be eating at this place again and again :)
No comment

I had the Bolognese Pasta (V, GF) and it was exquisite. The pasta was very good, and didn't taste like it would be gluten free. The sauce had chunky tomatoes, vegan meat, and flavors of garlic and herbs. All in all, a great restaurant for vegans and non-vegans alike to visit.
No comment

A someone who's not vegan, this place blew my socks off! I was hesitant since vegan food has always been a hit or miss for me, but the food was so flavorful and really left me happy with my choice. I got the Tibetan Mama -- I thought I'd try curry, an infrequent food for me. The curry was smooth and spiced, vegetables were well marinated and not soggy at all. 10/10 would recommend!

Great food! Ordered takeout and the food was hot and ready when we arrived. Highly recommend.

The best vegan food I've ever had. The veggie sushi roll was incredible and the veggie balls too. The employees were all so nice and welcoming too.
Food was amazing. Had the beet spread. So clean. I could eat like this everyday. My wife had the bowl with chickpeas and beets and other veggies. Overall very solid
