The food is good but customer service is so bad. One of the staff members has a major attitude problem. God forbid you ask her something! She constantly yells at the customers. She should be back in the kitchen not upfront dealing with the customers. I would love to keep coming back but unfortunately I don't want to get yelled at for asking questions.

Every time I have lunch here I feel amazing afterwards. This restaurant is so good and the outdoor seating is great. I had the Tibetan mama and it was to die for. I also wanted the coconut ceviche but they didn't have any when I went. Will definitely have to go back and try it next time! This is an all organic restaurant plant based restaurant and I love that.

Trying to eat healthier in 2020 and this may be my go-to spot for organic vegan fast and casual eatery. Everything on the counter is so beautifully presented with so many rich colors and variety of ingredients. I ended up getting the Vegetable Tarjune and it was very hearty and starchy because they put like a million potatoes in it. But it was perfect for a cold night. Also ended up getting the Mezze spread which I probably didn't need but it was worth a try. There's no table service so you just order what you want and sit anywhere. I also love the apothecary inspired decor. Would definitely come back again and try their other stuff on the menu.

Food is Medicine. If you're looking for Whole Food Plant Based Fare this is your place. The food is very interesting not just a side show to meat like most WFPB dishes. Service is friendly and it's served in attractive And trendy Le Crueset pots. Many will dig that. The food tasted ok. Maybe a bit of a disappointment since everything else was awesome. Maybe I had the wrong dishes. I'll give this place another shot and try some other dishes.

I love this place since everything here is organic and it's totally a steal for the price! The food tastes good for vegan and it's actually healthy. I had the chilli which was pretty good. It's so hard to convince friends to give this place a try but it's good enough for me!

Food was good not amazing. The inside of the restaurant had a pretty quaint French decor. I didn't try the chili but it smelled delicious especially on a cold day. I would def visit again and try something new. I liked the Decor better than the food but am willing to give it another try.

So good ! I love everything here. The flavors are so clean and delicious . Sometimes you can smell the strong spices from outside. I'm obsessed with the dressings  try the brownie and those flat cookies with tons of seeds .

I have heard a lot of great reviews from friends and colleagues about Le Botaniste. However, to be frank, I am very underwhelmed with the meal I had. I ordered the beer balls with tzatziki, seaweed tartare, and veggie sushi. Out of a score of 100, I will give it maybe a 43.5. The environment of the restaurant is great, however I did not enjoy the food. The beet balls were stale, the seaweed tartare didn't have a great taste, and the veggie sushi was decent at most. However, I will say that the tzatziki had a very alive and fresh taste as well as the sauce given for the veggie sushi. I do not think I will be coming back.

Once you walk into Le Botaniste you'll be entranced by the aroma of the food. I always get the Vegetable Tajine with tofu and super-seeded avocado.  It is pricey but I think the quality of the food can justify it as a nice healthy treat. I also have to say the staff are all super friendly and informative. I've seen some of the most entitled asshole customers come into Le Botaniste and I'm amazed at how graceful the staff handles these people. Ha. 10/10!

Very beautiful decor, interesting dishes, pleasant service. A great place for lunch or a date.

By far my favorite go to vegan place! So many options and choices. This place is the smartest company. They know what they are doing.

Quick counter service spot with a unique selection of vegan meals. Light and airy atmosphere with plenty of seating during dinner hours. The employees are extremely helpful and charming. Organic wines to sip on and healthy dessert options as well. What more could you ask for?

As a vegan it took me a while to try le botaniste and all I can say is I wish I had tried it sooner! Im obsessed with the green pea hummus, it has hints of mint in it too.I literally had to recreate this myself I was so obsessed. Theres so many other menu items to try too I love how you can subsitute nearly anything. I also thoroughly enjoyed the Tibetan mama over cauliflower rice its so nourishing.

Update: STILL IN LOVE WITH THIS PLACE!! Their Tibetan mama curry is pretty gnarly but I ventured out and tried the Moroccan tajine soup. Guess what??? STILL AMAZING!! I hope other restaurants and the food industry as a whole can adapt this way of "food is medicine" thinking as well Will definitely be coming back -even with my nonvegan friends- until I try everything on the menu! So far I haven't been disappointed!!

Randomly found this place with my dad and we had the best meal here. He's vegan and I am not so we were able to get a variety of items which still left us with leftovers! Recommend the box of chocolates although be warned the box is $15 but it contains 24 pieces of raw, vegan chocolate which is a pretty good price. Do not get the biscuits! They contain no sugar and therefore it tastes like a dog biscuit. Other than that the desserts looked good!

Just beautiful!!! What a stunning place with beautiful food! Great selection of salads, bowls, soups and sweets. Nice that they also have a wine bar. Everything we tried was delicious. I would say fit self serve the wine is very overpriced but that is my only complaint

Myself, my husband and couple  of friends were absolutely starving after a tea testing beforehand and my friend suggested Le Botaniste. My husband wasn't impressed with the idea as he is a masssive carnivore however he quickly changed his mind  as soon as we stepped inside. This place is beautiful with very chic and stylish deco. Their food bar is quite extensive and had a lot to offer even for those  with rather picky taste buds. We tried "chilli con carne" as well as tagine- both delicious and our friends "bolognese" and bespoke salad. The food was full of flavour, filling and very tasty. They also have wine on their menu but somehow I would go there to drink alcohol. Do go and visit if you're vegetarian or simply fancy some creative veggie food. Oh their chocolate mousse was yummy also. Wouldn't no other with the quinoa  brownie in the future...a little dry to my taste.

The Tibetan mama was nice and spicy, and very filling. I wasn't there myself. A friend picked up lunch for me, so all I can speak of is the dish.. does it belong cold? I do know that she waited for a long time due to health inspectors coming in, so really no fault of theirs.

So this was my first time coming to this establishment. I decided on the Vegetable Tajine bowl because I figured it would be the most filling since I've had it in Morocco as well as various Moroccan establishments in the city. Well my assumption on it being filling at Le Botaniste was a mistake! The base was quinoa (which didn't even fill the bottom of the take out bowl) and a small potato. They added a couple of garnishing veggies and vóla  a full meal meant for a small child . I understand portioning and all of that but to spend $15 (including tax) on a meal, that btw still left me hungry is super annoying. I had to take pics so that you could witness the shenanigans yourself...incidentally, the taste was ok...

This is one of my favorite places on the planet, and actually the reason I went vegan. Before I went vegan I was always an organic freak, so I stumbled across this place not knowing it was vegan about 2 years ago and I've been hooked since. Beautiful place, always amazing service, sickeningly delicious food. You HAVE to come here vegan or not!!! And the price point is insanely low. Love this place

No comment
Everyone who works there is so friendly and helpful. I had the pasta here I didn't LOVE it but I didn't HATE it it was ok. I like that they have wine bar as well that is very nice

Nice setup in a good location . No much competition for vegetarian dishes in the area . The menu was somewhat limited and the food quality and taste is just ok . Nice concept and they do have organic wines. I wish they had cooked the pasta more al dente and maybe have another option.
The best Vegan food I've ever tried! I am now thinking about joining the green side(you know what I mean :))!
No comment

Tremendous!!! Beautiful restaurant serving gorgeous veggies, delightfully prepared! Delicious, attractive, and satisfying. If this isn't exactly what you crave, it should be! The 3 bowl assortment is a bargain. Appetizers are artfully prepared. Perfect portions. Everything's better when you order a mix of cooked/ raw delights. Tibetan mama bowl pairs well with spring rolls, for instance! Let food be thy medicine.

It was an 18 degree day when I stepped into Le Botaniste and immediately, the smell of herbs and warm soups comforted me. The woman who I ordered from was very friendly. I ordered the vegetable tajine-the soup tasted like being in Morocco! It was incredibly flavorful, warm, hearty, and exactly what I needed on a cold day. The salad was healthy and delicious as well. There were generous chunks of potatoes and the woman asked me if I wanted fresh herbs on it which I did! I also enjoyed the vegetable noodles and quinoa in it. I'm not sure what the sauce was made out of but it was delicious. She put just enough that it was not overbearing. The absolute best part about it was the tofu because it had some spicy flavor to it that I can't pinpoint. All in all, the flavors went together in such a complimentary way. The atmosphere is clean and elegant. The only downside is that you have to order at the counter and you can't sit and get your order taken. Highly recommended!

Just opened up about 2 months ago in SoHo. Spacious place with ample seating and great decor at every corner. It's an all plant based menu with DIY options along with their recommendations to order form. Ended up going with the sushi, Tibetan mama, and the Moroccan stew. Wouldn't recommend the sushi - was dry and all the components did not seem to go together. The latter two were delicious and the perfect portions to share. They were offering glasses of certain wines on their menu on the house which was an added perk, not sure if they do this all the time. From the dessert menu we tried the apple/cashew cream dessert (unique version of apple pie) and the key lime pie, not usually a huge fan of key lime pie, but the apple desert was a must try. Staff was very friendly and service was friendly. Great place for vegetarians and if you're looking for a healthy clean eat.
No comment

No comment
Had the Tibetan mama and boy oh boy it really hit the spot! So much flavor and depth. Will be back for more!
No comment
No comment

Favorite vegan spot in NYC. The flavors are so amazing and they have such a wide variety of options. I got the curry with veggies, seaweed tartar, coconut ceviche, and kimchi. The garnishment options were amazing and I wish I could have gotten more! Absolutely AMAZING flavors and filling!

Definitely a go-to spot for me when I'm in soho and trying to be on the healthy side. I usually get the Tibetan Mama. This time I went with cauliflower rice instead of brown rice for a bit extra. I always want to try the chili sin carne, but I really want that with some cashew cheese (or cheddar). I always say next time... we'll see! I like all the desserts too!

Love the atmosphere here right when I walked in. They had a very interesting menu but I just told the guy to give me the most popular larger bowl which was the Tibetan one. Soooo delicious and healthy.. felt amazing after eating it!

I came here for lunch with a non vegan friend and it was incredible!!!  Both her and I were very impressed.  The food was delicious, the staff was very friendly and knowledgeable.  Very highly recommended!
This cost me $13. Sorry but Wtf ? Unacceptable. It's literally not even a quarter of the way full...
Great spot for vegan and vegetarian near downtown. Food is reasonably priced. It is also cafe style meaning you can work there for a while if you need to. Salads and soups galore.

Incredible meal, excellent service. Portions are very generous.  Absolutely save room for the cupcake with frosting. There are a lot of options , plant based but could work even for non vegetarians.  We will be back.

I happened to be in the neighborhood on a rainy night. I am not vegan, but try to eat vegetarian or vegan when I can. I stepped in and was greeted by a warm space, friendly staff, and a delicious smelling atmosphere. After looking at several things, i chose the Tibetan Mama, and wow it was a delicious meal. I don't think you could've gone with wrong with anything there. It was delicious, hearty, satisfying, and creative. Two thumbs up!
No comment

The best reviews for vegan/veggie fares are from meat eaters (in my opinion) because we go into these places with closed minds. Don't do that. This place makes GREAT food. Period. It just happens not to have meat, but you won't even care. Full, robust flavors and a variety of hearty meal choices ensure every craving and palate can be satisfied. Solid spot...

One of my favorite restaurants. Great energy. High quality, organic and gluten free. Can taste the freshness of the plants. The tagine and botanical salad are two of my go tos. Tagine is bursting with flavor. Salad so fresh. Their mezzanine is also top notch. My only question is...when's that recipe book coming out.
Delicious food, great customer service and ambiance. The coconut & peanut butter curry is sooo good.  I will definitely be back next time I'm in NYC.
No comment
Yummy vegan place. You order at the counter so a bit more casual. Came here twice now and will be back again! Love the chili!

The city has no lack of healthy food options, but  Le Botaniste stands out among them. First of all, even though it's counter service the atmosphere is as beautiful as the food. Clean lines, cool art, big windows, nice seating area, even a bar serving organic wine. There were so many delicious choices, and I wanted everything. The first time I got the Tibetan Mama Bowl which had a brown rice base with a lot of veggies and a delicious coconut curry sauce - YUM! The second time I got the Young Coconut Ceviche and a salad with the Seeded Avocado, both so flavorful. To top it off, for dessert I got the Chia Mud which was heavenly. The prices are fair for the quality of the food. I love this place and will go every time I visit NYC!

Shopping around SOHO, we were hungry, but not too hungry. We found Le Botaniste nearby and had a delicious, healthy lunch that didn't leave us feeling sluggish after. We both opted for a "small bites" bowl of avocado covered in crunchy bits, spring greens, cabbage, carrots, and I think beets. I also had a beet/ginger juice that had just the right amount of bite. This is what Urban Remedy strives to be, but sort of misses that mark. Definitely recommend this place if you've been overindulging lately and need a break.

Food is average tasting at best.  They forgot to include an item in my order and when I spoke to the manager she was rude and said "were busy and these things happen" after I paid $12 for delivery. Make sure before the delivery driver leaves that they include all your items.
No comment
Loved the ambiance of this place! Looked like a modern apothecary with the whole good-for-you-food vibe. Stopped by right after dinner so I didn't try anything but the wine which was pricey yet nice

Stopped in here for a quick and nutritious snack. Organic and healthy vegetarian options for bowls, wraps, snacks, and cookies. The summer roll was light and delicious. And the special spicy sauce on our table was AMAZING.

I can't say enough about this place. Beautiful interior, amazing food that leaves you feeling fresh, friendly helpful and accompanying staff (I have a lot of food sensitivities-I can't have onion and they substituted it for tofu without charging me). I LOVE the art on their walls in their Broome Street location and their little garden in their Lexington Ave location. I can't wait to try their midtown east location! I've gotten their Botanical salad twice now, so I should probably try something else..but I really don't want to.

Love this place. I have yet to try something I don't love! The service is also always great, super friendly   And accommodating. Not to mention the inside is absolutely adorable and unique! Highly recommend, I go almost every day :)
Super pleased with the food options here. Whether you're looking for a basic or something a little different (that you wouldn't make at home) Le Botaniste delivers! Delicious!!
Great vegan and gluten free! Super easy, awesome flavors, spices, hardy, well priced. Highly recommend for a vegan in the city.

It wouldn't seem like it, but this vegan restaurant has multiple locations in nyc and one in Belgium! It's casual in that you order at a counter displaying most of the menu items, but the decor is upscale and reminiscent of a European cafe with a quirky/kitsch vibe. The staff wears lab coats instead of aprons and the menu is marketed as "prescriptions." Unique concept but didn't really appeal to me. That being said, the space is beautiful and fairly spacious. We ordered the tagine bowl, gazpacho, coconut ceviche and omega 3 brownie. I loved the coconut ceviche-- big juicy pieces of coconut in a herby acidic dressing. The tagine bowl was good but had a high ratio of potatoes vs other veggies. The gazpacho was too salty for me. Finally, had to end with something sweet and the brownie didn't disappoint (we did get lucky and get one straight from the oven)! Definitely eat it with the cashew cream sauce! They also have a bar in the back and offer natural wines.
This is my favorite downtown, healthy spot. The vibe here is casual, but upscale. I'm obsessed with the seaweed tartare.

Le Botaniste is one of my favorite places to eat in SoHo. Incredibly fresh and organic dishes made by amazing chefs. I love everything they serve here. Stellar wine selection in the back as well. My #1 lunch choice. Can't say enough great things about Le Botaniste and the staff here. If you're reading this and you haven't been, stop everything and come here immediately. Thank me after :)

Stumbled upon this place this looking for a plant based meal whilst walking around SoHo one sunny afternoon.  This place did not disappoint.  It was clean, service was fast and friendly and the meal was oh so filling!  My favorite though had to be the Beet Caviar.  Served with a grain free dark bread garnished with pretty bright greens, it is the perfect shared plate or a nice light lunch!

We were looking for an interesting vegetarian meal and this was so good.  I had a seeded avocado with fermented veggies, greens and gluten free bread.  I am always surprised by how much fermented veggies add to a meal.  My companion had the Autumn Harvest salad bowl with turmeric apples, roasted brussel sprouts, tofu, fermented beets and mixed greens with pecans on top and a dressing.  Excellent.  I also had the Omega 3 brownie with cashew milk.  Yum.  l love eating organic food.

I order here about 2-3 times a week and love the food, very fresh.  Just ordered delivery, and they sent me the wrong food and told me I had to cancel through Seamless and reorder through them.  Not professional or understanding at all.  I have been a loyal customer and the moment they reopened during covid I ordered from them to support their business.  Unfortunately , they do not treat patrons with the same care.
No comment

My first time here and blown away by the food.  I love the branding , the design "!prescription" and the food.  It is one of the best vegan spots in the city and the staff was very nice as well.  Good job

Yum. Delicious. Had the salad of the day. It tasted like a BLT. Very filling. Carrot-grapefruit-tumeric juice was great. I have several food allergies and they were very accommodating, so I'll definitely be back.

It's a major "yes" for me, dawg. Sweet, helpful, knowledgeable staff. DELICIOUS food. I had the lunch special: half a Tibetan Bowl and a cup of tomato soup. Both were super flavorful and satisfying. I can't wait to go back and explore more of the menu. Go, Le Botaniste!
Great food and atmosphere.  Can you please open a location near Columbia University!!
No comment

It's February in nyc! Cold and rainy! A friend recommended this healthy slice of heaven!!! Everything was yummy! It was such a vegetarian comfort for the weather! The staff was lovely! I got the Tibetan mama!!! Yummmmmm

Cute little plant-based restaurant in SoHo. I went in for the first time the other night and the staff was very helpful with explaining the menu and offering suggestions, as well as offering to let me sample anything if i wanted! I got one of the salads and it was great, very flavorful. Love that there are more plant-based and vegan options coming around! Will absolutely be back.
This place looks fantastic. Great presentation, so I wondered in for lunch. Lots of choice. I went for the pasta. I found it was bland and couldn't finish it. A bit disappointing.
No comment
If you are a Vegan or even wanna try (because you think it might be lettuce and carrot only) - that's the place to go for sure. Food and drinks really awesome and idea of decor is even better :)

Delicious and filling. Fantastic comfort food. I had the chili and had to hold myself back from licking the bowl... Welcoming, helpful service. Interesting selection of natural wines. Highly recommend for a casual meal with a good glass of wine.
No comment
This place is exactly what I've been craving for NYC for years. Healthy, moderately priced, and delicious. Today was my first time... definitely will be back soon.

I'll start off by saying the food at la Botaniste is good. Now for the not so good: I came with my service dog and was immediately asked for her certification in which I replied that I'm not required to show it. When I sat down with my food the same woman came up to me and asked me what service my dog provided which is illegal to ask. My dog is trained to sit next to me in her bag but the woman working here told me she needed to be on the floor and that since shes a service dog should be trained to be on the floor. My service dog obviously had no issue sitting on the floor but I was uncomfortable being berated with questions about my disability and my service dog. I hope this doesn't happen to anyone else in the future.
Outstanding food and service.  I'm not a vegan but would eat this vegan food every day if I could. Everything I've had is perfectly flavored and delicious. Please open an outpost in Williamsburg!

The food was okay - nutritious with lots of raw veggie creations like spring rolls - but it wasn't especially yummy and it was quite expensive all considered. Atmosphere was pleasant though, and I appreciated the water on the tables.
No comment

Went here tonight with some friends and I was very impressed. The food was absolutely delicious. I had the chili sin carne and a brownie for desert. The best thing about this place though is the fantastic service. The staff are so attentive and friendly. I will definitely be coming back here.

This is a beautiful space owned by the folks from the Pain Quotidien chain (you'll recognize the same gluten free bread and crackers) with copious healthier choices. The first time I ate here I enjoyed my meal. We had a Tibetan Mama, Mezze (sushi & dips) etc. Unfortunately have been disappointed with subsequent dining experiences. Prices are high and many of the dishes are just meh (the tajine) or poorly executed (the summer rolls that staff remove from plastic wrap in front of the customers- I've yet to get one not completely mangled) and most of the staff is unfamiliar with food ingredients. They use lots of cheap starches (potatoes, pasta, rice) and tons of processed soy (tofu, TVP, Tofutti brand "cream cheese.") I want to love this place so much but the erratic service, mostly cold and unfriendly employees and expensive veggie fare is far from a top NYC veggie experience.

WOW what a fantastic place to eat. I am not totally vegan, my husband is and the food here was amazing. We were in NYC for 3 nights and 2 nights we ate here. I highly recommend the 3 different bowl samples more than enough for the two of us but the flavors in all three bowls were different but oh so good. Very filling meals and nice comfort food. Would definitely god back there again when in town.

Oook! Here we are in a fabulous setting the space is welcoming and charming. Desire to eat clean is a must and thanks to le Botaniste it is accessible + organic! If you are not familiar with it have the super friendly staff walk you through and help you chose one of the many options! My go to's are the Tibetan mama with cauliflower rice and the chili. Try out the soup of the day and their desert which are guilt free!
No comment
No comment

Big beautiful space that serves very healthy meals fbst you don't feel guilty eating. I finished the entire Tibetan mama bowl. Wished they had more juice options but I can't wait to try more of their food
What a find. Great place for the health conscious looking for a good vibe and hearty food. Parfait.

Just finished the most delicious lunch here!!  To be honest, i started with a different dish, the smashed potato with mushroom gravy, but there was a flavor in the gravy that i didn't care for, so the staff allowed me to switch to their Heirloom Tomato Caesar Salad, with their homemade saffron dressing..  and OMYGODDD!!!  Soooo Delicious!!  They serve it with a kale, arugula salad mix, marinated tofu and in-season heirloom tomatoes.  They add seeds of some kind, adding to the dish's amazing flavor and crunch. I asked for extra dressing on the side since it really enhanced the flavor! Note: They charge $1.09 for extra side of dressing..  but it's worth it.  What i really enjoy about this trendy Soho location is the filtered tap water they keep on all tables, for self-service. The decor is clean, stylish and relaxed. The menu is clear, bright and descriptive, and the light music is played low, complementing the vibe. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. They all wear their hair under caps or a net, and they wear white lab coats, giving off a clean, sterile vibe. They also have communal tables with electrical outlets to charge your devices..  such a cool place!  Prices are moderate, but all their dishes are made with organic, vegan ingredients, and lots of flavor and texture.  I will definitely be coming back!!

This review is for the braised Moroccan stew which I found bland and slightly undercooked. As far as salad places go, however, this place is fine. The bill came to just over $30 for two. They have good spacing between seats so that it doesn't feel cramped. Every table has a free bottle of water and you have access to free WiFi.

Amazing that a pretty vegan, organic and gluten free charmer like this has come to Soho. I appreciate their concept but their portions are far too skimpy given the price point AND the food cost if the items served...I imagine that I'm actually paying more because of the cost of what their rent must be in this great location...sigh! But I will say, their Vegetable Tajine is a DREAM (enhanced tenfold by squeezing fresh lemon on top!, but I must "plump up" the small portion (filling only half of the deep bowl!) by adding a side of Quinoa at an additional cost of $1.95...so all-in, this dish ends up costing almost $18. And let's face it, it's not going to break the bank for them to add an extra scoop of either quinoa or brown rice to all of their bowls -- so I hope they will reconsider because no one wants to anticipate enjoying something BIG and then discovering that what's actually presented is quite SMALL! Women, can you relate? Haha! Anyway, this place is great but the servers are asked to dole out skimpy portions and customers will think twice about returning and it will cost them more to lose on repeat business. I hope that the proprietors will recognize that. I wish them well. Sincerely, Former James Beard Foundation Writer who is in love with your Veggie Tajine...

Yummy vegan food! The flavors were wonderful and the staff sweetly describe all of your options. Tasty and wholesome. Had the chili sin carne, which was such a filling bowl that I couldn't finish it. They have some good drinks with no sugar or caffeine, a nice touch.

We came to order a small side of healthy food and were so excited to try Le Botaniste. My friend and I each ordered a side of Brussels sprouts since the place appears to be "buffet" style. The guy helping us was so nice and accommodating to our needs (as a good server should be to their customers). As we are about to pay, a woman comes over (unsure if it was his manager or just a coworker) and asks him what he was doing telling him IN FRONT of us that she is not allowed to serve us what we wanted and this is not how the restaurant works. Not only did it make us uncomfortable to be bystanders of this awkward encounter but we felt terribly for the server who was just trying to be good to his customers. She told us he needed to charge us more for a side of Brussels sprouts due to the fact that they aren't allowed to provide customers with something as simple as this (they were also cold and we were charged $19 for Brussels sprouts and a glass of wine). All in all, I will not be coming back to Le Botaniste. The first server was so kind and the ending experience was one that made me and my friends feel unwelcome at this restaurant.

What a beautiful little place.Complete with bird chirping soundtrack.All vegetarian (vegan?), not sure.But, quaint unpretentious ambiance.A most relaxed, romantic abode.Many veggie selections with numerous choices.Have been there twice and Plan to go again!.From kimchi to various soups and everything in between!.Such a variety of tasteful combinations, it's difficult to pin down a favorite.Seems the menu changes frequently.However, the colorful casserole pots give an inviting welcome.Can't recall any specific dish but, the waitstaff is very friendly and always willing to suggest!.It's a very healthy, pleasant place.Hey!, Wait!, U know where we going tonight!
So delicious. Very filling. Full of flavor. Makes you happy. I wanted to eat everything in there.
A hidden Vegan Gem!! Awesome and very tasty. Cool and chic old pharmacy vibe decor. Great organic wine. Desserts looks very tasty.Will definitely be back.
Vegan bowls. Very tasty and reasonably priced.

I had high expectations, and Le Botaniste did not disapoint. It was sooo good. I had the tajine, which was full of flavors and kept be full for a while. I'll probably go back tomorrow night to pick up something as much I loved it. The place is really cute too. Only thing a little annoying is that they have a big glass between customers and food, which makes it hard to order and hear what the waitress is saying. But, great place!
This place in one word.....delicious! In addition to great taste it is healthy. I recommend checking out this restaurant. In the words of Arnold....I'll be back!
No comment

The service here was outstanding and amazing. Everyone had great hospitality with such a bright positive smile. I had such a wonderful experience and the art throughout the restaurant is breathtaking. I didn't try any food. But I got a shot and had my jacket in coat check.
No comment
No comment
Be ready to spend some money and make a reservation but it's worth it. The pairing menu is fun and delicious. The ambience is spectacular. Service is great! Enjoy

No comment

Soaring over the NY skyline, the breathtaking views are well worth a visit. A reservation, as many have noted, also allows you access to The Edge, so we made sure to come early so we could enjoy the view before sunset. Admission to the Edge is $38 per ticket, so a dinner reservation seems well worth it. The entire restaurant and experience has a sophisticated vibe, with the elevator ride up showing a video of the New York skyline from above. Cocktails are tasty and the dessert, The Egg that everyone seems to order is fun. We split a pasta dish that was fine, but the reason to come to The Peak is for the experience and views (not the food). Despite not loving the food, would definitely come back with out-of-towners or for a special occasion.
I am a regular here, very close to where I live too. The food and service is very good. So many delicious choices to choose from.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Went here for our anniversary, love that we were able to go on the rooftop and enjoy the city skyline. The food was delicious, my husband and I both had steak. The service was excellent the cocktails were good and delectable desserts. A little pricey but expected for the location. It's well worth it.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

The view alone is worth it, however the food was spectacular! My husband and I came here for an early anniversary celebration and enjoyed every minute and bite. We got a seat right by the window and embraced the views of this amazing city as we indulged in delicious food and cocktails. The service was also great! A visit to Peak also gets you access to the Edge Observatory. Whether you're a local or visiting from out of town, you won't go wrong at Peak.
No comment

column3: Downtown Jersey City, Jersey City, NJ
column6: No comment

Heard about this spot and didn't get my act together in time to get a dinner reservation but was able to snag a lunch reservation at the bar and it turned out to be one of the best dining experiences of my life. 101 stories into the sky. Although the male bartender was a bit ornery at first my girlfriend and i won him over and he ended up being great as well as the female bartender who also doubled as our server. With a view over Manhattan we had the lunch 3 course meal paired with wines. The food was excellent. I didn't die over the dessert and definitely overindulged so if i were to do it again i would have done the 2 course menu instead. The view on the edge afterwards was breathtaking. Heard it costs $40 to get up there and it was free for those dining in the restaurant. What a bargain. Loved it. Will definitely return.

I absolutely loved this place. Service was great and food was phenomenal. Don't come here looking for meat and potatoes type food. The dishes were very seasonal. Cocktails were excellent, too. The views were priceless.

I stopped in for happy hour and some oysters. The bartender was phenomenal and really gave me very quality service. I had a blast. The oysters were big, meaty and just what I needed. The drinks were also on point. I had a Manhattan, sidecar, and a Kentucky mule. The bartender was very well versed in his cocktail mixtures. I will def be back next time I visit the big apple. For sure.
Nice restaurant. Food is great, the view is Beautiful. We Will go back again with  friends and family
No comment
No comment
No comment
Anniversary lunch with incredible views and really good food - highly recommend this over any of the other places to see NY
No comment

Peak is a surprising restaurant. Given the location and the attraction on the same floor. I think you would expect a certain kind of atmosphere that isn't really the case. In fact, it's actually quite good. The staff is incredible and the food is solid with generous portions. Going with the prix fixe is a no brainer, as the options are great for most palates.

Prime rib appetizer with bone marrow was good but not the best Ive ever had. The bone marrow was the star of that dish. The duck was amazing, the mole and bokchoy with peach made each bite worth it. Without reservations at 7 on a fri night after doing the climb we snagged bar seats. If you eat at the peak, you get entrance to the edge for free. If i go back id like the squid ink app. Service was friendly, they try to upsell bread. People ranged from being dressed fancy to us in athleisurewear. It is pricey but the dishes are artistically curated and ingredients so fresh, it justifies the prices.
No comment
No comment

I highly recommend this place if you want a great meal and view of the city. The restaurant is stunning and the view is breath taking. We also had superb service. My only complaint is our food, while tasty, did not come out very warm. The bread and butter was an unexpected highlight!
No comment
Outstanding food. Superb service, and phenomenal city views.  We had thee best experience here. YOU HAVE TO VISIT! I had the filet mignon and my friend the duck. SO INCREDIBLY GOOD!

Went there to celebrate the end of the school year. It was a long process to get up there and get seated. But the waiting space were always very comfortable. The restaurant is a bit too formal for my taste, but the food was all really delicious.
Nice restaurant to go to while going to the edge nice staff nice ambience and amazing food
No comment

Absolutely fantastic location. Their service is at best indifferent. Tried to book a large reservation for over a month.  Typically no one calls back. When onsite, they will say they will take care of it, but nothing becomes of the conversation.  Just tried calling and see if anybody calls you back.  Again, a fantastic view with sub par service.   Food and drinks are above average, but not spectacular.
No comment

What an experience, though it was snowing very windy, no view 2 see, no problem, the food was just exactly how I wanted it, just the right portions, don't forget to order the bread, Filet Mignon. Definitely you will enjoy here.
No comment
No comment
Always nice to come back to this place. The service is on top. All staff are polite and attentive. I always enjoy the food and the view here.
No comment

We had a company holiday lunch here and it was a blast. The service is very nice ( a little busy, but the end result is nice). No complaints, great quality food and obviously the view from the 101st floor does not hurt. I look forward to coming at night to see the view this way as well. The tartar and the trout are amazing. I think a must visit for Hudson Yards area.
No comment
No comment

Originally I had my reservation a week before, however, due to the weather, I asked if I could reschedule because the whole point was to eat with a view. The staff and management were amazing to accommodate me to the following week where I got to enjoy amazing food with an amazing view. The food was exquisite and very delicious. And being able to visit the EDGE was the cherry on top. I see myself visiting The Peak once again for dinner and hopefully for lunch as well.
Would highly recommend. Service is impeccable, great spot to bring visiting family/friends. The Burger served during lunch is amazing. Best views of nyc hands down
No comment
No comment
No comment

The restaurant itself is stunning and the views are immaculate. I love that it gives you access to The Edge. However, everything else about the restaurant was so disappointing. We were a party of 6 and waited almost 40 minutes before we were even served water. We finally ordered cocktails, which also took another 30 minutes to arrive. We ordered our food and continued to wait a very long time. We decided to order only an entree because of the long wait. The server seemed to give off a sense that he was unhappy we were not spending as much as he'd liked. I've never felt so judged while dining at any establishment. We were hopeful that the food would be worth the wait... but it was bland and not worth the price point. Save your money and go elsewhere, where your time will be valued, your patronage is respected, and the food is actually seasoned.
No comment

Extremely mediocre experience. They literally had an "Asian" row, which they promptly placed me in. First, I thought it was strange that both tables to my left and right were Chinese, versus the rest of the restaurant. I looked around to observe, and I found that they sat all the Chinese on this side. It was further confirmed when the 4th table, with 3rd including myself, was seated next to the table to my right. The service was fine and attentive. I did not appreciate being racially segregated to one side of the restaurant; it's simply unnecessary and extremely obvious. The view was nonexistent as I happen to come on a day it rained. The food was just okay. Being that my office was only 30 floors down, the view was the same, and this is nothing to write home about. The Edge access was given to those who dine there, and since it was foggy, there was nothing more to see. I wanted to swing by after work when I'm out of this NYC office, but needless to say, I do not think it necessary to return.
No comment

Beautiful ambience and breathtaking view of New York. Words cannot describe the experience!
Great view. Nice food we ordered. Service was good and friendly. You can go down to the lookout after meal. The bread before meal was delicious. I had the hamburger, which was good too.

Nice place to impress out of town friends.  The egg shaped dessert was very good.  Other food / cocktails were solid too.  Exceeded expectations for such a touristy seeming place.  Killer views - probably the tallest place in NYC where you can have a real meal.  Swanky nighttime vibe reminded me of the Park Hyatt in Tokyo.

column3: Upper West Side, New York, NY
column6: No comment

The bar has spectacular views and superb staff, it feels like a treat to be there to enjoy a drink or a meal even if it's a bit touristy! I just went for drinks can't speak about the food, my hostess at the bar Cris was fantastic at making everyone at the bar feel welcome and enjoying themselves!
Love the view, must visit place! Edge balcony is a bonus after nice a meal. Desert and  steak are worth trying

The food is amazing. The staff is very courteous and professional. The servers are very knowledgeable and recommended amazing dishes. Awesome vibe. When I visited there was rain so the view wasn't what it was super to be. But the dining experience made up for not having the view.
No comment
No comment

I like fried potato what come with wagyu burger.burger is fine but I was more into potato! Sheared tuna is ok and fish appetizer as well. They serve regular or sparkling water is very plus. But it was 1/2 pandemic not many stuff in a restaurant ( what server said) no desert... sad. But after eat we can go to the edge! For free.... It is big plus for Tourists!
No comment
No comment

There's a lot to be said about Peak! The service, atmosphere, views and food are all 5 stars! This is not another tourist trap location. The food is really delicious although a bit pricey however if you go for lunch prices are a bit cheaper. We started out with that ever popular milk bread which is a in-house made brioche served with a honey butter that is delicious. We also got the steak tartare which is seasoned perfectly and a nice touch to have with the bread. For our entrées we got the lamb pasta and the steelhead trout both were delicious. Really nice rich sauce on the pasta and the trout was so soft and moist it practically melted in our mouth! There was also a delicious roe sauce that was poured on top of the trout when it reached the table and topped it off wonderfully. Service is truly everything here from the servers and their outfits to the people at the front desk downstairs and the elevator service when you ushered up to the hundredth and one floor. Do try to get a seat by the window so you can enjoy the view while you're eating and definitely go to the edge at the end of your meal entrance is free!

We had been trying to get a reservation for weeks. It was totally worth the wait. We came here to celebrate our 40th wedding anniversary with our children! Just the process of getting to the restaurant is so special. You enter on a low floor and u think ... I thought this place was up top?! But after you check in your are directed to the elevators to the 101st floor at Hudson Yards to The Peak restaurant. You are greeted warmly and seated in this beautiful restaurant high atop Manhattan looking out of floor to ceiling windows. Our party of 6 was given a table a bit away from the window but elevated so it was not a problem to enjoy the views! We all ordered a variety of signature cocktails, all creatively delicious! We ordered a variety appetizers that ranged from shaved short rib, to goat cheese stuffed tomato salad and other items as well. You must get their special monkey bread! For dinner some ordered the trio of pork and others got halibut, and one duck! Dessert was delicious, one was complimentary! And then of course if u eat dinner there you get FREE admission to the Edge and it was a gorgeous full moon! All around expensive but totally wo

All smiles each time we come to peak. Ambiance is stellar, service is great and the food is good. The drinks were also well made.
No comment
No comment

Treatment from the staff was outstanding especially Isaiah who was super friendly and accommodating. If you wanna impress somebody this is the place to bring them. Food is great but the atmosphere and view is to die for.
No comment

No comment
No comment

It was the best experience. I loved the Seared Tuna (my partner ordered the strip steak but it was a bit overcooked) it was absolutely delicious (chef's kiss) . The dressing was a delicate balance of sour and savory. The views were amazing. The service was also good. I didn't like the wine I ordered after I tasted it and they immediately poured me a wine that was way drier like I requested. After lunch we were able to just walk down the stairs to get into the viewing balcony for free.
Loved the atmosphere and food. No need to buy tickets to the Edge like we did. I wish we knew earlier when we booked the reservation through Open table

We went for a late lunch reservation, and we had a great experience. Our server was extremely nice and attentive. At lunch, you have to do the prefixe 2 item or 3 item. The food was great, th ambiance was wonderful, and you get access to The Edge. We were lucky enough to be seated at the window. Highly recommend!

Emily is the absolute best! She accommodated us last minute and made sure we had the time of our lives! Promote this Queen!
Went there at Friday for my birthday!  The service was good, but food was ok, the view really awesome!
No comment

If you come to The Peak, you are coming for the incredible amazing 360 view of the NY skyline that is above The Edge. The restaurant is very modern and the views are breathtaking. I'm sure the drinks are great as well but I didn't have any. The food itself is mediocre. The chicken breast was slightly on the dry side. Wait time on food was relatively slow and that is most likely due to the pandemic.

Decided to try Peak during lunch on a random Thursday afternoon. Upon being greeted by the hostess at  level 5, she promptly called upstairs to see if they would be able to accommodate me which they were able to at the bar. Downstairs there is a gorgeous cocktail bar that is dimly lit with cozy chairs. I was then brought to a door that led to an elevator that swiftly whisked me up 102 flights in about 15 seconds (the walls in the elevator change around you as you go up which was a nice touch especially for those who need a distraction from the rise to the upper level). As the elevator doors open, your eyes are treated with a beautiful view in front of you and the restaurant is to the left. Once I made my way in, I was seated at the bar and was positively mesmerized by the view around me. The freedom tower can be seen directly ahead of the bar and the Empire State Building could be clearly seen to my left. Still or sparkling water is free of charge. I ordered a Henriot champagne along with the double wagyu burger that came with their housemade pickles, ketchup and hash in log form (sans fries- honestly these were really good!) I couldn't finish the burger and wound up taking a patty out because it was too much for me.  Capped off my meal with a double espresso. If you spend $40 or more (I know this goes for lunch) you gain access to the edge which is totally worth going to see! Stunning and I mean STUNNING views of the city. This is the perfect place for a romantic dinner or to impress out of towners. A must try!
No comment

My boyfriend and I decided to celebrate with a trip to the Edge-- and after spending golden hour outside, we spend sun set at Peak. At first we expected the food to be ok at best-- as most touristy restaurants are, we thought we were paying more for the ambiance over the food. But-- to our most perfectly splendid surprise, the food was phenomenal and the service even better! (Pro tip-- ask for a table with a view when you make your reservation!) The squid ink and scallops were absolutely delectable-- cooked to perfection. The milk bread was crunchy on the outside and soft and pillowy on the inside. The fluke was undoubtedly the best fish I've had in an American restaurant. The pork was good, but a little heavy. The dessert was a lovely surprise. I'll definitely come back with my parents when they come for a visit !
Food is good, cocktails are definitely not worth the price. They need to be much better for the price
From the moment we were greeted until the time we left the service and experience was exquisite. The food is beautifully presented and the view is breathtaking.

First time and it is completely worth it. Without a doubt, the initial draw is the ambience of the restaurant: 101st floor with amazing views. However, the food is the star of the show. Artfully crafted dishes with sophisticated flavors make this a restaurant worth visiting over and over again.
No comment

I made reservations for Peak months ago and informed them that we were coming from LA for our anniversary celebration. I was so touched at the check in when they wished us happy anniversary before seating us at our table right by the window with a spectacular view at 101st floor. We were  given complimentary champagne by Maryna who was so nice and ensured that our anniversary lunch was to be remembered. Food, drinks and dessert were absolutely amazing. We had a wonderful lunch above the clouds. Thank You all Peak staff and Maryna for an amazing time. We, for sure coming back to Peak again when we visit NYC.

A fantastic experience from start to finish.  You start off at their entrance separate from the Edge.  They have a bar downstairs you can check out while you wait if your table isn't quite ready.  Once upstairs, you get breathtaking views of the city.  The service is fantastic and it seems like all the tables have a decent view of some kind.  I thought the food was quite good.  Definitely fancy and great for a celebration or special occasion.  The reason I ended up going was because it also lets you visit the Edge observation deck when you're finished with your meal.  Keep in mind that you should make a reservation to come here.

No comment

Made lunch reservations and had to wait a bit for our table to be ready but it was so worth it. Even though we got a gray cloudy day, the view was still breathtaking. We started with the butternut squash soup, then i got the green circle chicken and my friend got the New York strip steak. I'll start off by saying our entrees took FOREVER, almost an hour- the manager came to apologize and sent us oolong tea drinks since he noticed we weren't drinking alcohol. I'd wait 2 hours if i had to, the food was phenomenal. I have never had chicken so juicy and tender and bursting with flavor- if only the portion was bigger I'd be in food heaven. My friends steak was an even smaller portion, about 4 pieces and the "brussels sprouts" was really one brussels sprouts cut in half lol. The steak was tender, juicy and well seasoned. They really leave you wanting to come back for more with portions and flavors like that. We ended with the chocolate tart which was perfectly balanced with a small scoop of ice cream. As a pleasant surprised we were able to check out the Edge, i'm assuming it's included if you dine at Peak. Overall our experience was good and I'd definitely go back, the food is worth the hype.

So glad I was able to land a brunch reservation during my NY visit! My hotel recommended this place to me since their high rise restaurant was closed. Glad I listened to their recommendation! I ended up order a very strong drink which name I forgot, and the wagyu burger. Not going to lie, I think that might have been the best burger I've eaten. And the fries (I think) was very good as well. Let not forget about the view!! I think ever table in this restaurant can see the view, regardless of its next to a window or not. But overall great experience! You also get a pass to visit Edge observatory if you dine here, which was a nice perk post meal. Great time here overall!
No comment
Amazing food in a beautifully appointed restaurant with a spectacular view! Love the prix fixe...terrific choices...everything beautiful and delicious.
No comment
No comment

Wow. An amazing place for lunch if you can get a reservation. Truly my new favorite spot for a special occasion or just for when I want to feel fancy. Gorgeous views, beautiful decor, delicious food for a relatively affordable price point, great service, and to top all of that, very kid friendly! Lots of toddlers and enough ambient noise to drown out the occasional yelps! Got the scallops, which were incredible. I'm very picky about scallops and most places make them too salty. These were perfectly cooked and seasoned, and they were large! Burger was solid too. Shared these 2 entrees and the milk bread, which was the perfect amount of food for 2 adults. The scallop dish is a little small but the burger and bread made up for it.

Amazing food and service. The view was absolutely incredible. I loved how you could also visit Edge after lunch. Each dish I had was good and I want to try more next time. Just for lunch menu, there aren't a lot options, I hope they can add more to the menu. That's my only suggestion.

My wife and I just finished watching an immersive art exhibit and a futuristic anime film at the "Shed", after that we felt a little hungry. My wife gave me a treat to this fantastic restaurant which is situated at the 101st floor of "30 Hudson Yards", just a floor above "the Edge". As we were on our way to the restaurant, we were led to a designated private elevator going to the top (which was cool). We were met at the front desk of the restaurant and was led to a nice table, my wife preferred a table near the glass window and the staff were courteous enough to give my wife's wishes. From the very start, service was already excellent. Table setting was phenomenal, restaurant was very clean, all wait staff were wearing mask. My wife ordered rose tea and I started with Capt. Lawrence beer. We had a monkey bread which tasted amazing (don't ever, ever miss this). My wife and I ordered the same entree, American Wagyu burger, hers was cooked medium well and mine was medium rare, it comes with lettuce and potato terrine. The Wagyu burger ( which was delicious) matched very well with the dijonnaise, tumbleweed cheddar and the smoked bacon. We had a breathtaking view of New York City and the NY skyscrapers during our lunch, plus add to it, they gave us a complimentary pass to "The Edge" after eating in this spectacular restaurant. Freddy, the wait staff was terrific, I had my second beer ( Brooklyn lager) in no time. But before I forget, I have to compliment, I had a super-great company (my wife). From the excellent service, great tasting food, to the ambiance,  cleanliness and spectacular view, this restaurant is truly impressive. Any tourist, NYC visitors, or Hudson yards guest, I highly recommend that you should try this restaurant.

Wow. This place is a VIBE! If you want to experience true upscale dining with a amazing view 101 floors up high, come here. We had Jake and Alex take care of us at the bar and they were incredible!! So knowledgeable and helped us pick not only cocktails but our dinner too. You can tell they both have such a passion for people and for this restaurant!!! Thank you Jake and Alex. We will ask for you both next time we come!!!
The place is very nice, an extensive wine list and variety, excellent food and exceptional service. The location of the restaurant is great, the view is a privilege. I totally recommend this place.

Not our first time at Peak but it has remained a wonderful experience.  If one sets aside the location (which is superb on its very own!), the restaurant itself is terrific.  The food is fresh, light and modern without pushing the culinary envelope.  Service is beautifully choreographed and the teams understand that guests might have many reasons to be there - leaving us patrons to enjoy each others company but never too far should service be needed/wanted.  It was a wonderful experience all around... not to be missed!
No comment
No comment

Do yourself a favor and go here!! When planning my trip, I had originally decided to skip this one and didn't get reservations. As the trip got closer, I started to regret it after checking every single day, multiple times on the days leading up to my trip, I was able to snag a last minute lunch reservation. The ambiance is very classy, yet still casual and comfortable. REQUEST A WINDOW TABLE! Although you can see out the windows from all tables, it is not the same as having a front row seat. Luckily the weather cleared up for a bit while we were there and had stunning views of the city. Our server was very nice and helped us pick a bottle of champagne and suggested some menu items. Hey the starter bread, I'm still dreaming of it! Everything was good though! Eating at the restaurant gets you free access to the viewing deck, which when you factor in the price of admission for that, it makes the food prices very reasonable. I would much rather pay a little extra and have an amazing meal with a view than to just have the view! One of my favorite parts of our trip! Will definitely be back.
No comment

Outstanding front of house - outstanding Service - best food in town ! Compliments to the chef for our visit 7/9/2022 - Best views in town - belay the 10pm close time - the party continues way beyond that ! - for what you get you - you also get access to Edge experience  - so count this as the best restaurant and value in Manhattan - we had a 8pm reservation - perfect for sunset and night time views out of this world !
No comment

Came back for a second time and was not as impressed as my first time. Got the foie gras, pork chop / pork belly dish, and egg dessert, and nothing was fantastic. However, service was fantastic still and now diners get to visit the Edge for free before or after dinner which is nice.

The luxurious family experience with the best-elevated experience, greeted by several hosts.   The family holiday highlight was the outstanding 365 views of NYC.   Excellent atmosphere, drinks, and service forgetting mediocre food..

Dinner was great. Service superb. Milk bread and Squid Ink Chitarra are a must try. Try The Egg for dessert. It's a nice mixture of flavors and not overly sweet. The Bees Knees is a great cocktail to try also. The meal was well worth it. It comes with free access to The Edge and they'll move you to a window seating for your meal when it becomes available
Make a reservation and go at sunset.  Worth every penny!  Amazing views are are only topped by the food, drinks, and service!

column3: Washington Ave./ Memorial Park, Houston, TX
column6: We had the absolute best experience with Kory! We sat at the bar and we had the best time! The food, drinks, and atmosphere were excellent as well. Will definitely be coming back
No comment
Alphonso was the best server we ever had nationwide!  View is BEST in nyc. Food was delicious!!!!
No comment

We came to the Peak for a birthday, and it was much fancier than I expected. You can choose from either a two course meal or three course, and the price is pretty common for everywhere else in NYC. Everything we ate that day was phenomenal. Top notch food, for sure!
No comment

Used to love this place not bc of the views but bc of the food. But recently the food has been subpar. Took my parents in law for lunch, and we ended up spitting out almost everything. We pretending tk wrap things to go but we all just threw it away before getting in a cab. Current menu (fall/winter 2022) sucks compared to the ones before & i'm devastated bc it was my go-to place for ppl visiting nyc. Honestly, won't be back if the menu/food quality stays this way. Food used to be amazing but idk what happened.
No comment
Loved the food. We sat in a perfect spot and had a great time. I ordered the vegetarian options-- milk bread, peas, roasted sweet potato, pistachio gelato-- and they were all good together.
No comment

I am not really sure how this place has such high ratings because that is what led me to making a reservation here for my birthday dinner and I was pretty disappointed. I definitely think all the ratings are catered to the views because this is the type of restaurant that you are paying for the view. The perk of dining here is the view as well as not having to pay to experience the Edge. Other than that, the menu items were very limited (with only around like 6 main entree dishes) which you would assume would be amazing since there aren't that many entrees; however, I would only recommend the appetizers (the only decent food items for the price and the taste). I ordered the lobster which was extremely small and SUPER salty, my friend ordered the chicken which was PINK and she had a terrible stomachache after dining here for the remainder of the night and the day after. The food also took quite a bit of time which was not as expected for such a high class restaurant. All in all I would only recommend going here if your main motive is to dine in with a view and grab drinks and appetizers.

Fantastic view and awesome food! You can walk out to the Edge and see the entire NY under your feet. The food itself is delicious and well prepared. The foie gras is prepared in two ways and very fresh. The dry aged steak is crispy outside and very tender inside. The steak comes with small potatoes which is a surprisingly delicious. I highly recommend this restaurant for both the view, atmosphere and food.
It's worth a visit, even for Sunday dinner! The staff is lovely and accommodating, but not overbearing.
No comment
No comment
No comment

This place has amazing views but the food is not up to par for the price. The bread was delicious and the right amount of flakey. For apps we got foi gras, scallops and tuna. The scallops were well done just nothing special. The tuna was enjoyable but again nothing that made it stand out. For mains the pork and the duck was underwhelming. The duck came with a nice sauce but was rough to chew and same goes for the pork chop- was hard to even cut. The dessert made up for it, get the cherry gelato for a tangy end to your meal. Overall unimpressed by taste but presentation and atmosphere as well as the complimentary access to the edge after the meal compensated.
Kory was the best bartender. He literally made my night. Thank you so much for the drink recommendations.
View was fantastic. Service was impeccable. I highly recommend. FYI there is a small bar up top where no reservations are needed.
Excellent food at perfect portions. Tagliatelle were spicy and delicious. Chocolate tart dessert was fantastic. Amazing view- ask for window table when making reservations. Service is awesome.

Went here for a fancy birthday dinner, and it was fantastic! They were great about accommodating our requests for certain views, and most importantly the food was great! We tried several things on the menu. My favorites were the beef short rib appetizer, the Sunchoke salad appetizer and "The Egg" dessert.
No comment
No comment

For the price you can find better food in Manhattan. I chose to visit this restaurant after a visit to The Edge with my spouse and friends. We had dinner plans elsewhere, however we were motivated to see the beautiful NYC sunset. We were in tasteful clothing (jeans & polo) and were treated as if we were second class citizens. After asking if there was reservations the host responded by saying "please make sure something fancy's you on the menu first" in a very condescending and rude manner. He then stared and smiled as the other host showed us to our table. I am a company executive and have never been treated as if I did not have the means to enter any establishment. It was a total pretty woman moment! I didn't catch the name of the host, however shame on you!!

11/10. This was such a great experience. The whole vibe, service, view, taste. All great. The Hudson Valley foie gras was incredible. Don't miss this. Access to the outdoor observation deck, The Edge, is free. Need to book about a month in advance

I took my fiancé to Peak for his birthday. Hands down one of the best restaurants I've been to in NYC. The quality of the food was amazing. Each dish was very unique and the flavors on each plate just blended very well together.

Dined here this past August. It was a very elegant experience on the top floor of the Edge! My favorite part was the view from our table. It was breathtaking to see the skyline of NYC. This is definitely a place I'll come back to if I'm near again!

Would've loved to try, but the stubbornly unprofessional Jordan at reception made it hell for me to simply go join my family who were already seated and were waiting for me. It was so ridiculous that I called my family and we all left to go somewhere else. A bit of warmth and a sense of welcoming would be good, especially if you are supposed to 'welcome' guests, and especially for a place in which you are about to spend hundreds of dollars on a simple lunch.  Shame I heard great things about the place and wanted to test before taking my clients.
Ron and Oss was the most amazing hosts, the custom craft drinks and food bites and entrees were amazeballs. I highly recommend this 101st floor venue
No comment
No comment

column3: Corona Del Mar, Newport Beach, CA
column6: By far my new favorite place in New York. The food was to DIE FOR. Absolutely amazing. My mouth watered with every bite. The lamb melted in my mouth and the mousse was very rich with good texture and taste. The meal was also nicely paired with an exciting view of lightning storms outside the window.

column3: Lower Nob Hill, San Francisco, CA
column6: This place is what I'd consider a perfect restaurant: located on 101st floor with amazing breath-taking view, excellent service, great food with thoughtful plating!!! Will definitely come back as a regular
No comment

I came here with colleagues for after work drinks and appetizers.  It took some time to find the place and then we were instructed to wait in their main area before being escorted in the elevator ride up.  When we arrived, the view was absolutely breathtaking.  As part of being guests at the Peak, we could walk around the observation area.  The service was excellent.  Servers brought hors d'oeuvre that looked great but the food was a bit too hipster for my taste.  It looked great on the platters but had questionable tastes/mixtures.  I recall a mushroom appetizer that tasted more like cheese than mushroom.  There was also a tuna tartare and a shrimp appetizer mixed with some other ingredients.  We were also offered raw oysters in the shell, which I skipped.  If I were to return, I would probably try some other dishes more to my liking and definitely look forward to the amazing view.

I had a great experience the first time, but I can't say the same for the second time here. Service definitely plays a big part in clienteles dining experience. I ordered a glass of sparkling wine and was charged a whole bottle instead; that got adjusted once I brought it to the waitress' attention. Now I'm looking at my bank statement and my credit card got charged twice (total to be more than what I signed). This is not ok. (She also overcharged the table next to ours -  my family overheard it).
Great lunch spot with a view.  Too bad the lunch choices were limited.  I do like the healthy selections.  Each were beautifully presented.
No comment
An amazing space with fantastic service and beautiful views! Meet here with some friends just this past weekend and had a great time. Definitely worth checking out when they reopen.

I brought my 8 year old here for his birthday and he LOVED it.  It was a little confusing to get to at first but the elevator rode up and the view of the city was phenomenal. The wait staff was very friendly and they paid attention to my reservation allergy accommodations.   I would have gave 5 stars if they had bigger portion sizes for the price. My fiancé was still hungry after apps and entree. My 8 year old enjoyed the burger and all the apps we ordered.  I probably wouldn't take children under 8 as it is fancy, slow to bring food out, and not a great menu for that age range. But they did bring him out his favorite food as a birthday dessert!

The peak is situated at the top of Hudson Yards mall and the views from up top did not disappoint. Dining here does require a reservation. The entire experience from checking in to the end of our meal was a treat. No matter where you are seated in the restaurant you're going to see beautiful views of the city. We came here for lunch and ordered the milk bread, the lobster bolognese, and the American Wagyu Burger. Water is complimentary whether you get still or sparkling. The waitstaff cleared the table between each dish and changed out our utensils as well after each use. Everything was honestly very good. We also ordered a dessert, but because it was a birthday lunch they surprised us with an additional small treat! The staff was attentive and friendly the entire time and left very happy. An additional perk of dining at the Peak is that you get complimentary access to the Edge. You can choose to go before or after your meal.

Great spot! Most "high up" spots I have been to have great food but disappoint when it comes to the food. This is not the case with the peak: both views and food are amazing. I recommend trying the foie Gras and the "Egg".

Wow!  Not only is the view the best in NYC, the food and service were incredible.  Just the right amount of attention without being overwhelmed.  The lumaconi appetizer and duck entrees were stand outs.  My husband had the pork and my son had the halibut - those were also both fantastic.  I finished with the egg dessert and t was a perfect finish although we had the cheese plate and my last bite was of the blue with spicy peach jam.  An incredible and very memorable night!

Can I give them 6 stars? This place is excellent! I went there for my birthday and felt so appreciated by the staff who are super nice and knowledgeable. The views in the restaurant are fantastic and you also get complimentary entrance to the Edge which is an excellent plus. The somalierllier was very knowledgeable and nice and really helped us pick a wine we loved. The Milk bread is a must order! So good! Light and savory while having a crispy exterior. Amazing! I also got the carrot wellington which was savory and delicious and like nothing I have ever had before. Then as a surprise they got me a chocolate ganache donut to come with our chocolate and coffee dessert order. Both were sooo tasty and not too sweet. I am shocked they do not have a Michelin star yet with their clear attention to detail (always filling our water glasses) and excellent quality of food. Will definitely come back!

Peak was so worth it. It offered such an elevated experience that is hard to beat. Dining in NYC is known for being expensive and while Peak is definitely on the higher end of that range when you take into account what you get it's worth a visit. We were immediately greeted with a champagne cart. We opted for cocktails instead but it was a nice touch. The on staff sommeliers were very knowledgeable on pairings. The food was incredible from the bread at the beginning to the cocktails and entrees ( I had the squash blossoms and I'd definitely recommend) . You also get admission to the edge with your dinner. For exclusive time at the edge without the tourists a late night dinner can grant you access after they leave. The views from the tables are spectacular. I'd recommend the bees knees cocktail as well, it was so hard to not down the whole thing immediately. Considering some places in NYC rely on Instagram-esque opportunities to draw people in Peak is one of the few spots that does both incredible food and experiential dining.

One might expect a restaurant perched on the 101th floor right next to The Edge to be a tourist trap. But no. This place is a culinary delight. The bread is not complimentary, but it is worth every penny. Every dish is great, and generously portioned. In fact, we didn't even have room for the dessert after the appetizer and the main course. Great staff. Spectacular views. Great food. Fair price. If you don't want to spend extra money for The Edge, you can get the same great views here (except for the glass floor).
No comment
No comment

Everything was great! The service, the view, the food, the drinks! Such a great experience! Very welcoming and friendly hostess took us to the elevator, then we were greeted by another hostess, who brought us to our table! The food is at the highest level of quality!
No comment
No comment

What a beautiful place. You have to make reservations months in advance, however this restaurant is amazing if you are lucky to score a table by the window which we did. The food and service is top notch and well the drinks some of the best I have had. Get ready to spend $$$$ but definitely worth it for a special occasion. Order the monkey bread and lamb ragu, it's divine.
No comment

The most incredible view in Manhattan! After you enjoy the Edge deck I came in for dinner without a reservation and they were able to sit me at the bar, which was great. I got the scallops to start which were delicious, then the green tomato tart which I actually don't recommend- it was mushy, hard to eat, not the best flavour- edible though. Dessert was amazing and our bartender was so sweet! And GET THE MILK BREAD!

A lunch date at the Peak on a fine Saturday afternoon  It has Manhattan's best view from the 101 floor of the Hudson Yards. Flavorful dishes: my favorite was the wagyu burger100% recommend this place for celebrations or just simply grab a bite with a great view.
No comment

I went to Peak yesterday for lunch. The service could not have been more attentive. The meal was spectacular and the chef tweaked a dish to account for my food allergy. We each ordered a cocktail. My friends ordered one of the signature cocktails which was over the top spectacular. I opted for a 1920's classic cocktail called the Aviation which was crafted to absolute perfection. Add a spectacular view and it was an amazing lunch with my amazing friends. Truly a Peak experience. Thank you Peak.

We decide to give Peak a try after seeing the restaurant when we went to the Edge. We started off with a couple of appetizers Lamb Rigatoni and Monkey bread, both were great and we even ordered another Monkey bread it was killer. 3 of got the Wagyu Burger, the other two butter nut squash soup and the trout. All the food was simply amazing and the view is unbelievable. If I could change one thing it would be the bun for the burger, tasted a little like a croissant but still a solid 9 on the burger.  Funny thing is even better than the view and the food was the staff, unbelievable how attendant, friendly and kind they were. Definitely heading back for dinner.
No comment

I came here for the first time for my boyfriend's 30th birthday late December. I wasn't really sure what to expect, and was a bit worried that it would be over priced for what it was worth. However, my boyfriend and I ended up having the most exquisite and wonderful evening. The journey to the top of the restaurant was exciting in itself; the food was also phenomenal and the ambience was very romantic. We were especially impressed with the service by our waiter, Ara. He was not only extremely friendly and warm, but also provided us with spot-on recommendations. From the most delicious cocktails, wines and desserts, Ara made our experience at Peak the best it could've been. He even brought out a special birthday treat for my boyfriend -- it was the most perfect surprise. Will definitely be back again the next time we are in New York, and hope we can have Ara as our waiter again!

I came here last night for my friends birthday and had such an amazing night! First, our server Alfonso was phenomenal. By far one the the best hospitality members I've gotten the pleasure to meet. We started out with a round of drinks where I got the Old Sport. We then moved to apps, where we ordered the milk bread (monkey bread with honey butter), the fois gras, scallops, and a lettuce salad with whipped avocado and pear in it. The crust part of the milk bread was so tasty. If only pizza crust tasted like that. The pin wheel for the fois gras was delish. The other two versions on the plate were also yummy. And then the pickled rhubarb or beet on the side was amaze! The scallop was also great, although next time I will likely replace this with another app due to portion size vs price. The app comes with 2 scallops with a sliver of cauliflower on top. The salad was so refreshing and honestly my favorite of these. For dinner I got the duo of pork while one friends ordered the duck and 2 others ordered the 30 day aged ribeye. All were tasty. My favorite was the duck so I will likely order this next time. The lobster and fluke may win me over when I come back though. The chimichurri sauce for the ribeye was so delish. I wanted to put it on everything! The pork came with a little bit of pork belly which I loved. I'm also a huge fan of black eyed peas so it was a pleasant surprise seeing these layered onto the plate. The Bordeaux we picked to go with dinner paired well with all dishes. For dessert, I got an espresso and the chocolate & caramel. I also got to try their black Forrest donut which wasn't on the menu. They surprised us with the donut for my friends birthday. I loved both and would totally order these again and again. Our waiter also sent us complimentary dessert wines that the chef picked out after our main took longer than expected. We did not bother the wait, nor did we say anything but they still went out of their way to recognize it which we highly appreciated. Lastly right before we left, the manager came out and offered us a private tour of the Indoor portion of the Edge as the outside portion had closed for the night. He brought us into the room and just told us to leave when ready. As the only people back there, we took in the views without any pressure of others being around or feeling pushed to leave. It was truly an incredible night that none of us will ever forget. Thank you Peak & Alfonso for such a memorable time. I will be back soon.
