A bit expensive but wow this place is incredible. Comes with a vip entrance to The Edge. Views are excellent and food is decadent. Reservations are impossible to get but half of the room was empty. I thought this was for social distancing, but noticed that most tables with people were right next to eachother so I don't know what that's about.

Fluke was far too salty. Other food was mostly adequate; tropical egg dessert was the best course. Good view but window seating should have been provided on arrival instead of after the first course, as it was requested during reservation and promised on entry.
The view, the food, the service - the whole package with this place.   Thoroughly enjoyed my birthday dinner there.   Would love to bring my out of town family to this place.

First time visiting with a friend from out of town. The service and experience along with the food was great. Food very flavorful and well thought out. Would definitely visit again. Would just recommend planning on a sunny day without fog to spoil the view.
I visited here third times, asked another seat before the seat was occupied. They ignored my request and served water late.
No comment

I was just leaving the Edge (totally lost looking for the exit) feeling somewhat satisfied about the experience then I happened to notice a chic male hostess in front of the entrance of what seemed like a glistening nook Illuminating from sunbeams. I needed to go inside. I asked if there was any availability to stay and watch the sunset and so pleasantly I was seated within a minute. The bar tables couldn't be placed more perfect, while organically structured to be socially distanced, to view the sun fall over the Hudson and vanish into New Jersey. The staff was extremely attentive and without trying made me become an instant advocate....Will have to come back for dinner but the small bites and cocktails fit the character of this new New York classic.
No comment

The absolute PINNACLE of my Mid-Winter Recess! Not only was the view breathtaking, but our server, Maria, was so friendly she was the cherry on the top of our evening!  I loved every second of my evening at Peak. I went for dinner and after a week of dieting I treated myself to the steak- so flavorful that nothing else was needed. The drinks (a Cosmo and an Old Fashioned) were ABSOLUTELY PERFECT!!! The color and flavor were the best we've had! ( it beat out The Beekman by a mile)  The best place to be in all of Manh
This place is a joke. To get upstairs for a drink, they have to call "to see if there's room" but no one upstairs picks up the phone. Manufactured exclusivity for a place that isn't that cool.

Total tourist crowd. People to the right and left of us had their overcoats at their tables as the coat check was full. Our table wasn't ready  when we arrived but we were told the bar was full so we couldn't have a drink while we waitEd. It took forever to get a bottle of champagne to start because we were told the wine cellar is four floors below. Entree choices very limited. Views amazing and food was very good but this is not a place where any sophisticated person or diner would be satisfied

Was here about a month ago. Simply amazing, you get an extraordinary view with amazing service! From the start our sommelier Beata greeted us with a great variety of champagne celebrating my friends anniversary, followed by this amazing monkey bread and honey butter. Food was out of this world, and especially with the view you have it was a different world to eat in. Would like to thank Beata and David for a great experience! Will be coming back!
No comment

First time at The Peak and the food was okay. We had much higher expectations since most of the restaurants at Hudson Yards has never disappointed us. We ordered the fluke but it was on the salty side. The duck was nothing special or that flavorful. Maybe we expected something similar to Eleven Madison Park. The milk bread, ink pasta and the desserts were good. Definitely it's a restaurant to go to for the view and the dishes were priced very reasonable.

Every aspect of the experience at Peak was First Class! Kudos to chef Chris Cryer for creating an exquisite menu that is bursting with innovation and culinary excellence with a variety of offerings for everyone. The pork and tuna may have been the best we ever had. His choice of ingredients and presentation are as good as we've had a Michelin 5 star rated restaurant. Isaiah was both professional and efficient allowing us to enjoy the entire experience un-rushed. This was one of the best dining experiences in New York including comparisons to celebrity chef restaurants that stuff you in and speed you out. If you are foodie, like we are, who appreciates well constructed dishes paired with unparalleled views during your dining experience, then Peak is the perfect place for you!

I don't like giving bad reviews because this is usually an awesome restaurant near my apartment. My very first time here I had a great time and amazing food, but to tell me my table is going to be ready in 10 min two times and having it turn into a 50 minute wait is just ridiculous. I understand if you have a  huge engagement party, but you need to tell us that you can't honor our reservation so that we can make other arrangements for lunch. When we were seated, it was clear the restaurant was overwhelmed, tables were still being cleaned and no one had their food. For what it's worth, the downstairs host was apologetic about the wait, but still upset that this happened for what was meant to be a valentines lunch.
amazing food professional employees would return 9/10 the view is amaxinggggg plus you get free access to edge GO HERE
Crazy amazing! My head is spinning from another level of dininig! 101 floor overlooking all of Manhattan if you are lucky enough to be allowed up here! The food is great
No comment
No comment
Erickson is the most attentive server ever, I love how he explained every dish and walked us through the menu and encouraged us to try new things! I am amazed with the service and the experience!

I consider myself a foodie; I absolutely love food and chefs and cuisine and the power of food as story. I can't say good things about the food here: it was pedestrian. The view is stellar. I'd recommend eating here for lunch and not a wow dinner. Service took long for dinner to arrive. My favorite thing was the salad and bread, and our table tried everything: the duck, chicken, fish... it's disappointing to say the least. I hope they get a new chef in here with a vision and some electric taste because NY f'ckn deserves that at a restaurant on top of the world, and this place just did not deliver.

So I would like to start out this review by saying that the hostess and our waiter were absolutely fantastic. After that it all goes down hill.  Our waiter suggested that we get the milk bread while we wait for our lunch since everything was made to order. We thought that was a great idea and ordered the milkfrad. We waited, and waited, and waited and finally our food came. Shortly there after the milk braid arrived! Please suggested that they take it back since we already had our lunch but they offered to comp the bread so we kept it. This is where the story gets interesting... My husband ordered a medium rare steak: it was neither. When he cut into it it was steak tartare. I had ordered a well-done burger and when I cut into it it was medium rare. It appears that the restaurant doesn't know how to cook its meat properly. I just same time I happened to look over to a table next to us and a gentleman had left most of his burger and eaten. The middle of the burger was totally raw, which Could suggest why it was not eaten. In any event my husband returned the state and asked for it to be properly cooked, however I ate the burger because I was relatively hungry. When my husband State came back it was now medium well. However he was too hungry to Send it back, and it by this time I had all ready eaten.  Overall I would judge our experience subpar. If you are charging $42 for steak and $35 for a burger you should get it right and cook it to the customers expectations. I would say I would not ever go back to this place, I would just go to the bar and then go to the observation deck

This is very shady place. We came in before 5 pm and they told us to wait til 5 pm to go up, 5 pm comes, they tell us we need a reservation and that will take a 1.5 hr. This is uncalled for if we needed a reservation why didn't they explain to us when we arrive at 4;30?????  Shady

Wanted SO much to like this place and left very disappointed. Took 2 hours total just for appetizers/drinks and dinner. Drinks took nearly 20 min to come out even though the restaurant wasn't full. Took nearly 40 minutes after appetizers to get our entrees. Our $75 medium rare steak came out cooked well done and was inedible. We didn't want to wait even longer to get a new steak so paid and left...

DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME AND MONEY HERE. I am extremely disappointed in the experience my family and I had here. I made a reservation for 9 pm weeks in advance, but we were not seated at our table for almost an hour after arriving on time. Because we waited so long, we decided to stick to drinks and dessert. After asking our server for dessert menus, the maitre d came over --seemingly concerned about our satisfaction--only to shame us for not ordering a full meal. He essentially implied that we were taking up a table for another potential party that would make the restaurant more money. This would have been a reasonable response if we did not order anything, but we purchased overpriced cocktails, mediocre appetizers, and underwhelming desserts, only to be treated as if we could not afford more. Any appetite I had disappeared after this blatant disrespect. The only positives to our experience was our server and the panoramic views of the city. Obviously we tipped our server generously as he was excellent and apologetic for the maitre d's behavior. I also should add that the maitre d was initially very attentive, but once he found out we would be spending less money than he would have preferred, he was extremely rude and never returned to our table the remainder of the evening. It's safe to say we will not be coming back here.
Absolutely amazing from the views, the food, the service, decor, ambiance, everything and then some. Not much more to say other than it's a must go. Worth every penny!
Amazing rooftop bar/restaurant on the 101th floor at Hudson yards overlooking the edge. Breathtaking views and cocktails with delicious foods. Great for a special occasion.

From the moment that we got into the lobby we knew this was going to be a one of a kind experience, the host politely escorted us to a private elevator that took us in 45 seconds to heaven, the second host walk us promptly to a beautiful and breathtaking room that has one of the best views in the world, our server Louis welcomed us and designed a complete top notch experience full of incredible bites, excellent service and the best vibes, my food highlights are the yellowfin tuna and the squid ink chitarra!,  Beata the sommelier paired our food choices with the best wines, and David the manager was always checking back on us having a good experience, I have to say this was one of the best dinners I've ever had, I can't wait to come back!!!

I wanted to give a big credit to the whole crew team at Peak NYC. Two weeks ago, I made an appointment via Resy website as I know this is one of the most popular restaurants with fantastic rooftop views in the world. I made a note to speak about my proposal plan today and asked them for help to give my fiancee a big surprise. Fortunately, she said 'Yes' to me with all the support I got from the waiters to the host. Firstly, even without guarantee, they still reserved a seat pretty close to the window with pretty good privacy for me. Secondly, they helped me hold a flower delivery and kept it a secret till the end of desert menu time. Thirdly, they helped me put my ring into a pretty fancy plate and finally brought it in with flowers together. Lastly, they even helped me make a video to record this most important moment in my life. Through all the process, everyone was trying their best to help me achieve this objective. I can feel I am not alone and I got a whole team to be my backup. Additionally, I wanted to thank the customers who were near me for all your congratulations. Again, if you were asking me where is the best place to make a proposal, I would not hesitate to say 'The Peak NYC'.
The view is incomparable, and the decor is beautiful, but the food is uninteresting at best.  Dessert was slightly better, but sadly, if the food matched the view you'd have a 5-star restaurant.

Please don't have a table sat directly next to the cash register/food thing. The entire night my date was annoyed people could hear us because the place you ring the food into was right behind him! Maybe just don't even give anyone that table to begin with? Not really fair that for the same price you can sit there, far away from the view with people behind you working while others get to be secluded with a great view. Just something to think about before booking here that you're not guaranteed a table with a view or privacy...
great drinks, super charismatic bartenders and staff, and a refreshing menu. highly recommend for an event and to impress someone special in your life. the views and service are amazing.

If your a seafood lover the scallops are the best on the menu. I had the main lobster and it was maybe 2-3oz. but tasted good with the sides. If you like drawn butter - it's not served in the house. The chicken was awesome, as were the side dishes, scallops as appetizers are the way to go. Enjoy!

Booked a table for 4 on 5/11 for birthday celebration. Called the restaurant one month ahead to make the reservation, but the restaurant told me for reservation on 5/11, I can make reservation online starting 9am on 4/21. So I set alarm on 4/21 8:50 to remind me of the reservation. After making reservation online with notes of requesting window seat, I called the restaurant to make sure they can see the note and the cake cutting fee. On 5/11, when I arrived, window seat was not given, so I ask the waiter. He said there is a waiting list for window seat and he can move us to window seat when people leave. We stayed in the restaurant from 6:30 to 8:30. I saw two table of 4 left and new customers come. I asked again for window seat, and he gave me the same response. I already make my reservation earliest in advance, so I don't understand why so many people are before me on that waiting list. Also, as waiter said people leave then he can move us, that was not our case. Very disappointment for my birthday experience.

Was greeted and treated well by everyone but really ignored by the bartender. So sitting at the bar might not be the best choice. I sat there with an empty drink for a while. The bar was  less than half full. Wanted to ask the bartender where the restroom was but he was not attentive at all. Was a little confused by the experience but everyone else was amazing and extremely helpful/friendly. The scallops were great.

My friend and I had dinner here last Friday and we had an amazing time. Neither of us had seen NYC like this before. We felt really safe covid wise. The food was delicious! We especially loved the scallops and duck. It was nice to be out in NYC again. I highly recommend this place.

Extraordinary place.  We had the loveliest time. The staff, the meal, the vibe and well ... that view. Can't say enough. Just go and enjoy the magic of New York City. As wonderful for New Yorkers as for visitors. Thank you to everyone at Peak who made my husband's birthday dinner with our family an affair to remember.

PEAK is a true service, culinary, and ambiance experience! From the moment we were warmly greeted by Amarita at the reception desk we knew we would have a great experience. We dined for lunch on a beautiful sunny  Friday afternoon, allowing full views of lower Manhattan, Queens and Brooklyn! Our Server Margot was exemplary in every sense of the customer service term. She was warm, attentive, informative and caring. A real gem! The lunch menu has choices for every palette. We started with the Monkey Bread, which was an absolute delight, along with an excellent bottle of Brut Rose Champagne, followed by the Crudo and Seared Tuna, which were both excellent. For main courses we shared the Farro, which I still can say has been the best I've ever had, I had the Atlantic scallops and my friend had the Black Truffle Tagliatelle. Both were beyond delicious! Thank you PEAK Team!

Beautiful views, delicious food, snazzy drinks and impeccable service. We really couldn't ask for more here. Safety measures were taken very seriously. I enjoyed my entire experience here and would definitely go back again when things are open and safe.

What a beautiful evening to remember. My partner and I went for our Anniversary, I'm telling you we had the best time there. We started it our dinner with an appetizer and chose the Rigatoni, what a delicious dish. Then, for our Entrees we had the Main Lobster and the 16 oz Rib Eye Steak. Another magnificent dishes , and let's not forget, for drink we got the Bussola Recioto della Valpicella bottle it was a red sweet wine from the '15, delicious! The food was amazing, the view was beautiful, the place itself was gorgeous and of course the service was amazing. Definitely have to comeback again.

I went to Peak this evening and was expecting a lot from the food, views, service,etc especially after reading all the favorable reviews. I did enjoy the view and service but I was disappointed with the food. I ordered the scallop and tuna appetizers and the scallop dish consisted of two scallops. At a minimum, this should have been three scallops as that's what I've noticed is the industry standard. Next, I was excited to try the ribeye as my entree. It came sliced up, at room temp so not hot or cold, salty, and very fatty. We barely had any steak as most of it was fat. I was very disappointed with the cut of meat we received and for the price, really underwhelmed. Everything else as far as sides, dessert, bread etc was good but to me if the entree does not wow me than the meal is not a success. On a side note, I was there at the beginning of the dinner rush at 5 and was also surprised to see that there were crumbs left on the carpet next to my table and fuzz/dust as well. During Covid, cleanliness is of utmost importance to me so cleaning between seatings is obviously critical.

View is amazing from the 101st floor of this Hudson Yards restaurant. I went with 3 of my girlfriends & we had a great night out after not being in a restaurant in over a year. 1 thing is we ordered scallops that only came with 2. The waiter knowing we were sharing this appetizer could of let us know it only came with 2, so we then could of ordered another plate of the same thing or something else.

Let me tell you, Peak was certainly wonderful. It is nice place. Every single thing that I have already tried has been quite tasty. The team is always friendly; willing to go above and beyond for you. Yes, Peak actually care that you are happy.

Excellent decor, beautiful views and great food, BUT service was lacking. A reservation was made 2+ weeks in advance with a request for a table by the window. The table was not ready upon arrival and we were seated towards the entrance of the restaurant with heavy food traffic. Bread was not served for 30+ minutes , drinks sat at the bar for 10 minutes and entree side was not delivered together with the entree.  Both table around us got rotated at least twice. Definitely disappointed by lack of service and attention to detail.
What a view .. Great place service an A plus . Wonderful people but the food was marginal at best ..

Amazing view and Fancy presentable food. Great service attentive staff. We made a reservation for lunch today and they did not limit the capacity. It was packed and everyone sitting besides each other and no social distancing. It was packed and all seats were reserved and close to one another. We enjoyed the view however, we thought by making reservation they will follow the protocol. There were no sanitizers provided and no temperature checked.

Amazing food for any diet, drinks were fantastic and service was also on point. I made a reservation about a week in advance for four. Health protocols made me feel very safe. Everyone needs to try the carrots!

The cocktails and view are incredible. They have a separate lounge and restaurant area. I highly recommend making a reservation at the restaurant beforehand but if you show up early enough, you can get seated in the lounge area as a walk in to get a few cocktails. The drinks are delicious and the view is even more breathtaking. Making this my new date/celebratory spot. Highly recommend!

A truly magical experience.  A view unlike any other in the city. Great food and drinks, amazing service,  and very health/safety conscious.  It was one evening- but so special and really felt like a treat in these times. The sommelier, Beatta, was especially wonderful. Highly recommended.  We will be back and recommended to friends and family!

the view is beautiful and so is the interior design... however the service was very slow and the food came out cold. additionally the portion sizes are very small for the amount of money you end up paying. the food was not worth all the money. if you are going for the experience it is an ok time but the food is not great. we had a reservation at 8:15 and didn't get served until 10:00

A recent trip (and our first) to the Peak at Hudson Yards has me writing early.  The trip up to the restaurant/bar space was attended to by four people whose collective demeanor created just the mood we were looking for. The first steps into the space were breathtaking, plain and simple. Seated at the bar I don't remember a "first-look" session that created more excitement about the potential future for this deep and brilliantly chosen selection. I could go on for a while on this alone but to be brief, the bar is not going for flash, it is clearly going for depth, nuance and story-telling. Moving into the dining room the motor-driven blinds that were partially closed until sunset slowly opened creating another breath-taking moment. Nothing like it. Period. The dinner was superb from appetizers to dessert and we were collectively wondering if this level of experience was sustainable. The peak was the dessert. A work of art in chocolate mousse with salted caramel sauce, gold foil, raspberry sorbet, dark chocolate crunch, raspberry fruit/purée artwork. We were asked if we would like to move into the space on the other side of the floor (views facing northward) for apéretif/digestif. A single malt Rye and Armagnac capped the evening at a wonderfully slow pace, the view, unparalleled. Unforgettable evening for their second night open. Kudos. Will return soon.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Dropped by here for lunch. It was pretty empty though I could tell they were getting lots of pickup orders. You can order takeout at the counter or sit down to eat. I sat down and ordered the Beijing Street Noodles. The portion was honestly pretty big - lots of noodles, minced pork, and shredded cucumbers. Didn't notice the black bean sauce but overall pretty good. Overall, pretty straightforward place with nice portions and good prices for Williamsburg ($12 for this). Would definitely recommend and try the rest of their menu.

This was a nice spot in Williamsburg that i walked into. The food was okay, they have a happy hour that is pretty good. I tried the crispy chicken wings with soy garlic sauce, a mint mojito, and a scallion pancake. The wings were okay. They were crispy but the sauce didn't do it for me. I've had better soy garlic sauce. Also, you can't take the happy hour food to go. It must be eaten in the establishment which is okay. The ambiance was cool. It was a cool mixture of hip hop, pop and R&B. They have a couple tables where you can dine in. The service was just okay. The lady at the counter was busy doing other things each time we approached the counter. So it wasn't the best service. I asked a question about one of the food items and decided against it by the way she described it. It was almost as if we were disturbing her. I hate that feeling. All in all, this place was just okay. I don't think I'll return tho. I'm sure there's better bao buns down Bedford. See pics below

Very average place for dumplings. The xiao long bao wasn't amazing and I wouldn't get it here again. The curry fried rice was also ok. The service was very meh. They got annoyed because we asked for extra utensils/plates which was kinda of off putting and felt kinda cheap.

Mr. bao has been popping up everywhere! And this location is open late so it's perfect for a bite after a night out. Fast service, good amount if seating. Food comes out hot! The buns are chewy and soft as they should be! Check this place out for a quick bite. They also offer takeout on several platforms. My favorite is the duck bao buns. They are so chewy and soft yet a meaty- nice balance.

I've ordered delivery a few times from here & it's always been so good, fresh, and relatively well priced. My personal favorites have been the shrimp dumplings (the dipping sauce is excellent) as well as the scallion pancakes - which are perfectly crispy and chewy. They also get bonus points because they're open late for those wee hour cravings!

Solid Dim Sum available until 2am. I recommend the pork fried dumplings, the shrimp dumplings. The popcorn ship had a great seasoning on it, and the green beans were perfect. Really impressive that they make everything fresh and homemade.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I had an appointment in New York and stopped in here before heading to catch my flight back to Texas. I eat a LOT of Asian food, and can solidly recommend Mr Bao! Service was efficient and friendly, the food was amazing (especially the pork XLB), and they had the white peach soda I can't seem to ever find. I can't wait until we come back to New York so I can bring my boyfriend!
So good and the delivery came early! It's one of the few places that offer delivery in this area late at night!
No comment

Here is a photo of the moldy chopsticks I received with my food delivery from Mr Bao today. I obviously didn't eat the food, didn't ask for a refund just glad I saw the chopsticks. Be advised that health inspections haven't been happening regularly after Covid. Be safe out there. I'm not the Yelp reviewer type but this definitely had me

I have gotten about half the menu at this point & it's basically all good. No matter what I get, I always add the steamed soup dumplings & then usually have leftovers of whatever else I got. The braised beef is great & all those bowls have a jammy soy sauce egg that makes everything better.
No comment

Perfect place to get a quick meal before going out! I came here on Saturday night and only had to wait 10 mins for a table. Dumplings were delicious and pork and rice dish was great. Prices are really reasonable! Would def come back

really wanted a light meal and ordered a vegetable soup. It was super salty and impossible to drink. I have no idea where is the vegetable besides the few pieces floating on top. I paid 5 bucks for this and it is very disappointing.
Been there a once a while back, love all those small plates.  The place is pretty small with attentive service and good food. I  will definitely go back for more soup dumplings.

This is one of my favorite Chinese dim sum restaurants in Williamsburg I've ever been to! And I've been all over the world including to China! The Chef Special was phenomenal!  The soup dumplings were top notch! I'm obsessed with the Chrysanthemum tea too. Kiki, our server was the best. She is so kind and polite. I highly recommend it

Super good place I came here with my friend after we looked around. I love soup dumplings so I got the pork crab soup dumpling it was super good. It's not as the best as compared to the ones I go at China town but still great

This place is totally on point re food and the people who work there are wonderful!!  I always enjoy the experience whether sitting in or taking out.  My personal opinion is the vegan spring rolls are tops in the neighborhood!
Amazing. Best soup dumplings in Brooklyn. Had an amazing time, staff is great- I definitely recommend to anyone who is in Brooklyn to try them out
Chef's dumplings, short rib guabao, roasted duck wrap should be on every single order. Don't pay attention to how it looks from the outside, the food is really really tasty.

Ordered take out. I got the create your own - jasmine rice, wild mushroom & salt & pepper shrimp. The shrimp had very good flavor. I was a little surprised by the mushroom. I was expecting something different but overall it still taste good. It reminds me of seaweed.

One and done. With the amount of places that serve dim sum this is not worth another try. Ordered about five different dumplings and a duck appetizer. The duck was oily and the paper wrapping was hard to distinguish. The dumpling fillings were flavorful and definitely worthy of a bit of a yummy praise however the dumpling masa (dough) was so thick and on some so mushy it was unpleasant and inedible. Overall I'd say try any of the many other spots around. (Note: my eats were pre-covid times).
Ordered the dan dan noodles, duck wrap, and soup dumplings-- all absolutely delicious. Can't believe this place doesn't have a 5 star rating! Can't wait to try everything else.

I'm so glad I tried this place again. It's not somewhere I would dine in at, but the food is amazing. I can't get over how good the braised beef was. It was succulent and the flavor was perfect. The smashed cucumbers were also sooo good. I wanted more! I liked the option for Korean style multigrain rice. The duck roll is also awesome. It's super flavorful. I came back just for that. The chicken wings are very crisp fried Korean fried chicken style. My friend raved about the dumplings - he had pork and chive and chicken and cabbage. To me they seem standard. He couldn't tell which was which but was very happy and ate every drop. I do wish the dine in experience was better. It's definitely more of a takeout place. Oh and the customer service was great! I accidentally placed my online order to the Park Slope location, and when I called to cancel they transferred the order for me. They made it nice and easy for me, which I really appreciated. Will be back!
Great fresh food. They forgot to enter one of the dishes but it turned out fine because we were pretty full by dish #3. Would definitely go back again.
Fantastic spicy wontons, hot and sour soup, and duck wrap. Highly recommend late night takeout
Everything was bomb. The Taiwanese fried chicken wrap was my favorite. Love that they're open later than most places these days.
Amazing food and the lady at the register is a Doll .. I love this place .. Williamsburg does have it all

More like Mr WOW! The food is incredible. Just take a look at the picture attached to this review. If that isn't beautiful, idk what is then. I have to say that the meat was so tender, I could just bite it off with my mouth without using utensils. I do not recommend. Less so if you are on a date. But that tells you how good that was. Maybe the rice could have been more on point but everything else was delicious.

The staff is so friendly. All the food is delicious and fresh, been there several times and it has always come out really fast. A great place to go, especially if you're gluten free, they cook many dishes with tamari and the staff is knowledgeable about many allergies.
No comment

I guess this place is part of a chain. Basically Asian fast food. The menu looks good but we found most of it really awful. The fried calamari was so greasy. The Beijing Street noodles were awful, tasteless and gummy store bought noodles. The soup dumplings were edible, but still not recommended. The service is all plastic even if you sit at a table and order from a waiter. You can do so much better in this neighborhood! Vanessa's Dumplings is similar but WAY better. M/Shanghai has much better soup dumplings.

Delivery soup dumplings are kind of a white whale and these are quite, quite good.  Cue XLB snobs saying they're not good... Yes, I know the holy grail of XLB is typically to get the thinnest skin possible, but I don't really care, and these are not too thick. Also, I'm not going to flushing or the Bao on St Marks every time I want a soup dumpling.  The crab and pork are delicious, get them. I wasn't a huge fan of the "sandwich" baos (including the duck others seem to like, it was glazed with too much soy/hoisin for me) or the non-soup dumplings. The best chicken dish is the sichuan (but it's not actually, it's American style kung pao/ sesame chicken with a different sauce, which is not very spicy and more sweet).  I'll try some of the other dishes, but it's called Mr Bao, so, like, I guess start with the baos right?
I ordered fried rice, soup dumplings, a duck roll and shumai. Nothing tasted good. Lacking flavor. The rice was specially plane

Food was amazing and filling. Sorry No pic I Was hungry. I ordered Pork Bao bun was fluffy and pork inside was juicy. I also got Taiwanese fried chicken bowl with vegetable fried rice & green beans delicious. Definitely check this spot out.

Popped in on a whim cause the exterior looked promising. Dumplings were good and I would order the again. However, both the noodle dishes we got(the Dan Dan and Beijing) were flavorless, watery, and the meat was like chopped cat food. Would not return.

This place had the BEST soup dumplings we have ever had.  The staff was very nice and they got our order together pretty quickly to-go.  We got those delicious soup dumplings and some shrimp fried rice.  Both were good (especially the soup dumplings - did I mention that?), and their soy sauce was also uniquely tasty.  It had a stronger vinegar taste, which we loved.  We don't typically pour soy sauce into our rice, but we dumped it all over.  Great spot, great food.. we look forward to coming back.

Kinda disappointing. Nothing we ate was really that good except the duck wrap, which was good but greasy. Even the crab soup dumplings which seemed to be the thing to get were pretty meh. The noodles we got tasted like plain pasta and the memory of them is so bad I just took another star off my rating. 2/5 stars generally, 1/5 for the genre of food.

Cute shop with affordable dumplings! The pork soup dumplings were my absolute favorite! The steamed chicken dumplings were also amazing. Really big portion sizes as well. The bao buns were incredibly fluffy. Would recommend coming with a group so you can share! Come here for a more casual lunch and most important come very hungry.

Fairly new spot. Very cute and cozy. Love the ceiling decor. It was the first thing that caught my attention. Make sure you look up when you enter :). They have both indoor and out door available. The staff was amazing !!! It was my first time there and someone took time to help and explain everything on the menu. The food was delicious. I recommend getting the soup filled dumplings. It was more of an experience eating than anything. I would definitely recommend this location and will be back the next time I'm in the area !!

Love their dumplings! My favorite are the chicken ans cabbage and their pan friend soup dumplings. Great price and texture, the dough is not too thick, good amount of filling. Their bao is perfectly chewy but soft. I've yet to try their noodle or rice bowls but will definitely come back.

We stumbled upon this place while walking in the neighborhood and ordered out. The food is excellent especially the Short Rib and Fried Chicken Bao. The Shumai and Popcorn shrimp deserve an honorable mention. The Dan-Dan noodles were so-so! I would definitely come back here ... either do pick-up or eat-in if I was looking for a casual place to catch-up with a friend.

We ordered Mr Bao for lunch via seamless, and the food was FANTASTIC!!! We ordered the pork soup dumplings, the pan fried shrimp and pork bao, shu mai, the set of 3 baos (pork, beef, vegetable), and the sesame balls. Can I just say, the baos are SO CHEWY and the fillings are so delicious?!? As Chinese/Taiwanese, I'm all about authentic Chinese food. Mr. Bao definitely nailed the authenticity aspect and then more. The taste and texture of every food is so amazing and the looks are beautiful!!! Will definitely come back a lot more!

I'm doing hair around here so I ordered take out. The buns are so good! My favorite one is the duck steamed bun, it tastes good even gets cold, very refreshing. The fried chicken I ordered is not that crispy since it's take out, but still juicy.
Pretty good soup dumplings and reasonable pricing. great addition to the neighborhood.
Great soup dumplings! Can't wait to try other items! Baos are super good and super cute

The bao is really small, and it's underwhelming. The meat is really chewy and the sandwich is barely filled. Seriously a rip off! Not to mention take out took 40 minutes for one bao sandwich. I recommend going to any other place for bao.
The dumplings were quite a surprise, alot better than other dumpling spot in the area.
I ordered Beijing street noodles, it tasted great. They have both indoor and patio available.
I ordered shrimp dumplings, shrimp and pork shumai and vegetarian wrap. Everything was amazing. Delicious and fresh. The staff is very friendly too. Great experience.
No comment
Order delivery for last night, we have crab and pork soup dumpling ,chef's choice dumpling and popcorn chicken every thing is amazing !!! Love the dumplings!

column3: Columbia Street Waterfront District, Brooklyn, NY
column6: Best / most unusual dandan noodles I've ever had! Sitting on Bedford ave is a little unpleasant but there are pandemic times after all.
I like the steamed pork soup dumpling very much. It coming with yummy soup! Amazing and delicious! I also like the fried rice, my favorite food. Also recommend 48 hour Braised galbi beef.
Food was not very good. Everything tasted store bought and microwaved. Server was friendly and they were fast.
omg this place is amazing i love it i'm obsessed w how soft the pork belly is & how crispy the scallion pancake is the portions were amazing i highly recommend
The soup dumplings are great and so was everything else. Keep up the great work! Chicken dumplings were very good and quick delivery and definitely going to order again soon. Noodles were great!
After two hours and a bunch of bullshit excuses from the restaurant, they delivered our order to the wrong address. Thanks for nothing.
love this place , they have best soup dumpling and spicy Dan Dan noodle!!!  Can not wait for coming back again
five stars！！！food is great ！ soup dumpling recommend.
Delicious fresh food and super friendly. We asked for some modifications with the drinks and they were more than happy to accommodate. Nice outdoor seating as well.

My husband and I have come here almost once a week since they opened in the Fall. We LOVE it. Incredible cocktails, a great happy hour ($10 cocktails from 4-6pm), and amazing food. The service is also really great. Perfect for a date night, or a dinner for 4. No reservations, so get there early. By 7pm, it's bumping -- but that's because it's so dang good! They also have great music playlists and the ambiance is chill!
No comment
No comment
No comment
Really nice spot. Good cocktails and good snacks. Need to come here for a full meal but I know it'll be good. Any place that makes a good Gin martini is good in my book,
Great cocktails and great food! Went with a group of friends on a Friday night and had a blast! Cant wait to go back for the tuna poke and Brussels sprouts soon!
No comment

Leroy's is a great addition to the already amazing greenpoint food scene.. the food here is amazing, everything we've tried has exceeded our expectations. We are vegetarians and have tried all their vegetarian items and would recommend every single one of them. The vibe is amazing, service is great.. overall just an amazing time here each time we visit!
$16 for a mocktail is so psycho...... the burger is really solid and the mussels are great. May as well just drink while pregnant though.
Chic interior, with a nice big bar. Excellent food (we had the scotch egg, Brussels sprouts, and fried chicken sandwich) and service.

column3: Racquet Club West, Palm Springs, CA
column6: food is terrific. drinks are terrific. service is prompt and not too pushy. amazing place.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Food was alright.  I know not to expect too much when you order steak frites because it's not a great piece of meat.  Everything tasted great and was cooked correctly, it was just tough, not really their fault I guess.  The bar staff was great made me a drink based on what I like and I gave them liberty to get creative.  Ambiance was nice
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

A true Fort Greene staple that never disappoints! Whenever I come here I usually get some appetizers and a couple cocktails. I've never tried the mains and probably never will but they look decent enough on paper. The real reason to come here is of course the unique and tasty cocktails. I like that a lot of the cocktails here are inspired off classics, just done in such a unique way that it feels fresh. Sometimes fancy cocktail places put too much emphasis on just picking the most random ingredients they can and doing something wild, whereas a lot of the drinks at Endswell are clearly meant to feel familiar. It certainly makes it easier to pick from the menu. My group tried probably 8 different drinks in total and everything was great! Don't be shy to ask if you want something to be stronger or not to sweet or whatever.
No comment

We recently came here to celebrate a special occasion and really enjoyed it. The drink/cocktail selection is great. They have a full bar and prices are a bit lower compared to other cocktail bars. Food prices for main plates are also reasonable compared to other French restaurants in NYC. The menu isn't huge, but sometimes that's best. There are only 2 desserts to choose from, chocolate moose and crème brûlée, and both are delicious!

Fantastic French Bistro in Fort Greene area! Cocktail list is expansive, unique and delicious! It is worth trying in multiple settings! Service was great, the bartender Caiden was amazing and hospitable! Definitely will be back to try the food and more of the cocktails!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

We came in with no expectations at all--chose this place purely for proximity to BAM--and what a gem it is!  I had a cocktail that is maybe the best cocktail I've ever had in my life.  The cocktail menu is mostly their own unusual creations and I just loved mine.  Delicious salmon for dinner and chocolate mousse for dessert.  Our server was so lovely and mellow.  Such a gift not to feel rushed along.
No comment
No comment
Alls well at endswell.exquisite drinks, if not overpriced. The best 17 dollar cocktails on fulton. Service so kind and attentive
They hallways seem to go the extra mile for me and my friends. Finding a place to sit etc.. If you go to the irondale for a performance. Go here after
No comment

Came here with my cousin for a drink and we really enjoyed our time. The workers are very friendly and got us a nice seat on a Friday night. The interior decor is gorgeous and although I'm not a cocktail girl, I enjoyed my beer. Also, the bathrooms are clean which is always appreciated. The area is nice and you feel safe. I'd recommend
No comment
Honestly I have no idea, I had a bad trip here and felt the French onion soup glued my mouth shut.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Amazing food and drinks!  The service was a bit disconnected but the people are all so lovely and friendly. The place has a great vibe and it's gorgeous inside. Will definitely go back when in Brooklyn again.

I went to Endswell for a first date and the place was so cozy! The ambiance is incredible. My favorite part was how for each cocktail they pointed a similar cocktail on the menu, and although that's prevalent in NYC, it was so easy to choose your next drink! So glad to have found this place and looking forward to coming back!

Endswell is a cozy bistro with delicious French onion soup + amazing $14 cocktails! We enjoyed the food and drinks and recommend making a reservation because it's quite crowded. That being said, there is no regard for social distancing between tables and no masks worn by anyone, from the guests coming in to the servers and bartenders.

Very lively, packed bar (on a Saturday night) with incredibly friendly (extremely, extremely hyper...) service/bartenders. The bartender was even kind enough to improvise a low ABV cocktail for my friend. The cocktail list is small but very well-crafted drinks.

This is an adorable bar! I was just searching for a bar to go to for a date and stumbled upon this place! The cocktails were all very cute and tasted great! I also had the french fries and they were amazing as well. A special bonus is that they air the Bachelorette on Tuesday nights too!
No comment
No comment
Great ambiance, friendly staff, very good food and drinks. Ideal for groups or solo tables. I highly recommend it.
No comment

The appetizers are a joke. The charcuterie board did not have cheese and the meat was old and oxidized. We asked for the scallops and were given two with a light sauce. The only thing we enjoyed were the fries...Oh...and the drinks were good. Maybe that's what everyone comes here for. Just for the drinks.
No comment
No comment
No comment

One of the worst dinning experiences. Waited 20 min for drinks and 45 for the food...waiter didn't check on us at least once, most of the time she was just taking to a bar tender. The restaurant was not busy, maybe 50% occupancy, most people were there just for drinks at that point. The food was ok, more on a worse side. We ate some since we were very hungry. Half of the food came cold already. The worst is that they tried to fool us by substituting tuna with salmon in Niçoise salad. We didn't say anything because they clearly won't care.
No comment

This is my favorite place in Ft Greene for my partner and I to meet friends for drinks. It has the best cocktail menu of anywhere in the neighborhood I've found. Although the food is perfectly fine, the cocktails and the vibe are the reason to check it out.

Awesome service ! Great drinks ! Not a bartender but a chemists i will say. The way the people sync here is very calm. Yes they get busy but it's nothing to them they handle it with grace. I would recommend if it's your first date and you want something with ambiance and good music but affordable this is the place. I didn't have food but I'm sure it's good. BONUS the bathroom is super cute and selfie worthy. Everything about this place is beautiful especially the aesthetics of the decor. No regrets try it ! They have great specialty drinks: okay I'm done bye
Great ambiance, great drinks and very nice waiting staff. It's the perfect spot for a date or if you want to treat yourself. The food was also very good. I will definitely be coming back.

Went to go catch up with my good friend, sat at the bar & had the best time! Austin gave us amazing service throughout the evening. Definitely enjoyed the cheese plate and glaze on the drums. Can't wait to come back and have more wine & eats!
No comment
All of the food was extremely over salted. My girlfriend spent the night throwing up after we had dinner.

This place just opened and its literally already my favorite bar in the neighborhood, possibly Brooklyn. The food is amazing, the cocktails are the shiz (my hangover can attest to that!) and the staff are so awesome and cute! But the place itself is what sets this apart from everything else in the area. What they've done with the space is just off the charts. The breakfast poutine at weekends is quite literally to die for; I've been dreaming about that poutine for days! So needless to say I'm going back tonight and possibly tomorrow and the next and the next.

Came here for HH yesterday with my sister and the staff were super friendly! They have amazing drinks and bar food if you're hungry (: they also have outdoor seating so it's perfect for the warm weather.
Excellent burgers, fresh fries, and great delivery. A covid staple for us when we are feeling fancy. Highly recommend.
No comment

I absolutely loved this place. It's 5 stars all around for me. Very clean and cute aesthetic. I loved the look so much and I'm big on ambiance. It's a smaller place but spacious and offers out door seating with heat closer to entrance!! Which was a plus for me lol. Not many places offer heat for outdoor seating. The food was delicious and presentation was great, the French onion soup was soooo good! Def recommend trying that. It's. Not something I'd get but my guy had it and I tasted it and loved it... drinks were awesome . The bartender did an excellent job and was knowledgable and skilled. Staff was excellent.  I'm big on customer service. They were very accommodating and helpful.. made recommendations, funny and just an overall good attitude. They also had really cute outfits lol it def went with the aesthetic of the restaurant. I also loved their bathroom which was random lol but it was just a vibe in there as well. They had lots of plants every where in the restaurant and I loved that. So yeah basically I love this place and you should all try it
No comment
No comment

A very cozy place. Our waitress was super friendly and convinced us to go with the outing to start. She couldn't have been more right, as it came with great flavor. Entrees were slightly less memorable but still very enjoyable. Will be back for sure.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Amazing vibe, delicious cocktails, gorgeous decor and super intimate environment in the heart of Brooklyn. Came in with some friends after a long day on my feet working for an evening to catch up. Had immediate service at the table. The waiter brought my drink super fast after personally recommending it based on my tastes (he asked!) Chose the Noir at first. Delicious and super drinkable! Accompanied by the Steak Frites (those fries are EVERYTHING) which I scarfed down. Finished off the night with an old fashioned. Stayed for hours and it passed by so quickly, waiter was super attentive and the owner even came by to check on us. Love this place! Will definitely be back as a regular.
No comment
No comment

Went here to meet someone new( but that's another story). Had 2 appetizers and 2 drinks. Loved the atmosphere !! Staff was very helpful and friendly. We shared the deviled eggs,which were excellent and a cheese plate which was ok. I'd have given 5 stars but it took them a full 20 minutes to deliver an ice tea (wtf) to her. My drink was delivered very promptly. Glad I found this place. I'll be back sans bad date.

Went for dinner before an event at BAM. The space is really beautiful-marble tables, lots of plants, great wallpaper in the bathroom. Had some rosé (light and dry and on happy hour), the heirloom tomato salad and coq au vin (both very tasty). Really nice service - friendly and attentive without being overbearing. Will definitely be back!

One of the best restaurants I've been to in New York. Took our temperature at the door and then seated us. Staff was friendly and helpful. Drinks were incredible and the Coq au Vin was even better. To end we got a crème brûlée and it was perfect. If you're going to choose a place to eat for dinner 100% consider going here.

Cute new place we went to check out for a drink and snack after work. Really loved the ambiance with all of the plants and greenery and the marble topped bar and they had great oldies music playing while we were there. I ordered a Blanc cocktail and my fiance ordered a wine and we split a flat bread. The preparation of the cocktail was a sight to see .. including the bartender slapping some herbs on the back of his hand and some other fancy handy work crafting the cocktail. I was very excited to try after that show. It was good but I think I was expecting something amazing after all that went in to making it. Also the ice cubes were huge and I felt like took away from the drink. The flat bread was also good. I liked the bread the most. My fiance enjoyed his wine. Would go again to enjoy the atmosphere and give some of the other colors on the cocktail menu a try.

Our local covid date night spot. Try to snag a high top table so you aren't on busy fulton st. Great cocktails. Try the devilled eggs. The steak frites is sublime but the tuna nicoise is my fave. My bf loves the burger he gets it everytime. Live music on the wknd.

Delicious cocktails made with care.  Well done!  Food was perfect, no complaints.  Hubby had the steak and I had the Coque au Vin.  Flavors and textures were wonderful.  Great vibe, darling little place with all kinds of charm.  Service was friendly and personable.  Great for just a drink too, but food is also very good.
Gorgeous design. Beautiful setting, good cocktails and menu looks delicious. Big fan of the flavor paper in the restroom. Keep it up Endswell!

I love the French bistro vibe of this place. Great ambience and atmosphere and service. The steak frites was excellent. Also quite good were the mussels. They also make great fries. The deviled eggs were delicious but.... the order only came with three deviled eggs(three halves).  That seemed like a strange choice. Just put four on the damn plate. Overall a good experience. I'd go back.

I swear they have the best burger in town, at least the best in Fort Greene! It's a double-patty burger that is so yummy and filling! The fries are excellent too. And if you are a French Onion soup fan like me, this place is it not to mention the nicest service. Great people, great food, love it all!
Great new spot in the neighborhood! Friendly staff, great cocktails and food, cozy vibe with plants all around. Solid date spot!

A dope and hip spot with beautiful interior. Not to mention a great crowd. I actually got to meet the owner and talk to him. He was pretty cool and very helpful as were the staff. The cocktails are good. I didn't get a chance to eat there but will be going back soon to hit brunch with friends.
Fabulous food and service. The restaurant is doing such a great job with social distancing and COVID measures.

Lovely space, good outdoor setup in compliance with COVID guidelines, great food and cocktails, reasonably priced for the area; yet the best thing about this bistro is the amazing staff who were very friendly and thoughtful.
The cocktails are amazing! I had the salmon for dinner--spicy and perfectly cooked. The staff is super friendly, the space is comfortable and theres wifi. Will be coming back for brunch.

I was fortunate enough to get to try this hidden gem before it blew up. The best french bistro in fort greene with a very chic vibe, the perfect place for a brunch cocktail. The owners grow many of their own herbs for the cocktails and recipes.
No comment

Went to the soft opening for Endswell and wow, I was blown away. Beautiful floral arrangements on the walls and above the bar create a vibe making it feel like you're in a Brooklyn backyard despite being inside. The cocktails were great as was the service. There was a huge turnout for the opening with neighborhood locals as well as people who must have heard via word of mouth/social media. It's a classy place with vitality and energy. Five Stars - i'll be back.
No comment

Endswell is such a cute spot and the service is spectacular. Shelby (I hope I'm spelling her name correctly) was absolutely fantastic!! She was so patient and polite - a true example of exceptional service.

Omg this is such a gem spot!!!!! I literally was walking by with my friend and we stopped in at the bar. Daniel and Danny took such great care of us from their conversation to their service...it was top notch. We just had a drink at the bar but I will definitely be back to eat!!!!!
Visiting from Philly.  Great spot, perfect drinks, great decor and super friendly staff.  Only drinks this time but looking forward to trying their food.
This place is great, especially at happy hour. It's always buzzy with a casual and fun ambiance but never too crowded or loud. Danny, their bartender, is the best!
No comment

This is a great spot for drinks, for brunch or for dinner. The food is delicious, the drinks are divine and the music/decor is lovely. The owners made us feel welcome and the wait staff was very friendly. The brunch poutine with a poached egg was amazing, as was the shakshuka. Would highly recommend this place!!
Came for fries, am now addicted to the cocktails which are more sophisticated than they have any right to be. A regular hang in the neighborhood. Nice
Literally a breath of fresh air, from the decor with its abundant and beautiful plants, to the cocktails and delicious food. Friendly and excellent staff - I'll be back!
Great drinks, awesome bartenders, delicious food. Incredible new spot!

Just had brunch here. The ambiance is cute and the food was pretty good but took way too long to come out. Think 50 minutes for a salad and pancakes. The Niçoise salad was prepared well but was way over-salted. Pancakes tasted delish.
So glad I discovered this neighborhood bistro. Such a cozy and comfortable ambience. The food and drinks were great. I'll definitely return.

A nice, albeit loud, moderately-priced restaurant conveniently located near BAM with tasty food. The cheese plate is lovely and me and my friend both enjoyed our mains. With the exception of the loudness this restaurant is great for the price.
This place is amazing. The food is great and our bartender (Daniel?) was absolutely wonderful. The cocktails were delicious!
Best atmosphere and staff in Brooklyn, hands down. They just opened and they've already got it down. Do yourself a favor and go soon
Everything's excellent - food, cocktails, atmosphere, and bartenders.
Great spot friendly attentive staff and strong drinks . The location is close to trains !

Disappointing - dirty glass and burger was  overcooked with strangely hard bun (seemed kind of stale). Steak frites had good flavor but got cold very quick. Not many people in the restaurant at the time so unclear what happened in the kitchen.
Delicious food ! Nice and polite staff ! I highly recommend the Mac and cheese as well as the aperol spritz!
Great vibes, great interior, great cocktails, great food, great people!   Amazing poutine!

Price is right but the food is pretty mediocre. Like college dorm room mediocre. The salmon I ordered was so basic and boring that I felt he $17 price tag - which is a good deal almost anywhere in the hood - was twice too much. The bar staff was friendly - like a bit too friendly - but can't blame them for being bored
Overpriced, limited menu, not enough vegan/veg options in Fort Greene. Or even for carnivores actually. Wait staff was nice and food was good, just boring. Also needs another air conditioner
Fantastic cocktails and great food!! The staff is lovely and the atmosphere is cozy. Could not have asked for a better brunch experience! I'll definitely be coming back.
Wonderful staff and fantastic brunch. Had the pate eggs benny and a couple cocktails. I'll be back for more!
Impeccable service. Charming decor and vibe with a partially-open kitchen and roomy cafe table seating. Great cocktails, and I highly recommend the coq au vin. Dang!
Out of all the bars in this area, this is by far the best. Solid atmosphere, bartenders are on point, and the food is absolutely amazing. Staff was very informative and pleasant.

This place just opened in Brooklyn and is the best bar and restaurant in that area by far. Great food and cocktails and the best bartenders. They have a great happy hour and brunch menu. This is my new favourite go to in Fort Greene
No comment
No comment
No comment

Amazing place, noodles are full of flavor and the perfect chewy texture. You get to choose between the regular hand pulled noodles or thick style. Plenty of seating, and it appears they take lots of take out orders as well. Prices are beyond reasonable for the portion you get, I was perfectly satisfied after finishing my bowl.
No comment
No comment

This review was for the beef noodle soup. The noodles we're pretty good. The beef was more on the tougher side. In terms of eating in, there is no service charge, as it's more of a go up and grab your food.
No comment

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: No comment
No comment
No comment
The noodles r perfection. Just the right amount of thickness and elasticity. The toppings were also good but there wasn't that much

More accurately 3.5/5. This restaurant is more on the casual side. Counter serve, but the interior is pretty nice and well-decorated. The food is delicious and comes at a decent price point given the location. I had pork dumplings (which were just okay/average, a little bland, small fillings), pretty good cold noodles, and a pork "crispy rougamo" - crispy bread stuffed full of delicious meat, which I would recommend. The oddest thing is that they don't have water, not even tap; you're compelled to buy a plastic water bottle if you want to drink water in this establishment, so do consider bringing your own H2O.

Awesome Szechuan spot! I got the spicy pork dry noodle and pork rougamo. Both were great. My friend got the dry noodle chicken and veggie dumplings which she said she also liked (not pictured). Prices are great, and the food came relatively fast.

I stumbled upon this place and it's great! The young man is polite and friendly. After eating bad foods at hectic overrated places, I just want a quiet sit down place with warm a meal. I ordered the traditional pork chive dumplings and it came out as hand made dumplings! Almost everyone there ordered snoodke soup. I'm sure that's their signature dish.
Great prices for tasty noodles and big portions! Will definitely be coming back to try more stuff on the menu
No comment
No comment
Authentic Chinese food at a very reasonable price. Highly recommend the pork & chive dumplings in clear broth. I ordered takeout and it was ready in 10 minutes
Good taste but can hard see eggs and meat. Feel catfished. As an old customer, I feel a little bit disappointed.

First time here and the beef noodle soup was just calling my name so obviously had to order it. It said it was spicy so I wasn't sure just how spicy but my boba pairing had my back in case I died. Turned out, it wasn't actually that spicy. It was just good enough to add the spice dimension but not too much that it was overwhelming my sinuses. The beef was nice and tender. I think the best part of this was the noods. I am a noods stan and these thoroughly satisfied my craving. They chewy, fresh, cooked just the right amount. Ugh, thinking about the texture I experienced makes me want it right now on a Friday morning. Go. Experience it.
Cold skin noodles with the perfect sauce is the way to go!! Very popular dish of xian and they nailed it
it's a good place. The place is very clean and well decorated unlike most similar cheap eats. The beef noodles I got were good, but not as good as I expected. Mostly a personal preference thing

Really good noodles and rougamo! Liangpi (cold skin noodle) was very málà - numbing  spicy but refreshing. Beef stew noodle and rougamo were both cooked to perfection. Love the chewy noodles and crispiness of the burger, and I will get both of these again in my next visit. We also had a side of cold chicken dish as an appetizer and it was just okay...  Still I'm satisfied with the overall dining experience and will come back.

I absolutely love the cold chicken in spicy sauce! The spicy sauce smells authentic and yum, and the flavor is amazing! I came here twice and always ordered this dish. The cold skin noodle is wonderful as well!

Everything was so delicious. I can't believe we found this hidden gem! So worth it, the food came out quick even though we had a huge order and I wish I had an extra stomach to order some more. Price range was great and affordable. I really can't wait to come back!
No comment
Was craving some beef noodle soup and stumbled upon Bites of Xi'an. Good portioning, chewy noodles, but just decent flavor. Satisfies the craving, but nothing extraordinary.
I've only ordered the beef noodle soup. It is really good. The noodles are chewy, the beef is tender, and the soup is a great mix of spicy and savory.
No comment

Authentic and a great value, especially for Manhattan. My bowl of noodles came out to around $13 with tip. You order at the counter and seat yourself. It does get busy, and sometimes there's not seating - luckily we were able to snag a table right as people were getting up. It's a more causal environment for sure. The soup is oily and the beef is tender but heavy. The noodles are fresh and delicious.
No comment

Amazing spot for the price. Not a ton of ambiance but really great for casual and/ families. Fast service. Actually liked dumplings more than noodles but everything was really good! Loved the friend chicken too.

This place was not bad at all, but it is not good either. It is the epitome of averageness. The noodle here reminded me of the noodles from the cheap chain noodle shop at Chinese train stations (加州兰州牛肉面 if anyone is familiar with the restaurant I'm talking about). Great if you want to feel some sort of normalcy and averageness the way you'd feel in a busy Chinese train station, but again, it's just not the best. I will say they put a lot more meat in the noodle than they would've in China. I'd give this place a 3.5 if they had the option.
It's just not authentic Xi'an food, a place known for handmade noodles, this place serves premade noodles, and the sauce was too sour. It's okay food, but not up to the standards of xi'an

Wonderful experience! The noodles was fresh, delicious and filling, and the buns were so moist and full of flavor. If you like spicy, I would recommend putting some hot sauce inside. Both perfect for the fall/winter weather. I'll be going back again and again!
No comment

Ordered this for lunch today and boy was delicious. The fried pork dumplings, as soon as I bit it, flavorful juice ooozed out haha. The scallion pancake with beef was great too, though it was little on the dry side. A little sauce fixed that! The beef is the same beef that they use in their beef noodle soup which is delicious!
No comment
This place is perfect for lunch. Cheap, convenient but with great quality and special taste.

Disappointing location. Not friendly. Other Xi'an locations control the spice level, this location acted as if that was an impossible question. If you are looking for the typical Xi'an, this isn't it.

Finally decided to try this place after passing by several times. Delicious food with a reasonable price. We got the cold skin noodle (凉皮), meat sauce noodle (炸酱面), and crispy Rougamo (肉夹馍). The Rougamo was my favorite and arguably one of the best I've had in NYC. The pork filling was a perfect blend of lean meat and fat (80% lean, 20% fat). Super flavorful and juicy and not overly oily at all. The pancake was the crispy, flaky kind. I was a bit disappointed that they no longer have hand-ripped noodle (the wide, flat one) but it was still nice and chewy. The sauce for the cold skin noodle was on point, would be perfect if a tad spicier. My only complaint is the odd shape of the noodle - short and curled up like curly fries. The traditional long, flat rice noodles would be so much better.

Pretty tasty. I like their beef noodle soup. They're not always the most consistent with the soup so -1 star. Also the pork burger is great. The bread is deliciously flaky, chewy, and oily (in a good way). Definitely get the pork burger.
No comment

I've had takeout from this place so many times and tried pretty much everything on the menu. Every dish is clean, nicely flavored, and satisfying with the right amount of spices. My usual favorites are pork & cabbage dumplings in spicy sour soup, dry noodle with pork in spicy garlic sauce, and pork rougamo. When I'm feeling under the weather, the water basin mutton instantly makes me feel much better. This place always provides great food and fast service.
No comment
No comment
Authentic Xi An food with reasonable price! Staffs there are really nice and helpful. We ordered their signature food, impressive flavor and clean environment. Highly recommended!

Very tasty and Im told authentic.  A simple place with counter service and takeaway was our go to when the nearby ramen shop was packed and we didnt wait.  It was a good move.  No alcohol served, few drink options in general but the food, tasty, spicy and filling!  My GF who lived in China was very pleased with how good and legit it was.  Friendly staff, probably a family operation.
No comment
Very tasty food. Everything is made to order. Definitely recommend.  The cashier was also very friendly. Check this place out guys.

Omg, best Xi'an food I've ever had! Must haves - Crispy Pork Rougamo, stewed beef noodle soup, and sour plum tea. The beef stew just had the right about of spicy, not too strong but enough for the authentic xi'an flavor. Oh, if you love lamb, water basin mutton is so delicious, my kids loved it. Did I mention, owner said no tips needed lol Overall highly recommend, I will definitely come back again.
No comment
Great spot. Wouldn't change a thing. Very accessible and filling. The cold noodles were perfect and the dumpling were to die for.

I've been here twice already since they opened. The rougamo sandwich is unique and a must have - it comes out flaky, hot, and fresh and is stuffed with delicious seasoned beef or juicy cuts of pork. Also got the spicy chicken with hand-pulled noodles and dumplings; perfect meal for a cold night!
We were craving chewy fresh noodles, and our craving was definitely satisfied here! The flavor is authentic. Service was great and super quick. Highly recommend stopping by.
No comment
Great little place, delicious, cheap, big portions and good service. Would definitely recommend this spot to anyone!

My son and I love this little Chinese restaurant. The food are amazing and the services are great. Especially the lady who is talking the order is very patient. She made us feel like you eat at your own home. Highly recommend to try this restaurant. You will love their variety of noodles and dumplings as well as other dishes. Plus their hospitality services
No comment
Delicious pork dumplings and really really great spicy broth and chewy noodles in the Xiao Man Stewed Beef Noodle. Would get takeout again!
Really good food and excellent service! Wait time was short and there was lots to choose from. A very nice little spot and helped to quell some homesickness in the first few weeks :)

So delicious - the chicken dumplings were so juicy almost like soup dumplings!! Ugh phenom. Also the stewed beef noodle soup is so good, noodles were super fresh and chewy and beef was super tender and briskety. Super good spot highly recommend

Last night I ate here and WOW. The food was amazing, I wasn't expecting to get such a great portion of food too. Customer service was very good too. The workers made sure we were okay and satisfied with our meal. We will be coming back soon! Thank you Bites of xian!
The meat in Their most popular foods are almost 100% fat. They use msg on everything.
No comment

This place was a pleasant surprise! I walked in thinking it was a part of the Xi'An Famous Foods chain restaurant. Turns out it is not, but the taste of the food is far superior to every other Xi'an cuisine I've been to in the city! Even my picky boyfriend loved their burger and spicy chicken. I personally LOVED the noodles. The seasoning was perfect, ingredients fresh, and a portion that can feed two. The price is absolutely a steal for such a cute little restaurant in the city. Can't wait to come back!

I'm reluctant to write a scathing review without having eaten the food but I think it's necessary.  I walked into this place at around 8:30pm and I was the only person there (the only other guy had gotten up and left shortly after I arrived).  I ordered something quite simple - their signature dish of beef stew noodles.  Since I was the only one there, I didn't expect there to be much of a wait.  Flash forward 15 min, I'm still waiting and the lady who rang me up comes out with what looks like the same dish I ordered...but for herself.  Then, I see one of the cooks walk into the bathroom while I'm still sitting at my table.  2 minutes later, I hear him loudly hawking loogies behind the closed door and then quickly come out, doubting he washed his hands.  Feeling disgusted by this, especially during COVID times, and growing impatient as well, I decided to walk out even though I had already paid.  I'll probably dispute the charge with my CC.

Food is excellent, tasty and inexpensive for the East Village. Ask for less spicy as it is best for western palates, and the beef noodle soup, Rougamo, cold noodles and pork/ shrimp dumplings are standouts. I will be trying the rest of the menu later this week.
fair prices for yummy food. their pork rougamo is very good, nice crispy outside and rich meat. will come back again when in the area
No comment
No comment

I've only been for drinks. I love the Bedstuy area, so it lends to the ambience of the bar. The bartender was very knowledgeable,and allowed me to sample a few spirits. The cocktails were all sensational. I'll need to come back to try the pizza, which came highly recommended.
No comment

Food and drinks are great here! We've been here a few times and love the simple menu. Good classic Italian food. Rarely is the service ever off. The backyard is cozy with heaters and cover. So many different kinds of spritz and the funghi pizza is our fav! So much flavors in the dough with perfect crispy crunch. So good!

Without reservations, we (a party of two) were delighted to sit and enjoy a delicious cauliflower soufflé appetizer, a very well made gluten free mushroom, artichoke, and olive pizza, and a couple of finely crafted Negroni cocktails. We really enjoyed the ambience, and sitting so close to the two-top beside us was not as uncomfortable or distracting as you might think. The soft lighting and the light music vibe was really perfect and exactly what we were hoping for. All of the ingredients tasted very high quality, and the service was all very nice and polite. We enjoyed our experience here very much, and we would return, especially for dessert which we did not have time to order. They gave us an hour and a half before the table was reserved for someone else. Just enough time to enjoy a second round of Negronis!

I love this place! Their Roman style pizza is so crisp and well made, and the Negroni are all amazing. Really reasonably priced and a super cute indoor and outdoor space. Highly recommend for a date night or just casual drinks at their beautiful bar! Super happy this place is in the neighborhood and that they made it though the pandemic.
No comment
No comment

I had the chance to visit bar Camillo on a weekend night to grab drinks with a friend. The bar itself is large with tons of seating. They also have a back area that also has more seating as well. When we arrived we were allowed to sit at two open high chairs at the bar. The bartenders here were super friendly and made each drink we ordered skillfully. I would recommend this spot to catch up with a friend or for a date night. It's a little bit of a walk from the subway but the vibes make it worth it!

I can only speak on the dinner- I thought the pizza was very nice! But the focaccia was very crunchy and the lasagna was just bad. The outdoor patio was heated and comfortable, but the lack of music made it too easy to hear other peoples conversations. There appeared to be only one person on the waitstaff (also bartending) and he kept it together despite being overwhelmed. I'll probably come back here- but just for the drinks

Bar Camillo is a great neighborhood spot -- anyone I've ever taken here is quickly a fan. The meatballs are a solid starter (never dry!), and the pizzas are consistently delicious. There usually is only a single server though, and though they are always wonderful, it's clear that the restaurant requires more than just a single person on their waitstaff. Would recommend to anyone looking for a nice night out!
No comment

I live on the same block. I have a 2min walk to Bar Camillo. I'm so glad that the neighborhood is growing and I wish I could be supportive but unfortunately Bar Camillo served the worst Italian food I had ever had in NYC. Ther service was very slow but the food was so bad, it was unbelievable. Other than the bread that was OK only and the Negroni, the Lasagna was terrible and the pizza too. It's so sad, and then again possibly a better chef or better restaurant manegement might be able to help... The space is kind of nice.
No comment

We have loved eating and drinking at both locations of Camillo! So happy that we have bar Camillo now that we moved to a new neighborhood. We love Negronis and they have a long list to choose from- tried the plum for dessert las time we visited.
No comment
No comment

3.5 is my official score. I came to Bar Camillo on a Monday at 7 without a reservation but I was still able to get a table for 3 in the covered & heated backyard dining. Not all tables get the same heat (or any). The table in the back left had no heat. A little unpleasant at first. I tried the Ginger Spritz it was nice and refreshing but I'll stick with Aperol spritz. For our meal we had the meatballs (polpette di manzo) , the artichokes (Carciofi), baked cacio & pepe and the seasonal pinsa special - all'Uccelletto which had pork sausage, Tuscan kale, cannellini & sage puree, tomatoes and mozzarella. I didn't love the pinsa special. It was lacking flavor and the after taste was chalky - weird for pizza, I know. I think that was due to the cannellini beans. The cacio e pepe was good not as peppery as I like and I was shocked to see that they used gentile pasta and not spaghetti. I'm also not a fan of artichokes BUT this was actually very tasty. I would try them again but different items.

Thank you Bar Camillo, for great service on a day where you were so understaffed! Our server was the only man waiting on guests, and he was kind, prompt, attentive! The Negronis were really great, and while we didn't get a seat out in the backyard, it looked very beautiful:)

They need more staff. Food & getting served takes too long. We never got the other drinks we ordered. & we have to stop the waiter in a hurry just to get served & needs met. 3 stars because great playlist & the Food & drinks were good when we did receive them.
Delicious cocktails, cool bartenders, and great atmosphere. We haven't tried the food yet but it smelled and looked delicious! Can't wait to come back here
