10/10 would come back again. They have Inferno and Campari cocktails which is amazing. We ate the Formaggi and baked Cacio e Pepe which were exactly what we wanted, as we we feeling like a cheese feast. The wine and beer were also great, wine was on tap hope they have draft beer soon.

Went to Bar Camillo for the first time on a whim for dinner Wednesday night. Had never been before and it's a local spot I had walked by before so I wanted to give it a try. We arrived around 8:00 PM without a reservation and were seated within about 15-20 minutes. I thought it might be quiet on a Wednesday, but while we were waiting someone else asked for a table and we realized 3 other couples were waiting after us! We sat in the back which was cute and romantic. It rained heavily during the meal which actually added to the atmosphere since we were protected by the transparent roof! It was warmer in the backyard than the inside which also looked nice but not uncomfortable as they had fans throughout. My partner and I noticed that it seemed like maybe a server called out; there was one guy literally doing everything from hosting to grabbing drinks to serving food etc. He was a champ! Service was still reasonably paced and I just couldn't believe how good this guy was. Despite doing a million things at once I still felt like he provided personal attention and was easy to get a hold of, like when we wanted the check. Pizza was nice and thin and crispy and filling! Was it the best pizza I've ever had? No, not necessarily. But I liked it overall and enjoyed the service and atmosphere. I would return again with a reservation and try the pasta dishes in the future.

Not sure how I forgot to post this but y'all need to know where the universe is hiding great food. First off, let me say that hands down indoor dining is likely better at this place in both locations but the food makes the noise outside at both locations tolerable. The salad was incredibly low key and delicious.  The pizza crust, sauce, and toppings were all fresh and memorable for the flavor pallette. It was a good time....minus the noise from the cars and area.
Food is amazing. Wait staff is even better. It's such a wonderful place. Terry is the best human.

I really enjoy this place! The atmosphere and food are lovely. Our server Mia was phenomenal, she really made our dinner over the top! She was attentive, informative on the menu and friendly. We will be back, thanks Mia and bar camillo for a great experience.
Been to both their locations, food is great. Their brown spirit selections are excellent, the food is just banging. Pizzas are great but the goat I had so on point!

Idk who these people are leaving 5-star reviews but obviously they have never eaten food before. Salsiccia and greens plate was clearly cooked + seasoned in an underground natural salt deposit. Focaccia was just crusty pita bread with with old rosemary. Cacio e Pepe was served as TJ's Annies shells. I wasnt gonna leave a 20% tip but my gf yelled at me. Overall, my mouth feels more disrespected than Chris Rocks' during the oscars.
No comment
No comment

This restaurant makes me wished I lived in Bed Stuy just so I could have a reliable Italian spot with $10 negronis and reliable food! The pizza isn't my favorite, but it's sturdy and obviously they put some care into their toppings. Highlights for me were the negroni and lasagna. I always order the meatballs when I go to a restaurant like this and I'd say you can skip them. Price is too high for only three balls and they fell apart & just tasted like mixed up ground beef with no binder/cheese/seasoning.

Food is good, service is okay.  It's a nice neighborhood place but sadly the menu almost never changes so once you been there a few times, there's not a lot to keep one coming back.

Hidden gem in Bed Sty with better pizza than Saraghina or Ops!  Light crispy but with airy texture that is hard to describe. We had a margherita pizza and artichokes. Recommend all!
No comment

Bar Camillo was pretty good. Happy vibe. I tried Funghi Pinsa here and it was absolutely great. Service was very good and everybody working here was really nice and hospitable. Definitely will come back to this place always.
Excellent appetizers and pizza with a lovely atmosphere that is clean and friendly. The service is great and is a lovely addition to the neighborhood.
This place was great! We tried the meatballs and artichoke apps, both were great. We split a pizza and the pesto lasagna for dinner- both were also amazing! & the Negronis are a must.
Best Negroni's around! The drinks are amazing-and the staff are always so sweet to help my friends when they come visit. It's been such a sweet and fun experience every time I come here.

We wuz passin by this place that we had odered from before what I like about is different what my gurl likes cuz she knows more about it than me. This place is more than just pizza its like they have different italian foods. I like the pizza doe cuz they have it like the pizza magarita. My girl,likes the pasta and the lasagna.  and they got different beers to drink if u want. we sat outside and it was cool cuz its in bed-stuy.
The food is soooooooooo good. The pizza is fresh and tasty. There is a backyard patio and the delivery was on time with hot food.
Holy shit the food is flavorful and the service is friendly AF and the vibe is supreme
Ordered delivery off Caviar. They sent totally wrong order-tried to call no answer. What a joke! 0 stars!

I ordered chocolate hazelnut pancakes yesterday for postmarked delivery and the pancakes came without any maple syrup, whipped cream or chocolate!!! I was so sad at this plain pancake atrocity that I didn't even take any pictures. Pancakes without syrup is just criminal

Great brunch in Brooklyn! The drinks were so good - the matcha was delish and not too sweet. We had the crispy fingerling potatoes, side of bacon, shakshuka eggs, breakfast burrito with pork sausage, and Smoked Salmon Croissant. Everything was great but would maybe skip the bacon next time was a little too crispy for my liking. The vibe of the restaurant was amazing, so bright and airy. Service was great too I'll def be back!
No comment

Always wanted to check this place out so I stopped by for dinner on a Wednesday night around 7. The bar was empty and slow probably because it was so cold outside. Ordered the ricotta and the pear salad. The ricotta is AMAZING and the bread came out so warm!!! Perfect. Good drinks, easy and elegant vibes. Pear salad was great but a little on the acidic side. Made for a great solo date night :)

Cute spot in greenpoint for brunch. My husband had the short rib panini, which was perfectly toasted but needed a bit more short rib and some extra horseradish mayo. I had the arugula bowl with chicken. It was tasty and just needed a piece of bread or two to be truly filling (as it had far more arugula than grains). All in all, the flavors were good, as was the service, and the cocktails were well balanced. We would likely return.

I only had a coffee at the bar, but! It my cortado was perfectly made and delicious. The interior was also absolutely gorgeous, bright and warm. The service was also great and quick/attentive, even as someone just having a coffee at the bar. They do also have takeaway coffee right inside the door, which is convenient if you are truly only looking for a coffee and pastry.
Shakshuka was awesome no doubt and the ambience is perfect for brunch, airy, clean and sleek but service and drinks were  just alright.
No comment

I'm not going to lie, I didn't have high expectations. I expected this place to be an overpriced Brooklyn hoity toity place with mediocre food. I was very pleasantly surprised at the brunch I attended. The breakfast burrito blew me away and the pancakes were heavenly. The service was very polite and quick. The ambience is a clean and bright aesthetic with a lot of natural light.
Just dropped in seated right away. Food was great. Service was good.
No comment

Really beautiful interior. I asked if they had any non alcoholic beverages and they have phony negronis! A huge plus. The staff was super kind and didn't rush us at all as we enjoyed the AC. Will be back!
Sandwiches are okay. Matcha lattes need a lot more matcha inside. Staff is great and are very friendly.
No comment
Was good food!!!! But they didn't give me a knife in my silverware napkin. So I took a knife from a nearby table
Food is average and service is lacking. If you want a good insta style pic, def show up. If you value your food more, pls think twice.

Amazing atmosphere, food, drinks, and service!!! Just had one of the best dinner experiences thanks to Sereneco. The restaurant is gorgeous and the vibes were immaculate. The chef is brilliant, everything we had was cooked to perfection. The service was excellent everything went smoothly making our night fun and relaxing. Also the bartender did an amazing job with the hibiscus margarita. Will definitely be back for more!

Came here without reservations and they were able to sit us quickly at the bar. The restaurant is small but the high ceilings make it feel bigger and the minimal decor is nice. Recommend the mushrooms, potatoes and crispy Brussels sprouts. They did forget our drinks but otherwise was good!
No comment
Was just ok. Cool vibe but very mediocre tasting dishes and fairly overpriced menu. Would come back if no other choice but nothing to brag about.
Walking around greenpont and found this new restaurant. Pancake was phenomenal. Breakfast burrito was very tasty. Cant wait to try their dinner menu! Fantastic food, good ambience, friendly staff

10/10. This is a must try- we're so glad this gem of a place just opened in Greenpoint! The interior is incredibly well done with a soft and upscale yet humble ambiance, fitting for date night, a work dinner, or a casual dinner and drinks with friends. The veal meatballs were amazing in a delicious romesco sauce and topped with parmigiano reggiano. For the main, we both had the Arctic Char- I've never had it cooked so perfectly before. It was melt-in-your-mouth smooth and buttery, while the perfectly seared skin added a light crunch to the flaky char. Served over a bed of greens and beans, we both noted that it felt like we had a farmers market on our plate. For dessert, the creme fraiche ice cream was phenomenal. All in all a superb dining experience and a great addition to our neighborhood. Would recommend to anyone and will definitely be back soon! Great music too :)

What a lovely spot! I came here for brunch with a friend and the food was top-notch + vibes were immaculate. Really love the decor and ambiance in here! It's very modern, airy, and cozy. I ordered the breakfast burrito and a Bloody Mary, which was perfect. The servers were also very sweet and accommodating.

We had a Friday night reservation, and were seated right away, even though the restaurant was packed that night. The waiter did a fantastic job of helping us understand how to order small plates, vegetables, and main courses for the table, and every dish was delicious.
short rib, cashews and salmon crostini were so so good. and while caesar salads are everywhere, i really liked this one because of how light it was. really love the decor here as well
Great service, amazing coffee, AND the most delicious short rib I have ever had. The drinks were great as well, and the service was top notch. Happy to have such a gem in the Greenpoint neighborhood!

Comfortable ambience and great cocktails, especially the gin and tonics with craft tonics specifically paired with local gins! Food was quick and delicious, especially the veal meatballs, short ribs, and arctic char.

RACE TRIGGER WARNING:  Let me start off by saying that the food was phenomenal not to mention I am a neighbor of this restaurant and was very excited to go for Thanksgiving.  I'm giving Sereneco 1 star because of the service we received .  While half of our party was met with phenomenal service over the Thanksgiving holiday, the other half of our table which coincidentally only consisted of minorities was made to wait over 30 minutes for each course to come out.  It was incredibly uncomfortable because every person at our table felt the awkward tension of a group of POC watching a group of white blonde women eat their meals.  I do not believe that there was some racist vendetta the restaurant had towards the second half of the table... that being said in real time it felt the way it looked.  It was incredibly uncomfortable for both sides of the table.  The prefix was $75 with standard priced cocktails.  We ordered several drinks and ordered bottles of wine.  We were there to spend money.  The tales of how this restaurant handles seating and service is not of my interest, the point is we were a group with a reservation.  We paid good money and were met with an awful dining experience.  The few servers that did bring us our drinks could barely garner a smile when speaking to the second half of the table which really planted a seed of prejudice considering the other end of the table received glowing service.  When the two black members of our party brought this to the attention of management we were offered no restitution on the matter.  It was very much so swept under the rug naturally leading the minorities in our group to feel like all of a sudden we were the issue here.  The owner reached out and spoke with a member of our party who left a review asking him to take it down and I cannot stand for this injustice.  We absolutely paid and tipped gratuitously and as a member of this neighborhood, I will not be silenced after a holiday that had a huge cloud over it because the POC sat and watched a table of white blonde women (who are our friends and all felt equally the same about this matter) receive different service then the opposite end of the table.  The owner was young and pretentious; yes Billy, I see you.  Upon walking into Sereneco, we weren't greeted with so much as a smile.  The restaurant was not full.  During the time of service for our entree the table next to our party received their food first as we watched half of our party eating....  That table came in after us.  The service was deplorable here.  The food was absolutely incredible.  The owner is disgraceful. In conclusion, minorities receiving poor service  in fine dining is nothing out of the ordinary.  I'm making this post because I cannot stomach going to one more dinner where the minorities in our group are made to feel less then.  When we left Sereneco, that is how we felt.  It was a subject that consumed the rest of the evening and when I heard today that the owner asked our friend to remove his post I just about lost it.  Billy, you get one star and no, I will not be removing this review nor will I be returning.  This is the impression we left with and I will not be silenced on the matter.  For the sake of the chef who prepared such an appetizing meal, do better.  As opposed to offering some defense it's my hope that you can see that customers of yours who came in on a holiday left feeling terrible.  It was not our fault, it was a result of your restaurant's service practice.

If you are in New York and looking for some amazing food and top notch service you have to get  a reservation at 53. We took the servers advice and got some of the top rated items and we were not disappointed. Great ambiance, nice for date night, girls night, or even after work drinks. The drinks were amazing, I will be going back when I am in New York again.
No comment
No comment

The space is beautiful upstairs and downstairs with upstairs being a little noisier than downstairs. Our hostess Cayla was amazing and started our evening on the perfect foot forward giving us a beautiful banquette which I recommend to anyone trying to get a table there . The sommelier Kelly was amazing and a lot of fun. Shirley our waitress was also fantastic. The fluke appetizer was delicious but better once we added a little salt and lime . The halibut was tender and a pretty good size portion. I felt the quail was overwhelmed by a sweet and sour sauce. It was tasty but quail is too delicate and should've had a crispy simple application as opposed to being drowned in a sauce. The Cabernet  Tres Leoni by the glass was delicious and fairly reasonable compared to the other wines by the glass. Overall a fantastic evening.
